review_body: On a very well located area, Shibuya. various mode of transportations are nearby such as bus stations, trains, direct nex from narita Airport, direct mt fuji express line. There's also a airport bus express on lvl 5 where the lobby is located. Free wifi in room. Room is big compared to other normal Japan room. Toilet amenities is comparable to international 5 stars hotel. Recommend this hotel to all travellers.

One of the best hotels to stay at if you are at Dogenzaka. Lobby is at 4th floor and if you happen to stay in a room on higher floors, the view of the Shibuya crossing is all yours. The hotel is also accessible by the Limousine Bus from Haneda or Narita airport. If you're staying with family, try to book a room here as early as you can!

this is my 6 th stay here, the room is clean, spacious, bed is comfortable, linen is soft and super clean, same goes for the towel, amenities complete, only lacking is the ditness center, staff very courteous and kind. airport shuttle bus stop right in front of the hotel. highly recommendable.

Big rooms for this place in Tokyo. Location - splendid, right next to the metro. There was good breakfast for extra cash. There was no crib for babies so my 1.8 year old slept on a single bed places against the wall - not optimal but a lot of hotels in Japan don't have cribs for babies.Overall good hotel but for a very high budget

An hour and a half by shuttle bus from Narita Airport. Stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel was in a very good location.The room that we stayed in was reasonably sized (but not spacious) . Downstairs, there was a nice looking cafe, but it seemed a little pricey, so we didn't go for it. Instead, we got our food from the shopping complex in the basement.There were various shops to choose from, from Starbucks to Japanese food shops(bento boxes). The hotel is also connected to the station.I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to save time.

We stayed at the hotel a few days before and after New Year’s Day which was in a busy period. We interestingly didn’t feel as though the hotel was packed, which was great as we knew they were as we tried booking other rooms which weren’t available. The hotel is in the perfect location as it’s close to everything.The things we liked: - The hotel offers complimentary transfers to their sister hotels, which came handy as the express train from the airport was cancelled and we needed to take a bus from the airport (side note: we used the airport limousine bus to the hotel and I highly recommend it... It’s brilliant! The bus drive was 1.5 hours from the airport, has free wifi onboard and you can transfer from a sister hotel at no extra cost).- The rooms were cozy and and modern. - You are given a mobile phone (Handy) to take out which was great as it allowed free calls and internet access on the road. - You HAVE TO order room service as a robot delivers your items... Yip, an unassisted robot. - You’re a 2 min walk to Shibuya station which has multiple trains. - You’re a 2 minute walk from Shibuya crossing. - There’s 1 bar and 2 restaurants at the hotel. I wouldn’t recommend the bar as service was terrible on both nights we had drinks there.- There are dedicated areas on different floors for laundry (irons, washer, dryer and pants press), a drinks vending with an ice machine, shoe care room and a kitchen. - You’re connected to Shibuya Scramble Square and a few delis, external restaurants and coffee shops (Starbucks is 30 seconds from the hotel). The things we didn’t like: - There’s no concierge which ended up being an issue for booking trips. We couldn’t book tickets for TeamLab and because there’s no concierge we were just pointed to the same website with no further help than that. - The biggest issue is the traffic noise as it’s VERY loud. If you’re a light sleeper, ask for a room FAR away from the roads. This may affect your view, but I couldn’t sleep the first night, and after moving rooms, things were a little better, but still too noisy for me.- The check in was ok. It didn’t feel as though the reception wanted us to be there and was relatively moody. This is very different to the other hotels across Tokyo, Kyoto and Osaka. Interestingly, it was a similar experience at the newer hotel in Osaka. - There are only 2 local charging plug ports with only 1 plug point (ie no international plug points).- They mention there’s a gym but there are only 2 tiny gym spinning bikes, so don’t plan to do anything fitness related here.- When we checked out, we asked to store our luggage as we had a trip planned before heading out to Kyoto. It felt as though storing it was an issue because we needed to be very specific on the time that we could store our luggage. It was just a cold experience. Overall, a great location, but I think we’ll choose a different hotel when we’re back in Tokyo. The area (Shibuya) is a must to stay in though.

When I am in Shibuya, I stay either at Cerulean Hotel or Excel Tokyu, but if I have the choice, it will always be the latter.Excel Tokyu is situated on the 5th floor of Mark City. It is on top of all the subway lines and the bus terminal. The hotel has a lift that goes directly down to the Shibuya Station. Whether I fly via Henada or Narita, there is a shuttle limousine door to door usually at half-hourly intervals.Mark City is a mall with many shops and restaurants. Connected to the mall is the Tokyu Premium Plaza for more shopping and a nice supermarket/food hall.Hotel rooms are relatively spacious. A standard single room is usually 20 sq m. I paid approximately HK$6500+ including tax and service for a 4-night stay booked through Trip.com and was upgraded to a twin room.Service at the hotel is not something to boast about but for me it is quite all right as I go in and out of the hotel hardly having to pass through the reception area.In general the hotel is adequately comfortable. Although Cerulean is a little bit of a higher standard, I still prefer this one for it convenient location.

We chose this hotel for the location and it was worth it. It is a nice hotel with standard features. Great view of the crossing. The night shirts were amazing. When I get back to Tokyo I would stay here again.

Besides the customer service is remarkable, the room is huge, clean and tidy compared other hotel. The city view to shibuya crossing is amazing. My wife is have fun taking photo in multiple scenario such as morning rushing and evening lighting. The best shot shall go to "raining" full of umbrella. Surely will stay again. I will never forget the service provided by them. It is an impressive service level especially the employee name Seryon Ban (Star of the day)

Second time to stay in this hotel and will surely book it again when I visit Tokyo for the nth time. In the heart of Shibuya with a view of the Shibuya Scramble/Crossing. A lot of food choices, great shopping area, walking distance to Harajuku/Ometosando area. Airport buses from/to Haneda end/begin from this hotel

The best feature of this hotel is the location! It is situated smack bang in the centre of restaurants, shops, train stations, and within walking distance of everything. The other great features are the bedding configuration and size for per person. The housekeeping was really good and the bathroom size was great. I liked the hotel gym. The hotel is also above the food courts where you can find all sorts of delicious delights. It is near 7/Eleven, Star Bucks (coffee) and McDonald's. The only frustration, in the beginning, was finding the hotel entry points. Once we figured out the entry to the hotel, it was all smooth sailing. I recommend this hotel.

Stayed here a second time, location still beats that of Shinjuku. The hotel upgraded me to a better room with good view and near to elevator which is a blessing so we don’t have to tread feet’s down the Long hallway after a tiring day. Gd service, gd rooms, best location. Note pachinko street on the side can be quite rowdy with drunk kids at night.

This hotel is perfect located in the party area of Tokyo Shibuya, great rooms, great breakfast and a lot of great shops around very close to the hotel. The Narita expres train is just across the street and goes directly to the airport aproxx 1 hour trip and easy to chance train to other places around in Tokyo, this is hotel i will use again on my next trip to Tokyo

A brilliant location for shopping and transport, with a direct bus to and from Haneda airport. Rooms are a decent size for Tokyo and well decorated. However, it's expensive, bland and has an outrageous 'early check in' charge if you arrive before 2 pm.

Great location. Right in the heart of Shibuyu. There is a shopping complex on your doorstep. I am currently staying here for 5 nights. Amenities are great. You have enough tea and coffee making facilities.But the biggest issue with this hotel is the very old hotel room. The bathroom smell is revolting- likely due to old plumbing. The toilet has a mind of it's own. If you are a fan of the 80s you would love the bathroom. I don't know how they are marketing this as a 4 star. Definitely stayed in better 3 star hotels.
user_name:
AneesaS21
Cape Town Central, South Africa

review_body: I booked one night on a return trip to Tokyo after having travelled elsewhere in Japan and having stayed in this hotel previously with no great mishap (though it needs renovation and doesn't seem to merit its "standing", being a very average "business hotel" type.) Arriving very late, and having unpacked my bags, I discovered on lifting the toilet cover a most appalling detail: the toilet seat had 3 blood stains on it. It being extremely late and me exhausted, I didn't complain immediately and only did the next morning, telling the girl at the reception that having paid an equivalent of 230 euros for the night for a single room, it was totally unacceptable to see this amazing sight. Having been a traveller for decades, never had I encountered such a disgusting incident not in the poorer countries and certainly never would have dreamed it possible in such an orderly normally-hospitable country such as Japan. The receptionist referred to her superviser, who equally didn't seem to know what to do except to frown and say "oh I'm so sorry"... and when realising that I wasn't shouting impolitely but was obviously upset, after a few minutes he offered lamely a coupon for a breakfast which I have already taken that morning in their restaurant. I was also dismayed by the slowness of reaction on their part as if this was the sort of things that happen regularly? Surely not ! I'd hate to think that because of the excellent location and the gorgeous view indeed from their restaurants upstairs, that they could imagine being able to get away with something like this. I have a photo to prove this but honestly I wouldn't want to subject your readers with this gory detail. This is all I have to say, actually. (of course, the expresso machine in the room didn't work either and water spilled all over the place, but that became a kind of tragic-comic detail in the morning.)

Always my choice when I visit Tokyo. Location is fantastic. There's no need to worry rain or shine as the subway and jr stations are sheltered, airport bus stops here, and malls and food options all within the connected malls. The staff have been very helpful, especially the check in staff who helped to allow me stay through the 2 nights without the need to check out first as I had made separate bookings due to changes in my original plan. They also helped to store my luggage when I had to travel elsewhere for a night. Thank you and I really enjoy my stay here.

We stayed here one night. We were upgraded to a room with 4 beds on a ladies only level. What a delight when we found the room has a facial steamer !The hotel is surrounded by shops, restaurants and departmental stores. The Shibuya metro station is also nearby. We loved to watched the Shibuya Crossing from one of the lifts.

So i always to stay at the hotel at Tokyo which has excellent city view. And Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is one of those. So i booked excel twin room 30m2 for Tokyo hotel is quite spacious. It was not cheap either but it has all you need. I asked for shibuya crossing view and i loved it. I loved the amenities the shampoo smell so good and make your hair so soft. The provide water and amenities daily. I didnt tried the breakfast tough so i cannot tell you how was it.

Not the first visit to this excellent hotel ideally situated in the heart of upbeat Tokyo. Easy to reach by train, taxi or airport shuttle bus to & from Haneda & Narita airports.Wonderful old & new shops, bars & restaurants, both trendy & traditional. The hotel is well laid out with superb views from the upper floors. Modern yet tastefully well appointed rooms.Handily central & easy for people to find whether meeting friends or business associates. Very friendly & accommodating staff. Highly recommend this for location & style. Perfect for my needs. Will definitely stay here again.

First impressions were ok despite a struggle to follow the directions to the hotel out of Shibuya station (to which it is close). Sleek, modern, decent decor, good shower, nice washout, carefully laid-out (small, as often in Japan) room. There is no porter service or assistance with bags, ad we were surprised on calling down for room serve to be informed that this finishes at 10.30 pm - an hour before the bar shuts! The bar is cool, and the DJs were playing some decent stuff but then the bar manager was rude to my partner. We left a day early.

This was a quad room and there is a huge amount of space unexpected in Tokyo. 4 king single beds. But the bathroom is old and smells of mildew, and having the bed on the wall the joins the bathroom, I could smell it while sleeping. The following night I swapped beds with my husband as he couldn't smell it. Loved our stay here.The location is amazing, view from our room of the scramble crossing.

If you are the type to look for convenience and accessibility for short business trips, this is a good hotel to go for. Serviced by Airport Limousines, easy in getting taxi downstairs, direct access to a comprehensive mall and metro, plus food and shopping all within walking distance - this is a very decent hotel.Rooms are relatively small comparing to western standards, but I'd say hey are decent sized for Japan standard. Generally busy hotel, so be prepared to be a little bit self-sufficient.

Stayed here for 4 nights because of very good location but they have the worst service..staffs are not friendly..they do not smile at guests and were not willing to help..and would gossip about us while doing our check-inWe asked help for our luggages but was told to bring it ourselvesMy mom asked for the luggages to be brought out cause we asked them to keep it when we checked out(when we traveled to another location)but the staff was smirking and making rude hand gestures cause she was trying to say something that we didnt understand..she then brought it out,smirked at my mom and left our luggages and walked away without..SUPER RUDE!! My mom is a senior citizen so a little kindness would be appreciatedAlso we asked them to reserve a slot for us for the airport limousine but was told to just do it when we come backAnd when we did..we were told that it was already full and couldn't accommodate us,we already bought the tickets and it was their fault but still they werent even apologetic and was just told to take the train instead! Imagine my parents..both senior citizens carrying their luggages to the train station and was even told that they called the ticketing office and our tickets was non refundable..it was 12500yen ..In the end they realized they got the time wrong (and that was after an hour or so of wasting our time and imagine the stress it caused us) it just amazes me how they are not apologetic..There was this one particular staff though who was really nice when we checked out forgot her name though..

Very friendly and efficient staff. Got a nice view on the 24th floor. Very convenient easy access to all the shopping area and the train station. Comfortable room. Would recommend this place anytime. Loads of restaurants at ur door step.

Stayed 5 nights at this hotel. Got a 21st floor room with no viewThe room is big for its size. Twin bedroom is bigger than if you take a double bed roomService is good room are clean up pretty fast. Only thing check in is 2pm and not earlierThe hotel is located on 5th floor of the Shibuya station. It is quite easy to find

Arrived at Haneda airport and took the airport express bus to hotel doorstep (which is very convenient for kids or heavy shoppers). In the heart of Shibuya shopping belt where most brands are represented and good eateries too (like ichiran noodles). On departure, bus takes tired shoppers to Narita airport (where more international flights exists). During the stay, hotel staff were polite and always keen to help. Room was clean and very functional.

This is a business hotel so it’s not a really fancy place but it’s close to everything. Trains right below with stores and food within a half a block. The room was comfortable with two twin beds. Small by American standards but bigger than other Japanese hotels. A big plus is the limousine bus stops at this hotel and the hotel will sell you tickets and load up your suitcase. They stand and watch you leave while waving or bowing. Thakuri is a concierge there and is excellent. Thank you Yoshida San and Thakuri for making our short stay wonderful.

Great stay! The staff here is very helpful and they are making sure you are comfortable and all you need is there for you. They also friendly because if you want to go to a place and you don’t know how they are very helpful in giving directions and maps for you to fully understand what they say. They also very hospitable when it comes to the guests and they making sure they are there to help you and accommodate you. Thank you so much!

Absolutely lovely stay. Very comfortable. Pleasant staff. Excellent location near train station. Will definitely return to this hotel. Bed was so comfortable. Excellent restaurants downstairs from hotel.

We stayed for one night and would recommend this hotel. The rooms are well equipped despite being very small. The staff are friendly and the location is great. If you can, stay on a high floor as the surrounding area is extremely noisy.

Comfortable hotel, well located in Shibuya. If you are lucky your room could have view of the famous Shibuya junction. Restaurants ok and staff as usual in Japan. Well connected with the highway bus from airport stopping just at the hotel. Airport hotel you may take more than one hour but it is a good ride.

You literally couldn’t get a better location in Shibuya, right across the road from the main train station and over looks the famous crossing. The room was very spacious for a Japanese hotel! We enjoyed the delicious buffet breakfast every morning (would recommend this, good start to the day, especially for westerners, our style of breakfast was hard to find)Highly recommend staying at this hotel no complaints

This is my first time staying in shibuya excel tokyu, the location is very convenient, location in the heart of shibuya, very easy to find food and all sort of shopping there. The service from the hotel staff is amazing, the room is big and clean, very good atmosphere. Highly recommended.

Stayed for one night & the hotel & staff couldn't have been better. I read some negative reviews here about the staff but we didn't see that at all. Yes, it can be a very busy lobby at times but everyone there were eager to help. Yes, they do seem to hold to the "No check in until 2pm" (we arrived at 11am) but of course they store the luggage until then. Each time through the lobby we were met with big smiles & "Do you need some help?" One employee even walked us close to a mall restaurant, we wanted to find, so we would not get lost. Great location. Great shower. A 15 minute indoor walk from the Narita Express platform. We'll definitely stay again.

It was a privilege to stay at this beautiful hotel overlooking the famous Shibuya Scramble Crossing and Hachiko dog statue. The staff were very friendly, efficient and bilingual; speaking both Japanese and English. My room was very comfortable; with extra amenities of a vanity with facial steamer, slippers, extra toiletries, refrigerator and a room safe. The view of Tokyo and the crossing at night was very impressive. I enjoyed the wonderful Japanese breakfast and excellent Japanese/Western breakfast buffets. This hotel is located near many wonderful restaurants, shopping and subway stations. A memorable place to stay!

This is my second time staying in shibuya excel tokyu, i choose the location due to its very convenient location in the heart of shibuya, its very easy to find food and all sort of shopping there. 1st time i stayed there i went with my girlfriends so we tolerate the non service from the hotel staff but this time i travel with my mom and grandmother, it is very inconvenient that there is no porter available at the hotel loby, we need to carry all our luggages ourself, we went to the loby to get taxi and there was nobody there to help us, i called the loby and instead of helping us order the taxi they told me to go back to the hotel loby just to order taxi, when i ask them to help cancel my restaurant reservation from my room, they ask me to go down to the hotel loby again just to do that. The receptionist barely speaks english. it was just not a 4 star hotel experience

Fantastic location right in the Shibuya Terminal complex. Every sort of transit within a few minutes of walk. Tokyu food show, the basement food market , and Mark city mall are right below and outside of the hotel with plenty of food attractions. Shibuya is also saturated with many decent and reasonable restaurants. The room was comfortable, clean, quiet. Breakfast on the top 25 th floor was certainly fulfilling.

It was amazing to be in tokyo for first time. We enjoyed a lot. Service in the hotel was attentive, anything wowww but we received all the necessary to explore the city and take the maximum from it. We went to akihabara where we had a fantastic time in big camera shopping mall. For electronics was the best. The rooms were a bit small, but this is tokyo. All restaurant we went were extremely good, from gonpachi to a kobe beef near ginza. Tokyo is a must

I was in Tokyo for a business meeting and really there is no more centrally located hotel. The rooms are clean and larger than expected. Do be aware that the hotel is on the 5th floor of the mall and it can be tricky to find the entrance, with the elevator to the 5th floor located right across from the train station. It is possible to enter the hotel directly from the 3rd floor of the train station. There is an enormous amount of food and shopping all in or near the mall.

We travelled as a family of 4 and booked 2 standard twin rooms. Rooms were very comfortable, spacious and amenities were very good. we were on the 11th floor , nice views and quiet. Rooms are clean and comfortable and we all slept well every night.The staff was very helpful with all my questions on how to get to various places that I would ask each morning. The location is the best part. It is right at Shibuya crossing and you can view the scramble form the hotel anytime. The reception for the hotel is on 5th floor, the 4th floor has many restaurants and the 3rd floor has access to the station. After a long day of sightseeing it was great to be able to get to the hotel from the station in a few min , freshen up and have so many food options one floor below and even right around the hotel outside. Highly recommended.

The super plus point for this hotel property is its location-1 min walk to the following:Shibuya Mark City Highway Bus Terminal; Shibuya Scramble;Hachiko Square; the Metro Station. This Metro Station has 6 main lines. On the JR Yamanote Line you can get to Harajuku in 2 mins, Shinjuku in 7 Mins. On the Tokyo Metro Ginza Line you can get to Ginza in 15 mins. The Shibuya Mark City Highway Bus Terminal is 5 mins walk away-from there you can get to the 2 International Airports, Narita and Haneda, or well as to Kusatsu Onsen, Kawaguchiko, Kamogawa. We took the Limo Bus from Haneda Airport to Mark City; then took the bus to Kawaguchiko the next day.The hotel rate is expensive but I had a comfortable stay. The check-in was slow. We arrived before check-in time and the service staff took our passports and processed the check-in and we were told that our rooms were not ready until after 2pm. We returned at 2.15pm and had to present our passports again; this time we were told that we had booked 2 double and 1 single room (we needed 3 doubles for the 6 of us). Took some time before the problem was solved - adding a extra bed to the single room. Simple solution yet took some time to solve this. Besides this we had no other interaction with any other service staff for my 2 nights stay.

We have not long returned from a fantastic stay at the Excel. We had originally booked a hotel in Shiodome, but decided to move a couple of months before our trip to a better location. We booked an Excel room (floors 21-24) and got a corner twin on floor 23. The view just blew us away! Our room and view looked exactly like the first photo on this trip advisor page. Book the Excel corner twin (ask for crossing view) and you won't regret it! I can see how some lower floors could be louder, but we slept very well on the 23rd floor. We knew before our trip that rooms in Tokyo ran a little small, but this room was absolutely fine for our family of 3 and definitely bigger than our room in NYC last year. More drawers would be helpful, but I find this is an issue in every hotel! Yes, the bathroom is small but again, very adequate for our stay. The staff were very helpful and welcoming upon check in and check out, and there was a birthday gift waiting in the room for my husband who was celebrating his birthday during our stay. The location was fantastic - right in the heart of Shibuya, with lots of restaurants, shops and the station a few steps away. Having the hotel in the Shibuya Mark City complex was really useful - we were able to get to Starbucks and FamilyMart really quickly to grab some essentials, and we got takeout from Tonkatsu Wako one night when we got in quite late. We would absolutely stay here again!

We spent 2 nights here with family. What a great location for seeing this part of Tokyo. Our college age kids loved the street life, urban shopping, great restaurants, karaoke etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. Loved staying here! Shibuya crossing is right out front of hotel and the subway across the street - super location!

Great location in Shibuya, around a 40 minute bus transfer from Haneda. The hotel is in the same block as the railway station so easy to get about the rest of the city.Excellent shopping area in the direct vicinity and easy to navigate.Surrounding area whilst busy with tourists also had a decent feel of a neighbourhood and had some good places to eat and drink on your doorstep.Hotel itself is typically compact for the city.Rooms are small but comfortable. Check in starts rigidly at 2pm apparently regardless of how many people are waiting or that the rooms are ready.Cost me just under £200 / night room only over a weekend which seemed in line with the other options on the same dates.I didn’t eat or drink there although believe there was a cafe on the lobby floor.

My husband and I only stayed for one night over a weekend. The woman who checked us in was very friendly and spoke perfect english, which we do not expect from people but it was great for us. She brought up a possible room upgrade if I wanted to pay extra but we declined. We booked a semi double room standard. However, when it was time to come up to the room, I believe she upgraded us anyway, with no extra charge as the room was bigger and the bathroom more spacious.I highly reccomend this hotel for those wanting to be in the center of shibuya.

While I generally lean towards hotels in quieter areas, I’m bringing my 16 year old godson with me on a trip to Japan in July.....and based upon his interests, Shibuya seems like the best place for us to stay. After a lot of research, I picked the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu and made reservations for next month. Having seen some negative reviews since making the reservation, I decided to stay at the Shibuya Excel when in Japan last week to check it out myself. I stayed for two nights in a Superior Single room. The positives:*Quick and friendly service during check in and check out*Good sized and comfortable bed*While small by American standards, the room comfortably fit a desk and chair in addition to an easy chair and side table. *Good AC*Refrigerator, electric kettle and air purifier/humidifier *CNN and BBC - thanks to BadBoyz’s PSA/review, I quickly reset the tv to English with no Japanese voice over*free English language newspaper delivered to room*Great views*Good bathroom amenities *Easy access to the Airport Limo Bus*Right in the center of the action*Easy access to the subway, JR station, mall and Shibuya crossing*Quiet room despite the location *Clean*I was pleasantly surprised to discover the hotel offers room service in the evening although I didn’t try it*Good service and food in the lobby area cafe*Friendly and helpful front desk staff when I had questions*Good availability for guest elevators*Guest elevators secured via keycardThe negatives:* while AC in the room was great, the hallways were quite warm and stuffy* small old stain on the carpet * bathroom dated* difficult to adjust direction of flow for shower * busy and central location may not suit allI was pleased with my stay and will happily return next month with my godson.

I’m not one not to stick out a hotel, especially two nights, but I left after first night. And it cost over $400AUD!!!!!! Absolutely not worth it. Usually hotels are encouraged to update rooms every 5-7 years. I think this one is going on 15!! The room was dark and so small. It smelt, it had an evaporator thing in the room, clearly someone had smoked in there (non smoking room). No food or water, no room service. I arrived late and was starving with zero options.The bathroom door looked temporary like a portable cabin and opened outwards. Sitting on the toilet my nose almost hit the door. It was so old and horrible. The hotel came up as a suggestion as it said it had a gym - it didn’t. The bed was as hard as nails, the pillows tiny and horrible with a plastic type cover under case. Only plus, the view in the pic of the famous Shibuya crossing. If you want to stay right in the tourist zone, great. But don’t spend much time in that hotel

The location wins it for Excel. Service wasn't particularly friendly, particularly for the lady who checked us in, and oversaw our checkout. No smiles unless I smiled first. No small effort to provide helpful info. Felt like China or Hong Kong, not Japan. Being centrally located (and somewhat similarly priced) as Swissotel is to Osaka, maybe our expectations were just high. Give the Excel team great training in hospitality and service and I can see raves coming in.So... 5 stars for location. But after this, unfortunately nothing remarkable.(The lady who handled our baggage on checkout though, was kind and smiling)

I stayed here because of the views offered to Shibuya Crossing, particularly from the restaurant/foyer on the top floor. The rooms are a bit small, but you don't go to Tokyo to lounge in a room, and the rooms were surprisingly quiet for the location, due to the height of the hotel. It's located directly above the metro/train station and the airport limousine bus stops directly here, so access was fabulous. The hotel will store luggage if you arrive early.

Breakfast is to expensive, not a lot of choices and the service is not that great! But the location is perfect near the shibuya station and shopping center.Overall experience for this is average.will not comeback to this hotel.

I only stayed for a weekend for this trip, Haven’t regarded to pick this hotel, it’s very convenient located at the heart of the city, just right next to JR, subway station. We were so lucky being upgraded to corner suit on 24/F, which is the highest floor, view is spectacular overlooking Shinjuku, the room is very big with living room, 4 seats sofa and coffee table. High recommend this hotel for it convenience and good service.

Shibuya Excel hotel is an at best 3 star hotel. The hotel furnitures seem to look very old even though it seems to just have been renovated not so long ago. The buffet breakfast on the 25th floor is forgettable. We didn't even bother to go back after going there one time to have breakfast even though it's part of our stay. The beds look old as well. Housekeeping is also no good. They are the only hotel in Asia I have been that limits water bottled waters to guest and has no 24 hours housekeeping service. I asked for towels around 11pm and I was informed housekeeping is close. Also, the hotel is not friendly to families as they consider kids above 7 years old as adults so you cannot stay in one room if you have to kids who are below 12 years old but above 7 years old. One good thing about this hotel is its location. Its near the commercial area in Shibuya. Needless to say, I will not go back to this hotel ever again.

Bad things first:Rooms are not new but ok (electric plugs , in-room connectivity is not up-to-date - WLAN is OKBUTthe view is fantastic (if you have a room to Shibuya plaza) See attached picture shot from Elevator hall 13th floor.So, you staying here right in the middle of everything in Tokyo.Hint: take time for the breakfast- next to food and coffee it offers a great view on the Tokyo Skyline.

Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our Japan trip. Top notch hotel. Would definitely recommend.Check in: quick + easy. Checked out using a machine, took about 30 seconds.Room: We had a standard room. It was spacious by Japan's standards. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom, everything we needed was there. Great view of Tokyo. Awesome controls right at your bedside. Also provide you with a new set of PJs every day, which was a nice touch.Location: Amazing location. Right in the middle of everything. 5 min walk to Shibuya crossing. The 3 floors below the hotel are all restaurants, and it seemed like a "tendy" area. Service: The staff were lovely. Always greeted us with a smile, and were very helpful. Most of them speak English, which is not necessary but always appreciated. If you're looking to stay in Shibuya, don't hesitate to book this hotel. You won't regret it. I will definitely stay again when I return to Tokyo.

I love this hotel for its location. But don’t even think about eating here at any time of day or night. Breakfast in the restaurant is always overbooked and the hotel refuses to take in-room breakfast orders after 11pm. Sleep in, eat out!

I have been coming to this hotel every year (usually twice a year) for many years now. Mr. Yoshida is a great asset to the hotel and does his best to make sure my every stay is as wonderful as always. The concierge/bell staff is also great. My go to person is Thakuri but all of the staff there are awesome. I wish I knew all their names so I could acknowledge them all including the girl that got my taxi for me and helped me carry all my luggage (and I had a lot) to the taxi and waited there until I left. The hotel is located within Shibuya station so it is very convenient. It is also adjacent to Shibuya crossing so you are right in midst of the Shibuya excitement. You can do all your omiyage (gifts) shopping without even leaving the building. Rooms are a bit on the smaller side and bed a little hard but that is typical of most hotels in Tokyo. I highly recommend this hotel but then again, many already know about it.

We chose this hotel because it is convenient to Shibuya and right on top of the metro. But there are a few things worth knowing. The hotel has no conventional street entrance so don’t try to find it on street view. There is what really is a back door up a concealed alley that the bus uses plus two well concealed hotel lift lobbies inside Mark City Mall. The lifts go directly to hotel reception and are very convenient but until you are familiar with the layout they are invisible. The very best way in from the airport is to use the Limousine Bus which has a route direct to Mark City Shibuya with one stop. This drops you right outside the hotel back entrance with no confusion. Tickets from a stand in Haneda airport lobby (don’t know about Narita). Problem we also discovered is that some dummy allowed there to be two different hotels called Excel to open at Shibuya. If you exit the metro at the wrong exit (South Gate) without knowing then signage will direct you to the other Excel (actually Excel Stream but not signed in full) and it is then a long walk with lots of steps to get back to other end of the station. Also critical is that hotel will not check you in until the dot of 2.00pm because that is their rule. So if you arrive at 7.00am as we did, that forces you to wander the streets in the same state as you got off the plane for over six hours and it is not pleasant. So watch your timings. Otherwise it is a reasonable hotel. Fairly well organized but not Swiss level. We had a big bed and all the usuals, decent breakfast just a shame the tv had no English speaking channels. BBC and CNN were both overdubbed in Japanese. If I really wanted Shibuya I might stay here again but probably Shinjuku is a better area.

This is my second time staying in this hotel, because of its location and excellent service of the hotel , smooth check in , even we were there at 13.30 they allowed us to check in what’s normally at 15.00 check in time . And then we had a high floor on 24 th with a good view to the zebra crossing; so that I had ample opportunity to capture the zebra crossing during the morning or the night which give us a very different scenery. Japanese breakfast is always wonderful, but the western breakfast is also excellent with its fresh fruit and other healthy stuffs and special cheese mouse super.All amenities in the room is fully provided , just I feel that the matraze should be replaced , this occurrence I got also for 2 years ago when Inwas the first time staying in this good hotel.Otherwise I should opt for 5 stars.But still highly recommended hotel.

Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is very convinient - with a bus stop just outside the hotel lobby and the metro and the subway underneath - it was so easy to navigate Shibuya, The staff are friendly and helpful too.

The hotel is located in the heart of Tokyo, very good and convenient for tourist. you will have direct access to Shibuya underground that is located adjacent to the hotel.The hotel room is tiny which is normal in Japan, however, very clean with awesome pillows. If you are a tourist, it is really recommended to stay here.

This hotel has a great location! They have nice and helpful staff, particularly at the concierge desk. One associate directed me to a great dinner, and great shopping sites, all within walking distance.Rooms were not large, but understandable for the price in a big city.I was surprised that there was no gym, or morning coffee shop with pastries (plenty on lower levels of the mall, but not open until 7am), or lower cost option for breakfast. Also, I could not fit my normal sized laptop in the room safe. Most modern hotels have all these things.Without a gym, I did do much walking of the city (over 11 miles for 2 days in a row). The parks to the north are great, and the shopping areas are loaded with people and good fun to watch as you walk.Summary – I would not normally rank the hotel so high, but due to the location, price, and staff, I raise the rating.

Great location...you can walk to hot spots to visit like Meiju Temple/ Omotesando/ Takeshita and Cat Street/ Ebisu, and you are almost inside Shibuya Station, where you have Narita Express and several lines.The accommodation is not luxury, but has a good space, good cleaning and good amenities (shampoo,etc). They also have ice/drink machine on every floor.

Great Location, near Hachiko, near Subways, near crossing, near Center Gai, near everywhere and everything, but if youre travelling with kids who can’t hide their emotions this is not the hotel for you, we are being knocked and called fron the fone several times because our kids are noisy, sometimes they do cry sometimes they are overjoyed with happiness and excitement, it is our first time to experience that, and it is very rude for a family who wanted to have a decent vacation.. killjoy... tsk tsk

Great location. Hotel staff goes above and beyond. Within walking distance of great shopping. Right next to a transportation nexus. Some wonderful little restaurants with great food. Even a McDonald's (yuck). Train ride away from great sites. Stay

This hotel checked my three main boxes: cleanliness; convenient location; and comfortable beds (yes, beds and pillows are on the firm side, but we're finding that throughout Japan and we're fine with it). The star, here, is the hotel's location, right next to Shibuya Station and in an excellent area for restaurants and shops. Why only four stars? Our superior double room was definitely on the small side, and the hotel and lobby have a more impersonal feel. However, you cannot go wrong if a convenient location in Tokyo is important to you. Bonus: Many of the hotel windows, including those near the elevators, look out over the amazing Shibuya crossing!

It’s just next to the Shibuya station and major shopping malls and the famous Shibuya crossing is just downstairs, very convenient and also the rooms are bigger than the other typical hotels in Tokyo. It has direct shuttles to the airport and occasionally there are Narita Express passing this station. Easy to travel around!

I stay in this hotel serval times. Their service is getting worst and worst . Reception no smile and impolite . I don’t know why they are rushing for check in , although it don’t have people queue behind me. The concierge is unwilling to answer your questions . The room is old and have smell. It’s not valuable tor high price . Only the location is good. But I won’t stay in this hotel anymore. I feel so disappointed. Same price have many choice in Shibuya. Pls consider before you book thus hotel .

Hotels location is really terrific everything's at your doorstep. From shops, to restaurants, to stations. But I'm writing this review for one particular STAFF who eventually became a friend named TAKORI, great guy who helped and never gave up on getting my cellphone back. Plus he really speaks English well, so that's a huge plus for those guests who doesn't really speak Japanese. Will definitely be back to stay in this hotel and hopefully takori will still be there.

This hotel had everything I needed for a comfortable stay in Tokyo. Our room was spacious for 2, especially for Tokyo, with plenty of room for both our suitcases to be neatly out of the way. The beds were small and the pillows were hard, but the beds were comfortable enough to get a good sleep. The bathroom is a tight fit, but clean and easy to use. The size was made up for with the room having a full sized, light up mirror as well as a smaller, well lit mirror which could be used for hair and make-up. I didn't have any interactions with staff, but our room was always cleaned in a timely manner and without any issues. The airport limousine bus dropped us off at the front door, making it an easy journey from the airport. Having the train station directly under the hotel made getting around Tokyo a breeze. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Small rooms and hard beds but fantastic location.Easy to get to from airport. Limousine buses stop right at hotel lobbyBar is average and closes early.Right next to train station and mall so there are food options very close

I would stay at Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu again for the fact that they have airport limousine bus to and fro the airport at various hours, much more compared to other hotels. It stops near the hotel, so that is a plus. No need to carry luggages up or down steps. Did not see much staff during the day, so can't really comment on it. The staff I met during check in was much friendlier than the staff I met during check out. I did not see any bell boy at the hotel, nor did I see anyone opening doors for guests. So this is not those kind of fanciful hotel. Though I had expected it to be for the price of its room. For the price I paid, I would expect better service from the staff or to at least see more staff around, but really, all the staff I saw were behind the reception counter, thats it. I travelled with my parents, so I booked a triple room. The room was spacious enough, for 3 beds, 3 bedside table, side tables and chairs and enough space for 3 luggages. I think it is good that the toilet and the shower are in separate rooms. The room provided enough towels for all 3 of us, replenished everyday. It also provides combs, shavers, toothpaste and toothbrush, slippers, and many more. Hairdryer is also provided. The pillows are a little hard. But its better than if it was too soft. The bed was comfortable, not too hard or soft. The room does have a flask for boiling water, however, ours was already filled with water. We were not sure why, so we did not use the flask. The hotel links to the Shibuya Mark City which has some great food. Don't need to venture out to look for good food. It is near the JR Shibuya station, however, despite staying there for 4nights, we were not able to figure out how to get from the JR station to the hotel. It's quite a nightmare navigating the station. I would stay there again because the location is good and the room is spacious enough and provides all the necessary amenities.

Hotel is at a very convenience spot with direct access to both shopping mall and Shibuya Station. If lucky, you could have a view on the businest junction with hugh amount of pedestrian crossing. This crossing also held the best New Year Countdown Event on every new years eve. Direct airport shuttle is also avaiblle which could offer you a comfortable ride without carrying your luggages up and down those JR station stairs. The bus terminus at the lobby level also provide express shuttle to lots of different attractions, i.e. Kisarazu

Located in the heart of Shibuya, Tokyo. Easy access from Haneda airport taking the airport bus which stops directly in front of hotel. If you love shopping and dining out, this is the place to be. Super convenient, with usual sized Japanese rooms.

Excellent location, much convenient compared to cerulean tower which I stayed at the last time. Some pachinko on First floor so a little worried bout rowdy crowd late at night. Amenities are sufficient though bathroom feels oldish. I stayed at 23rd floor and could still hear soft rumbling train sound at night.

Staying here for 5 nights and already loving it on night 2!!! Great location, super close to Shibuya station, in the corner room on the 24th floor with a view of Shibuya crossing. Absolutely stunning! Close to lots of shops and the Hachiko statue. Room is nice, twin beds but two of us can fit on one. They provided so many extras from razors with shaving cream to hair bands to tooth brushes with toothpaste - not even the four seasons gave us those things! Big room, nice bathroom with complimentary water everyday and lots of plug points.

As reviewed by many other travelers, this Hotel is situation at the perfect location in Shibuya. Convenience stores, shopping malls, eateries & even the Train Station (Shibuya station) are all within proximity of the hotel. Hotel Service, cleanliness and everything else is ok and they have competent English speaking staff at the Concierge.The double room I booked was rather tight, but the bed was very comfortable. Wifi is fast and the signal is excellent! They even have wired lan (the one in our room was not working though) in all rooms. There have ice & a vending machine (serving drinks) located near the lift lobby at every floor.

I was introduced to this hotel10 years ago when I was here on business. I choose to stay here when I can every time I have to come to Tokyo. This is a review based on our previous stay. It's a hotel you can catch the train to -from Haneda, we wheeled our 3 large suit cases straight from the belt to our room. Not much has changed. The service is still excellent and the quality is still up there in comparison to some of the other big hotels I've stayed at like the Hyatt in Shinjuku or The Prince in Shinagawa. The biggest attraction to this hotel is its location. You can walk everywhere and it will take you days to explore Shibuya itself. There's Food Show (top notch supermarket) directly across the road and Tokyu Hands (from haberdashery, toys, adventure, stationary to hardware) just around the street. You can walk to Yoyogi park, Meiji Shrine, Cat Street, Harajuku, Omotosando, Jingumae. Although in the epicentre, it's relatively tranquil from above. Views of Shinjuku is impressive, especially when there is a blimp in the air. If you want cool little bars and more neighbourhood atmosphere, pop over to Shimokitazawa - a few stops from the above ground station right below on level 1. I was there with my family this time but in the past, I've had some good nights out in the many bars and live venues in the area. Breakfast buffet is a must. Has everything you need plus more. Our daughter got quite ill and we had to call an ambulance. The hotel sent a translator to look after our needs. So much appreciation and commendation to Nakemoto san for making sure we had a good departure to the hospital and the follow up call to make sure we were okay. Despite having seen much more grand and luxurious places, The Shibuya Excel is always going to be our first choice for service and location.

1) Super excellent location, right on top of Shibuya center / crossing , direct access to trains stations and bus terminal 2) Very average breakfast, not many options. Expect delay and long queue on weekends 3) Staff are generally very helpful and nice except the housekeeping- they didn’t clean thoroughly. They seemed just making the bed. 4) Busy hotel! Overall my stay was with family, we just needed a base to explore Tokyo and I didn’t mind this hotel due to its superb location. If you are expecting a personal touch and you’re looking for an experience, then this hotel is not for you!

You really cannot beat the location, but as it is so central you will pay for it. Yes there are more economical places to stay in Tokyo but the views are pretty amazing and access to the station to do exploring is great.We had a three bed room and found it quite large for Tokyo, and suited us well for the two nights that we were there.We choose to stay here also as the airport limousine from Narita airport drops you right at the front doors - so no need lug bags onto the trains after a long flight. The deco is nothing exciting but it is clean and the beds a comfortable.

We stayed here for 5 nights in a four bed room. The room was clean and fitted us snugly with our luggage. This hotel is right above Shibuya station (in Mark City), so choices for food and shops were great. We speak no Japanese but it was easy to check in as a few of the staff speak English, in fact we found all the staff were really helpful. The bathroom was a bit squeezy but that seems to be the norm in Tokyo. They also had coin operated washing machines and dryers on the 8th,9th and 10th floor which was really handy. We would definitely stay here again due to the convenience of the hotel location.

Hotel is nice, location is in the heart of the famous shibuya crossings. It was amazing to see how busy the crossings was. It was the highlight of the Tokyo new year event . We were expecting fireworks but nothing happen. It was just the new year countdown. I think new year in japan is not celebrated with fireworks. Very quiet event. Our hotel offered a free drinks for the guest and a light entertainment. A jazz singer which is quite ok. Breakfast is not included on the $500 a night rate for the room. Anyway, overall hotel is cozy .

Spent a couple of nights at the Shibuya Excel Hotel when we arrived in Japan, predominantly for the famous crossing. Asked for a high floor with a view of the crossing and got exactly that. Wonderful views over Tokyo and was fascinating to just watch the crowds traversing the crossing with a drink in hand in the evening.Beds were ok and fairly comfortable, bathroom likewise. Hotel staff seemed to struggle with English-speaking guests but were very friendly and helpful. A great base to explore the very buzzy Shibuya area, although rooms could benefit from a lick of paint to bring them up to speed with other hotels charging similar prices.

We stayed at this hotel for 10 nights and it made a great base from which to explore Tokyo. It was conveniently located right next to Shibuya Station (great for commuting and not as complicated as Shinjuku Station). Super easy access to downtown Shibuya with its myriad shops and eateries. If arriving by train, follow the directions to the Tamagawa exit once you arrive at Shibuya Station. Exit the gates and head right following the signs to Hotel Excel Tokyu / Mark City.We stayed in Superior rooms and found these to be spacious and very comfortable. Rooms had everything we needed and wifi worked fine. This is the sort of hotel that would suit people who are more interested in nice comfortable rooms with easy access to transport and downtown Shibuya rather than people who are looking for pleasant greetings from hotel lobby staff on a daily basis. If you want personalised and attentive service, then this hotel might not suit you. We did not need anything at all during our stay so the only time we spoke to staff was at check-in and check-out. They were polite and efficient, and basically gave us privacy for 10 days which worked perfectly fine for us.Tip: Tokyu Food Show is located nearby (opposite the Shibuya Station Tamagawa exit). This is a great place for picking up food like bakery items, sushi, sashimi and salads for when you feel like eating in the comfort of your own hotel room.

We have stayed at the hotel twice and will definitely choose the same hotel whenever we are in Tokyo. Staff is very helpful and efficient and location is amazing.Book a room overlooking the Shibuya crossing, city view from the hotel is beautiful.Shopping and eating areas are a short walk and is well connected with the train station across the road. Great place to stay in Tokyo!

We loved this hotel - so many modern features including a robot that delivers things to your room from reception. The hotel is situated above a range of restaurants and a five minute walk to the JR station.

The hotel is a bit pricey but with this wonderful location, we won't complain. We only stay one night in Tokyo so we decide to find a hotel with great location and easy access to all attractions. We were so glad staying at this hotel. Everything is within 2-10 minutes walk from the hotel. We can see Shibuya crossing from our room so don't forget to request for room with a view. Or else you can clearly see the crossing from the window near elevator. About Life Cafe is less than 10 mins walk up a tiny street(toward the back of the hotel) from the hotel. We went there twice to get good coffee. Highly recommended.Plus we can even use our JR pass on Yamanote line which is great to access to other station such as Shinjuku and Tokyo or other JR station.Shibuya has all the shops we need such as Zara, Muji, Adidas, and countless others. The hotel itself is above Marc City shopping mall with direct access to Shibuya station.. They even have One Piece shop at OIOI mall near Shibuya crossing.The thing that we do not like is the long check-in queue. This hotel is very popular for tourists in all nationals so be patience during check-in (14.00). You can leave your luggage before check-in or after check-out. So you save a few bucks on luggage storage.

My son and I stayed at this hotel on Jan 2-6. We took the limousine bus from Hanada airport to this hotel within 45mins. The hotel is above Mark City and you can find a lot of good restaurants for breakfast so I didn’t book room with breakfast included. I paid another US$30 to upgrade to corner room. There was no closet just hangers hanging the clothes next to the TV set. But the room was big enough for 2 of us which was around 27sq ft. I love the view but at night it was a bit noisy since the famous Shibuya cross street just downstairs while we stayed at 11/F. The bathroom is quite small and really need a makeover but I will still choose this hotel next time if I go for shopping with my friend. For a trip with my son, I would still prefer the Capitol Hotel Tokyu as its bigger with nicer design especially the bathroom. Excel hotel is more for convenient purpose!

large room, clean the staff hotel so friendly , its location close to shops and restaurant, the train station below the hotel, statue Hachico just near by, if i were to Tokyo i would stay in this hotel.

Right across the street from Shibuya station, wonderful property and staff was very helpful. I stayed on a high floor facing Shibuya crossing and it was very cool. The room was not tiny and had all the amenities one would need. While not a luxury hotel it was high-end.

Stayed here for one night upon arrival during NYE. One of the best locations if not the best as it was smack bang in the middle of Shibuya. This is our second time in Japan and enjoyed Shibuya and the hotel's location.The room was quite small so I suggest getting a bigger room if you are staying more than a night and plan to spend more time at the hotel.Value for money as well!

I've lost count of the number of times we have stayed at this hotel. It is definitely our preferred hotel in Shibuya. Ask for a room on the "scramble crossing" side of the building - great views. We stay in the corner room - marginally bigger than other rooms (and I mean "marginally"!) I can't fault this hotel. The staff have always been friendly and helpful. I'm really surprised to read reviews where bad service is called out. I have NEVER experienced bad service at this hotel (or anywhere in Japan for that matter). I haven't eaten at the Hotel (there are lots of great restaurants in the area). If you are flying into Narita - I strongly suggest you take the limousine bus from the airport to the hotel. It's basically direct and avoids the hassle of dragging your suitcases on the train. It's on time (of course) and runs every hour I believe.

1. Location - Excellent!!! 11/10 haha; Very near to all shopping areas; Bus stops here; Bus loads here2. Room - Very spacious3. Price for Room - quite expensive but you get what you pay for4. Fast Check-in

First off the rooms are a little pricey but Excel Hotels have some of the best locations where ever they are. Check is typically Japanese, smooth and efficient. Staff are always very courteous and professional. Rooms are typical Japanese. A bit on the small side but I'm fine with that. No complaints about the bathroom or shower. There is a nice breakfast buffet with crazy views of Shibuya. Price was reasonable for the service and what was offered. I'm confident that the hotels in Honolulu would manage to double the price for a similar buffet. Really enjoyed staying here.

Crowd Tokyo , too many tourists, less friendly , tasty food and good as usual , more expensive to visit in Tokyo , a lots of fake goods in harijuku by the Africans , better visit 2020 before the Olympic, this is the best convenience hotel that you can ever have in Tokyo if you like to shop and night life

Location is just top of Mark city shopping, nearby famous Shibuya crossing. Easy to go anywhere since the train station just step away, easy to get something to eat that’s lots of restaurants. Hassle free to get the express bus to/ from airport .The bus stop front of hotel. We stay in Quad room with 4 single bed, room is clean and comfort bed.Definitely will come back .

I used to stay at the beautiful Cerulean across the highway but the Excel is impossibly convenient. So easy to step out and grab something just downstairs. PROSAirport Limousine Bus drops off on lobby level of hotel. Smack in the midst of Shibuya. Right next to that crazy crossing. Don’t even need to leave the building for shops and restaurants. Indoor link to metro station. Decent 4star. Great shower pressure. Reasonable rates. CONSCNN with Japanese translation so cannot hear presenter.

We stayed here on our recent inspirational trip for work and it was a great hotel base to navigate around Tokyo. The room was quite small but perfect for one person alone. The bed was comfortable and I loved the dressing table in the room. The view I had over Shibuya was also incredible and I enjoyed sitting and watching the world go by when I couldn’t sleep (jet lag)I would definitely recommend this as a great location for exploring.

The hotel is located in the heart of a bustling center, close to the subway, and its dining room is located on the 25th floor from which the view of the beautiful city is seen.Rooms are spacious and cozy.

Stayed in May 2018 for 4 nights at the end of our trip. I found the many room types all a bit confusing, and only a certain few room types could be booked on their website even though it appeared more options were available. Regardless, we booked a "View Double A Non smoking", which was located on the 15th floor. It was the most expensive hotel of our holiday but we felt worth it due to its location. The room was very comfortable for the 4 nights stay, definitely not large at all, in fact most of the room was taken up by the very large comfy king size bed. There were lots of little touches in the room that made it great, such as a vanity area with mirror for getting ready/doing your makeup in, a small table for use for eating etc, and the wardrobe was one of the largest we encountered, which was handy because by that point we'd done heaps of shopping we needed to store somewhere. The room had a view north over shibuya, but as it was down the end of the hall we were unable to see the crossing. The crossing however could easily be seen out the end windows near the lifts (great for photo purposes)The bathroom was the most disappointing part, very ugly brown tiles, but servicable. Could do with a re-do. Check in and out was fairly fast considering how busy the lobby area is. However, we stored our bags after check out for a few hours, and getting our bags back took a long time. Location was great, the hotel is on top of the Mark shopping centre which is attached to Shibuya station. Coming out of the station you can get to the hotel lobby easily and quickly without going outside at all. The area is always intensely busy, so if you are after somewhere quieter and away from the craziness, staying here might not be for you. As soon as you head down from the lobby it hits you!

Our room was on the 24 floor with a great view of the Shibuya Scramble. The room was large and bathroom small. Very clean with lots of amenities. Lots of hot water in the shower. The hotel sits on top of two shopping centres with many restaurants. Under all of that is the metro, subway, Keio and JR rail lines. The local buses also stop outside. The airport limousine buses stop at the front door. The breakfast room has a fabulous view and has an Balmuda toaster; try it for fluffy warm toast inside and perfect toast crunch on the outside. Highly recommend.

This is the hotel I will usually stay at whenever I go to Tokyo unless it is full. I love it very much as it is close to everywhere, to shopping, eating and all means of transportation such as JR, metro, buses etc. The Narita and Haneda airport bus stop is just right at the door step. Their staffs can speak good English and there is no problem in communicating with them at all. Their rooms are also big, comparing to most of other hotels in Japan. I have no problem in opening my 2 big suitcases in a single room where I stayed this time; and I still have space to walk around. It is not cheap though comparing to 5-6 years ago and I can see that their room rates are keep on increasing almost every year. This obviously is a downside but again, I would prefer to pay for bit more to stay at this hotel as other proper hotels in Shibuya aren't really way cheaper (or unless they have special promotion lol~).

Stayed here on the last night of our Honeymoon. We stayed in the corner room with the view of Shibuya Square. It was a large room, largest ive stayed in Tokyo, with sweeping views of Shibuya and the shinjuku skyscrapers in the background, with. You could look down onto the famous Shibuya square. Room was very clean. Check in is a bit of a hassle given how busy the hotel is.

We stayed at this hotel while visiting Tokyo during June and we like the central location and its proximity to transportation as well as being in Shibuya. The hotel was has high occupancy throughout the year and the staff is now quite jaded. Even though we stayed at the hotel as part of a travel package we arranged through JTB, when we came back to the hotel after a couple of days away in Hakone, they wanted to initially downgrade our room. When we protested, the gentleman handling our check-in said "Then, no breakfast" and took the breakfasts which were part of our package away. I did not contact JTB for this as we did not want to complicate things but I certainly will not stay at this hotel again. Even though its a block or so away from Shibuya Crossing, I would much rather stay at the Cerulean from now on.

Book through their membership site to save more. There was confusion during our check out, we thought we were already paid, but found out we still had to pay hence check-out took longer. Service maybe because of the busy season can be better. Clean rooms, not too small. Convenient access to shuttle bus to airport.
user_name:
Cherry A
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed 2 nights. Family Room of 4.Great Location - beside train station, lots of restaurant nearby, great view of Shibuya Crossing, accross Center Gai and Hatchiko, beside bus stopRoom - very clean and nice, usb hubs beside each bed, bath room has all stuff you needStaff - very accommodatingHad a nice view of the Halloween Street Party at Shibuya We are at the 14th flr. Slight Sound of the party or cars could be heard inside the room but its tolerable. Note that its located at the busiest part of Shibuya.

We had a very pleasant stay here for 3 nights! The location is excellent -- there are superb views of Shibuya crossing from the elevator and from each of the floors. Check-in is at 2 pm sharp -- not a minute earlier, but the staff was very nice and stored our luggage for us. We were also "upgraded" to a higher floor room which we appreciated. Overall, a great stay!

Location in front of Shibuya Station and Shibuya Crossing. It’s convenient to explore around this city from here. Front desk are helpful. Noisy, I can hear train inside my room on the 15th floor. You may ease train sound if you turn on air conditioner all night.
user_name:
jw2018939
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: We loved the location because the subway is right there. We came in on a Saturday and stayed 4 nights. The scramble seemed busy in the evenings. Even though this is a huge hotel, we never had a problem getting easy access to the front desk. An unexpected benefit is there is a bus limousine that goes to/from Narita and Haneda Airports. We were so happy about the bus because we had lots of luggage. Our room was spotless and lots of amenities. The shower has great water pressure and very hot water.

This hotel is at a prime location in Tokyo, steps from Shibuya crossing, close to public transportation and some interesting sites. Super clean room with all necessary amenities. Good size, bigger than rooms in NYC and Europe. I expected a very small room. It was comfortable for a three night stay. I strongly recommend for a first stay in Tokyo because of the practical central location.

Great base for a Tokyo stay. Transport links excellent - sits on top of one of the busiest train stations in Japan with abundance of shops and restaurants and very lively nightlife surrounding the hotel. Arrived very early in the morning on a night flight but the hotel has no facilities for showering or changing - which was disappointing. They did let me change in a meeting room - which was better than nothing. Rooms a good size for Tokyo, nothing overly special, good and functional- go for a high floor to stay above any street noise. Western breakfasts pretty good on the top floor. No gym or pool in the hotel. Would stay again.

This is the best location to choose when coming to Tokyo is you wish to be in the heart of the action. The night life, the busy business days, the most crowded cross in the world, the football fields on the top of the building super booked at night, shopping malls and so many restaurants you will never starve! I have been in this hotel many times during the last 15 years and it really make life easier (there is also a bus direct to/from the airport from the hotel itself). And connections are simply amazing... get your MRT/train card (Suica one of them) and travel all around Tokyo and around. Breakfast is also good in the Hotel but overpriced for my test/need. I prefer enjoy some French Bakeries and a good coffee super easy to find around that location and just few meters away.

This is the second time we stay at this hotel. We found that their service level still maintained with previous yearNo questions asked for the location. Location is the main highlight of this hotel. Right in the middle of shibuya with tons of rest, shopping places, games etc etc etcHotel & Rooms is spacious (we choose triple bed for this time while we chose 4 beds last year)Cleanliness is superb as common in Japan. Staff also friendly despite of little language barrier but mostly can speak general englishThey also have limited self service laundrette in some floors which is very convenientIn-Out from Airport is very easy with airport limousine bus stop at the same level of lobby.This hotel is not a luxury hotel but very convenient for family holiday trip / business tripDefinitely still our first choice hotel for tokyo trip

Read this and will save you lots of headaches. Follow instructions to turn on English for CNN and BBC. On remote turn on television, upper left hand corner "red" button. Then press second black button from the left under the "S" to get to CNN. Then press "10" on the numerical keypad. You will see the voice over is in Japanese. That's fine if you can understand Japanese. If you want English you must now "open" the little flap bottom of the remote and press the last or furthest button on the first row of buttons under the flap. There you have it. Now CNN and BBC will be in English and British English. You'll thank me. Enjoy.

I usually write all my TA reviews after I get home from a trip, but I'm making an exception for Shibuya Excel. We arrived last night, jet lagged from an 11- hour flight and typhoon-related train delays, to be welcomed by the friendly staff here. And to our joy, they had upgraded us to a 21st floor room looking directly down at the Shibuya Crossing! All because I had asked in an email if a view might be possible. I know hotels can't always accommodate requests, so we are so grateful ... this has made our trip so special already. I should also add that the room itself is lovely - spacious, and quiet. There are lots of amenities and the furnishings are pretty and restful. But the wall of windows is my favorite part. Thank you Shibuya Excel!

I spent 8 nights at Shibuya Excel.... it has one of the best locations in the region. Right across from the JR station and right at the Shibuya Corssing with all shops and restaurants at your feet (check out Food Show! under Tokyu Department Store).Staff is great and always gave their best to accommodate our requestes. Rooms are nice, clean and bed is comfortable.I gave 4 stars and not 5 for 2 reasons: rooms is not to big and concierge only makes reservations in restaurants once you are at hotel..... And for those who have been to Tokyo know that this means you will miss out of a few top restaurants. Many, like Jiro, only except reservations by phone in Japanese, and usually a few months in advance.Anyway, Excel is a great choice, but if you have the extra bucks Cerulean Tower Tokyu Hotel is better. Cerulean Tower is 5 min from the JR station, has bigger and modern rooms and concierge will help you out once you have a reservation.

Every time I stay in tokyo, id rather pick the location of the hotel than the services or quality.Shibuya Excel will be your best location, food, shop, everything you need in the neighbour. The JR shibuya station is right under the hotel. The room is quite big compare to most of the hotels in Tokyo. I think its great deal with this price and is the most convenient location ever. Cheers

This hotel is located across the street from Tokyu Shibuya station in the same complex as Shibuya Mark City. It is nice, quiet and modern with big (for Tokyo) rooms. There is a coin laundry (one washer and drier - laundromat) on three of the floors. We could see Shibuya crossing from the windows of the elevator.

This hotel is really well situated, right above Shibuya Station. The location makes travel to and from the airport easy, with the option to come by bus or train. Also, commuting for some sightseeing is easy with the choice of subway lines. If you decide to roam around Shibuya, it’s easy to get back to the hotel as it’s right by the famous crossing.However, I did find my non-smoking room smelt of cigarettes and the bathroom had a moulding smell. But I had to remind myself it is a three star hotel room.

Loved the location of Shibuya Excel hotel! It's directly above the famous Shibuya crossing, right above the JR lines and the subway lines which means getting anywhere in Tokyo was a piece of cake! Many big shopping malls all around the hotel, Food Show in the basement is worth checking out although everything is very expensive.Room is what you'd expect in Japan, quite a tight space but enough for me and my fiance. The cleaning guys didn't vacuum very well nor did they mop the toilet floor as I accidentally spilt some coffee on our second morning there and the stains were still there by the time we left (5 nights later). Minor detail though, as you don't come to Tokyo to stay in your hotel!!The main complaint I do have is the lack of English speaking concierge. We tried asking whether we can hike up to 5th station at Mount Fuji but the girl (while very lovely and polite) couldn't understand what we were asking. We wanted to know if we have to show our shopping at airport customs on our way out of Japan as all tax free purchase receipts were stapled and stamped onto our passports, but she either didn't know or couldn't understand. We also asked the same girl to book a Michelin restaurant for us but she said it was "impossible" to get a seat. To her credit, she did book another restaurant for us and she did try very hard despite her limited English.It is extremely frustrating when hotel concierge cannot effectively communicate with their English speaking customers when it is part of their job to do so! Despite that, it is in a great location and very convenient!

The room a bit small but cosy .. the location is excellent especially when it rains you do not get wet.. the train just downstairs... the view of the Shibuya crossing is great.. will stay when I come back to Tokyo...

Location of this hotel is very convenient. Room is clean with comfortable bed. Customer service was great and staff were friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out was very efficient. Thank you to all enabling us to have a good stay there during our business trip. Will definitely come back again.

I stayed at this hotel from 13 May to 17 May 2018. I created this tripadvisor account to write this post.It was almost everyday I encountered bad service staff from this hotel. My bad experience started on the first day. I was in the queue to wait for my turn to check-in. An older looking staff allowed another guest to cut my queue. A colleague of his alerted him but he ignored. That colleague of his seeing his reaction quickly ushered me to the next available counter for check-in.Second bad experience was with the housekeeping staff who brought the ironing board and iron to me. It was 1+am when I requested it. Upon receiving the ironing board and iron, I was told by the staff that I have to return within 45 minutes. I told her that it is very late and I am tired and ask if I could return it tomorrow morning, she declined.Third bad experience happened when I wanted to book the Limousine bus from hotel to Narita Airport. I book the voucher through Klook and instruction given was to exchange the voucher with the hotel front desk for the actual bus ticket and book the boarding time. At first, the staff keep saying I have to book myself as the hotel do not assist with the booking despite me showing him the voucher. I clarified with Klook and they assured that the hotel can book for me. Hence, I tried again the next day with a different staff. True enough, that staff issued me a bus ticket and a lady helped with booking the boarding time. Due to many bad encounters with the hotel staff, I confirmed with the lady the boarding time to be 9.30am, She said yes. The next day when I am checking out, I asked the front desk staff where I can board the bus, to my horror, the staff said that the bus had left. I was at the counter at 9am, so I confirm if my boarding time recorded is 9.30am. It is not, what was recorded was 7.30am. Seeing my frustrated face, the staff serving me quickly assured me that I can board the bus at 9.30am as he had included my name in it.All these bad experiences had deterred me from staying with this hotel again. I never imagine service standard in such reputable hotel can be so bad. Is it they are too complacent?

Reception is helpful, service is friendly and check in/out is very efficient. The location in the heart of Shibuya is excellent, and you're just 2 minutes away from the subway. Outside, you are in the midst of lots of very traditional Yakitori restaurants and some nice little bars. Rooms are comfortable but a tad dark. The bathroom and shower are of a decent size by Japanese standard. Breakfast is very disappointing with the buffet food like sausage and bacon being stone cold. Coffee is in a big dispenser and tastes like it's been kept warm for hours. They could really do with a decent coffee machine. (Having said that, they provide a nice little coffee machine in the room). I would not buy the breakfast if I ever come back here. That knocked my rating down by one star. Overall, not bad quality for the price and I love the location.

Room was clean and amenities a plus, Bedding and pillow flat. I paid for a view and received a Alley and backside of building. Superior and Premium only means you will get a higher floor.
