Breakfast don't bother purchasing that soft scrambled eggs and cold chicken no omelet bar. Best you go outside for the price you pay for that. 7-11 next door is a better bet. Location of hotel a major plus. Workers were really nice. Best part of this hotel is its location.

Good hotel, central location in Shibuya, across Hachikō (the dog) statue.Getting around requires checking the maps, and some training."Mark City" (shops and restaurants) is in the same skyscraper, floor 4. You can get to Shibuya train station without going out to the street. Coming back we got lost sometimes.Breakfast included, French buffet - good; Japanese fixed menu - so-so.No ATM in the hotel (there is currency exchange machine in the lobby)There are several ATMs in the Mark City, but they are not 24/7 (more like 9am - 9pm)Tokyu Department Store is underground: below the hotel - sweets, next to the train/metro - groceries etc (good luck not getting lost there)

This is my second stay in Shibuya Excel. I have 2 things which I do not like in this hotel (1) limited bottle of water without any service water and (2) the iron set for clothes can only be used for an hour. The staffs are accomodating amd approachable. What I like most is the fact that it is located in the center of shibuya. Great view for shibuya crossing and the skyscrapers at night provides a nice view. The toiletries were of good quality. I love this hotel.

This hotel is located above a very busy train station. Lobby is on 5/F. Below the lobby level, one may be overwhelmed by the commuters coming in and out of the station on every level.The hotel is clean but one of our rooms (we had two) had a stale tobacco smell despite the property being non-smoking. The issue is complicated by the room's power supply requiring activation by a room card key to be inserted in a card slot near the entrance door; as soon as housekeeping finished cleaning and left the room, power is off, A/C is off and the stale tobacco odour remained in the room until the new hotel guest enters the room. Not ideal.Furthermore, prior to booking I was given to understand that the hotel rooms have been renovated in 2016/2017. In actual fact only the soft furnishing has been redone and the bathroom still has that dated 70s appearance to it.Once you get over the ugly bathroom and the busy train station below, the hotel is actually quite enjoyable as the location is great. On three mornings we went to three different delicatessens all within walking distance and enjoyed excellent freshly baked bread and good coffee. There are just so many options to choose from in Shibuya.

The Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu offers excellent accommodations with a most convenient location. The subway entrance is right below the hotel. The fine breakfast, either Western or Japanese, is served with a great view on the 25th floor. For comfort and convenience in Tokyo, it's hard to do better than the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu.

This hotel has a very easy access to train, subway and bus. Right in the heart of Shibuya, you don't need to worry about restaurants and bars closing time. Also, for people arriving from overseas, there's a bus direct from/to airport.

Great hotel at the heart of one of the busiest places in Tokyo and on the corner of the busiest set of pedestrian crossings in the world ( feat, in the film Lost in translation” )Get a shuttle bus from the airport, it’s easy and leaves you a few meters from reception. There are several subway stations just a few meters away too. There are fantastic restaurants & eateries on the first few floors under the hotel as well as food markets fashion shops etc. This hotel also has coin laundries on 3 floors as well as a smoking room on the sixth floor. I also liked the fact there is a Starbucks also on the busy intersection where you can sip your coffee and watch people on the busy crossings. It is well worth the money, specially if you’re only staying a couple of days!

Don't hesitate to stay here if you are not looking for a doorman, lobby, old-school place and instead want an adequate room at a good price in an unbeatable location (for having fun and getting around).And, the Japanese-style breakfast may be the best meal you have all day. The Western one could use some sprucing up - I went there once because I was craving fruit and yogurt.The hotel is attached to Shibuya station (great view of the crossing from 19th floor), so you can take the train directly to or from Narita, and you can get anywhere in Tokyo in 30 minutes or less. Good walking to the temples and major shopping. Killer nightlife and small restaurants in the neighborhood. Staff was friendly and I had no issues.My room was a little tired, but everything worked just fine.
user_name:
Jcgannonphoto
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: Believe due to location, this mid hotel becomes expensive. Well, after all, one could choose. Its basically building which up to 4th floor is deparment stores and it has connecting bridge to Shibuya station. Hence connectivity to lots of places are wonderful. Lobby level is located on 5th floor, and it has bus stops for Narita and Haneda. This adds to its main attraction. Apart for connectivity, it is in the heart of most photograph / filmed scramble pedestrian crossing in the world. Simply amazing. I think Shibuya district or area has more shops vs times square in NYC. Foods are nice and price is OK. Make sure to visit Mega Donqi for souvenirs

Location is the #1 draw of this hotel from our experience. The bus from the airport takes you straight to the hotel doorstep, or you can choose to take the train as well since Shibuya Station is connected to the hotel without having to go street level. Having the train station connected opens you to the whole of Tokyo basically so Shibuya Excel is awesome as a base. In Shibuya itself, all around the hotel (from 1 to 15min walk), lots of restos, cafes, convenience stores, boutiques and shops.The hotel itself is quite standard, lobby generally busy but the lines move fast. Don't expect bellboys or doormen here though, you have to deal with your own luggage, which is perfectly fine as the reception lobby to the elevators is a very short distance.The elevator lobby has a good view of the famed Shibuya Crossing, and so does one of the elevators, good but not too great. If you want to take better photos, best to do it from other vantage points outside the hotel.Got the triple room, just right for Japan standards, not too much space to move around but not too cramped either.Overall, the hotel itself was above average but not spectacular, but will stay here again if only for the convenience of the location.

Triple room included 3 large single beds, separate toilet with sink and bath/shower room with sink, capsule coffee machine and great views over the city of Tokyo (triple rooms do not overlook the crossing, however our view was very impressive). Very well insulated from outside noise. Great location at Shibuya crossing, above two separate railway lines, bus terminal and taxi rank. Located aboce Mark City Shopping Centre which included many food options (mainly Japanese), including french patisserie, Cold Stone Ice Creamery, Starbucks. Washing machine and dryer located one 8, 9 and 10th floors. Most staff spoke some English, some staff were fluent. A big bonus was the mobile phone in our room for our use for local calls, local information and google maps app to assist in finding our way around Tokyo.

2nd time staying this hotel. Service was friendly and helpful. Hotel has all the amenities and pretty good breakfast. Room is typical Japan hotel room, small. Bedding was clean and bright. Good for shopper in Shibuya and only 5mins walk to Shibuya station, Hachiko exist.Good stay.

This is my second stay at this hotel and the main reason is the location. The hotel is connected to the subway system, you never really have to leave the building to take the subway. A member of my party had trouble walking and they were very accommodating, it’s great for people with disabilities. It’s also connected to a mall and lots a restaurants. In addition, the area that surrounds it are more restaurants and stores. If you want a hotel that makes you feel like you’re in the middle of all the action this is the place. The rooms are clean, everyday we could tell that the rooms were cleaned. I never saw dust inside the rooms. The hotel staff was friendly but and helpful at all times. Overall this is a great place to stay.

This is the second time we have stayed here whilst visiting relatives in Tokyo. Once again, it didn't disappoint. Right at the heart of Shibuya, above the Mark City shopping complex, it overlooks the Shibuya Scramble. Shibuya station is virtually on the doorstep and the airport limousine bus stops right outside the hotel. Even though there is a great deal of building work going on in the area at the moment, I would still recommend the hotel for its location, relatively spacious rooms and helpful staff.

Probably one its best strenght is their location. You have the best view of Shibuya crossing. Restaurants and shopping areas are all walking distance. Not to mention if your planning to go around Tokyo, train station acces is whithin the same building. Non Japanese speaking friendly place where most of the people I talked to somehow can grasp a few english word ( while few can fluently communicate). I got Two rooms for my family. 1 room is perfectly ok while the room I used have this unusual smell but somehow tolerable. They have accomodating staff and serve good food.  We had a great Japan adventure.

Location location location! That is all! It’s in the centre of everything, Bus station and train station underneath. We got Bus to Disney land right out the back of the hotel. The famous hachi statue is right across the road and the hotel looks over the shibuya crossing, you can even see the famous rooftop soccer pitch from your room. Amazing breakfast views too. Staff very friendly and good english. Rooms were spacious for Japan sizes. So glad we stayed here.

Top location in the best district to stay. Staff spoke limited English but did their best to help. Clean rooms and facilities. Would stay here again. Loved the Harajuku district for restaurants/cafes but limited accommodation options.

The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's right next to the Shibuya station of Japan Railway, the subway, and other railways. There is also a bus from the hotel to Narita and Haneda airports. Also it's in the bustling area of Shibuya.The rooms are all right; they are clean and functional. ButThey are showing the age. It needs some remodeling with new toilets and bathtubs, etc.The service was in general good except for one female front desk receptionist, who hastened us to check out even though I explained to her the problems my husband were having at the time because he was stuck in the elevator. That was not kind.

Stayed there for 3 nights, and even though I was staying alone as my friends were in another hotel I decided to upgrade to a nice room with a view to the Shibuya crossing! It was very worth it as the room would have been just nice for 2 adults so I can’t imagine how cramped the smaller rooms will be (though that’s Tokyo for you I’m told). Try asking for an upgrade when checking in rather than pre-book as they give out better rooms for cheap if available. The hotel is very easily accessible from the airports via the Limousine Bus. You can reserve a seat in advance for the bus back to the airport at the hotel concierge. The Shibuya train station is also at the foot of the hotel making traveling around in Tokyo a breeze. There is also a counter next to the station to buy or exchange your JR rail pass. There are tonnes of cafes and eateries of a variety of cuisines around so I almost never ate at the hotel, but the breakfast looked expensive but decent. Hotel was clean, staff spoke good English and were courteous. There was some sort of a free phone with local data available in the room but as I had a data plan and most of the instructions were in Japanese I didn’t risk using that phone. Don’t expect luxuries like turn down service or extensive tv options, but you’ll have all your basics covered. All in all a decent 3.5 to 4 star hotel.

Stayed 10 nights out of our almost 3 week honeymoon trip in Tokyo. The location can't be beat, it's connected to Tokyo station, a department store and it's right in front of the Shibuya Crossing. We had a great room in the 24th floor with a beautiful view of the Shibuya Crossing. It made it so easy to travel around the city and spend New Year's Eve there right in front of the hotel. There's some floors with coin washing machines and vending machines, very convenient. The service was always excellent. They all spoke good English. Can't recommend it enough!

Nice hotel in the Center of shibuya. It’s near the scramble crossing, the very large zebra crossing. The hotel is very clean, also no guest noise, but street noise,even on the 24 floor can still be annoying . Staff pleasant but very limited English. They do have a self service laundry if you want to do some washing . I carnt comment on the food, but friend says very nice.The bathrooms are on the small side . But you do get great views , and sunsets.

Stayed five nights and pleased with the choice. This is a smart, sleek hotel offering one of the best locations in Shibuya. It is directly connected to the station, a department store, and is serviced by the airport limousine bus. My single room was adequate in size and nicely furnished with a view of the crossing. Staff extremely willing and helpful but as is usual in Japan, English is limited. Things can be lost in translation and patience is needed. The hotel has a good, modern vibe. It is spotless, bright and vibrant. Numerous shops including 7Eleven, very close by.Do be careful to check the price of a cup of coffee at the cafe in the foyer before ordering.

This really is a business hotel, four hangers and no drawers mean you need organised cases. No room service after midnight so don't arrive late. On the plus, very clean with good selection of toiletries and very central location. Would recommend if you are on a flying visit.

The room is very small so I had to upgrade my room. The service was great. The best Japanese sushi restaurant in the building. There is a long 1-2 hour wait but totally worth it. The view of the shibuya crossing was insane and love every bit of it. The regular room that we was place in was tiny. But most hotel room is similar to New York hotels.

At first we kinda lost. We need to go around the hotel twice since we don't see the hotel signage. The hotel is connecting with the mall and only a few steps you will find the subway. The hotel located in the center, so its near to go to everywhere. The service is good, they even upgrade our room. Will stay again and promote this hotel to my colleague for sure.

The hotel is located at ideal location, very near to shopping mall, supermarket, Shibuya station, even the Hatchiko statue! The room is spacious, better than my expectation. I stayed in 4 bedroom. I'd love to stay at this Hotel again when i visit Tokyo in the future..

Coming here by train from Narita airport by train (approx. 50 minutes) one can reach the hotel directly from the train station.The lobby is on the 5th floor of the 25 level building. Levels 1-4 host a shopping center and a food court.The hotel has two restaurants on the 25 floor offering a French inspired western cuisine and a Japanese cuisine.Here the breakfast is served in the morning, too. For breakfast the guest may choose between a not very interesting western style breakfast buffet (continental) or a Japanese set menu breakfast. I would always go for the Japanese menu. The continental breakfast was only slightly better than in a Comfort Inn Motel in the US.The rooms are quite small compared to European standards ( we head already a superior room), but offer a comfortable bed and bath. The air condition worked silently and the view from the rooms was vey nice. The rooms are clean and room service did a great job every day.

We were upgraded to high floor rooms (21st floor; not sure what exact type) which are really nice and had a great view at the crossing and the skyline of Shinjuku (not all rooms have a free view on the crossing though). Bathrooms are small and just functional.On the downside:- very limited public facilities; you can only sit in the crowded lobby cafe or one of the two restaurants which double as something like a hotel bar. Both require a purchase, are not too cosy (except for the awesome view) and after ten or eleven are closed altogether. That is really bad if you are in a group and what to sit down together before retiring to the rooms. We were suggested to sit in the lobby, but there you cannot even sit down facing each ither. I feel that is not acceptable for a hotel of this category; at least the lobby cafe should operate 24/7. This was the reason for 3 stars.- for the smokers: no smoking rooms and only a smoking booth without seats or any comfort (see photo). They could at least move the thing so you can see the window, which has a nice view, while smoking...

We stayed here for 5 days and it was the best hotel for the Shibuya Crossing view. The hotel also provides everything including a free mobile phone that you can take out when touring the city. The space in the room is not small unlike most hotel in Tokyo. It was also a convenient location since you can ride a Limousine Bus from Narita Airport for only ¥1,800 and it drops you off direct to the hotel. The hotel is also connected to Shibuya Mark City which has the Tokyu Mall and a lot of train stations including the JR Yamanote Line which is connected to everywhere in the city. You can reach Asakusa, Harajuku, Ropponggi, Ueno, and many others in this line.

This was a very convenient hotel, located at Marks City, right at the Shibuya Station.From the lift lobby, you can see the famous Shibuya Crossings too. The room was OK sized for 2 pax, bathroom was quite big. Staff was great! Friendly and helpful. We taqbin our luggage from another city and they had stored it for us before our arrival. Very good service. There is also an airport limo bus right at the hotel, very convenient for getting to the airport!

The hotel has a very spacious quadruple room that fits even four adults. Can configure the beds to one double bed with two single beds or four single beds. There is even a small living area in the middle of the room with a coffee table and four chairs. Location is convenient where it sits right on top of the train station. This hotel is a good choice in Shibuya area.

This is the second time I’ve stayed here due to its ideal and great location in shibuya. Easy access to the station and for transfers and surrounded by shops and restuarants within walking distance. Don’t expect luxury or good service here. On checking in we were early and happy to do a luggage drop but the desk girl said she had a room available on a different floor. I reiterated that it was at no extra charges and she agreed,however, paying on check out was a different story = limited English Is the big downside here which left a sour taste on checkout as they blamed miscommunication.The rooms aren’t well vacuumed underneath and along the corners of the bed. The bed sheet had stains and the bathroom is small. Housekeeping doesn’t wipe down or dust. If you’re looking for location and convenience this is a great option, it’s not the most affordable however, and don’t expect asking for help to get you far here.

Great stay... gorgeous views, great staffWe was a small room.. but that was ok as we only used it to sleep inSo check if you want a larger room Downstairs restaurant is very expensive so check the menu firstAll in all we were very happy to be staying there.......as we had been using AirbnbNext time it will be the hotel. Nothing beats coming back from being out all day and everything has been done for you, whilst your away, fresh towels etc heaven

Top spot in shibuya and for exploring the rest of Tokyo. Next to train station. Amazing views of the shibuya crossing and lights. Rooms have big beds but are small when you have 2 large suitcases. Good range of toiletries. Good western style breakfast.

Location, location, and location. The hotel is located right by the Shibuya station, which was super convenient. Many restaurants near by as well as shopping malls. The rooms we stayed in were big and comfortable. Didn't have much of a view but it wasn't that important for us. Will come back for sure.

A new hotel in a great location.Very clean and well designed hotel with great staff.We flew into Narita and Shibuya train station is across the road from the hotel so getting there was extremely easy. Flying out of Haneda was even easier as Limousine Bus left from front of Hotel.On the last day we had lunch at the French restaurant upstairs - what a find! - food was amazing and it was good value too.Will definitely stay here when next in Tokyo.

spent 5 nights here with my husband, check-in and check-out very easy, love the location, very strategic, you can easily get back to the hotel after a tiring day from strolling around the shibuya area. everything was perfect, except the room was not as i expected, a bit different from what i imagined and from the picture, the bathroom is small, but room size was ok considering most of all the room hotel at tokyo is pretty small. but overall everything was good, my stay was perfect and surely i will stay at this hotel again when visit tokyo.

- Great location - we could see Shibuya famous pedestrian crossing out of our window. - - Breakfast to choose from European buffet or Japanese style. - Big shopping mall downstairs. - Decent room size. Bus limo service from airport directly to the hotel $10 per person.On cons side be careful about restaurant on reception floor - prices as steep and if there are two persons each has to order.

I’ve stayed at the Shibuya Excel hotel several times and also their other hotel, the Cerulian. The best feature of the hotel is the location. Their room descriptions make no sense. I booked a Semi-Double room which is only 215 square feet. The bed is a twin bed which only sleeps one comfortably. You are very cosy if there are two people. The room was so small and the bed mattress was so hard I asked to switch to a bigger room. They offered the Premium Double room which has a real King size bed and the room is 323 square fee which is about the normal size of a hotel room in the USA. The room was also on a higher floor but not facing the Shibuya Crossing.Online, the price difference is usually around $30/ night. They said “do we have a deal for you.” They said normally the price difference is around $100/ night but we will give it to you for the low low price of only $60/night which is about double of what it should be. I told them that that I stayed several times at their hotel and also was a Comfort member (their frequent guest program/ should be called Discomfort member) and it didn’t phase them. They said if you want to switch rooms you will have to pay the ransom, I mean upgrade price. Since there was no way I would sleep another night in the “mini me”room, I paid the difference. This exorbitant pricing left a bad taste in my mouth. As a Platinum Starwood member, I have stayed at the Tokyo Westin and the rooms are very spacious with some views of the Tokyo Tower and there is also complimentary breakfast and a Club Floor for Happy Hour. I prefer the location of the Shibuya Excel Hotel but I probably won’t stay there again.

I've been travelling to Tokyo for business for around 15 years and I've almost always stayed at The Shibuya Excel Hotel! It's still my first choice! The best feature of the hotel is the location. Being situated right next to the famous Shibuya Crossing, it is walking distance to all of the great shopping & eating on offer in Shibuya. As well as being an easy walk to Harajuku & Daikanyama. If you want to travel further afield, the Shibuya Station is just across the road.The rooms are spacious enough and simply decorated. And you can get an amazing view of the Shibuya Crossing from the windowed elevators! Getting to & from either airport is really easy with the Airport Limousine bus which stops at the hotel.

This Hotel is just great. Location is excellent, in the middle of Shibuya. So easy to go everywhere and when you are very tried after a long whole day walking around the city it is just sooooo good that your hotel is at the subway/train station. We were on the 15th floor and the view was just a big wow. Thx Shibuya Excel Hotel, we really loved staying at you.

Stayed a few nights for work and this is the 1st time I've stayed in the Shibuya area. Hotel is in a great location and makes a good base if you want o explore Shibuya area. Directly across from Hachiko at the famous Shibuya crossing. Lots of eateries within the complex and surrounding area.Rooms are slightly small but to be expected for a Japanese hotel. The room I stayed in had only a single bed, definitely not meant for double occupancy. Room is clean and efficiently designed.

My first trip to Japan consisted of staying at 2 hotels. I booked a cheaper hotel my first two nights to save a bit of cash but also because I wasn't going to be in my room much. If you are curious, the first hotel was Unizo (will rate it 3*). Shibuya Excel was great. I checked my bags in at 8am since my room wasn't ready yet and came back at 6pm since I had plans that day. They were very helpful in directions and location was right by Shibuya Station. I booked a Ladies room on the 20th floor where of course, no men were allowed. As a couple, my friends stayed in a regular room. The bathroom had Shiseido products (all rooms) but also had an additional sample kit with toners and moisturizers (not in regular rooms). A humidifier was readily available and they had nightwear for me in a pale pink (regular rooms come in white) and slippers to use. Next time I visit, I will not pack sleeping clothes. The breakfast had a huge variety but not worth the additional $20-30/day for me since I don't each much and would rather try new foods. View was wonderful from up top though. The room itself was clean and they had laundry machines on a few floors if it's needed. Friends used it when they got soaked in the rain and mentioned the dryer was slow. You can find detergent at the local dollar store. Bonus: They also include a cell phone in your room that can be taken out. Internet is slow but useful for mapping and local calls are free which was great when I needed to make reservations. My room faced the main street (Shibuya Crossing way to my right), and at night I could hear emergency vehicles passing, even on the 20th floor. Otherwise, everything was perfect. I signed up for the Comfort Membership which offers late check out and lower rates.
user_name:
LidaTravels
New York City, New York

review_body: Did not stay at this Hotel, but wanted to review for excellent service. It is really close to the famous Shibuya crossing. We actually were only locating the hotel for Airport Bus Limousine use. We had trouble locating this site. We arrived to the lobby at 12:57pm (our fault). The gentleman at the lobby asked us when we needed to leave and we said as soon as possible. He literally ran out of the hotel with us to flag the bus down to make sure we caught the 1:00pm bus. SO NICE OF HIM. I wish I could review this whole country 5 out of 5. There were many people to help us find the bus site.

OK, the rooms are small but, hey, this is Japan! The location certainly more than makes up for it. Excellent western and Japanese buffet breakfasts to choose from on the 18th floor, some 100m above street level. Amazing views!Clean small bathroom, basic amenities.

The hotel is located almost upon the famous Shibuya pedestrian crossing. It’s close to all manner of restaurants including a great food hall in the Mark City building complex. I have stayed here a lot for business and their understanding of the needs of business travellers is underwhelming- try getting them to print something (very difficult). All in all though it’s a nice place to stay.

My brother and I ended up staying here after we found our Airbnb to be unacceptable. The staff was great. They spoke English and were very helpful. I loved that it was in the mall And that it gave us really easy access to the metro. We were on a high floor and when we were in the transparent elevator, we could see the Shibuya crossing. We would have stayed here for the entire trip but it was fully booked in the middle of our trip so we only stayed for two nights and went to another hotel.
user_name:
LostTraveler510
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Reasonable hotel in a great location. Rooms were clean tidy and comfortable. The hotel itself was busy and a bit impersonal but thats what you get in a fast moving location. Hotel itself is above the metro station so great for getting around the Tokyo area. There are also lots of shops and eating places to enjoy.

The size of the room was excellent when compared to some smaller rooms in other parts of Tokyo that took us by surprise. Very comfortable hotel with excellent breakfast and amazing views from the room and from the restaurants. The location is also ideal if you are looking for excellent access to the hip and trendy neighbourhoods in Tokyo. The Hotel is in the heart of Shibuya district so the Hotel lobby is very very busy and hectic. The lobby of the Hotel is not on the ground floor but you will be prepared for all of this if you are prepared to receive the full-on Tokyo experience. There are many many restaurants and cafes outside the Hotel to explore.

This is my second time staying at this hotel. The hotel is easy to find with my heavy luggage as it is connected directly from the Shibuya Station. There are plenty of nice restaurants downstairs the hotel and lots of shopping at Shibuya. I could always bring my heavy shopping bags up to my room and go down again. My hubby and I even came back after a whole day out, rested for 2 hours and decided to go down to the 24 hrs Donquijote Shibuya for late night shopping. Hotel staff are polite and can speak English. Hotel concierge also sell airport limousine bus tickets which made it very convenient for us to go to the airport. My room has nice view of the city as it is on high floor and with a good view of the Shibuya Scramble. I would definitely stay here again when I next visit Tokyo! We love this hotel!

A great base to get to almost anywhere in Tokyo and further!The main rail station is a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Some amazing sights - the Shibuya scramble - 5 zebra crossings in the same place just to the side of the hotel, good food option over the road from the hotel during the day and evening eating is difficult to choose as there are so many places to eat.The Hotel itself has a fantastic breakfast at the top of the hotel with views across the Tokyo skyline over to Gonzales and you can just see Fuji san on the left of the main picture window in the European breakfast area.Room is ok although a little smaller than I expected but this is Tokyo and space is at a premium!Looking forward to returning again.

This is my 3rd stay in the hotel, the location is excellent. The rooms are small but the breakfast is very good. I recommend that you venture out into the streets and alleys. They are all connected. You can walk to H&M, Forever 21, Donki Mega store and lot's of good food on the road level and the basement food street. The Shibuya station is connected to the hotel, so there’s no fear even when the weather changes. I was caught in the heavy storm but I could get back to the hotel safely because of it's location and shelters. There's plenary of shopping around, and you could see the famous Shibuya Crossing while taking the lift to your room. I highly recommend this hotel. The price is worth it.

We stayed here for 8 nights in January and will return here in May. After checking out Shinjuku we have changed our hotel booking to be back here in May. Shibuya is less touristy, the hotel is close to shops and food, and sits above the Shibuya Station. Everywhere in Tokyo is only a train ride or two away so having close train access is perfect for us. It is also where the Narita express stops so it is convenient for fly-in and fly-out from Narita.The other great features of this hotel - it is right next to the Shibuya Crossing; free mobile phone with unlimited data we could take all over Tokyo; free unlimited WiFi in the hotel that worked flawlessly; all staff spoke English; we could leave our luggage with the hotel after checking out until we were ready to catch the narita express home; house keeping were excellent.The downside - the beds were very hard. I had bruises on my legs; toilet needed a bit of air freshener.

Extremely strategic hotel located near Shibuya Crossing. The great place and spot to take a picture or time-lapse video of people crossing the streets. Around the hotel, you can find great cheap food and souvenirs.

Very convenient location, right above the Mark City which is linked with the Shibuya JR/Metro station. There is airport bus to/from the hotel. Very spacious room. Helpful staff as they helped carry our suitcases to the bus stop.

The hotel located at the midddle of Shibuya's hustle and bustle with a lot of restaurants and shops around , above the train station near the famous Hatchiko exit. ( the Yamanota line at this station is convenient to reach almost anywhere.)And above the famous Shibuya crossing. I booked a room overlooking the crossing.The room with a huge window (can't be opened) overlooks Tokyo and of course the crossing. Not large, but comfortable with a small seating area, refrigerator, free Wi-Fi. Also there was in the room a mobile phone with a built in GPS of Tokyo's streets and attractions marked in it . We didn't use it. The bathroom equipped with toothbrushes, toothpaste ,a one-time hair brush and a lot of more comfort treats . The shower with a good water flow. The room was clean and pleasant. The bed was comfortable for sleep . The staff are nice and helpful .Important - If you arrive with a train there is no problem, go up with the elevator to the 5th floor and there the hotel reception. If you arrive with a car, you have to know how to get in. The GPS and Google Maps led us to the entrance of the train station and only after a few rounds with the car and a few phone calls to the hotel reception they explained how we supposed to arrive with the car to the hotel enter, from a side street. So if you come with a car make sure you know exactly how to drive to the entrance.

The hotel has amazing location. Stations shops hachiko etc. the room also Big and clean. Choose highest floor so u can see legendaryshibuya crossing. The room is quite expensive but value for money. For 3 adult and1 child I just Only book 1 big room enough. Access to airport also very easy. there is direct limo from airport . Definitely I will choose this hotel if I go to shibuya. Shibuya is not as crowded as shinjuku.First choice who one first time go to Tokyo.

We stayed in the quad room, which was a good size by Japanese standards. Normal price is a bit on the high side, however we booked early and got a discounted rate which made it very reasonable.Location is absolutely awesome. It took us a little while to figure out how to get to the hotel from the station, but once we had that sorted everything was very convenient. Hotel itself is nice and would definitely recommend it.

The best thing about the hotel is the location. And this explains why the hotel is also pricier. It is located right above Shibuya station which has plenty of train connections to diff parts of Tokyo and Japan. From here you can take the jr line yamanote to shinagawa or Tokyo stn to take the Shinkansen to other cities. The hotel is also right beside Shibuya mark city 5f where you can take the airport limousine to and from the airport as well as the bus to kawaguchiko. Absolutely loved the fantastic location. Close to shops and restaurants. Higher floors also have a good view of Shibuya crossing. However all the convenience means higher prices for this hotel so expect to pay more for its prime location. Otherwise, hotel rooms are quite spacious for Japan's standards.

Location is amazing! Smacked right at the distinctive Shibuya scramble crossing! Very convenient for shopping and food. The room is spacious for Tokyo standard, although pretty basic. Breakfast is on the TOP floor , perfect to view Tokyo skyline.

I have visited this hotel a couple of times now. Their customer service is great, rooms are large (for Tokyo context) and their customer service is great. Staff speaks English very well. The location can not be beat. Steps to shopping, restaurants and trains.

Hotel lobby for check in is on the 5th floor, taxi and airport limo bus also make it to the 5th floor. Below is Shibuya Mark City mall and there is 3rd floor access to various metro line and Tokyu Plaza accross the street. You can avoid to go outside to get food or transport. Hotel entrance is available on the 1st floor right infront of Mark City entrance, shibuya scramble crossing and hachiko statue is almost visible from the door. Twin bed room is bigger than the double bed room. If you need an extra bed, it would be better to book the twin bed room. Room size is spacious for japanese standard. No bell boy but they provide luggage trolley so you might need to walk inside lobby to get the trolley if you need one. Easy to go around for us a family with 2 children ( 2 and 10 yr old) and a stroller, even at late night the area on the way back to hotel is always light and still any people around. Airport bus also depart from this hotel 5th floor lobby so it is easier for us with many luggages. And it is the 1st stop for airport departure so the bus is always empty.

The hotel location is really great!!! Heart of Shibuya, can find food around and below got supermarket.. very crowded area.. But disappointed with the hotel service, no bell man, no staffs to help you with the luggages. Reminder if you take the airport limo bus to the hotel, the bus doesn't stop right in front of the hotel. It stop at the next building although same level but the distance was quite far if you got many luggages and young children like me. The concierge service lousy... don't know why always packed of people. Their infor is not updated, better still no limo, no hotel car service. Funny the hotel consider branded but to my surprise the service very limited. Cos I stayed for 3 nights and moved to Disneyland they totally can't provide any hotel car for me. As I got many luggages and kids around but got no choice hailed 2 cabs which is damn exp..... but again cos I need family room or quad room is not easy to find in Tokyo...

We have arrived today at the Shibuya Excel, and the first impression is very disappointing. We booked a room for 3 (2 adults + 1 child), and we got a tiny room with one queen size bed and no space for an extra bed...so they told us that we had to sleep the 3 of us together in the queen bed!!! They explained me that I booked a “semi-double room”, but I just booked the lowest rate available for 3 persons...When I told them that it is impossible to sleep at 3 in a small bed, they offered me an upgrade...for 10’000 JPY additional per day! After 30 minutes arguing, they accepted to do the upgrade for free, but the room is also a disappointment. It has 2 queen size beds. And the first point of that hotel is to have direct view on the Shibuya crossing...but there is so much humidity and condensations that we can’t see through the window!!!Finally, I will need to pay an extra-charge to get a better room, and maybe better...I would definitely not recommend the hotel.

The hotel is situated in the heart of Tokyo. It is very accessible and very near to a lot of places of interest The hotel is very clean and very "friendly to smokers". The staff - very accommodating, helpful and efficient. This is the place to stay when visiting Tokyo.

Very centralised location, just above JR Shibuya Station, many shops and restaurants aroundGood amenities in hotel room - personal handphone for making unlimited local and international calls such as to Singapore; Shiseido shampoo, conditioner and body wash; bottled mineral water; etcDelicious food nearby such as Midori sushi, Nabezo shabu shabu, Ichiran ramen, Ginza Lion beef steak with garlic rice, etcAnd of course, right beside the famous Shibuya crossing!Recommended!

Location was excellent, close to shops, restaurants and just above rail and metro station. Able to see the famous Shibuya scramble crossing from our lift lobby. Both breakfast options (western buffet or Japanese set meal) were of high quality. Fantastic city views from both breakfast locations. Service was polite and friendly. Staff can improve by providing more info about the hotel and surrounding services(eg coin laundromat near vending machine on levels 8th,9th and 10th)(laundry powder byo or get from convenience store).Room size can be bigger. Limited TV channels. More options for room service menu.

Biggest room we had in Japan in a great location. Took the airport limo bus from Narita right to the door of the hotel. A little hard to find from Shibuya station. I would stay there again due to location.

As a solo traveller who goes to japan at least twice a year, this hotel is superb in the location. Easy accessibility to Shibuya station and also for the airport limo buses. The hotel is connected to Mark City, which has good restaurants (Wako, Midori, etc) Walking distance to most of Shibuya shopping area! Highly recommended. Rooms wise, they are functional and more like what you would expect from a business hotel, clean and functional.

Having just arrived from an overnight flight it was slightly disappointing to be told that I would have to pay extra for early check-in (it was about 11:45). However, we reached a compromise so I was able to get to my room at 12:30. The room was quite small, perhaps not by Tokyo standards, but had everything that I needed as a single traveller. The bathroom was also on the small side with just enough space to stand and towel-off between the bath, toilet and hand basin. The shower (shower over bath type) was very good. The breakfast buffet was on the 25th floor offering an excellent view. You have to select between international buffet or Japanese style and then you are guided to different dining areas. I am not sure why it is not possible to offer both styles from one area which would have been my preference.Overall, provided that you are prepared for a modestly sized room and bathroom, this hotel works very well for a visit to Shibuya.

We stayed 4 nights here and was very pleased with the size of the room (4 full size beds). Room was nice and spacious and clean. Bathroom was also spacious and clean but a little outdated. The location was great!

Absolutely fantastic location. If it is your first time in Tokyo I couldn't recommend this hotel more. You are right above Mark City/Shibuya station, so very convenient for getting right into the action, or travelling within Tokyo or outside of Tokyo. The hotel is clean and quiet, and boasts a great view of Shibuya, including Shibuya crossing. You are right in the middle of it all, but never feel rushed and stressed.Rooms are rather standard, and are fairly small. Nothing to comment here, but within the price range its all essentially going to be the same thing. If you are picky, or are a bit of a princess you may find the rooms to be lacking. Service is great. My partner and I speak Japanese (She is fluent, I am probably 6th grade level) which definitely helped a lot, but most people working there also spoke English.
user_name:
Tom G
New York City, New York

review_body: First time in Japan and Tokyo at all, stay 8 nights Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu, room in 23 floor (Excel Single, non-smoking, free breakfast, free wifi) and window towards the famous Shibuya junction. As most of the reviewers have allready called, the most striking feature of this hotel is the direct location of Shibuya intersection and the presence of several undeground stations right ta the hotel. The hotel’s staff is friendly and helpful, rooms are clean and cleaned daily. Most of the staff can communicate in English. Dare to recommend this hotel.

How you rate this hotel depends on whether you are here as a solo traveler or not. I began my stay here as a solo taveler, and I found the hotel to be better than expected (or, at least better than some reviews). The room, while small, was fine for one person, as was the slightly-larger-than-single bed. And the view, oh definitely the view from the room was amazing - overlooking right on Shibuya junction. There is even a bathtub, and internet was quite decently fast. The restaurants upstairs had such a superb view of Tokyo that it was a marvel everytime I went up there for breakfast. I had the choice of either Japanese or Western breakfast - and this is where it became strange: the Japanese breakfast was very underwhelming. What a pity! So I went to the Western side every time afterwards.But the issues began when my friend arrived, and we paid extra to share a room. We discover that the room was basically the same size as a room for single, but now there is an extra bed... We paid a decent amount more basically for just another bed, and it got ridiculously cramped. Which was really not ideal, and we were not sure if it was worth it or not. Worse, the walls were thin, so you can hear everything going on in the corridors outside, including the next door rooms with screaming kids. Noise proofing is very minimal.That said, this hotel had the best location possible - right outside is the limousine bus to Haneda/Narita, and underneath is a mall that is right on Shibuya junction.Another note is that the front desk is trying, I can tell, but they really need a softer touch as they could come across as very lecture-y at times. So service there could be improved.I would rate the place a 4 stars if you are a solo traveler, and 2.5 stars as a couple. Big variance, but this must be noted.

Me and my friend opt to stay at a place where everything is within walking distance. This is the hotel with the best location. We loved it! We intend to go back next year and stay in this hotel again. Upon checking in, we were asked if we wanted an upgrade to all women’s floor and with a view of shibuya crossing. We did and best decision ever. The view was spectacular and we felt really safe there.

The Shibuya Excel Hotel is a very nice clean comfortable place. Excellent location. Try to get a room facing the infamous scrambled crossing. Higher floors give better views to this crossing where missions of people cross in all directions.

Right opposite JR Shibuya Station, very close to Shibuya bus station and multiple Tokyo metro lines. It is convenient.Hotel is within walking distance to Yoyogi Park, Harajuku, and Omotesando.Shibuya is generally for the young, with food establishments catering to them. Hotel offers two types of Breakfast, I opted for the Western Buffet vs Japanese traditional breakfast. A relatively small but well varied selection, with fruits, mesclun salad, cereal, smoked salmon, cherry tomatoes, scrambled eggs, sausages, breads and juices. I give its breakfast 4/5 for its quality despite it relative small but adequate spread. At the 25th floor, come early to enjoy the amazing views during breakfast if you can get one of its tables close to the windows.There is a free mobile android smartphone for use during your stay, so you might save on some data costs but the phone is generally slow.Housekeeping is prompt and thorough.Overall, the condition of the room was 4/5 in modernity and condition.The hotel is on the airport limousine bus route from Haneda.The two cons during my stay was that, close to Halloween, the noise level from the street parties filtered into the room late into the early hours of the mornings. I was on the 11th floor. The other con being, they are very strict with check in and check out times, don't bother trying to check in early or leave late.Not sure if I would stay here again if given a choice. It is just too busy an area and Japan is not Shibuya.

First time in Japan, Tokyo. Narita to Excel Hotel.....Limousine Bus stops at the Hotel, costs you around 30 euro, but money well spent. No wandering around with your luggage and looking for your hotel. And trust me, not easy when you're first time in Tokyo. I got there 1 hour before check in time ( 14:00 ), was told my room is ready, but had to wait till 14:00. Ok. Very polite staff, apologized and thanked me for waiting. Rules, I guess. Hotel is from 5th floor ( front desk ) up to 25th. Got a room at 17th floor. Loved it. It was just me, so I was OK with the size of the room. I think it was pretty big. Big bed, loved pillows and views to die for ! Some people here don't like size of the bathroom....I had no problem with it at all, small but hey.... in and out right ? Breakfast is on 25th floor and I loved it. You have a choice ...western or Japanese buffet. And if you're a smoker....get a cup of coffee to go and go to 6th floor....there is a smoking area. And they are 4 lifts and 2 of them got brilliant view of Shibuya crossing.....and every floor actually.

The hotel itself is nothing special. It's "okay" and clean and the staff is kind etc.The reason you should choose for this hotel is because of the location. If you want to stay in Shibuya, then this is a great place. From there you walk right to all the nice streets and parts of Shibuya. We always like it when you don't need to take the taxi all the time, when you can walk right from your hotel to all the nice parts. Ofcourse Tokyo is big, so when we visited the district Marunouchi we stayed in another hotel (Four Seasons) to be able to explore that part, also as much as possible on foot.But Shibuya is such an interesting part, so if you visit Tokyo you should explore Shibuya and this hotel is in the best location of the district Shibuya :-)

We had booked a quad room but when we got there we were upgrated to two interconnecting rooms on a very high floor (25?), which was great, since there were 5 of us. The 3 kids had one room and we had the other. Nice to have two bathrooms. Great view of the Shibuya Crossing from the lift and we had a nice coffee and cake in the lobby (see pic). It was very handy being about Mark City shopping mall and the train station.The only thing I would say wasn't great was the western breakfast on the top floor. Just not quite right. Perhaps they need a westerner working on the menu.

Terribly small sofocating rooms, they where also very old and rundown. Also not so clean our sheets had some type of stains as shown in the picture.For the cost of the hotel you can find much better options.

this is our first time stay in Tokyo for 5 days, we were worry about the transportation on arrival, the taxi from airport was quite expensive for us, so we book the limo bus and surprise it make the second stop at our Hotel also they have bus go to both airport in tokyo, it is a plus for the convenient ,the front desk check in was ok with smiles but I feel a bit of odd , I feel it more likely a robot type of welcome it seem lack of the nature smile i was getting from other country in the area like Vietnam, Hongkong, Taiwan.... the location of the Hotel was convenient , it is walking distance the subway and lot shopping and small restaurant around ,

This was our first time in Tokyo and we were surprised by how big the room was. The view of Shibuya crossing was excellent and you could watch the crowds of people moving around for hours. The location is excellent being within walking distance of major shopping areas and an endless amount of restaurants. The added bonus is having the subway station right at the hotel . We would recommend getting the Limo bus from the airport as this is not expensive and drops you at the front door of the hotel so totally hassle free. Hotel service was excellent and rooms were very clean and comfortable. We would definitely go back again.

Located over Shibuya station it is quite comfortable.Rooms are not so big but OK for Tokyo standard.Moquette on the floor looks a bit old and make me feel not too much clean.Service is good even if their english is not the best.I was on higher floor and it was very quite despite railways is just under the hotel and famous Shibuya crossing is very close.Internet connection was quite bad

Large rooms, in Japanese Tokyo standards. Quite comfortable, nice, clean hotel. The bus for the airport goes from there so it's very convenient. There's a smoking area on floor 6 so you don't have to go outside to smoke. The room came with a mobile phone which has unlimited data and you can take around with you and use as a hotspot as well which is super convenient when navigating Tokyo - bonus points for that!

The location itself, looking over Shibuya crossing, is obviously great. For the hotel itself: yes, it doesn't have the plushest bed, the biggest room, the fanciest newest anything, but I found it perfectly adequate, clean and comfortable and would certainly return and recommend. I have been lucky to stay at quite high-end hotels (Andaz, Palace) in Tokyo and yes, they are infinitely better (no surprise there, Sherlock) but also a LOT more expensive. So the key question is: for Tokyo, is this decent value for money, and is it a pleasant, workable hotel with a room that doesn't feel like a closet. In my opinion (and my much pickier wife's), the answer is yes. The breakfast at the top floor was nice, with a great view of the city. Will likely come back.

The location is really unbeatable. You go down and after a few meters, you're at the scramble. Walking distance to everything downtown Shibuya has to offer. I specially like that's its very near Mega Don K. The hotel rooms are small which makes it difficult for travelers with big luggage. The toilet and bath is clean but old. Service is prompt and good. This hotel may be a bit hard to find because it is at the 5th floor of the building and access are small glass doors that open to elevators of the hotel. There's a train station connected to the building where the hotel is so that's a good thing. I may stay here again.

Generally, rooms in the four star category hotels in Tokyo are comparatively very small. Excel Shibuya is an exception with decent plus rooms. A BIG advantage for business travelers on a long haul!Location wise - one of the best locations from a connectivity perspective and eating out. Also, it is just at the edge of the famous "Shibuya Crossing" and it is indeed a wonderful view of the amazing number of people crossing this pathway every day. Shopping too, is very good in this area and in case you are new to Tokyo and you need someone to fetch you everyday from the hotel, they would find this hotel the most convenient to reach.

Very hard to find an entrance to the hotel, taxi drivers don't seem to know how to find it either! But we eventually did by heading in to shibuya station where it was finally sign posted (this really needs improving) The location is perfect though for being right in the middle of shops and all the activity in shibuya. Great views of the famous crossing. Rooms were clean and tidy and bigger than some other Tokyo hotels, fresh towels daily . I'd say the restaurants need some improving so I would venture out of the hotel for great food as you will certainly find it!

We stayed here twice during our 12 days in Japan. Once for three nights at the start of our trip and once for 2 nights at the end. Firstly, the location is perfect. It is right next to Shibuya station and the famous ‘Scramble Crossing’. We walked into our hotel and were immediately impressed by the lobby which looked very clean, Grand and modern, went up to our floor, and were again impressed by the styling in the hallway....and then we opened the room door. It was tiny, old and as basic as it gets. We were staying in a Superior Double Room. There was no where for our suitcases to go, the bathroom was old and quite dingy, and the bed was awful. My pillow was stuffed with hard plastic beads and one of my wife’s pillows had a giant red stain on it. Obviously I got this promptly replaced. To the hotel’s credit, the receptionists and the concierge were quite helpful when they could understand what I was saying, but it was quite hit and miss with the staff as to who could speak English. The western breakfast we ate was iffy at best. The scrambled eggs were mush but with big sightseeing days ahead of me I felt they were my best bet at actual sustenance as the rest of the options were terrible. I repeatedly ate mushy eggs and a croissant with jam as they were the most reliable choices. All in all I would still suggest someone look into this hotel and make their own mind up because if you are relying on the train network a lot whilst in Tokyo, this hotel is really located unbelievably. In other areas though, it’s average at best.

The hotel is great ideally located across the station in the east Mark city mall. Very good breakfast served on the 25th floor. Astonishing view. our only problem was to find it when you first arrive to shibuya station and get some shock.. the sign is tiny/modest.

Across the road from Shibuya station, if you want to stay in Shibuya this is a quiet and luxurious hotel and the staff are lovely. Bed was very comfortable, very clean, really nice decor. We walked everywhere, and had the best ramen I've ever tasted in a nearby restaurant.

Excel hotel in Shibuya was an excellent location to the subway/train station and a lot of other tourist spots. Would definitely recommend!!! Staff was very polite and helpful. So much shopping and eating to be done near by.

Perfectly locating right at the centre of Shibuya. Take the lift and straight you are in the centre of Shibuya, full of shops and restaurants, you will never be bored at all! Room is a bit small, but its Tokyo, space is precious. Hotel service was good. Hotel has Airport bus pick you up and drop you off directly from Narita Airport. This was super convenient, especially Narita airport is far from the city.

This is a four-star hotel located in a five-star location.The limousine bus took us directly from Narita airport to the entrance of the hotel. (That was great so that we did not have to drag our suitcases through the train station or on the streets after a long international flight). The check-in process was quick. The staff was very polite and helpful. We initially reserved two three-bed rooms on 7th-12th floors and got upgraded to higher floors at the check-in. Our rooms were on two separate floors (23rd and 24th) because there are only one three-bed rooms per floor. The room is clean and has basic amenities, except for lotion. The room is good-sized, besides the three beds and a sitting area we had enough room to walk around. I never feel tight. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The hotel is not new or upscale but it is clean and nicely decorated. There was one large complimentary water bottle every day (that is nice).My daughter and I ate at the café by the lobby on our first night (so exhausted to go out). We had an egg sandwich and a cheese pizza. The food was ok and a bit expensive. We did not try other restaurants in the hotel. For breakfast, we had Ichiran ramen every day – just less than 10-minute walk from the hotel. Quick snacks and drinks during the day, we went to a 7-11 store next to the hotel. For dinner, we went to food basement floor of Tokyu department store across the street from the hotel. There are lots of places to eat and shop close by.The view from one of the elevators looking down Shibuya crossing was amazing, especially at night. The lobby is located on the 5th floor of the building. The walkway access to Shibuya station is on the 3rd floor. The first floor is at the street level. It took me a bit time to learn the directions from the hotel lobby. Next to a train station, it is a very convenient for our day trips. We also used the train from Shibuya to Shinagawa (only four stations away) to catch our bullet train to Kyoto.The self-laundry rooms are located 7th-10th floors which we used our room cards to access to these floors. They are stacked washer-dryers in the same rooms with vending machines by the elevators. There are only one or two stacked washer-dryers on each floor. The machines accepted 100 yen coins. I found the dryers were not hot enough to dry a full washing load – had to divide the load into two. There is a designated smoking area in the hotel.The hotel provided luggage transfer service which we used to send our luggage to Kyoto one day in advance before we arrived there. This hotel provides everything I need – good stay in an excellent location for transportation and eateries. I will definitely stay at this hotel again if I will be in Tokyo.

The awesome location at Shibuya Station, literally at Shibuya Crossing (you can see it from the hotel elevator), makes this the perfect stay for those who want to explore Shibuya and Tokyo overall. The room was standard, but well designed and comfortable. Looks like a go-to destination if I ever get to Shibuya again.Just one quaint observation - the room didn't seem to have an off switch for all the lights (we tried all switches we could find), lights went out only if you removed the card from the slot by the door... which also turned off air conditioning. There was a portable air-con unit in the room likely precisely for this occasion, but it was still very hot on an August morning. We later observed a similar situation at other Japanese city hotels.

Happy with our decision to stay here for 4-days while we explored Tokyo. Rooms are small, but that's Tokyo and we managed to squeeze two adults and a toddler in (plus luggage and a cot and a pram). Hired a cot through the hotel which was great - they're hard to find/hire here as most kids sleep with their parents until they're 6yo. Hotel was a great location above Shibuya station and overlooking the scramble crossing, quite, clean and hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There's no gym or pool facilities, but you really don't need them in a city that has so much to experience on offer. Buffet breakfast was average standard buffet, but there really isn't anywhere to get a western breakfast in Tokyo, unless you go to Bill's (which we did instead). Head across the road to Tokyo and the basement floor food hall for all your takeaway food and snack needs.

Great place to stay in Tokyo. Right in the middle of everything- great place to base yourself. Had read about small rooms in Tokyo hotels but ours was spacious enough for a family of 3.Check in and check out was quick and efficient.Recommend.

I go to Tokyo for work every year and this has becomes my new favorite hotel for business. Its located in the heart of Shibuya, basically over the Shibuya station, with tons of restaurants underneath. The hotel rooms are specious, clean with good bathrooms.The reason why i love this hotel is the fact that it is in the heart of Shibuya, my favorite part of Tokyo. You have everything from shrines, old architecture, to tons of cool Japanese restaurants in walking distance. Also on the top floor you have an amazing breakfast resturant with one of the best views in Tokyo! Just see the pictures attached

The location of the hotel is very good but we took a long walk and hassle to go there on the first day after we got off the N'EX at Shibuya Station, as we didn't pay attention to the Exit, but just got off the train and went up an escalator, then to the wrong exit - New South Exit. The room was clean n quite spacious. Two complimentary bottles of water were provided daily(some hotels don't). But I got dry n itchy skin after using the shower gel (I guess that shower gel was common in many hotels there) Better bring yr own. Hotel is connected to the JR and a shopping mall - Mark City, where we enjoyed our breakfasts at the Cafes there every morning. Also, lots of restaurants n shopping centres nearby.

I was in Tokyo for 10 days on a business trip. My company booked me into the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyo.It was a most pleasant stay. I particularly liked;Quiet - good sound proofing and respectful guestsLocation - right in the heart of ShibuyaView - my room had a great view of the crossing and north across the park Service - very efficient and politeBreakfast - "ok"Transfer - brilliant Airport Limousine coach comes straight to hotel. Excellent.Room - smaller than on previous trips around the world, but it is Tokyo!AC - worked well & quietly.Elevators - quick and reliable, great views from the glass ones.I recommend the hotel unreservedly. When there was a small issue with the hotel bill - it was sorted out very quickly.

The location is hard to beat. It's the best place if you want to explore Tokyo. The airport coach stays outside and the Narita Express train stops at Shibuya station, which is next to the hotel. The breakfast is really expensive and if you don't have a voucher, go to any of the cafes that are just outside for half the price. The rooms are big, but there was so much furniture in my room (two desks, 3 chairs) so I had no space to put my luggage. There were few hangers to hang your clothes on and barely any drawers. There's no iron in the room. If you want one you must call reception desk to see if there are any available (according to staff they only have 4, FOUR, for the whole hotel, which has over 400 rooms!!!!!!). Then you have the iron for one hour. After that you must call reception and leave it outside for them to pick it up. If you have lots of clothes that needs to be ironed after a long journey, better bring your own iron or you'll have to call them daily.

Hotel is very well connected to the Shibuya Train Station and various restaurants via the Mark City building complex. I booked a 4 bed room which is very clean, but a bit tight with a center table and 4 regular chairs. Moving them on the side, made the room bigger.Check in was a breeze, elevators have a commanding view of the Shibuya Crossing, plus the window on each floor next to the elevator doors.Room has a lot of toiletry products for each person (shaver, shaving cream, toothbrushes, shower caps, scrubbing mat, ear buds, etc.) even disposable slippers. There is a Nespresso coffee machine which is very much preferred for a coffee junkie like me. Beds are comfortable, pillows are plump but soft...overall this is a very clean hotel. Typical Japanese bathroom, it has tub with a removable shower handle located outside. There is also a plastic bathroom chair and basin...a bit strange for North Americans. TIP: Check a YouTube video on how to get from train platform to the hotel doors (under VLOG account name Japan BackpackersXpress). This helped a lot since we had an appointment plus in a rush to get dinner at Midori Sushi Sohonten which is on the same building complex, Mark City.

I stayed in Shibuya Excel for almost a week. The location is excellent with parks around and even more important, in the famous and vibrant Shibuya area full of restaurants and bars.The rooms are very small as typical for most Japanese restaurants, but well equipped - some even with massage chairs.For breakfast you can choose between Western and Japanese style. All food is of higher quality.The service is very friendly and attentive.A highly recommendable hotel in particular for business travellers who want to catch atmosphere in the evenings.

Only and great advantage of this hotel is its close location to Shibuya station. but Shibuya station is so huge that it may takes over 10 minutes from station to hotel.Other things are not that great considering its high rate.

Went for a short getaway to tokyo for 4nites on 9/8/17-13/8/17. Chose the shibuya excel hotel because of the location and how convenient it is for the airport limousine to drop us off just at the back entrance of the hotel.Arrived early in the morning and reached hotel at 11am. We were told the check in time is 2pm. Not a minute earlier. And the counter lady pushed our passports back to us with an impatient grimace. By 1.30pm there were a group of guests waiting to check in. But still the rule applies. 2pm means 2pm. Finally checked at 2pm sharp. As we are a couple, i requested for a king bed. But nope, we booked twin beds. Rules are rules. We need to top up extra per night to get a king bed. Well we have been travelling quite a bit, so its quite an unpleasant surprise to hear that we cant change to a king bed or even just to have the twin beds joined together. Hmmm...The next morning, went for the breakfast at the cafe. Nothing spectacular about the buffet, not so many choices and food was average. We tried the japanese set breakfast the next day but tasted equally bad. Fish was rubbery n cold. On the bright side, the subway is just at the basement of the hotel. You dont need to get out to get to the train station. Practically well connected to any place you want to go to.Eateries and shopping aplenty just steps outside the hotel.The hotel room is quite spacious by Japan standard and clean too.Overall a good place to start your holiday !

Great location in central Tokyo with direct access to Shibuya train station. My room was a decent size by Tokyo standards and although I was a solo business traveller, it would have been fine for a couple. Check in and concierge staff were very polite helpful with enquiries. Meeting room facilities were very good and staff very attentive.

Located at Shibuya Crossing (right opposite the famous Hachiko statue) with direct access to Shibuya Station (one of the big stations in Tokyo) and Shibuya Mark-City, this hotel offers convenience for travellers. The hotel itself was clean and comfortable. The room were small but so is every hotel room in Japan. The english speaking staffs were corteous , check-in and check-out processes were fast and easy. Two bottles of drinking water were provided every day in every room (we booked 2 rooms). We didn't try any of the restaurants, since there are so many restaurants within walking distance from the hotel, even for breakfast. The soap and shampoo provided in the bathroom were from a very well-known brand in Japan. There were a vending machine and an ice machine provided on each floor. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay and we will definitely consider this hotel if we visit Tokyo again.

We got a room that had 4 small beds in them--2 on each side of the room. Basically 4 single beds unless you share with very small kids. Nespresso in the room was a nice up-scale touch. I like them better than Keurigs since I like espresso more than drip coffee. The room had a small coffee/dining table with 4 cushy chairs in the center of the room in addition to a small desk and the fridge/coffee cabinet. That's a lot of furniture in a small space and it was a bit tricky maneuvering around the room and finding places to store suitcases. But this is Japan, after all. The toilet was in its own small room separate from the bath/shower and sink. That made it easy for all to get ready in the mornings.Our non-female-only floor was high up and had a great view of the Shibuya Scramble--though we didn't know what that was until we got there. We hear that female-only floors have slightly different amenities like face masks and water vapor machines.Our room included breakfast and we tried both restaurants twice. The Japanese restaurant felt like a much fancier style of breakfast and the food was great! The buffet breakfast at the other restaurant was not bad, but is small compared to other larger properties. Plenty of food choices and excellent views of the city from either restaurant.This property stands out a bit because it has coin-op laundry machines on some floors. You can get change at the front desk and machines sell laundry detergent next to the laundry machines. Just make sure to clean the dryer lint filter before drying your clothes--otherwise it can take forever to dry and take a lot of coins.The location is fantastic. Right on top of a subway line and the Hachiko statue. Very short walk to plenty of great shops and restaurants. Very convenient transfers to/from Haneda airport with the bus stop basically at the rear entrance to the hotel.

Excellent location! Only checked in for a few hours, long enough to freshen up, have dinner with some friends from Shibuya, and then caught the bus to the Haneda Airport.The room and amenities were fine, free wifi in the room, and staff were all very helpful. If you need to catch a plane, there is a bus that stops right outside the hotel that will take you to Haneda for just 1030 yen. Great price, If you want to have a nice kaiseki dinner, go to the 25th floor to the Shunsai Restaurant. Excellent food.

Excel is a superbly located, clean and modern hotel right on the edge of the famous Shibuya scramble. Rooms are very small but comfortable, and the two restaurants on the top floor have great, if pricey, breakfast spreads with impeccable views of the city. One has a western breakfast buffet and the other serves a delicious Japanese breakfast. Conveniently located across the scramble from Shibuya station and surrounded by restaurants and bars, most of your needs will be covered here.

We had joined the Comfort hotels reward programme before going and had requested a room on a high floor. We were upgraded to a premium room on the 21st floor with a fabulous view of the crossing. The hotel was clean, brilliantly located, though initially not that easy to find when negotiating the multiple exits from the train station!Check in was easy and our room itself was great. The bathroom is small but perfectly formed and well equipped with toiletries. The hotel is also connected to a shopping mall, and within a two minute walk of a fabulous bakery and coffee shop which we used for breakfast, so I really would not pay the expense of the hotel breakfast.Only negative comment would be that due to the size of the hotel and it's multiple entrances, it's quite impersonal, but if you want a high quality central base, connected to transport and shopping/eating options, this is perfect, and we would not hesitate to stay again

Location is convenient, however concierge was not professional as we are being provided with wrong information. We were told that we are not able to buy bus tickets online to Gotemba factory outlet, which is not true.Housekeeping did not do a good job which I am very surprise as Japan is known to be a very clean place.The cups were not washed and bathroom floor was not thoroughly cleaned.The floor which we are staying has a bad smell near the lift lobby.

I only stayed in 2 hotels during my stay in Japan. This one beat the other 5 stars hotel that I stayed in Kyoto. The location is good, right at the Shibuya station, and next to the famous crossings. I would stay here again if I come back.

We were lucky enough to get a room on the 11th floor facing Shibuya crossing. Although the hotel has transitioned to non-smoking rooms the room smelled a bit smokey. The staff were ready to remedy this my offering us another room but we opted to stay put because of the fabulous views and spacious room setting and with the air con on the stuffiness cleared. Although the breakfast buffett was pricey, it was worth the splurge with good quality Western-style selections. The restaurant is on the 25th floor so you get amazing views of the city. Found the staff to be most helpful and courteous (consistent throughout Japan). The location is a great base because Shibuya station is easily accessible and the hotel is part of Mark City mall. You can shop for food options if you want to skip the buffet, tons of good quality, food options throughout the mall all price ranges. Would def. stay here again as a central base for Tokyo. Still buzzing from the energy!!
user_name:
alofasamoa
New York City, New York

review_body: Shibuya is a great place to be based while in Tokyo, so in that respect I was very satisfied. Also, the concierge was very helpful in arranging for a package and a letter to be sent out. However, we were offered a room upgrade for $30 more a night, and promised a bigger room and a good view. The view was good, but the room was tiny, which made me wonder what the regular rooms must be like! Breakfast was not included for us, and the "western" style breakfast was definitely not worth $27 a piece. It wasn't really western style; the scrambled eggs were a gloppy, unappetizing mess and I couldn't find toast. The lunch was also way too pricey for what we received. Room service was only available at night between 9 and midnight. It was nice having coin laundry machines so we didn't have to wash everything in the sink.

Its conveniently located at the Shibuya crossing.. from here u can explore the city with ease! The room is actually big for Tokyo standards! Charging and watts might be an issue but thats over whole of JP due to the converting. I was here for Halloween, and i must say.. They really know how to celebrate it!Pros:LocationSize (For Tokyo)Clean and restocked dailyCons: Finding the entrance at night is quite the search.. (Main entery closed)

We stayed 4 nights in this hotel. Our room was 4quad room means we have 2double bed and 2single bed in 40sqm room. It's quite big in shibuya and very hard to find in other hotels. Room is ok, not old and not too modern but cosy and homey. Bed is so comfortable. Quad room is not facing shibuya crossing. It's located on the other side of the building. We still have city view since our room is in 12th floor. Since it's quad room, it's not cheap but if you want space, this room is very excellentLocation is unbeatable, right in the center of shibuya and literally next to shibuya crossing. Very easy to find anything you want; shopping, food, fashion; almost anything. It's also connected to station indoor so no need to walk outside Hotel itself is not a luxury hotel, it's a good quality 4* hotel in a very strategic location for you to enjoy shibuya has to offer. It also has washer and dryer in 8-10th floor but only 1 set per roomHotel itself is very busy especially lobby floor. It seems many people always go to this hotel either for meeting point or just hang around in lobby lounge area. But when you go to guest only lift area, it's very quiet Staff is very polite as usual Japanese people especially concierge staff. Their english is fine although not excellent. Free wifi for hotel member Lobby floor also connected with Excel limo airport bus to and from airport, very convenient but very busy. The limo bus is excel group airport limo bus, not the usual orange friendly airport limo bus. They pick up passangers from excel big hotel such as shibuya excel and cerulean tower shibuya before head to airportOverall if you want to stay in shibuya area, this hotel is definetely my 1st choice

My room was at 8th floor and from 8th floor itself it shows really great view. In evening whole city light up with different color. Its an amazing experience to drink hot coffee in window while its raining and you are sitting on top of the city. Wherever you go in Japan the rooms are smaller. Shibuya Excel Tokyu comparatively have bigger rooms.
