This was a good quality 4* hotel. Very clean, helpful English speaking staff. I booked a corner view room and we had a very good view of Shibuya Crossing day & night. This was great fun to watch. There is only one room per floor and they can't be booked online. As such you can't get the discounts you can on the others. If you join the loyalty programme there is a 5% discount.Japanese breakfast was good but challenging. The Western buffet ok though McDs near by is probably better.Being on top of Shibuya station makes for a great location. Lots of places to eat around.There are also washing machines & driers (1 of each) on floors 8,9 & 10

I stayed here on a last minute business trip. Though last minute, I had everything I needed. Hotel provided all necessary toiletries. Single person room was spacious and comfortable, though the view wasn't amazing - which wasn't a problem since the location is great for walking and going out sight-seeing. Room had a television, coffee, desk.Breakfast is GREAT and with an amazing view! From the top floor, you have a great view of the city.

Had a room with the view of shibuya crossing. Beautiful city view! The room was very clean and the service was great! The location and the view are the best part about this hotel! Walking distance to all the restaurants and shopping area.

The hotel is in the center of Shibuya, only two minutes away from subway and JR station. Staff is very friendly, rooms are comfortable and large for Tokyo standards. Restaurants, shopping malls and sightseeing hot spots are close by or easy to access via trains. For breakfast a Starbucks and French bakery is within 2 minutes walking distance.

I stay for 2 nights during my holiday in Tokyo. Eventhough the room a bit small, but it is very clean and tidy. The best location if you wanna go eveywhere in Shibuya. It is at the shibuya Mark city level 5. But you need you need to use elevator to reach the hotel.If you want to use shibuya station, you just need to go downstairs. It also very close to hachiko statue. And if you lucky you can get shibuya crossing road from window view. This hotel also a ggod place if you need to access Haneda airport. The shuttle bus will pick you up in certain hours and pay directly to the driver. But for narita airport, you can buy the ticket at the hotel counter.The room wilk be clean up once a day.very standard.Please remind yourself that this hotel not giving you service for greeting etc.I didn't see any bellboy to bring up my suitecase. So self service. Overall I'm quite satisfied.

Stayed here for 3 nights.Our room on the 7th flr was just enough for a queen bed, 2 chairs and 1 small table.It's quite tight.The bed is comfortable, but the pillows are smaller than the regular size pillows. and they are hard.The bathroom is also small, but clean.they have coffee in the room, but if you are a coffee drinker, don't even try.TV channels are all in Japanese, except for CNN & BBC. There is wi-fi but some hours its really slow.Hotel Front lobby staff are not really friendly. It seems that they are always looking down and doing something. Hotel lobby is too noisy and sometimes crowdedHotel is no smoking hotel. but they provided a space on the 6th floor for smokers.The only great part of this hotel is the LOCATION.

I regularly write reviews and very very rarely bother writing bad reviews, however, this hotel was so awful that i couldnt but warn people of how grim it is! To start there is no one to greet you when arriving at the hotel, so no one to help with luggage or guide you in the right direction. On arriving at the reception and lugging 2 large cases and a medium size travel bag, none of the 8 available members of staff offered any assistance! I understand this is a busy hotel, but at this particular moment, none of the 8 staff at reception were occupied assisting a guest, there help would have been appreciated. The man checking me in could not speak adequate english to be workin on the reception, i was in no mood to continue to try to help him to understand so requested someone who could speak better english, but he appeared to be more interested in honing his english skills and so refused. finally, i got to my room... the most disgusting, dirty, dusty, smelly room i have ever seen. i travel for a living so have seen alot of hotels, this was disgusting. the bathroom was also absolutely appauling - just felt like the fascilities on a public train. overall this was the most awful hotel experience and myself and my colleague were so excited to get out of the hotel and move onto our next location, such a shame as we were so looking forward to our visit, it was a little spoiled.

Stayed in March for business. Small, typical Japanese hotel. Clean, friendly staff, with women's floor. I wasn't aware of the women's floor during my stay but will try it for my next trip. Centrally located, elevator on room floor was directly above Shibuya crossing. Many big shopping malls around the area (Shibuya 109 is directly behind the hotel). Tried breakfast, both western buffet style and Japanese traditional style. They were pretty good. The view on the Japanese style breakfast restaurant is much better. Hotel offers airport bus at a fraction of cab fare especially if you're flying in and out from NRT. All in all, will return for my next trip for work.
user_name:
Autumn K
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed in a standard double room this time, though compared to my previous stay in a high-floor quad, amenities here were not exactly on par. Some observations this time. The not-so-great:- Room came with a thermal pot/ kettle instead of capsule coffee machine- thin pillows, not exactly comfy to sleep on- No USB ports. Though ample power sockets were present, USB ports would be preferred as they are universal and less of a hassle for charging devices. Hope the hotel will make small updates to the room to keep up with the times.- Noticed a permanent stain in the carpet throughout my 7-night stay, wonder if attempts were made by hotel to clean or shampoo the carpet on regular basis. The still-great:- Room size of the standard room was still generous by japanese standards, came with a small sitting area and a separate writing desk. Huge window and great view too!- Reception staff is still professional, courteous and efficient. No problems with communication. - Location is still great and super convenient, time and effort saved in commuting and getting daily necessities. Other great thing is the airport limousine bus stops by the hotel, no need to trod around lugging heavy luggage.- Cheap food readily available, take-away bentos in Tokyu basement Food Hall, ramen eateries lining up the alleys right at its door-step, Genki-sushi and Ippuddo just a stone's throw away. On the whole, there are just too many plus points to make this my choice of stay time and again.

I stayed at this hotel the last part of May with my older teens. We had two rooms on the all ladies floor which is the 20th floor. Both rooms had safety deposit boxes.Love the location and the view. If you can, get breakfast with the hotel stay. The food is excellent and the view just can't be beat. The hotel is conveniently located next to Mark City which has many good restaurants. It is also next to the Tokyu Department store which has fantastic fancy food stalls in the basement. The best part of the hotel is that it is right above the Shibuya subway station. One could get to everywhere easily, even in the rain.There is coin laundry on 8th, 9th and 10th floor. The rooms are very clean and spacious. Staff is very attentive and friendly. Wifi is good enough for us to Facetime our family back in the U.S. My daughter left her wallet in the safety deposit box. The staff mailed it back to us with no problem.I reserved this hotel through Expedia which told me to call the hotel in Japan if I have any special requests. They do have a New York contact number which you could call. The number is 1-800-42-TOKYO(86598).

This was my 4th stay here. I choose this hotel consistently when in Tokyo. First of all the location cannot be beat, best place to be when you want to explore Tokyo. The airport bus limousine makes a stop directly at this hotel which is very convenient - no mucking around. The hotel is part of Mark City and has multiple entrances - extremely convenient as you sometimes tend to lose your way in Japan. Not to mention it has direct connection to the train station downstairs and is just located next to the famous Shibuya crossing- winning!! Views of people making this cross from this hotel never seems to bore me. Then when you are downstairs outside - Shibuya is at your doorstep! There's Shibuya 109 just across the road, hundreds of eateries and you're smack bang in all the action Shibuya has to offer. I enjoy the buzz and noise but I appreciate that when I retire back to this hotel- it's nice and quite. All front desk staff are very professional and most speak good English. Check-in was a breeze. I had my pocket wifi sent here prior to arrival and was instantly given the parcel upon check-in without asking. I stayed here twice on this holiday to Japan - initially when I landed in Japan and again after travelling to Osaka, I returned. I usually get the same room or one or two down from each other on all previous stays throughout the years. The rooms are spacious by Japanese hotel standards, there's plenty of room for luggage which is a plus when you want a comfortable stay. I also find the built in adaptor points on the dresser extremely convenient - you don't have to request for one at front desk. Everything is clean and amenities are always well stocked and I really like their shampoo by Shiseido. And again the city views are spectacular. My first room this stay I did have one major negative. The bed was so badly worn that it dipped in the middle and gave me back pain every morning. Upon inspection I found that because the bed was so badly worn they had to put a mattress foam topper on - however it was so soft that the bed dipped in regardless. Second time round I raised my concern regarding the last bed I got but front desk personnel either did not understand me or couldn't do anything to change it so ignored what I said altogether. I checked in quite late, so exhausted I couldn't be bothered explaining further. He checked me into a room slightly smaller than the first but had a slightly better bed with no topper. Apart from this I had a great stay like always. For the price I paid, I've had better but I return here time and time again because I just love its locality. I have recommended this hotel to all my family and friends and will continue to do so however they should just update their worn beds!

Intro:After making some wrong decisions in the past on where to live when visiting Tokyo, this was our first time staying in Shibuya, and we LOVED it. Getting to the hotel:By far the most convenient ever! Just take the Narita Express to Shibuya station, and you are there! Can’t get easier than that! I highly recommend sorting out your return ticket for the Narita Express immediately or the day before your going back. The queues can be super long and please allow for plenty of time for the trip to the airport! The Location:Outstanding! Forget all the hassle with airport transfers, hailing taxis and carrying luggage around. The location has it all and more! We always stay in Shibuya when in Tokyo (just finished my 8th trip!) The Room:Supersmall, but great view! A big plus for the coffee machine! Unique details:It’s situated on top of the station, can be tricky to find the entrance from the ground floor. Go for the breakfast! The view is amazing and a great way to start off your day! Customer Service:Not the best to be honest! A bit grumpy and not flexible at all. Overall impression:If this hotel were to be anywhere else in the world, I probably would not recommend it, but it really has the best location ever! This compensates for everything else.

I was super impressed with this hotel. They're check in was easy and the rooms were clean. I'm a stickler for clean rooms and I was really impressed with the cleanliness of the room. The rooms were large when compared with the standard Japanese rooms. We had a nice view of Shibuya crossing, which was nice. The hotel is connected to the subway and JR lines, which made it convenient. A member of my family has trouble walking long distances and this hotel was perfect. There were several elevators that connected us to the subway so we never had to use the steps. There a several restaurants and stores that surround the hotel, you don't need to look hard to find a restaurant, the only problem is that you may have a hard time choosing what to eat! I definitely recommend this hotel, it's great for families and people with disabilities.

the hotel is big, and the rooms are a good sizeour room on level 16 was perfect with an amazing view from the windowthe location is perfect above the station, and next to shibuya crossing, that's a must seewe didn't eat or drink in the hotel, mainly because there is so much around youthe rooms are cleaned to perfection and bedding changed dailywould recommend staying

Picked this hotel during my stay in Shibuya, and I admit that I was stretching the budget a bit. I requested that I be placed on a high floor to be able to see the famous crossing, but they couldn't guarantee it since those rooms cost more than what I had booked for. To my surprise, they booked me on their highest floor (right below the topmost floor which had a restaurant) and the views from my room were just spectacular. The room was cozy, modern, clean and came with its own Nespresso machine. The location is superb as it's located on a subway station and mall. What a great decision to stay in this place! Thank you, Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu!

The vistas that Shibuya Excel hotel offers are really unique, from the elevators letting you enjoy shibuya crossing to the rooms where you can enjoy the skyline of tokyo :)The room itself are nothing super special really business oriented but those big windows are totally worth it :)The location is the other big point of the hotel letting you explore shibuya at night with ease :)

I would not hesitate to stay here, this is my third time and I'm still impressed. The location is so central and convenient for tourists. And by Tokyo standards there is a good amount of space. The view is one of my favorite things. You can look out over the city and the famous shibuya crossing. The staff are friendly and professional. The can help you in English which is nice for international travellers. I even called them a few times before my trip to request a city facing view and change dates and they were very accommodating and courteous. For a section of my trip I was without my family (because we were meeting up in Tokyo from separate flights) and the hotel was nice enough to upgrade me to the women's only floor. This floor is for women only travellers and the rooms have a slightly more feminine decor and a free facial steamer. It was very thoughtful of the hotel to do that for me. The hotel lounge is very nice with great coffee and I had a sorbet fruit parfait. If I have a chance to come back another time to Tokyo, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

My husband and I stayed here for our birthdays. We spent two weeks in this hotel and it was just amazing. Room was an average size or a bit smaller but the view was amazing. Our view was to the famous shibuya crossing and the hotel is centrally located. Best decision to stay here, highly recommended.

We spent 3 nights here. The location is very perfect. You can access directly to both Metro and JR, very convenient to go around.We tried both Japanese breakfast and buffet. The Japanese breakfast will come in set , you will grilled salmon and choice of boiled rice or rice. For the buffet , it is western style. The point for breakfast is the view from the breakfast room, you can see Shibuya Scramble crossing view.Anyway, what I disappointed is the some of reception staffs were not friendly enough for the high standard hotel like this. I think this point should be improved

It can be tough to find quad rooms in Tokyo. The Shibuya Hotel Excel is one of those hotels that is right above the Shibuya station. It was a great base to explore all of the various areas of Tokyo. Furthermore right in the basement of the station is a great food court which was ideal for the four of us since we had different cravings. We also enjoyed breakfast on the 25th floor with panoramic views of the city. The only slight negative is that the rooms could use some updating. I would give it a 4.5 star if I could.

We only speak English and every staff member we encountered spoke English. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was very nice and spacious. All the amenities you need in the bathroom are there. The bathroom is compact but that is expected in Japan. We were so impressed with the phenomenal view of the city from our room. The bus to and from Narita or Haneda stops on the 5th floor of the hotel. It is so convenient. The Japanese restaurant at the top of the restaurant was exquisite with unbelievable views of Tokyo from one end of the restaurant to the other. If you want a Western Breakfast, you can choose the other side. We learned that the Japanese do not have top sheets on the bed so we had to order one and they quickly had one placed on our bed. We stayed 3 nights and traveled to several cities surrounding Tokyo by subway to Yokohama, Asakusa and Chinatown. There are several various types of cuisine restaurants throughout the hotel that will sure be able to meet your taste. If you stay here, you have to see "Scramble Street" located outside the hotel. It is crazy when the walking light turns green, everyone walks at the same time at a rapid pace in every direction. It was amazing that no one ran into each other. Anything you need is within walking distance. You will enjoy this hotel and I recommend it to all travelers.

My family stayed here in early May and loved the hotel and the location. Great views of the "Shibuya Scramble" from the higher floor windows and the train station below made meeting up with other family members very easy. The rooms were comfortable and all the people at the reception desk were very helpful, especially in arranging a bus to Narita, which stops at the hotel. One of us stayed 3 days longer and the switch to his new room was seamless. We were on a non-smoking floor and clearly there was someone smoking in a room down the hall. The staff took care of that quickly as well. About a mile away there's a nice park for running which seemed worlds away from the chaos in Shibuya.

My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Shibuya Excel Hotel from Apr 26-May 05. We were so pleased with our accommodations and could not have picked a better place to stay for our first trip to Japan!We stayed in a Standard Double Room, upgraded to corner unit, and it was perfect. The bed was a lot bigger than we were expecting, we sleep on a king-sized at home and this was fine for us. I thought a Double would be smaller or the same as a Queen but for some reason it felt bigger so that was a plus. Bed was firm but comfortable and pillows were fine for us as well.Every amenity you'd want is provided in the room, including slippers, toothbrushes, toothpaste, razors, shaving cream, hairbrushes (all those I've never seen provided before!), hair dryer, Nespresso machine, safe, flashlight (enjoy looking for it :) ), and complimentary bottled water (LOVED that!).As all the other reviews mention, the location is unbeatable. We were on the 22nd floor overlooking the scramble crossing, great views from all around. We took the Narita Express train from the airport and probably would again for future trips here just to avoid any rush hour issues that the airport limousine buses may face. All in all it was a great stay and we've already decided that if we return we would stay here again.Highly recommended!!

We only stayed here for one night as we were passing through before flying home. The best thing about the hotel is its amazing location and views of the Shibuya scrabble crossing. The open glass lifts are a great way of seeing the crossing and views of the city. The rooms themselves are quite large for Tokyo standards including the bathrooms. Nice and clean rooms, again with great views. It's not cheap to stay here, nor is the breakfast but overall it was a good stay.

The location is just ideal. It is located with great view of the highly noted shibuya intersection. the train station is on the 3rd floor with a mall below it. It is very convenient as the airport limo actually stops on the hotel. I expected a bath or a gym but they didn't have it. but the location definitely makes up for it. A lot of places are in walking distance of this hotel.

Just spent 6 nights at this property on a shopping / eating 8 night stay in Tokyo. The location could not be better if you want to be in the Shibuya area. You can catch the train from Narita, hop on a train to Shibuya and if you manage to take the right exit when you get to town, walk straight into the hotel without going outside. It is also the best located hotel to view the amazing Shibuya Crossing where up to 3000 people cross the road at one time. Our room on the 10th floor faced a large neon sign which kept our room rather light at night, despite blackout curtains, but this wasn't really a big deal. The only other slight negative was the size of the bathroom which really felt like more of a large cupboard than a room.Service at reception was reasonably good, but other than that we had no interaction with hotel staff, and generally the hotel seemed very quiet, despite high occupancy.We paid around A$280 per night which we felt was great value, and would definitely stay again for the convenience of it's location.

We've just had our fourth stay at the Shibuya Excel and I would not stay anywhere else if staying at Shibuya. Cannot beat the location above the station. Beautiful triple person room with plenty of space, separate toilet and bathroom. Amazing city views. Very clean, comfortable beds. We splurged this time and had the japanese breakfast in the top floor restaurant one morning and it was amazing. What a view! Awesome food and presentation. A very nice hotel in a superb location. We will book this again next time.

The hotel is super convenient. The 25th upstair restaurant for breakfast is really good and support a good day for every morning. The staff are nice and helpful. The hotel location is good and the path are covered by Shibuya station. So, it is no problem even forget to bring umbrella Anyway, I will choose this hotel again.

My wife n I flew to Tokyo to watch the Paul McCartney concert last weekend and as usual Shibuya excel is our hotel of choice. The hotel is still in very good condition, very clean n great service. For first time visitors, the location is the best if you want shopping, food and sightseeing, the train station is under the hotel. Airport limousine buses takes you from the airport to the doorstep of the hotel. Everything is so easy n seamless.

Excellent location near the crazy Shibuya Crossing. The hotel lobby is on the 5th floor of the Mark City complex. The Airport Limousine Bus will stop right outside the 5th floor entrance. The pedestrian entrance is on the first floor. The entrance is not very obvious so I included a picture for your reference. Also Google Map would point to the general direction of the hotel, but it got confused about the hotel entrance, so get a good bearing of the surroundings when you first get out. If you want to take JR or the Metro "G" line, exit the elevator on the 3rd floor and walk across the skyway to the other side. The hotel is right in the midst of Shibuya downtown and very close to all major department stores in the area, plus tons of restaurants and shops nearby. Make sure you check out the Flying Tiger shop on the ground floor. This Copenhagen store has many unique stuff at dirt cheap prices. The room is not large but it's clean and quiet. It also comes with a small fridge and a safe. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and I would definitely recommend it.

Came with family and a couple of 1 year old. Room: Small, slightly tight and dated looking, but comfortable nontheless. Got a room with not much of a view, although you can see the Shibuya Crossing from the lobby window. Amenities: Basic amenities. Free WIFI was good quality. Did not manage to check out rest of hotel due to kidsBreakfast: Did not try.Location: Right above Shibuya Train station on Ginza Line, good and convenient. Supermarket and few restaurants within same building, although pricey. Many other options across the streets.Overall: Small size, excellent location, basic amenities by comparison.

I and my family stayed at Shibuya Excel Tokyu for 6 days in total, and these stayed devided into 2 periods 4 nights and then 2 nights, as we went to Mt.Fuji in between.I have to admit that this hotel was beyond perfect for us.The location was unbeatable as it was just across the street from JR Shibuya and Metro Ginza line station, and it was in Shibuya Mark City where there were many shops and restaurant and supermarket downstairs, including Keio Inokashira line.The airport shuttle buses also stop at the 5th floor of Shibuya Mark City, the same level as the hotel lobby. Makes it super convenient for the airport transfer by bus as well.For the room, I'd got a twin room on the 24th floor (there were 25 floor in the hotel, and the top floor is for restanrants). To access the room, there were 4 elevators separated from those access to ground level. My twin room was at a good size, not too big. Beds were very comfortable. There were working desk, sofa by the window.A fridge, a coffee machine, free 2 bottles of drinking water.For the bathroom, the shower was in the bathtub. All toileteries provided including handsoap, body wash, hair shampoo & conditioner. Hair dryer, foot spray, pyjamas, slippers were provided in the room. You can just check-in with no bags!For check-in and check-out process were fast, smooth, and informative. The staff were excellent. I'd been always greeted with smile from Mr. Ikeyama at the Front desk.My room rate included breakfast which could be chosen either western style buffet at Restaurant A Bientot or a Japanese set at Shunsai, which were on the top floor (25th floor). I did not try the Japanese set at all, so for all 6 morning, I had the western style buffet breakfast. One little thing was that they only served scrambled eggs everyday. So I had scrambled eggs every morning. Although repeated dish but it was quite tasty so nothing to complain! I loved their salad corner, bread corner and their fried fish and chicken karaage. From the restaurant, you can see the Tokyo skyline clearly. One side overlooking Yoyogi Park, Meiji Shrine, and Shinjuku highrises.For the location, probably the most perfect location with everything within a little walk in Shibuya area. Department stores, brand shops, discount shops, fastfood & restaurants, bars, cafes were around the hotel. There were many convenient stores around, but the nearest one was a 7-Eleven just on the next alley of the hotel.During our stay, we used Metro Ginza line a lot, as this line passes many major stops such as Omotesando, Shimbashi, Ginza, Nihombashi (near Tokyo station), Ueno and Asakusa which the end of the line.I totally love Shibuya Excel Tokyu, and if I have to choose where to stay in Tokyo, Shibuya Excel Tokyu would be my first choice!

The hotel is located 2 minutes from the train station and is dead center of all the attractions, shopping and dining. This hotel offers very spacious and clean rooms as well as a Western Buffet Breakfast or a traditional Japanese Breakfast. I recommend you at least try the Japanese breakfast once, it is very good. Below the hotel is a market where you can find a variety of bakeries, coffee shops and a traditional Japanese treats.

This is the secod time I am staying here. Last time was in 2009. The location is great, just overlooking the famous Shibuya crossing. Right next to train and underground station. Shopping, restaurants and bars all around the hotel. Nice rooms, good size for a Tokyo hotel. Hotel breakfast was good too. Though with so many cafes and restaurants nearby there is no need to have breakfast at the hotel.

This hotel came highly recommended by friends and so we booked 4 rooms for Easter break. Location is unbeatable as the JR and Metro stations and a major department store (check out their basement food hall!) are literally across the street, a big shopping mall downstairs, restaurants and convenience stores galore!Service is so-so. It looks like they are understaffed because unless you go to the front desk, you won't get any help. This is not a big deal for us as we expected this of Japanese hotels. Front desk personnel could be a bit more friendly though.I do want to comment on the hotel rooms we occupied. I highly recommend the triple rooms for larger families. It is substantially more spacious than a regular room; the toilet and bath are separated so you needn't wait so long for your turn. Housekeeping does an awesome job everyday. We also love the many electrical outlets in the room! We would absolutely stay in this hotel again on our next trip to Tokyo!

Just across from Shibuya station (Hachi-ko), in a central location for the lively Shibuya area in Tokyo. Our room had a wonderful view of the famous Shibuya crossing - perfect for our first night in Tokyo. Rooms were nicely decorated with comfortable beds. A little small by US standards, but large by Japan standards. Although we only had one night here, I woudl highly recommend for its location and views.

Good location and very convinient from Shibuya station. Pretty good price considering the room soze and service they offer as well as the strategic location. A lot of shops and food joint so walking around the hotel is enough to get the feel of Tokyo culture and behavior. Best part they have the airport shuttle very close to the hotel so you won't have any troubleif you are traveling with family or if you have many suitcase.

We wanted to find a hotel that allowed us to stay in or around Shibuya and close to a train station. Shibuya Excel was exactly that. It is literally at the Shibuya train station, which has multiple lines running through it, including the JR. The first day could be a bit confusing trying to figure out the entrances and exits of the building because it's so big, but once you do, things can't get more convenient. We had a view of the city and of Shibuya crossings from our room. Amazing. We didn't take advantage of the amenities of the hotel since we were in the middle of the city and had plenty to go see and eat. If you stay at this hotel, be sure to walk over to Drunkards Alley to sip on some High Balls after a long day of exploring.

i was able to book this hotel thru japanican.com. it's perfectly located near hachiko and the famous shibuya crossing. we were booked at the 19th floor and had a superb view of the city =) rooms were a bit spacious and always clean! wifi in the room was really fast. staff were always helpful. we arrived @ haneda airport and the airport limousine bus conveniently stops at this hotel so we didn't have any problems going to and from the airport -- a big plus!!! once you go down the hotel, there's easy access to the train station, money exchange, mall/shopping area in shibuya, grocery (tokyu food show) & lots of different restaurants frequented by locals and tourists. will definitely go back!!!

Managed to booked this hotel through Japanican.com and was upgraded to ladies floor with a excellent view of the famous shibuya crossing! The service of the hotel staffs were great. The lady staff even carried our luggages to the bus stop and waited with us.The airport limousine bus stop right in front of the hotel which made it so convenient. Hotel access to supermarket, shops, restaurants and shibuya subway station.

well, the location is definitely perfect for travelers and also room condition was so clean.BUT from the day I checked in to the day I checked out, every staffs I met were so unkind, I felt so grotty.they were unhelpful and when I ask a staff about the bus to airport, her behaviour was so bad like I was bothering her.can't forget those GROTTY STAFFS.and the wi-fi does not work well. I'd rather use pocket wi-fi.I will never use this hotel again. the worst hotel I've ever been in Tokyo.

Perfectly located at Shibuya Crossing. We got a room on the 16th floor and the view was amazing. Everything in the room was nice and clean. Good breakfast buffé (you can choose between japanese or western).

Situated right at the center of Shibuya. Limousine bus from Haneda airport took us right at the hotels door step. Rooms are big and clean. Breakfast buffet at the top floor had a scenic view of Tokyo. Many restaurants around the hotel and with a wide variety. Will definitely stay here again!

My first time staying here and will be for the next few to come. First, the airport limo stops at the door step of the hotel so we don't have to drag our luggage across any streets or change to a cab to reach another hotel. Second, the hotel is located at the top of a big shopping mall with a variety of restaurants (akin to staying at the Swisshotel or Fairmont at the Raffles City in Singapore). Third, the train station to all around Tokyo are directly accessible at the 3rd and ground levels. I have stayed at Shinjuku central which is equally good but can be very congested. This hotel is just 2 stops from Shinjuku. Fourth, there are a lot of eateries and small boutiques, H&M, Zara, theatres within walking distance. Fifth, it is not far from Haneda airport, and even traveling to Narita for flight out is a breeze with the bus limo that picks us at the back of the hotel lobby. Room wise, it is very clean, very comfortable beddings, good size. Choice of breakfast at the Japanese restaurant for set or International restaurant for buffet. The spread is sufficient but the same everyday, so best to alternate. If these are insufficient reasons to stay at Shibuya Excel, I don't know what else would.

The hotels location is very good with a great view of the shibuya crossing. The concierge is useful and speaks English. The rooms were small. In the Japanese restaurant, you can find yourself waiting a long time for your food. You will have a good choice of food for breakfast with fruits eggs and meat. The atmosphere was alright. A good place to stay.

We stayed at the Shibuya Excel Hotel for 5 nights. The location is great and central to everything. The front staff are very helpful, as our travel agent booked the incorrect room and the staff were very helpful to sort something out for us. We had breakfast at the hotel overlooking the famous Shibuya Crossing.

Could not be in a more convenient location - connected to Shibuya station and above Shibuya Crossing while being a block from many restaurants and shops. Also, 45 mins from Narita airport via Hotel Limousine Bus. Rooms were a good size, modern, and staff very friendly with a currency exchange machine in lobby. Definitely would stay here again.

This was our first time to Tokyo so picking a location to stay in felt tricky. We were so happy that this hotel turned out to be the center of everything. The crossing and the train station was right below us as well as shops, restaurants, and anything else you could possibly imagine. My daughter and I appreciated being upgraded to the Women's Floor and could not have been happier with our stay.

This hotel is conveniently located across the Hachiko Exit of the Shibuya Station. Very convenient for tourists and shopaholics. Walkable distance to shops and restaurants in the area. The staff are very polite and accommodating. The room that i stayed in is a bit small but clean and comfortable.
user_name:
AzianMatey
Subic Bay Freeport Zone, Philippines

review_body: Had booked the premium double room, rather spacious with a great view! Even manage to see Tokyo tower from our room! The hotel location is also wonderful with many great shoppings and very convenient to travel around!

Right off the Shibuya subway station exit, we stayed at this hotel when the previous accomodation did not meet our needs. it was very convenient to have indoor walkways to the station itself and the Yamanote line that made this hotel the perfect homebase for our stay in Tokyo. Rooms were decent for the price, good English speaking staff - room service could have more options, but the dining options in the connected mall (including the famous Umegaoka Sushino Midori) is more than plentiful

This hotel is very convenience, it in the center of Shibuya. Airport bus stopped at the hotel.The subway and JR is on the ground floor of the hotel. You can choose the room that you can see the Famous Shibuya Crossing.Recommence High floor.

Excellent English speaking concierge service. They provide specific instructions on how to get to places using the train. You can get a ride to and from the airport using the airport shuttle bus for 3100 Yen per head. Awesome view of Shibuya Scramble from the elevator lobby. Breathtaking view of Tokyo from the 25th floor resto.

Everything is great here for business hotel, breakfast, service and cleanliness is excellent. But I have to say that the Internet here is extremely slow and most of the times not working. Frustrating at times. Other than that it deserves full points.

What can you say about this hotel?Its right in the heart of Tokyo and immediately next to Shibuya Train Station and "That pedestrian crossing". There is a frequent and direct Bus Link between the hotel and both Haneda and Narita airports, so it's really easy and cheap (around £7.50 or 1050 Yen) to get to.Once at the hotel you will find a modern, Western style hotel full of mainly tourists (foreign and domestic Japanese) as well as holiday makers and business people from around the world.My room was on the 15th floor and had a great view over Shibuya crossing. the room was well appointed and everything easy to use, warm and comfortable, with great room service.The breakfast restaurants are on the 25th floor (Japanese on one side and western buffet style on the other) and the view is to die for. Huge panoramic windows give spectacular view of sunrise on one side and sunset on the other. Huge panoramic view over Tokyo and if the weather is clear and sunny you can see right out the mountains and Mount Fuji. Definitely take your camera's to breakfast!One of the elevators in the hotel takes you down into the Shibuya Shopping Centre and then further down to Shibuya Railway Station as well as Shibuya Crossing (that on in all the photographs.) They tell me that its a five-way simultaneous pedestrian crossing and that typically allows around 3,000 people to cross per cycle! its something you really have to see in the evening when all the tourists come out to take pictures.Probably won't be able to go back anytime soon, but if I ever visit Japan again - this hotel is where I will stay.

The hotel is located right above the Shibuya station of Yamanote line. There was nobody when I checked in. For that night, it's hard to secure a room in both Shibuya and Shinjuku, and I don't know why, it was the last room of that price range I can secure of this hotel, and I'm very glad. I was offered a paid upgrade from a semi-double room to a deluxe double room for a reasonable amount, which I gladly accepted. The service is very good, the staff always carried a smile on their face. Even though they are not very good with communicating in English, they're trying very hard to make you understand what they are talking about, and I appreciate that. I'm so surprise they gave me a room at the top floor. The room itself was great and the view was absolutely gorgeous! Those who fancy a nice cup of coffee in the morning will be very glad as they have a Nespresso coffee machine in the room. I had a good sleep. Check out is time is 11a.m., which is late for a hotel in Japan. I will definitely stay there again!

The location of the hotel is great (located inside Shibuya Station) and the pictures I have seen also look fine. The price seems reasonable given the location and quality of the rooms. However, I am writing this review even before checking in as the staff are not accommodating at all with regards to the check-in time.I noted in my reservation that I would be flying in in the morning and thus requested an early check-in. Once I arrived at the hotel (at 9:30am), I was told that early check-in would result in an additional fee, which is not unreasonable. I asked what time I should come back and was told to come back around 2:00pm.I came back a little earlier at 1:30pm and asked to check in. There were obviously rooms available (as they offered to check me in with a fee), but they did not accommodate a 30 minute early check-in. I am thus sitting in the lobby in front of the check-in counter killing time.This left a bad first impression of the hotel, and I will reconsider staying here on my next trip.
user_name:
FumiT_12
New York City, New York

review_body: Great Location. very convenient near Shibuya JR station, with all shopping mall , restaurant ,supermarket and tokyo department store nearby the hotel. rooms is comfortable and spacious. nice view . staff is very nice and helpful.

Great location. Easy access to the train, bus, food stalls. Great view of shibuya scramble crossing!Staff are english friendly. Buffet breakfast area has a great view of tokyo. Shopping area has a good mix of budget and luxury branded shops

From the airport to wherever you plan to go in Tokyo, the location is excellent. Airport Limousine Coach drops you (and picks up) in this hotel and it's practically above the Shibuya Station so Ginza is just a 15 min ride on the Ginza Line while Omotesando and Harajuku just a couple of minutes away. The area around the hotel is vibrant and even at 10:30 is still very much alive.The room came with a view of the scramble crossing and it was captivating. Room was clean and housekeeping made sure it stayed that way during the entire stay. Staff at reception could also communicate well in English. Couldn't find a fault during my stay. Will be staying here again when I come back again later this year.

I had always stayed in Keio Hotel Shinjuku whenever I visit Tokyo. We thought of making a change for once since the kids love Shibuya. This hotel is just a stone throw away from the Shibuya train station, facing the Shibuya crossing. Below the hotel is the Tokyo Mark City where you can find many restaurants. The twin room my kids had was much bigger than ours but we won't fault it as its typical of hotels in Japan. There is even a dehumidifier in the room. The only thing to fault as some reviewers have mentioned is the lack of body moisturiser. The airport limousine bus also stops here. I simply love the convenience and cleanliness of this hotel. I am already looking forward to our next stay in April.

There are several options for hotel guest to travel between the hotel and airport, limousine bus, JR, metro etc. are all convenient. It is also on top of Shibuya station and Mark city (department store). The room is large compare with other hotels in Tokyo, and super recommend to try the breakfast. The guests can have Japanese or Western buffet for breakfast, both restaurant are located in 25th floor with great city view!

Super easy to get here from Natita airport. There is limobus that goes directly to the hotel.A little expencive, but that's Tokyo. Rooms where nice, the service was top, breakfast was good and you can choose between western and japanese.The view is also amazing, close to all the shops at Shibuya.Definitely coming back.

My family of four stayed at Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu in late Dec 2016. We chose this hotel because of its convenient location, not only right at the Shibuya station but also right at the Mark City Bus station, which we could check out in the 5th floor and took a 6:30AM express bus at the 4th floor to Kawaguchiko station. There are lots of restaurant in the Mark City, including the famous Midori Sushi. Tokyo department store was right adjacent to the hotel.The first night we stayed at the club floor room for 4 on the 24th floors, it was a little bit small for 4 adults with 4 large luggage. When we returned from Mount Fuji, we changed to two double room in the 8th floor (803 & 813). The rooms were relatively noisy compared to the high floor rooms.

Shibuya Excel Hotel is very good located, just next to one main train station very easy to connect with different places in tokyo or to Narita Express from the airport, the room was small but clean, I did not give then 4 because I arrive early and the check in was until 2:00PM and they do not make any effort to provide me with the room early.

Shibuya Excel is one of the first hotels that we consider when traveling as a group or family to Tokyo. The size of the rooms are big by typical Japanese standards. A twin room with 2 single beds plus one extra bed is still quite spacious for us. The hotel is centrally located on top of the Shibuya station with a direct access inside the building. You can literally travel to anywhere in japan via the nearby JR and subway stations. There are also numerous department stores and hundreds of brand name shops within the vicinity (Uniqlo, WEGO, Zara, Bershka, Forever 21, H&M, BIC Camera, Doin Quijote, etc.). In addition, you will never run out of dining options with all the cafes and restaurants around the Shibuya crossing area. There was just one unfortunate incident that irritated me during our check-in on December 23, 2016. When we reserved the rooms via hotels.com, we indicated the need for an extra bed for each twin room. However, the lady front office staff insisted that there were no extra beds available at that time and that we have to pay for another room for the 2 guests who were supposed to use the extra bed. She argued with us for almost half an hour. I got furious and asked for the Duty Manager and told her that I will write a review about her and report the incident in all available hotel review websites. Suddenly, she changed her tone and told us that it would be possible to have the extra bed for each room now and we just have to wait for 30 more minutes for the set up. What a Liar! She should be given disciplinary action by the management for lying and arguing with the hotel guest,

This is our regular hotel when we visit Tokyo ~ centrally located, accessible by Airport Limousine Bus. Front Receptionists can communicate in English. The down sides are slow wi-fi & the Hotel's reluctance in helping with restaurant reservation by e-mail.

We are a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 teens), and it's not easy finding a hotel room for 4 in Tokyo. This location was exactly what we wanted: at the shibuya scramble, with subway service downstairs. Everything you need is there. Check out Tokyu Foodshow (basement), It is absolutely incredible, and has any food you could possibly want.

This hotel was excellent for me the first time traveler in Tokyo as this was in a centralized location in Shibuya close to all types of transportation. Train lines, buses and taxis are easy to get around the hotel. The room that I was in had an good view of the surroundings including the famed Shibuya crossing. There is a wide selection of shopping around and restaurants. I was actually expecting the room to be smaller as I kept hearing rumors of small Tokyo hotel rooms. I did the buffet breakfast the first day I was there but was not impressed by the selection for the price that was charged so I do not find value in it. The hotel service was very efficient with good quality towels. The bathroom had the multi-function toilet which is a nice luxury to have. I started my stay on December to early January and did the New Year celebration at Shibuya crossing which is just right outside.
user_name:
TriniNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is in the middle of it all. The rooms are appropriate for the area. Staff was very helpful finding where I wanted to go and arranging transportation. There are shops and restaurants below the hotel.

If you are in Japan to see or have business in Shibuya, this location is unbeatable. Just above the train station and directly exiting into the famous busy intersection. You will be spoiled for choice with the sights, food, shopping and business. And if you want to go anywhere else, you cant get any more convenient than having the train station on the 2nd / 3rd floor.The rooms we stayed in had a great view, but were clean, quiet and more spacious than I expected for a Shibuya hotel (based on others we've stayed in). The Shibuya bus from Haneda also very conveniently stops right at the hotel driveway. Also asked for a 'firm' pillow and was given a very heavy one which had the husks or beads inside, anyway that was one of the best pillows I've ever used.It really is the best hotel in terms of convenience in Shibuya, my relatives and associates have booked repeatedly for years. We travelled with 3 kids as well and the location made it easier for us.

We are a family of 4(2 teenage daughters) and had a quad room which was actually quite spacious. The problem we had was that we had read various reviews about how great the views were from this hotel but unfortunately we looked straight into buildings(7th floor I think -obviously tried to change but to no avail) and at A$675 a night I would have expected a view. In saying that the Hotel was immaculately clean and conveniently placed to enjoy all the action. I would stay there again but would want some surety higher floored room.

This is located on top of the Shibuya station and you can see the crossing from the hotel. It is accessible to nearly everything especially if you prefer the busy nightlife with lots of restaurants. The rooms are clean and service is good. Overall we had a great stay here.

When staying in Tokyo this hotel is well situated. close to trains, busses and the MRT. The hotel is comfortable with great service, easy walking to restaurants and shops. The rooms are just the right size and spacious enough that you can move around.Enjoy

You really can't beat the location of this hotel. It's connected to the Shibuya station via a series of covered walkways. It's also connected to the two nearby malls. It's right next to the "scramble" crosswalk. It's right by the Hachiko statue. What more can you ask for? The room we stayed in was actually big by Japanese standard. We had no problem finding room for two pieces of luggages and various other daily shopping bags. Also, we had the traditional Japanese breakfast at the hotel. The food was great. The view from the restaurant was just amazing. One can see Shinjuku and the Meiji Jingu. Also, joining the hotel club membership also gave us some discount for our room. You may wish to look into that.

We will definitely be back !accessible to train station. Good food and courteous staff. Highly recommended.Good for Family. Good view of Shibuya crossing. Shopping great brands just around the corner.

The only thing good about this hotel is its location in central Shibuya. However, if you don't want to be overwhelmed with a crowd when you retreat to your room, tge location is not worth it either. This hotel is horribly overpriced for what it offers. The rooms are not clean and small. The bathroom smelled like mold and everything is made of plastic. The doors are thin so you can hear a lot of noise from the hallway and from inside other people's rooms. There is NO ROOM SERVICE unlike what is shown on Tripadvisor. The two restaurants were fully booked for dinner so I could not even dine there during my stay. The dirtiness and smell of the bathroom and rokm overall are what will keep me away from this hotel. There are many hotels in Tokyo that are conveniently located and are very clean and that are not that expensive. This hotel is really not worth it.

Stayed in Shibuya Excel Hotel for five days with my husband and two grade schoolers. The airport limo bus brings you practically right to the door, saving first-timers to Japan like us from the trouble of going through the complicated rail system with big luggage and kids to boot. The staff are very courteous, efficient and helpful. The view of the Scramble from the corner elevator is legendary. The hotel is located right on top of the Shibuya Station and sits right on the Scramble. Shopping and eating choices for all budgets are available within a stone's throw. For those travelling with families who would prefer the quad room, book really early. It's pretty roomy by Japan standards, with four beds, separate toilet and bath, closet, round table.

Excellent hotel in a prime location. Stayed here for 5 nights and used it as a base to explore Tokyo. It is located right above the Shibuya crossing, and Shibuya train station. The rooms are modern and roomy compared to the other hotels I stayed in. I didn't have much contact with the staff, but the few that I did were lovely. The airport limousine picks up guests from the hotel which was very convenient. I would definitely stay here again on my next Tokyo visit.

We stayed one night on our way to Niseko. There is a fabulous view of the Shibuya crossing the location is amazing. One the group left the camera memory card with ALL our holiday snaps in his bed. This was discovered on the way to the airport and could have ruined the rest of the holiday.After a frantic phone call to the lovely reception staff at the Excel hotel, they found the tiny memory card in the sheets. They then packaged it up and couriered it from Tokyo to our next hotel in Niseko. Truly amazing!!!

Wow! I so loved the staff here, they were so friendly and helpful. Room was super clean, great view of Shibuya crossing, restaurants and shopping outside of the hotel. I would definitely come back and stay here my trip was too short.

Conveniently located near shopping district, above JR station and near Tokyo Metro. Just next to the famous Shibuya scramble crossing so expect this to be a busy place but the hotel lobby is located on 5th floor so it is not as crowded.The room is reasonably sized and clean. We had a 3 bed so there was not much room for luggage. The queen bedroom is a lot smaller so opt for the twin/double if you can.Overall, nice place to stay if you want to be at Shibuya.

We picked this hotel because we love the Shibuya area - shopping and nightlife. It is convenient to get around as well. The Airport Limousine has a stop at this hotel (about 1.5 hours from Narita Airport), and the complex is connected to the Shibuya subway station. At present, the Airport Limousine is doing a round trip promotion. You may wish to check out their website or ask your travel agent about special deals when planning your Tokyo trip. If your hotel is along one of their routes, it is the best way to town and back to the airport. For trains to/from the airport, I think it is only a good idea if you are worried about traffic jam, don't have much luggage and won't mind going up and down platforms. We used to take the Narita Express, but we now find taking the limousine bus less of a hassle.We had a standard room with a semi double bed with no breakfast (there are so many cafes around, we just went out to eat instead). The room was small, but not too small for Japan, considering the location. My rating for service, cleanliness and value are all "average" because there was nothing too impressive about these items (they were not bad though). I gave a higher overall rating mainly because of its location and view. If you are traveling with elderly parents, Shibuya may not be a good choice, as it is rather busy and crowded. The streets are always full of people until late. Before my trip, I also considered the Cerulean Tower Tokyo. However, the Cerulean Tower, a nicer hotel, is quite a bit more expensive and its location is a bit not as convenient. Their rooms are larger and it feels more quiet over there though. I was glad that we stayed at the Excel Hotel. If you would like to stay in Shibuya and prefer a nicer hotel, you may wish to book your hotel well in advance, as I found out hotels may offer early bird discount if you book like at least one month early. If we go to Tokyo again, Excel Hotel will still be my first choice due to its location.

Perfect location in the heart of Shibuya. Very close to subway line for easy access to get around the city. Excellent staff who are very helpful. Nice bar in hotel for a late night cocktail after a day of sightseeing.
user_name:
Nancy S
New York City, New York

review_body: Very convenient location. Everywhere is easily accessible from the hotel as it is right in the middle of busy Shibuya, on top of Mark City and next to a JR station. Moreover, it is one of the airport limousine stops to Narita airport and it was convenient for purchasing tickets and storing the luggage after we checked out. In fact, our luggage was transported all the way to the queue right before we boarded the bus. Superb.I stayed in the semi-double room, which i found spacious and comfortable for 2 of us, despite having 2 large luggage. The room is clean and comes with a fantastic view, overlooking Shibuya streets and the city skyline. The bed is comfortable and the toilet facilities are clean and modern. Two bottles of fabric freshener were provided which I found really useful as its good for freshening up our winter jackets.The hotel staff are efficient and proficient in English, making it easy to communicate our queries.We had breakfast in both the Western and Japanese restaurants on the 25th floor. View is fantastic, food is good, and we especially liked the Western breakfast for its selection.Nonetheless, I do find the breakfast price a tad steep.Overall, a very good hotel for a comfortable stay and hard-to-beat location.

At exit of Shibuya, world's most busy crosspoint with 6mio people a day shopping around or taking the Shibuya metro.As hotel is on 15th to 20th floor no noise & very clean modern rooms yet as always in Japan small size if you don't take luxury room option.Friendly staff but poor English.If you want to be in the heart of the city place to stay

Great position – could spend hours watching the people on the Scramble! Stayed on 24th floor with great views. Some slight train/street noise may be bothersome if you are a very light sleeper. Small hotel foyer – nowhere to sit and relax. Reasonably sized room, no complimentary water, iron/ironing board. TV: 2 western news channels or paid TV. Café very expensive. Efficient staff but by week 3 we knew if 2pm was the time to get into your room then you wouldn’t get in a minute earlier! Lots of maps/info in the foyer and an exchange machine. We used the orange Tokyo handy guide [free] for all our time in Tokyo, it was all we needed! Bought 600Y 24 hour metro card for the subway. Great supermarket Tokyu on the lower ground, great fresh fruit but not cheap. Mr Farmer in Mori Tower, Hillside, B2F, Roppongi Hills near Lego education was the only GF restaurant that specifically had on its menu the coeliac sign, GF and GF Pasta!! Convenient bus outside the hotel to Haneda airport 1,030Y [40 minutes].GF: After spending 3 ½ weeks in Japan there are very few if any gluten free foods available. You must bring some of your own foods otherwise finding food to safely eat is very very difficult, GF awareness is just not part of the café food culture so take: cereal, rice cakes, muesli bars, biscuits etc. Plenty of rice, salads in convenience stores, eggs, cooked chicken, fish.

My husband and i enjoyed staying here in August 2016 and wow what an experience, the hotel was amazing with really good sized room and bed, we had heard that the rooms in Japan were small and as my husband and i are both 6 foot plus we were worried, well i can tell you we need not have worried, we had ample room and the bed, shower etc was all more than ample for us. The location of this hotel is amazing and once we worked out the train system it was so easy to go our and see so many sights with the convenience of popping back to the room for a rest and them another exciting outing for dinner. Their are so many restaurants and bars within walking distance that you are never to far away from a meal. We also ate at the local 7/11 and the food from there was really good. Our stay included breakfast and we found this to be great, the breakfast room has a great view and we spent our mornings looking at where we had been the day before as you had an amazing view from 20 plus floors up. The food was of a good standard and always plenty on offer. The hotel upgraded our room which was fantastic as they needed the room we had booked for a large booking, thank you for making our stay a wonderful one and we will be recommending your hotel to our family and friends.

Though a 4* property, I thought the bed, bath and rooms were comparatively smaller to other countries. But I understand from the residents that this is normal in the costly city of Tokyo. The hotel is centrally located with an optional choice of break fast - Japanese or American. Otherwise a normal standard hotel experience, nothing outstanding.

This is arguably my favourite hotel when I travel to Tokyo. It is right in the heart of Shibuya and hover right over the famous intersection. Rooms are clean and spacious. The only things this hotel lacks is service and smiles. Staff seem unfriendly and not very customer service driven. Any request seems like a huge ask and the staff almost retaliates. The rooms do not have irons and you must request one and you get it for only 1 hour which is annoying for business travels.

Very central and next to the famous Shibuya crossing. Expensive even for a small 'semi-double 'but close to hundreds of eateries, all types of food and thousands of shops. Busy and a little like time square outside. The service is excellent. It backs onto a big shopping complex and is near the main station. The cafe and upstairs restaurants are very expensive. $15 for a cup of coffee a bit much for this Aussie !

We traveled to Tokyo with our 4 month old and could not have asked for a better hotel to meet our many needs.One of the amenities we required was a coin-operated washer and dryer. This was great since we could pack less clothes to accommodate all the goodies we planned to buy. It was ¥300 to use the washer, and the dryer was ¥100 per 30 minutes. I liked that they had separate units. In the past, we've stayed at hotels that have the washer and dryer in one machine and they don't completely dry your clothes. The only downside to the dryer here is that it only has one heat setting so I'm pretty sure it shrunk my son's clothes.. or he grew while we were staying here haha. Bring your own detergent as the vending machine only sells drinks. Beer is an option to help keep you occupied! We packed detergent in pod form instead of buying those travel packs of Tide since it's cheaper to buy and you can still use them at home. The hotel provides an actual crib vs. a Pack-n-Play. The crib does not meet US standards though as one side can be folded down. For our infant who is not able to crawl or pull up on the bars this was not an issue. For our next visit I'm not sure I would be comfortable using their crib. They did not have a fitted sheet so we had to use the provided flat sheet and wrap it around the mattress so it would have a tight fit to reduce the risk of SIDS. They provided a plush blanket that was perfect for tummy time! The room had a refrigerator with a small tray for a freezer. The hotel staff will gladly store your pumped breast milk in their employee freezer as long as you keep it in a hard bottle with lid and label it. I brought large ziplock bags for this but didn't end up using their freezer. It was nice to know they would help if the room fridge was too small for your needs, though.The location is awesome as others mention. It was supposed to rain many of the days we were visiting so it was great to be covered as the hotel is connected to the train station. You can get to the hotel via elevator or escalator so it's nice to have options. The rooms are clean and the shower pressure is great. The shower head is also pretty tall which was nice for my husband who is about 6'1". Towels are on the thin side but you can always request more if you really need them.It seemed like most people purchased a breakfast plan with their room, us included. I enjoyed the Japanese style breakfast. The fish and dumpling changed daily. My husband preferred the variety of their Western buffet. If you want a quiet meal, eat at the Japanese restaurant. The Western buffet was much more crowded. I highly recommend this hotel whether you're traveling with kids or not!

Great location. Shibuya train station below hotel and direct bus to the airport leaves from hotel. My only complaint -- only one washer and dryer in the laundry room. But a few floors with a laundry room.

Hotel is in a great location for both business & leisure given proximity of the Shibuya train station. Rooms are not that great but ok for Japan,But he breakfast is terrible & way over priced!!! Biggest let down was from a business perspective there is nowhere to sit & meet informally, if you use the hotel bar each person must buy at least one drink!! The staff were not that helpful nor friendly when we had questions. Overall a disappointing experience & few like it's gone backward over the last few years that I've stayed there 1-2 per year. Will likely try to find a better option next time.

This hotel is in a great location attached to Shibuya station and overlooking the famous crossing. However, in terms of value for money this place is pretty poor. Rooms are small and of 3* quality. Some staff had a bit of an attitude problem and there is nowhere that people can meet and chat in the hotel unless you use the restaurant which is extortionately priced (£8 for a black coffee) and has a minimum order to use the facilities. The western breakfast was so expensive and of such poor quality that even though I paid for the week, I ate out every day after trying twice.

fantastic location right smack in the middle of the Shibuya Crossing and easy access to the train station. The airport limo bus stops here too! There are so many shops around the hotel and finding places to eat wont be any problem.

Very accessible in the busy environment of Shibuya. The view on the 23rd and 25th floor of the Shibuya Crossing Scramble is really nice if you like to take photos. The hotel building has shopping and restaurant establishments.

recommend for every people. the location is perfect i wanna go this place again.near shibuya so easy to find shop.facility is ok.The staff is good service, clean and not expensive for us.Thank you so much

The place is located in a busy place in Shibuya. Easy access to train station. Surrounded with a lot of shops and restaurants. The breakfast is great. Clean room and nice staff. This is a great place to stay in shibuya.

This hotel is very well located; the trains and subways are right there. The views are awesome. Definitely choose to include breakfast--it's well worth the price, and the Breakfast Room location is fabulous. Service is excellent.

Location: The Best. Being right on top of the Shibuya crossing makes everything so easy to access. Food, shopping and the subway all within less than 5 minutes.Service: The service is great. They were helpful and efficient in both checking in and out of the hotel. Also, they helped me in sending my luggage to my next hotel.Room: My wife and I got a semi double room for 8 nights. The room was clean and wifi worked great in the room. The negative is that the room is small, which was expected, but the bed is really small for 2 people. The bed is also hard which makes sleeping difficult. After a couple of nights, you just get used to it. The view from the room is great showing shinjuku and yoyogi park.My suggestion, try and getting a room with a larger bed.

You simply can't beat the location. It is sitting basically on top of the Shibuya station. I took the train from Narita to Shibuya station, about an hour and ten minutes ride. If you know your way the hotel is a 5 minute walk, if do not know your way it is more like 15 minute walk, at least it was for me. If the train sounds too daunting, take the limo bus from Narita airport and it will drop you off in front of the hotel. Time wise it is as quick as the train if you travel during non-rush hours, during rush hour it probably takes an extra 45 minutes or much longer all depending on traffic.Now the hotel as such doesn't offer any great cheers other than the great location. The lobby feels crowded and very sterile. The rooms, including the bathroom, are small by western standards, about average by Japanese standards. The furniture looks a bit dated. The beds are comfortable and the room is very quiet - just what you need to overcome jet lag. The place is spotless clean. I certainly will stay here again. Good value for Tokyo.

Service was excellent, view is fabulous.. we could see and take pictures of shibuya crossing from the 3rd storey very clearly. We spent 3 nights in this hotel and did not have any complaints about anything. When we were lazy to go out for food, we just went downstairs and there are plenty of restaurants and take aways for us to choose from. Location is great, strategically located next to JR station, shibuya crossing, shopping malls, and convenience stores. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody who is mobile and needs a strategically located hotel.

This is my third time at this hotel. It's location can't be beat for fun and proximity to shopping,food,people watching, and transport. It's right at the shibuya train station so easy links to the airport and everywhere. The rooms are a bit small but comfortable and I was so happy we had a nespresso in room as many of my Japan hotels did not have one. Bathroom was small and not recently updated but completely adequate. My only negative is the staff. They are polite of course....but not really helpful or concerned about really caring for their guests( compared to my stay earlier in the trip at Tokyo station hotel...see my review)The best thing about this hotel is location. Front desk and concierge staff barely speak English and their help with any requests is minimal and not very caring. Also..when I wrote an email asking if they could reserve a restaurant for me in the neighborhood they told me they don't do that until you check in! Never been told that by a concierge anywhere in the world so as I said I am not impressed by the staff helping me as a guest. I would stay here again because I love the location but I feel no connection or warmth to the staff and they don't make you feel welcome. They are in a way indifferent. Hope they will work on this aspect of their service.

It's hard to book a hotel with a better location than this. It's almost right above Shibuya station - I was off a train and in my room within five minutes. Given that you are next to the station, you're also right in the middle of Shibuya's action. The rooms seem to be of a comfortable size - mine had a view of the crossing. Service was attentive and unassuming. Breakfast was adequate.

Top notch service and an amazing view! The room was comfortable, clean and a good size by Tokyo standards - the amenities were great and the service was perfect. Our room overlooked the Shibuya Crossing and the lights of Tokyo - we could see the neon of Shibuya, the lush green of Yoyogi Park and the Skyscrapers in the distance. Very convenient to the station and being on top of Mark City you are steps away from a really good depachika where just about any type of food is on offer!

Great location right next to Shibuya crossing. Made life easy to get around Tokyo being on top of the JR and subway lines. Narita Express back to the airport too. Hotel room good size with very comfortable bed and good sized bathroom. Wonderful views of Shibuya and the Tokyo skyline.

As others have mentioned this hotel is accessible from the Shibuya train station, which makes it super convenient. The upper floors also have amazing views over Shibuya and the rest of the city. The rooms are contemporary and a reasonable size for Toyko. Would stay here again.

I was on the 17th floor and the view was amazing day and night. This hotel is centrally located right outside JR Shibuya Station (actually connected to the Shibuya Station building). From the elevator hall, I could see the famous Shibuya Crossing in action. Amazing. My room had a big window looking towards trees in Yoyogi and skyscrapers in Shinjuku. Absolutely amazing. Modern furnishing, has everything you need. I stayed for 4 nights and I already miss that hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel and happily return on my next trip to Tokyo. Complimentary newspapers available at the elevator hall every morning. As usual, hotel restaurants are quite pricey but inside the Mark City building (where the hotel is), there are tons of eateries including the famous sushi restaurant Midori. Very convenient location for anything and everything. It was convenient for my business and also enjoyed shopping (shops were mostly open until 10pm).

The most valued for place, Everything is walking distance, pricey but what you pay is what you get. Smoking area is on the 6th floor. Breakfast is at the amazing top floor overlooking the city! Recommended!

The hotel overlooks the Times Square of Tokyo, complete with a dazzling view of the famous pedestrian intercross, which is not to be missed. We were surprised and delighted when our 3-bed room turned out to be far more spacious and graceful than the website led us to expect. The 25th floor restaurant served above average breakfast fare and afforded great views of the city from almost any angle. We thoroughly enjoyed our brief (one night) stay and would recommended it warmly.

This hotel is convenient in that its located in the Shibuya train station so its very convenient but its feels like you are still in the train station and very chaotic and public. The rooms are TINY and needs upgrades. Bathroom was very small too even for Tokyo standards. Its much better to stay at the Cerulean across the street. Although its a 5 minute walk, its worth it for significantly better rooms. Too expensive for what it is but the views of the Shibuya crossing are magnificent.
user_name:
ladygyani
New York City, New York

review_body: Smallish room and bed, but good service and excellent location. We stayed for four bights and they looked after our bags for three days while we went on a hike in Nagano which was nice. I would deffo look at staying here again

Me and my husband stayed there for about 5 days, got a great view from our room, rooms are small though but we managed, it shouldn't be an obstacle. They need to improve their cleaning of the room just a bit, but it was a really nice stay, and excellent location.

We stayed one night and chose this hotel as the limousine (airport) bus service drops you directly outside. However we could not check in until dead on 2pm even when sitting in the lobby and asking at 13.55! Still they looked after our luggage for free from 19am-2pm. No complaints re room. Very clean, but was small however we expected this in Tokyo. Hotel is in perfect position for experiencing Shibuya. Breakfast was good - but expensive at about £22 per person. Staff offered advice re our travel arrangements to Kyoto.

My husband and I stayed here for a week and were impressed with the location, cleanliness and room space. We reserved the semi double room and were placed on the 19th floor with a city view and partial view of Shibuya crossing. We liked that there is an airport bus that transferred us from and to Haneda. The bus is located just outside of the reception floor. It's also pretty quiet. I had a good night's sleep each night because of the nice and quiet set up. We didn't hear any neighbors or street noise.

Hotel is in a good location, with airport express buses to both Narita & Hanenda stopping right at hotel. It's right next to Shibuya station and is Ginza line's first stop so you'll get seats. The Shibuya scramble is just 100m away (you can see it from the lift lobby) and there are many restaurants, pubs around so that's another plus. We booked a semi-double room, which is rather small, quite unlike the picture shown on booking websites. Bed is against a wall so if you have only 2 pieces of luggages & put them on the chairs, you'll have walking space. Service and amenities are adequate, not spectacular. Overall, it is a 3 solely for its location.

Hotel with fantastic view over tokyo .The hotel entrance is basically located in the Shibuya station which is very central for visiting tokyo.Very fast check in and friendly personnel.Fantastic view over tokyo from the restaurant on the 25th floor.It is worth while to ask a room on the 24 th floor , the view is impressive.

I chose this hotel and selected excel class room because of good location on a busy area with good public transport connections, and because of a good city view from room window. Both requirements were perfectly met. As hotel was located right upon Shibuya Station, it was really easy to get anywhere in Tokyo, and all services (restaurants, convenience stores, shops, bars, ticket machines...) were very close. And the view from a upper floor excel room was just spectacular! Room itself was OK, pretty good size and some nice amenities like free wifi with good signal, hot water kettle for coffee/tea and refrigerator. Air-conditioning worked well. Service was nice and everyone spoke English. In overall, a very nice hotel.

This hotel says they are 4 stay but I would say they are about a 2 star. Very overpriced for what you get. While space is limited in Tokyo these rooms are beyond small. The rooms are tiny, you will barely be able to fit 2 suitcases. We had to call and ask for the chairs to be removed from the room so we could open our suitcases up. The bathroom is so small as well with very bad lighting. On the first night our towels were stained and smelt moldy.There is no gym and room service is only offered for limited hours. The only good thing about this hotel is its location on the crossing. But I do believe you could spend the same amount of money at another hotel and get a bigger and better room.

This hotel is in a great location on top of the shops and train station - very easy access to all the shops, restaurants etc. The hotel staff are friendly and will go beyond to help out. The rooms are spacious compared to other hotels in Japan I have stayed at and the room is very clean with great amenities. The beds are a double size which I think is standard but not very comfortable (maybe I'm just used to my own bed). We were there for 2 nights before going on a cruise - the first night I couldn't sleep at all - the second night I slept for most of the night (probably because I didn't sleep the night before). The restaurants at the top is great for breakfast - a bit expensive around $30 for a buffet - if you want something cheaper then go to the local restaurants below however the view is great from the top level while having breakfast.
