I would stay here again but getting used to the small bed for 2 people would be a challenge.

The hotel is location right on Shibuya crossing connected to the JR shibuya station. Best location for getting around Tokyo. The hotel service was good, the room we had was quite big at around 20sqm. Hotel was clean and had all the required amenities , free wifi. Quite pricey but worth it. Will stay again !

In Shibuya we found it difficult to find a single room to house all 4 of us comfortably but we managed to find this one above a main subway station and great shopping centre - at a reasonable rate. We did bring a travel cot which fit comfortably in the corner. I found out Japan has a culture of children co-sleeping with parents till approx 6years so most enquiries I made had 2 king singles which they advised would be totally suitable for a family of 4. For our needs we had a double bed, and a single for our 3 year old and we used the cot for our 18month old. Super convenient location. Also has a coin laundry - also convenient!

Stayed here quite a few times. Great location ... near the subway of Shibuya .. and if yo get the right room, you can see the Shibuya crossing to your window ....Just a stone throw from The Room club if you like that type of thing too .. soulful and funky and jazzy music most nights of the week from the guys from the Kyoto Jazz Massive ... As with all Japanese hotels "The Computer Says NO!!" if you ask for anything not define in the rules .. absolutely NO CHANCE of ever getting an early check in in a Japanese hotel ... even if the hotel was empty the night before and all the rooms were ready from 7am in the morning ... just a warning ....

This is a great hotel at reasonable prices for Tokyo. Especially considered the rooms were quite comfortable - compared to some hotels in Tokyo where you can either have access, or keep luggage in your room. But not both. Staff were very friendly and and usual in Japan, service good. Only thing is that neither google maps nor Apple maps know where it is, sends you to the back of the building. Entrance is just off the road under the bridge.

We stayed at this hotel twice for a total of 5 nights. The first 3 nights of our trip were a splurge. We stayed on the "Excel" (highest) floor 24. We had a perfect view of Shibuya Crossing, also known as the Pedestrian Scramble. We made this request when we reserved the room and were thrilled that it worked out. Our bed was a double/king. Plenty of room for us, but do keep in mind it is smaller than a western style hotel room. We found availability and the best price by bookings directly through their website. There is a link to view the page in English. You are paying to be in an awesome location, not for luxury. My standards are pretty high, and I thought the room was clean and comfortable and the staff was excellent. We would book this hotel again in a heartbeat, but if this is a splurge please know I wouldn't call it a luxury hotel by western standards. The hotel is directly located above Shibuya Station - you can't get any more convenient! Easy access to plenty of shopping and dining within the station - perfect on rainy days! Shibuya Station is large and a great starting point for day trips etc. We had no trouble visiting all over Tokyo, to and from Kyoto, and to and from Narita airport. It was sooooo nice to arrive at the station and now we were already "home." I can't recommend this location enough! My only complaint was that the second time we stayed at this hotel - our last 2 nights in a double room on the 15th floor - our room smelled like smoke. I have asthma and this was a big problem for me. The hotel staff was polite and apologetic and had us in a new room on the 14th floor within 5-10 minutes of calling them with the complaint. This room was great- no smoke smell. If you run into this issue they will correct the problem without hesitation. Just book this hotel; you won't regret it!

I have used the Exel for all of my trips to Tokyo both business and private for the last ten years. It is perfectly located next to Shibuya station making it ideal for getting around the key areas such as Shibuya, Dakanyama, harijuku, Ebisu etc. the hotel is no smoking, has fast free wifi and is affordable by Tokyo standards if you book online. A Major advantage is also that the main bus stop to Narita and Hanada airports is in the hotel car park. If your going to Narita you can actually book your ticket in the hotel reception, no other hotel can offer this. Very convenient!

I stay at this hotel often and highly recommend it. The perfect location for Tokyo, clean and quiet rooms and a great city view. The downsides? Being a Japanese hotel the rooms are small and the bathrooms are tiny.But the biggest gripe is the service is not up to international standard - certainly not for a hotel charging $400+ per night - and is the limiting factor for this hotel. Upon check in it becomes clear that you aren't a guest, but you are merely a transaction. I have consistently noticed that if you ask for a different room upon check in, regardless of how full the hotel is, the staff will not even entertain the idea of reassigning your room - "the computer assigned you this room" isn't an excuse. Due to jet lag I was asleep when the housekeeping came. Later that afternoon I requested for my room to be made up but was told no - the housekeeper had gone home. How can a hundred room hotel have only 1 housekeeper that goes home at 5pm?Despite the lack of practically any service what so ever the location of this hotel still makes it a winner.

This hotel is in THE BEST location if you're planning on staying in the Shibuya area. It is conveniently located next to / above the train station and on the corner of the busy crossing. There are hundreds of restaurants to choose from and store to shop from. The room was a normal American size hotel room and we were fortunate to have the view of the city. The staff spoke English and was able to help us with taxis/ directions/ suggestions and everything else we needed help with at that time. There is also the "airport limousine" (nice large shuttle bus) that brought us to our hotel from Narita airport for $30 USD. Very convenient.

Centrally located to all the Shibuya madness. Hotel is above the metro/JR station. Convenient to everything. Room was bigger than anticipated, super clean. Bed and pillow were hard. Check in was easy and staff spoke perfect English. Took fellow trip advisor advice and took the bus service from Narita. Door to door service, 3,100 yen, no schlepping bags around the subway. Starbucks in the third floor. No coffee in the rooms. Recommend the Tokyo Food Show across the street for every kind of snack you can imagine. Would stay again and recommend to friends.

It was a spectacular hotel, with the best location you could ever bargain for.Service is impeccable - from the front desk to housekeeping and restaurants.I stayed for 8 nights and naturally alternated my breakfast vouchers between Western and Japanese food. Both are equally tasty.As mentioned, location is unbeatable - JR to subways bring you all over Tokyo practically. Food-wise and shopping , you have unlimited options; HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

This place is changed a little bit. The rooms have been upgraded and her clean but there's no more sitting area except in front of the lobby. Small Cafe next to the lobby are quite strict about everyone ordering something if you're going to sit in the area. Great location and awesome scenery from the 25th floor restaurant. Great restaurants within a stone's throw of this hotel. Of course being right next to the Jr line is very helpful.

My first stay here and was very happy with the hotel in general. Clean, modern, great location, small rooms but to be expected in Tokyo. Front desk very helpful and speak English perfectly. Very easy to get to on bus from Narita
user_name:
Brad J
New York City, New York

review_body: Clean and functional rooms and decent buffet breakfast but falls far short of international 4 star level (except in cost). No gym and limited room service options but worst was the service: curt reception staff and limited housekeeping service. Our daughter was ill and therefore refused room cleaning when it came in the morning. When we requested this later in the day we were told that housekeeping staff had left for the day. They were "sorry" but would not remedy the situation. Would not choose stay here again.

Stayed here a few times before but this visit was the worst. There was blood on the toilet seat, oh my goodness. I told the receptionist but she did not really understand.Then was the towel, the smell of bleach was very strong. I had to ask for another one. Although it is very convenient, I would not recommend my friends to come and stay at this hotel. I will not return either !

Room was great with good view over the famous crossing. Always very clean with good amenities. We had a twin room with good space for a Japanese hotel. Hotel is a little difficult to find if you don't know the area and there is a bit of construction work around the railway station. Only disappointment was the western breakfast which was not good considering that everything else was five star. Service immaculate.

We stayed here for 6 days, me and my daughter. We had a semi-double room with a view on Shibuya crossing. Excellent room, great conditions! We loved it so much!!!I was afraid that the room will be tiny, but in fact, it was an absolutely regular sized room. Plenty enough room for both of us and our three pieces luggage)). We didn't take the breakfast option because we wanted to taste as many Japanese food around as we can. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Most hotels in Tokyo are quite pricey, we got recommended by a friend and booked here. Stayed for 3 nights and yes, location was superb as metro is just few steps away. The hotel is located inside Tokyu Shopping Mall and I think it belongs to them too. Anyway you got like 10 malls around and we couldn't even visited them all. The hotel was in very good condition and quite new I would say. Check-in seems to be quite strict 2pm but you can leave your luggage there. The room itself was small but great city view and new. For 2 persons, please note that is Queen size bed. If you are Asian size then is fine. They have amenities given but no water :( Another great point is that you can buy the bus service from airport and drop you right at the hotel, same thing for going back to airport.So overall was a good choice :)

Great location and excellent views of the city. Hotel is new, clean and the staff are very friendly. Their are motion detectors in the room and the A/C only works if someone is in the room. Overall great value for what you get!

My daughter and I travelled to Japan on a whim. No time to plan; we listed all the things we wanted to do and looked for a hotel conveniently located. We hit the ball out of the park! Located across the street from Shibuya station, we had easy access to the Yamanote line (free with our JR passes) as well as the local metro trains. We stayed for two nights before we left for Kyoto, and returned to this hotel for the remainder of our time in Tokyo. Be sure to inquire about upgrades; we moved to a corner Scramble-view on our return for only $50 more than our bargain-basement price for a room right above the trains. Note: room service is only available for a small period of time, but there are restaurants on other floors of the building.

We booked and then cancelled two other hotels for the Tokyo portion of our trip to Japan before I found this place, and we are so happy with our decision!The location is perfect, right above a major train station (with JR access as a bonus if you book the rail pass). The nearby shopping is fun and lively, and you can even see the famous Shibuya crossing right from our 19th floor hotel room! The room itself is a good size for a Tokyo hotel room, and the staff have been very accommodating. All in all a perfect hub for our first Tokyo adventure!

Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a ski trip.Great location, don't have to go outside to get to the hotel from the Shibuya JR station.Great access to everything. Only disappointment was that the windows get so much condensation on them you can't see out of them. Had to use towels to mop up all the water.Must have breakfast in the top restaurant. expensive but worth it for the view.

....and the location. Our second stay in two years, the Excel is really the go to place for a Tokyo stay.The neighbourhood, the actual location and the view from the room are an unbeatable combination.Had a room on level 13, not as good as 24 from out last stay and without a scramble view like last time, but the room was still excellent and still with a with out to yoyogi park. And down over Shibuya.Staff a lot friendlier than last time and very pleasant and helpful, this place is always full, but we're allowed and extra hour onto our checkout.Rooms are small, but super clean and warm.For us the only place to stay in Tokyo.

Having seen Tokyo Drift the movie, I had selected this hotel, knowing that we would be looking over the Shibuya scramble, where one of the car scenes happens as a true highlight to teenage son. We stayed here toward the end of our two week Japan trip, so it was a great place for the family to be able have some time to each of ourselves, and then meet back at the end of the day having each done something cool to share. Everything shopping like is within your finger tips. The rooms were straight forward but nice enough, and the staff were helpful in providing information.My favourite nearby restaurant was in the Hikarie shopping mall (on the other side of the train station) - go to the sixth floor for Italian (we allowed ourselves to have western food at the end of the trip). And on your way there is a four story Lindt shop, where we frequented for dessert. If you walk past at the right time there is free chocolate!!! Daughter and I loved the 6 storey Forever 21 shop, all within easy walking distance.

We took the Airport Shuttle from Narita and it stops right outside the front door. Super convenient. The hotel sits right on top of Shibuya Station, just go down a few escalators and there you are. Views of the famous and busy Shibuya crossing and just a few steps from the statue of Hachiko. We stayed in a quad room---these are not easy to find in Tokyo---and it was a great option for our family. 4 twin beds plus a table and chairs. There was an electric kettle for tea and an empty mini-fridge. We were very comfortable though the room was not huge, I think because we all had our individual corners (beds) to retreat to. Though this was definitely a Western-style hotel, we got the distinct impression that westerners are not the main clientele. And for us, that was cool! First thing we noticed---the bathroom was split into 2 sections around the corner from each other. One was toilet and sink, the other sink and tub/shower. The toilet was one of those automated ones and obviously had about 100 commands; however, the instructions were only in Japanese and we were lucky we figured out how to flush it! We also had four pairs of room slippers and unlimited pairs of bathroom slippers. Shoes stay at the door. A few of the floors have laundry rooms. Again, an adventure in trying to decipher detergent and machine instructions solely in Japanese, but how nice to be able to clean some clothes on a sweaty July day. Staff at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The fluency of their English varied but we communicated well enough. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel---clean, comfortable, but most of all for the excellent location.

I stayed at this hotel between Christmas and New Year.It's location is untreatable. Right on top of a department store, train station and within a few minutes walk of restaurants and shops. It's the perfect location if all you want is eat and shop.Rooms on the small side but it's Tokyo.

This is a business hotel that give you fast and easy Check-in / Check-out. Everything can be done on the machine with your credit card that you had book the rooms with. The Hotel is easy to access to and from the airport with the Narita airport Shuttle bus. It is located in the center of Shibuya with the access to Subway of Yamatote Line and Ginza line. Shopping and food are surrounding the hotel so one will not go hungry or run out of places to spend your money! However because it is located in the center of the Shibuya district, you would expect the rooms on the lower floors to be slight noisy from the street activities especially during the weekends.

This is my favourite hotel in Shibuya. You cannot get any more convenient - right on top of the Shibuya train station. If you are travelling here by train do not consider anywhere else. I have stayed at the Cerulean Tower Hotel as well as the Shibuya Excel. If you are considering both then do yourself a favour and choose this hotel. The Shibuya Excel is a very elegant hotel with great facilities. On our most recent stay we chose a triple room. SO comfortable - great beds, separate toilet and bathroom. Amazing views. If you are in Shibuya to see the crossing, experience the great restaurants and shops and visit nearby areas like Harajuku by foot or train then you will not find a more convenient hotel.

This Hotel is a gem in the present day Tokyo. I visited Tokyo for the first time and I owe the awesomness of the trip to this hotel. Otherwise where else can you find a hotel in todays's date in Tokyo which is connected to the station itself. The scramble view, The Hachiko Statue are all right across the day. Even after midnight when the train stops, you dont have to struggle with the hotel visiting card showing it to the cabbdrivers everytime, just say Hachiko and the whole Tokyo knows it.. I tried three four times during my stay. The staff is superhelpful..If you are coming for the first time, I definitely recommend Shibuya as a location and this hotel as the accomodation. Five additional stars to this hotel from me!! Thank you Shibuya Excel!

I have stayed here many times now and my opinion remains the same. You cannot beat the location if you are doing business in the Shibuya area or if you're a new visitor to Tokyo. It sits on top of Shibuya station. From many rooms, you can see Shibuya crossing. There are endless restaurants and tons of shopping right by the hotel. So location gives this a "very good" rating. Otherwise I would rate it "Average".The hotel itself is average. Not bad but not great. Basic and covers the essential needs. If you have breakfast at the hotel, you may get bored with the western style breakfast after a couple days. It never changes and the quality is not great. I would suggest trying the Japanese style breakfast in the other restaurant. It's a set meal and very delicious.Rooms aren't the smallest I've stayed in but they are small as is common at Japanese hotels.For transportation to the hotel, I would recommend the airport bus rather than the Narita Express train. It is only a little slower that the train (by 15 minutes or so) but it drops you off right at the hotel so you don't have to navigate the train stations with luggage on either end of the journey.

its located at mark city . suggest to get off the hachiko exit cross the road to reach hotel would be the easiest way. its the jr line exit. ask for high floor and you can see a great view of the neighbourhood and the famous shibuya crossing. if you r there for shopping this is the place to explore and it has good connection to harujuku, shinjuku, ginza and asakusa line.

This is a great choice for first-time visitors to Tokyo and/or those who don't have long to explore this amazing city. We were in both of these categories. The Shibuya Excel Hotel is extremely well located which makes it perfect for a short visit. It is situated directly above a busy station and transport hub. Once we figured out how to use the subway and trains (not actually that difficult but takes a bit of getting used to), we managed to find our way to lots of parts of Tokyo from this hotel. We are a family of four, with two children, and we booked a quad room for two nights. I was expecting something tiny and cramped, but actually the room was spacious and had everything that we needed. The beds were super-comfy and roomy. We arrived in Tokyo at 6am, and requested an early check-in. The hotel was only willing to accommodate us for over $200 (after 11am only!), which we thought was very overpriced, so we left our luggage at reception and set off to explore the city instead. We didn't eat at the hotel (again, very overpriced), so we had minimal interaction with hotel staff. However, those we did deal with were unfailingly polite and pleasant.And the views from the hotel are fabulous!One more thing - there is a bus that takes one directly to the hotel from Haneda airport at a reasonable price.I would definitely recommend this for a short Tokyo stay.

Spent one week here this month, and loved it! The location can't be better if you like to be in the center of the action. My room was for 4 people (hard to find in Tokyo!), and of course it seems small to north americans, but it's BIG by Japanese standards. Besides, you're only there to sleep, and maybe eat something in your room, right? Very comfortable beds, great views (HUGE windows), and a perfect view of the Shibuya Scramble from the window at the elevators.The 25th floor restaurants have views that are outstanding. The western style buffet breakfast is very good, but 2800 yen (really standard price for hotel breakfasts, anywhere).No pool (if there is, we couldn't find it).Friendly, courteous staff.Downstairs (1F) is Shibuya Mark City, a huge mall, and in their basement is Tokyo Foodshow. Hungry? You can get anything here, including wine and whisky to bring home. Almost all malls have their food courts in the basement. ATMs are everywhere, with one being right by the main street entrance.We travelled with our two teen daughters, and they loved everything about the hotel, and location. JR Line is right in front (Shibuya Station), and subway tickets can be purchased at the machines (check the map, figure out where you want to go, and the price from that station is noted above it)

I stayed here for 3 nights in July 2016. The hotel is clean and modern, and the rooms are comfortable and particularly spacious for a Japanese hotel. It is also very quiet, which is nice after a hectic day sight-seeing. I stayed on the 11th floor (room 1130) and had a fantastic view. The famous Shibuya crossing was also partially visible from this room. The best thing though is the location. It is on the 5th floor of the Mark City shopping mall, which means that you have Starbucks on the 3rd floor and plenty of other eateries should you be worn out after a long day. There is also a supermarket on the ground floor of the mall. The hotel is the last stop on the airport limousine bus route. This made it so easy to get the bus back to the airport as it was the first stop just outside the hotel. Major train lines run from Shibuya station across the city, so it is very convenient for sight-seeing. Make sure you buy a Parco/Suica card at the station as it takes the hassle out of travelling.These cards are easily loaded up at every station and can even be used to pay for taxi fares. For convenience, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Booked this hotel because it has convenient airport bus, Shibuya station, able to accommodate 3 persons. Booked via Agoda, assigned a 9th floor room with facing of bus terminal. Room is near lifts and as written by previous reviews , the room is bigger than others. Room has comfortable beds and pillows, free wifi, separate bath and toilet area. Service staff are all very courteous and helpful. It will be better if the hotel can provide complimentary coffee in the room. My room only have green tea and Ceylon tea. Overall a satisfying place for rest and base to Yokohama.

We loved the location of this property and the stunning views from the elevator. The room was decent size for Tokyo and very comfortable. The hotel has an airport shuttle service that you can arrange from the front desk and it's much less expensive for 1 or 2 to use to get to the airport. 3 or more would be better to get a cab.The price of the hotel was quite high but for a one night stay we were happy to pay to be in a great location in Shibuya!

No new surprises.. This property remains clean, quiet and right in the heart of Shibuya. Right outside is the famous Shibuya crossing. There's lot of restaurants and shops, to include a kaiten-Sushi (conveyor belt sushi) on the 8th floor of the Seibu department store. The hotel is an easy 5 min walk to all of these things.I've recently discovered the 3rd floor of Mark City, which is directly under the hotel, and a huge pedestrian walkway to the Tokyo metro and JR lines. There are dozens of restaurants on 3 floor, and while most sell Japanese food, it all looks good.Also note there is a Starbucks on 3F, right under the hotel. This location is built right into/under the hotel, so if it's raining or foul outside you don't have to cross Shibuya crossing outside to go to the Starbucks which faces the crossing.

i really enjoyed my trip late may to early june in Tokyo. Shibuya hotel has excellent location and place. Nice crew! My room was kinda small to me but overall japan is like that. So, definitely recomemmend it!

We stayed here for four nights and admittedly, given our middle-range budget, we thought the hotel would be nice...but not outstanding. We were very wrong. The hotel far exceeded our expectations in every way. We had an amazing view of the famous Shibuya crossing and the broader Tokyo skyline, including of Yoyogi Park and Shinjuku; a wonderful, fairly large corner room with a separate area with a couch and chairs; and a spacious hybrid Japanese/western bathroom that we loved. When we checked in, we were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a larger room. It wasn't that much more, we decided to upgrade, and it was well worth it. We had large suitcases and there was plenty of room for our things and to sit and enjoy the room. The location is amazing: We were right smack in the center of bustling Shibuya center, just above the local subway and JR train lines, and near endless shopping and restaurant options. Despite this, the room was incredibly quiet and secluded. One of our favorite dinner options was buying food at the high-end grocery store in the basement of the Tokyu Department Store and bringing it to our room to enjoy with a glass of wine in the evening. The Estacion Cafe on the entry-level fifth floor is pricey but the iced coffee is fab and it's a lovely atmosphere. Since we had been traveling for a couple of weeks, the hotel's DIY laundromat service on the 8th, 9th and 10th floors was very convenient and inexpensive. Overall, the hotel service was excellent and while Tokyo is pricey in general, the rate we got and the overall value of this hotel can't be beat. An added perk is that airport shuttle buses stop here, and our experience with the airport bus when we first arrived in Tokyo was that it was very easy and convenient. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Great location, ok rooms and service was good but didn't go that extra mile for us.Room was clean but smaller than what we were used to. Great with transfer's to/from both Airports can purchase these tickets from reception.

This is a great hotel at Shibuya. My parents and my sister stayed here for 6 nights and loved it. First, the view is amazing, our room shows the famous Shibuya crossing below us. Second, it is clean and comfy and has fridge, wardrobe, safe, TV and the wifi is good too. The staff is very friendly, speaks good English at the front desk no problem. There are shopping malls, brand shops like Forever 21, H&M, Adidas... Just a few minutes away. Great food nearby as well. Some people might have a hard time finding the hotel because the hotel lobby is indeed located at the 5th floor of a shopping mall called shibuya Mark City. So if you are riding the metro, just find the exit to Mark City and there will be a big floor sign telling you where to go. If you land on the Narita Airport like me, make sure you go to the service counter to buy a limousine ticket (and a 72-hour metro ticket optional) that will take you directly to the hotel in less than 2 hours so you don't have to worry about taking your luggages everywhere. The Mark City mall is great, in fact, there is a Starbucks on the 3rd floor! So great for tourists that just want some nice coffee in the morning! There's also a food market at the mall so if you are tired from all the walking, just buy some food at the mall and bring to the hotel room to eat! (Tip: everything is discounted at 50% after 8:30pm so grab sushi and anything you want at that time for great price and great food!) Just dial room service for some utensils and plates and your dinner is ready! Overall, lovely hotel, great for families, business, friends.

We stayed in 19th floor directly viewing famous shibuya cross roads, excellent room with a very comfortable and interesting toilet, house keeping excellent with very prompt response,breakfast at the top floor was emazing, famous star bucks was just across the road, high class brand shops all around hotel,metro is just few steps away, the staff at the reception are very helpful,they suggested the top floor with minimal extra payment and it was worth paying,bell captain service was excellent,very polite and always smiling,excellent restaurants around the hotel,Spanish,mcdolands,curry,Italian and many to our choice. Reception staff helped us to find out kabuki theatre and helped to get the seats. Over all we were very much satisfied with everything of this hotel,we will recommend to everybody who wants to visit Tokyo,excellent,excellent,excellent-------location.

We stayed 6 nights in this hotel. It is just right above Shibuya Station with good view of the Shibuya crossing and has access to many shops and restuarants. The reception speaks good English and housekeeping is efficient.

The rooms are very narrow but the bed & pillow was good. Breakfast very limited for Turkish people. But due to wonderfull location of the hotel you can reach to everywhere ery easy. There is a metro station near of hotel and thus your trip is eaiser.

This hotel had a great location as it was connected to the train station, dept store, food court. It was right across Hachiko statue and shibuya crossing. There are a lot of shops in the surrounding streets. Connected to Mark City mall with lots of restaurants and convenience stores, as well as Tokyu Dept. store.We chose this hotel because we had lots of luggage and the airport limousine bus stops at this hotel.Good size room. We transferred from Tokyo Rei Hotel as it was too small for us, especially the bathroom.simple hotel but convenient location. they have a business center for 100 yen i think to use computer for 5minutes. coin operated printer (very interesting to learn there was such a thing.)

With a great location Shibuya Excel Hotel give a great experience for meeting, with a sub-way station just a block away, incredible facilities, and a very complete shopping area.Is the best place to stay in Shibuya. Great night live around.

We stayed 3 nights at Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu in early April. The hotel is in a brilliant location smack bang in the middle of Shibuya (one of Tokyo's main hubs) located above the station, everywhere and anywhere is easily accessible from this hotel. Friendly English speaking staff, nice rooms (which are bigger than average for Tokyo) and even though we stayed right in the middle of Cherry Blossom season, the price was considerably cheaper than other lower grade hotels we have stayed in and paid more for. Amazing views over Shibuya Scramble and greater Tokyo from the lifts. We will stay there again when we visit next!!Thanks for a lovely stay. ぜひ、まだ泊まりますので宜しくお願い致します。

I booked this hotel last minute on hotels.com and got a good deal. Room was surprisingly bigger than I expected. Very clean and comfortable. Can't beat the location. Nice to be centrally located to allow for breaks away from the crowds. Even though you're located in the middle of Shibuya the rooms were very quiet. Also has great views of the crossing. I would definitely stay here again in the future.

The concierge only reserve seats for the Friendly airport limousine bus for hotel guests. Non-guests, beware, even if you go there in person. Instead concierge gives you a piece of paper on the bus service.

Earlier this year, I stayed at Shibuya Southern Hotel Tokyo which looks really nice but it's a bit far from the bustle of Tokyo. This month, we booked at Excel Hotel and had a better time during our trip because all the action is there when you step out of the hotel. The hotel is a part of Mark City which has shops and restaurants. It is also surrounded by malls, restaurants, attractions and the train is a few walks away. Shibuya Crossing is so near and can be seen from its elevator. I will definitely stay here again.

We were so glad to have chosen this hotel because the location is so phenomenal. You are right inside the Mark City Building, with tons of shopping, restaurants and bars right outside your door. Shibuya station is literally just beneath you in the same building. The hotel is floors above though so there is no noise, but it's so easy and quick to jump on a train to anywhere else in the city. We found it so easy to get around from here and we loved walking by Shibuya Crossing all of time. Our room looked right out over the Pedestrian Crossing in what looked like a scene right out of Tokyo Drift. Stay here and your time in Tokyo will be so fun and easy!

No breakfast included No fitness room or pool Rooms are very small and out of dateGood location thoughIn shibuya and great views of the city and the junction but very old and badly in need of modernisingVery central location saved it from a worse review though

Went here with my family last March, during Sakura. We booked the family room, and though small, could actually fit 4 adults, 2 children and 1 toddler. I wouldn't recommend doing that on your visit, though but it is quite spacious for a hotel in Tokyo. The hotel itself is not fancy and quite old, but the location is unbeatable. It is right in the middle of Shibuya and all the train stations. Great proximity to foods, malls and food halls. There are even coin laundries inside the hotel. Overall a great basic hotel for the family.

it is so close to anything and great location above the subway, shopping mall and streets with local eating and shopping. I checked in and went for a walk this time trying to locate the same places i had been 1 year plus ago but i couldnt as i am forgetful. The bf is not cheap but scene is great over there. I like Western breakfast more than Japanese as they offered choices. Another good thing is that the airport bus stop right at the hotel and make things easier of all.

I stayed at Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyo twice in 2014 and 2015. It was a decent hotel and located at the heart of Tokyo. I was staying at the Ladies Floor. The guest room was provided with a facial machine which allowed me to conduct a 15 or 20-min stream cleansing at night after a long day.

The view is so beautiful ... I really liked every thing in this hotel ... They have two kind of breakfast Amirican and Japanese , they both are delicious ...The people work are nice .. You should know that they dont carry your luggage

This hotel is all about the great location. It's in the Mark City shopping plaza, connected to the Shibuya Train Station and a bus stop for the Narita Express Bus. Lots of options for restaurants and shopping right outside the hotel. A bit pricey for the small rooms, but the service and location make up for it. Would recommend.

One room just 20 down cost 400 usd per night No water complimentary No big towel for showerNo service for your luggage No friendly serviceThe manager is very rude he said ........If you don't like I can cancel and to find one better we don't care we are Full.I'll cancel forever from my list and better any body look another place better and cheaper .

We got 2 x double bed room and they located us a few doors from each other. They usually don't help with luggage unless you ask, as with most 3.5 star hotels. The room and hallways we're clean and theirs three floor of coin laundry with dryer, one on each floor - with a vending machine too if you need to break your note. The hotel is easy accessible via the lift or escalator form Shibuya station once you figure out your exit. Would definitely recommend to get the airport limousine bus from Haneda airport (this one is closer) or Narita airport than to train it from the airport.

Very fine hotel in a fantastic location atop the Shibuya train station. The room was small by Western standards, but typical for Tokyo. Everything was nice and tidy and super clean. The genial concierge staff helped us with dinner reservations a couple times, and helped provide directions in a couple other instances. Really, though, the biggest selling point is the location -- a perfect home in Shibuya and excellently situated for exploring the rest of the city.

The Shibuya Excel Tokyu was booked to me by my client, and I was into a very pleasant surprise once arriving at the hotel at 2 a.m. from the airport, in particular coming from China. First of all, both Haneda and Narita airport buses arrive at the door of the hotel, and the location of the hotel is on in the Shibuya station complex. The view from the room, even from the lower floors, is excellent. The 10th floor room was smallish, but bigger than single rooms in many big cities. The bed, even in a single room was about queen size, and there was still enough room to move about in the room and keep the suitcase open. The bathroom was small with a mini-size bathtub, and a typical Japanese automatic toilet seat with seat heating and washing functionality.The breakfast is served in the top floor of the hotel with spectacular views to two directions, and from the elevator lobby one has a spectacular view of the world-famous Shibuya crossing intersection. The food was excellent quality and there were enough choises - the selection seemed the same every morning. There is also a Japanese breakfast option in another restaurant, but I did not try that.The hotel is completely non-smoking (ok, there is a smoking room somewhere), which is good for those who don't like the smell.It is possible to connect from the hotel indoors to Tokyo Metro and JR railway. I had some time off and took the opportunity to explore Tokyo. If you have heard the story of Hachiko the dog, Shibuya station is the place where it happened, and the statue of Hachiko is accross the street from the hotel under the trees near an old green railway car which is serving as tourist information booth. The Shibuya shopping and entertainment area is on the northwest side of the hotel, with easy pedestrian access to dozens and dozends of stores and restaurants. The JR Yamamoto line will take you to the most important tourist areas (from Shibuya to Harajuku, Shinjuku, Akihabara, and Tokyo which is a walking distance to Ginza) and only costed 750 yen for a day. With more expensive ticket one can add other modes of transportation, like several metro lines, Tokyo Monorail, buses etc. The amount of people in Tokyo is overwhelming, but the city is very beautiful, clean, and safe, with excellent shopping and dining options.

First off the name of this hotel is not shown on the outside of the building, the building says Mark City. The hotel lobby is on the 5th floor. You must take an escalator to the 3rf floor or take an elevator on the first floor both the signs are small and this first floor elevator is not out front it's in a bit to the left side of those main escalators.The hotel itself is extremely modern nice lobby area, friendly staff most spoke English. Our room was on the 23rd floor, it looked to be a suite. ( not sure if all the rooms are this way ) We had a great view of the Shibuya intersection as well as the surrounding area.The toilet was in a small room with a sink, the bathing area was in another room looking to be Japanese style, where one would wash and rinse outside of the tub, then soak in the tub. Or just shower as I did.The twin beds were comfortable, the room itself was very large it had a desk, coffee maker and sofa as well as two chairs. Again we did not use the TV as when we got back to the room we just showered and planed for the next day.I would stay at this hotel again. Great area lots of shopping and places to eat and drink. The hotel was very clean the same for our room, again I can't say a lot about the room as I just look for price, and location. I was happy with both.

This hotel is in a great spot! Located at the heart of Shibuya - you can see the busy Shibuya crossing down below and just walking distance to the train station. A few steps and you'll also see Hachiko.Tokyo is shopping and you're also located at Shibuya Mark City. You'll also never go hungry as there are so many restaurants below.Room is clean, toiletries complete.Checkout was easy too. This hotel has access to the airport limousine bus - the bus will drop you off right at the hotel!

This is a standard hotel, nothing great but also nothing bad. Its ok.However the location is fantastic. If it weren't for the location, I would've given it 3 stars.It is not a hotel were you are going to want to stay extended period of time.It is perfect for 2-4 day tokyo trip, were you plan to be out exploring most of the time.Loads of options for food and nightlife. Also located on top of the Shibuya crossing/subway station so easy to get around.

Stayed here on my recent Tokyo visit. It is on top the Shibuya station, something that's helpful at the end of the day when you're tired touring!! When you get out, the action is there, you walk into Shibuya, people walking everywhere, the shops!!! You could see the shibuya crossing from the hotel. The shops are a walk away. Space is adequate. Rooms are clean.The view is amazing. The airport limousine from Narita drops you off/picks up from this hotel.

In an excellent location just above the famous Shibuya Crossing. Connected to the Shibuya station which has the JR lines and Tokyo metro running through, making it accessible to other parts of Tokyo. Facilities are clean, bed is comfortable but overall room feels dated. Toilet is extremely small but I suppose that's typical of most Japanese hotels. Service has room for improvement. Hotel insisted on charging an additional full night charge when I asked to be allowed to check in early when I arrived at 630am, even though the hotel is not running full occupancy and the room is essentially available. Having arrived on a red eye flight, I would have appreciated some flexibility since the room was available anyway.

Excel Tokyu Hotel is just across from the JR Shibuya station, and from the excellent food hall in the Tokyu Department store basement level. The rooms are spacious by Japanese standards, and the Japanese breakfast is worth trying. The room cost is also very reasonable, and there is a shuttle bus from the hotel to Narita Airport

The location is superb and nothing beats it. You are literally waking up in the middle of Tokyo shopping district. Major subway stations, bus stations and JR stations right under your feet! Very convenient location. The rooms are tidy and clean and relative large. Service is good and up to par. Very good for hardcore shoppers!

One of my favorite hotels in Tokyo! This hotel is strategically located in the busiest area in Tokyo. Surrounded by many places to dine and shop, one can really lost track of time. This hotel is located in the upper ground of MRT station, which is very convenient. It also has pick up point from and to airport using airport limousin.

superb location, right next to Shibuya crossing and Shibuya train station - very convenient to get to from the airport, just take Narita Express to Shibuya and exit @ Hachiko Gate - hotel is located in the mega mall building called Mark City, right across the exit from train station. excellent amenities also very roomy for Japanese hotels. highly recommend staying here

Overall ImpressionClean, and okay place to stay. But also nothing that excites.LocationJust great. If you want Shibuya, here you go. Located directly at the crossroad this is right in the centre of action. If you are lucky you get a room with a view on the famous crossroad. RoomsI got a free upgrade they told me at the reception. I am not sure what this meant to be honest. The rooms was simply standard, also not really big. But maybe normal rooms that I had booked would have been even smaller - who knows. Anyway. Room has an air filter (never seen that before in a Hotel) and the air condition works very well and without annoying you with loud fan sounds or else. Room was clean & equipped with TV and a water boiler, Safe etc. And even though it is Shibuya - you don't hear anything. The room is very quiet. The overall appearance though is a bit - old. The bathroom amenities are ok, but nothing great. Except of course the typical Japanese toilette seats with all its crazy but appreciated functions.RestaurantI just went here once for the western breakfast on the 25th floor. This is, for the price, rather poor. Other Hotels have set much higher standards here and I was honestly disappointed by it. But the view is fantastic therefore. All in allA save choice. But definitely nothing to right home about. Simply very convenient because of its central location. This is its biggest asset. Price-Performance ratio: not really good in my opinion. You simply pay for the location I suppose.

Highly recommended if you hate carrying your heavy luggage since the airport limousine bus stops directly at the hotel itself. Additionally, the hotel is near many subway lines and is very very very close to the heart of Shibuya.But if you like somewhere peaceful and quiet this may not be the place for you, since it's very near to the Shibuya scramble.

1. Once you arrived in location, good luck with finding the hotel, better again the lobby. No sign, virtually unseen from the street.2. Booked via JapaniCan.com, booked single room (1 bed), checked in to Twin room (2 beds) and yes I am travelling with my wife. Called reception if we can be moved should there be available. The answer given was "that room usually is single room but because your request come as double hence we put extra bed". Im sure im not that stupid to not being able to tell between Twin room and Single room with additional bed3. Being international traveller, the least they can do is give a room with some decent view, not as pictured. Especially when we checkin at 6pm. Not rushing them to get the room ready prior to usual checkin time.In Summary, we have spent 10 days in Japan, and our last accommodation in Shibuya is appaling.

This hotel has the best location! It is above the Shibuya station, you can walk indoor to the hotel. This hotel is within minutes of all shopping and restaurants. The size of the room is good in Tokyo standard. Some of the rooms have the view of the Shibuya crossing too. The service is good, however i didn't have any specific request.Because of the above, I will definitely stay here again.

The Hotel is great location, but Front Desk staff are very unfriendly and not flexible in service upon check in. Room is small and very basic for TV channels which mostly all Japanese channels. Toilet are too small and breakfast is very basic for western food, with expensive price, not value for money.Im staying there for few times, the Hotel does not recognise repeat guest benefits. Overall, the Hotel is over pricing but not service delivery at all.

The room was clean and comfortable but it had small room with tiny bathroom. Not exactly a luxury hotel. They come with mini-refrigerator. The location is right above Shibuya crossing and connected to Shibuya station. There are tons of restaurants and shops within walking distance. Overall stay was great.

This hotel was in an excellent location and was great value! It was spotless and pretty spacious by Japanese standards. The staff were lovely too. We had a great view of the crossing from our room. The bathroom was the best that I experienced in Japan. The only thing that I would mention is that because the main entrance is part of the train station the after hours entrance can be a bit tricky to find, so I would where it is before you go out!

The Good:Location -As someone who had never been to Japan/Tokyo before, one trademark location you see anytime it is discussed is Shibuya Crossing. I naturally wanted to be as close as possible to get the "wow" factor and this location was right on top of it. Further if you get book one of the higher floors, the Park view and Shinjuku skyline is superb. If you feel like a workout, as the hotel lacks a gym, the Yoyogi park is a get running spot, with plenty of local joggers.Shibuya will certainly appeal to some more than others. It is the 'youth' and trendy center hangout, with lots of fashion forward shopping, clubs, and entertainment. On weekends and at night I found the area to be filled with people hanging out, visiting bars, or smoking and conversing outside. As a more youthful area the benefit is that most places cover English with menus or servers that are fluent, in case your Japanese is lacking, and Western-styled food options in case you have a craving of food back home.As far as getting around outside of Shibuya, you are right next to the station which is on the Yamanote line, which had a good deal of sights I wanted to see along it, which saves a bit on switching lines and figuring out if your getting on the right train.Room -I booked an Excel Single, which although not large in size was well organized and definitely felt larger than it's dimensions. From what I remember, it had plentiful outlets, safe (with an outlet in it I think), Japanese bidet toilet, reasonable sized TV. Nothing was exactly luxury, but it was clean, well maintained, and comfortable. Of course, as mentioned, the view is great. Big plus was rather than having a stocked mini-fridge with overpriced stuff you're not going to touch unless desperate, it was empty and instead there is a small vending room by the elevator bank with drinks at an okay price.Price -I assumed that hotel in overlooking such a landmark would be quite expensive, as is the norm with almost all other major cities, but I found the rates quite good for the hotel and location. I stayed here end of 2013 (overdue review) and they had only renovated some rooms, so it may have changed, but it was well below what I expected I'd have to pay. It's hard to compare, as the exchange rate was much different at the time. The Bad:No extras -Other than the rooms and restaurants, there is not much else to the hotel. This is a plus if you like staying at nice hotels, but would rather not pay the higher rate for having those things in house. However, the lobby is quite small, and of the times I went through it always seemed a bit busy given the space in relation to rooms and guest count. They do offer spa services in room, so there are options I guess in absence of a true spa. Restaurants certainly looked nice, but I opted for local places.Miscommunication - A typhoon was meant to blow through one day I was staying, so I decided to book a tour to cramp activities in, anticipating maybe having limited options for a few days. Rather than running into issues trying to book it myself, I figured I could ask at the lobby if there was a concierge to assist. I showed one gentleman a booklet of the company and tour, from the stand in the lobby, that I wanted to try and book and I was instructed to take a seat at a little desk area on the edge of check-in. I sat there for about 10-15 minutes, with a several desk staff shuttling back and forth in front of me, but no one talking to me. I was going to meet up with a friend at the top of the hour and by the time I had waited, he had arrived and found me sitting in the lobby. He asked what I was waiting on, and I explained I was waiting but no one had come back to speak to me, so he asked in Japanese one of the staff. The answer was along the lines of no one knew I was waiting to be helped. Random guest sitting at what appeared to be the concierge desk with a tour booklet for while in full view, but no one thought to proactively check if I was all set?Rigid check-in - I had a good fare on a US flight to Haneda, which arrived quite early due to their landing slots, but I figured by the time I arrived, got my luggage and ate at the airport, before finding my way to the hotel, I'd be not that far from check-in time and I could luck out with an early room. Japanese transport efficiency got me to the hotel earlier than expected, even after loitering in the airport for a bit. I was told it was not check-in time yet and to come back at the exact published check-in time. I wasn't offered to have my bag held, a restaurant in the hotel that I could perhaps choose to eat in to kill time, nothing. I believe the cafe on lobby level was roped off and the lobby was full, so I basically just walked around Shibuya, with luggage, to try and remain awake. Other hotels seem willing to anticipate if a room will be available early or provide alternative and hold your luggage.Summary:Clean, modern, comfortable, centrally located hotel, without the built in price tag for hotel extras. If you want a good place to use as a base for Tokyo adventures and sightseeing. Rooms sufficient for the time you likely will spend there (some rooms fit quite a few beds if your with friend/family and don't want to spend for extra rooms). I never thought "it would be great if they just added ____" at any point and you can work around what’s missing easily. Maybe the hotel was in transition when I was there and the staff was working in, or there are subtle culture norms I missed and which made me felt like service was lacking.5 stars at the price I paid in 2013, 4-4.5 based on prices I see quoted at the moment.

We have beed here several times, and this is the first time Iam dissappointed. We stayed for 7 nights. We approached the front desk to inquire about car rentals to take us around Tokyo, the first thing the lady said was, " oh that is very expensive" I understand there may be a language barrier but customer service just have one language. Maybe since we have been loving this hotel, we expected same or exceeding our last stay when it came to customer service. The lady did not smile nor accommodating. Rooms were not spotless clean but the housekeeper was very friendly and accommodating.

Pros: location (connected to shibuya station, right above shibuya crossing), rooms are relatively low price considering the location, I like how the staff is friendly but not overbearing, AC is strong, free wifi that is actually very strong (not common in my experience with other Japanese hotels), limo bus from Narita airport drops you off right in front of the hotel, nice firm bedCons: Tiny rooms (even by Japanese hotel's standards), tiny bathrooms, taxis are not available at the front door (I was told it would take 25 minutes, so I walked to the taxi pickup area at shibuya station)

My friend and I decided to stay in this hotel since it has direct access to the train station. Some of their rooms even have the view of Shibuya crossing. This hotel has access to everything. Staff were friendly too!Perfect location in Shibuya, with nice rooms and nice staff.

The hotel is located right in the center of Shibuya. From the hotel bar enjoy the shift from dusk to the sparkling lights of Tokyo by night. Easy access to Tokyo metro and a number of decent eateries located in the Mark city complex make this a convenient place to stay. Staff is helpful and many of the rooms provide a view of Shibuya crossing.

Enjoyed the hotel, great location and had all the amenities you need. It's across the street from the Shibuya metro station and you can see the famous "Shibuya Crossing" right from the hotel, near the elevator bank and from the Japanese restaurant within the hotel. They have a good international buffet breakfast, a cafe/lounge (good for lunch/tea/desserts), French restaurant and a traditional Japanese restaurant. The hotel connects directly to the metro station, shops and a Starbucks nearby so if it's rainy you can stay dry. Very clean and spacious rooms.
user_name:
Exploring_ss
New York City, New York

review_body: Location is perfect. A few steps to train, subway, metro. All shopping and restaurants at your doorstep. Super friendly service. They have luggage storage if you arrive early. Airport limousine bus stops at hotel so no problem if you carrying heavy or big bags. They upgraded our room (22nd floor) with a really good view of the busy Shibuya crossing. Bigger than Tokyo Standard double room (plenty of room to move and enough space for 2 big luggage). Great housekeeping service. Very clean bathrooms with generous supply of toiletries. They also provided us with Delongi coffee machine and we get diffent flavor coffee everyday. Free high speed wifi. I am so glad we chose this hotel. Reasonably priced as well.

The location of this place is the best. We got a room with a fantastic view on the famous intersection which was amazing. The room itself was really big and clean. It's right in the Shibuya station which means you have tons of good food around and you can get anywhere quickly.

we went during Nov 2014. we got the triple room and was huge for a hotel in tokyo. close to everything. train station, center of shibuya. one thing was the bright lights in the soccer field was bothering us.
user_name:
dimp0s
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel was conveniently located above Shibuya station just across from the intersection. I was just able to get a glimpse of the busy intersection from my room which was very cool. As with all Japanese hotels, I found the staff very friendly. Make sure you come out of the station exit with the Tokyu department store, otherwise you may have some trouble finding the hotel. The slight inconvenience of the hotel is in getting to the station or ground floor, you have to switch lifts at the reception level. We had a small issue around our window area with puddles of water forming on the ledge of the window as a result of the aircon and outdoor temperature differences.

If you aren't in the first few rooms right off the elevators, they will be small and cramped.All rooms are non-smoking as of April 2014, so that is great!The noise from the scramble kept me up after my first week there. (Was there for 3 weeks on business) It turns off at midnight and on at 9am. I was so sick of "Glico" playing every other minute. Ugh! I was on the 11th floor and my co-working on the 17th also had issues with the noise.You can do your own laundry!!! This was essential for a long business trip! There is self service laundry on 4 floors (7, 8, 9, 10) in the vending room. 300 yen to wash, 100 yen to dry per 30 min. 100 yen for soap from the front desk. Note that the dryer can handle a few shirts and socks and that's about all it can do in 30 minutes!Humidifier in the room too - essential for the winter!Soap, shampoo, conditioner in bath + all the little things you may need (razor, brush, comb, q-tips, etc - tons of stuff!)Lower flowers on the opposite side of the scramble will feel the vibrations from the trains as they are right under the 5th floor (where the front desk is).Higher floors are decorated nicer, and are quieter, but not necessarily worth it.There is a giant trouser press in the closet. You can request a small ironing board and iron from front desk.Sleeping gowns and slippers are in room as well.Best part - the access this location has to everything, JR station, subway, Tokyu Food Show and department store, Mark City Restaurant Row (Midori Sushi!) and food shopping are ALL accessible without you having to even go outside! That alone is worth it!

Clean, tidy and customer friendly hotel. More specious than most modern hotel in Tokyo. Excellent location and well connected to subway lines plus to and fro narita. This hotel is deserved for five stars with all the stuff needed, value for money and may stay here again in future.

the hotel allows you to explore Tokyo by public transportation since is basically on top of the Shibuya station. you can also get to and from the airport on a bus that will leave you in the door of the hotel at very affordable prices.The hotel is pretty basic but it has everything you need to make yourself comfortable, at the end in Tokyo you basically want to be outside as much time as possible.

The room is quite basic. Not so much amenities. What the hotel compensates for is its location. Airport bus stop is 10 meters away. Shibuya station is below the hotel. There are tons of restaurants and shops within walking distance. And if lucky, your room might have a view of the Shibuya crossing.

Rooms are actually not small by Japanese standards. I have been in much smaller ones. Breakfasts are OK, both Japanese and western. But of course the main point is the location. Right next to the Shibuya Station and the entertainment area.

Stayed at this hotel as part of a business trip to Tokyo. While the rooms are quite small (as is to be expected for a hotel stay in Tokyo), they were quite clean, with excellent daily makeup service. The view over Shibuya and the rest of the city is quite something and will be very inpressive to first-timers as well as seasoned Tokyo travellers alike. Make sure to reserve a room on one of the higher floors if possible. The western breakfast wasn't that great, though it was functional, with different types of espresso drinks offered as well as regular coffee and many types of bread/egg/hams & fruits. The Japanese breakfast however, is actually very tasty. The Japanese breakfast room is on the opposite side of the building with views towards Shinjuku. You will be offered a choice of rice or porridge and after finishing your set meal you are free to take some coffee to your room or on your way to the office (or wherever). Would recommend to business travellers with offices in Shibuya, or leisure travellers of any kind due to practical train connections (incl. Yamanote line) available without having to leave the building.

I would stay at this hotel only for the location.Pro:- great location, steps from Shibuya station- ladies floor has great amenitiesCon:- basic business hotel, expensive for the facilities- room and hotel a bit date, although room was renovated in 2014, bathroom remains old, dark and looks gloomy- lack customer service

We stayed here for 4 nights after a ski trip in Japan. This was our second time to Japan but our first stay in Tokyo. The location of this hotel is excellent, however it is difficult to find from Shibuya station. Once we knew where we were going though it was great. We were on the 18th floor so we had great views of Tokyo to the south and west.We had a triple room which was quite reasonable for 4 of us, (we shared a bed with the 3 year old). It even had a small sitting area looking out the window which was nice. It meant we didn't need to always be sitting on beds.We didn't go to the restaurants upstairs as the price for breakfast was quite expensive for breakfast each day. So finding breakfast was a bit of a challenge but there is a food hall downstairs from the hotel with excellent options available.Overall it was a very comfortable place to stay for 4 days. The beds are western style and very comfortable, and a very good size (especially if your not sharing with a 3 year old). It was a very reasonable place to stay. It's not 5 star and the service was ok, but I probably would have expected a little more for the price.

Had a quad, room was generous by japanese standards. It was comfy, with a sitting area as well. We had a room on a high floor, the view was fantasticRoom was clean and well appointed, had a separate wash room (with it's own faucet) so it was great for our family of 4.Staff were polite and efficient, good command of English...very tourist friendly.Best of all, the central location and convenience of having the train station and supermarkets connected. We need not worry about rain (was raining quite a bit in November while we were there.) Harajuku, Meiji Shrine and shopping (Muji/ Tokyu Hands/ Loft/ Maruzen/ Chacott/ Parco etc etc) all within walking distance from the hotel ....We enjoyed our stay very much

we stayed there for 2 nights. The best thing about this hotel is its central location: Ideal for people who want to shop and eat around the city centre. We found it difficult to locate initially, and that wasn't pleasant with kids and luggage. Having said that: The hotel has a taxi ramp and the taxi drivers know it easily. There is a lift that goes to the lobby directly, but you have to read the signs and ask.We showed up 11am but we could not check in till 2 pm. The receptionist tried to convince me to pay more to get an upgrade as the upgraded room was available right away, I thought that was cheeky. They don't have luggage storage facility se we just left bags in the lobby. our room was on level 19, we had a nice high view of the city. We had breakfast on level 25, and the open buffet was as expected.

We stayed 3 nights here during a short stay in Tokyo.The location is excellent - you are in the heart of Shibuya and close the the metro and JR lines. It can be a bit tricky to find but there is a forum here on Trip Advisor that gives instruction.Our hotel room had views across the city and down onto the famous Shibuya crossing. It was breathtaking.The room was a very decent size (for Tokyo standards!) and was well equipped with toiletries, phone cables and international power plugs. There are also vending machines on each level. You can hear the noise from the street but it wasn't enough to disturb or be an inconvenience - after all, it's Tokyo so you have to be prepared for some hustle and bustle.I wouldn't hesitate in returning to stay here, and would recommend it to all visitors to Tokyo.

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights and found the location to be most central to everything, as the Shibuya train station is connected to the hotel and from there Tokyo is at your doorstep. If you not speak any Japanese you may prefer to go to a western chain hotel, though with our limited knowledge of the language, coupled with English speaking guest service staff it was not a problem.Rooms are small by American standards, however we did not go to Japan to stay indoors so it was good for us. Though the rooms are a bit dated - the rug could be changed or perhaps deep cleaned. The room, bed and linens were all clean and comfortable. Amenities include hot water for tea, ice bucket, mini- refrigerator, free wi-fi connection along with a host of chargers for various smartphones in case you forgot yours. There were terry in room slippers as well as plastic ones to slip on to use either in room or to go down the hall. Ice and vending machines which included beer, soda and water - were not marked up more than 100 yen from convenience store. Bathroom amenities include a Toto toilet w/ bidet, shavers, Q-tips, cotton pads for make up removal, tooth brushes, folding hair brush, soaps, shower cap,hair dryer and a retractable clothes line.Our room package came with breakfast, which was a choice between western or traditional Japanese menus. We tried each and enjoyed both, but ended up eating more often at the western restaurant as I like yogurt, fruit, and granola. There were the standard options of scrambled eggs, meats, mini pancakes, green salad, spaghetti - that one made me laugh, potatoes, a variety of danishes/breads, juice, milk and coffee. Really who could ask for more than that! It rained one day we were there and they offered complimentary umbrellas at the desk.Centrally located to the major train station, JR line across the street, a Starbucks - if you must, and a currency exchange kiosk. Do note, the latter charges approximately a 10% commission. Bring an ATV card, as you may never find an actual bank with currency exchange. I searched and searched but...nada.Everything you can ask for is right there within walking distance. Be sure to check out "Tokyu" store/market which is accessible from the Shibuya train station. Wish we had found it the first day. The selections there are fresh, and worthy of any sit down restaurant you would dine at. The last day we were there our flight was not until 8:00P. The front desk arranged for our pick up by the Limo Bus and stored our luggage, and then took it to the Limo Bus for us. We would like to thank Mr. Hihara, Mr.Saito and Ms. Takana for their exceptional service to us during our stay. Mahalo!

Right in the centre of Shibuya (looking down on the famous busy pedestrian crossing) this hotel scores highly for location and the fabulous views from its high rise dining rooms.It's right next to a mainline train station and subway so it's easy to explore the city by public transport.The bedrooms are clean but relatively basic. The hotel can book you seats on a coach to take you the hour journey to the airport which is handy as it picks up right outside the front door.

This place literally stands on top of the shibuya crossing . You have an amazing view from the higher floors. Beds are big and comfortable and there's a nespresso machine and tea making facilities in the rooms. The breakfast is a bit on the steep side price wise, but there's a zillion other places to go right outside the door so no worries.Subway station and shopping center under the hotel and loads of restaurants and shops in all directions around. I will definitely come back here next time I'm in Tokyo.

Good hotel for a couple of nights overlooking the very busy and popular Shibuya crossing. Great location for shopping, eating and close to the Yoyogi Park and Shinto Temple. Rooms good size for Japan. High level rooms overlooking the crossing have outstanding views. For the price ($AUS400+ per night) however front desk was businesslike and lacked warmth. Rooms were on different floors and was upsold to get both on the same floor. Observed another guest being advised that housekeeping was finished for the day - around 5pm - and he would have to pay a fee to get double bed split into twin. Room stocks seemed mean - one towel per occupant - and had to search all drawers to find bathrobe. It served our purpose to experience this interesting part of Tokyo for a couple of nights but next time would seek a less expensive option.
user_name:
RMWZZ
City of Greater Geelong, Australia

review_body: this is one of the three hotels we stayed at during our vacation and it was the best! connected to train station, shuttle bus for the airport right in front of the hotel, supermarket across the street and great view. definitely will stay here again.

We visited Tokyo twice in late 2015, and stayed at the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu both times. Why? (1) The hotel is centrally located with the main Shibuya station just at its doorstep - that means you can travel any part of Tokyo or even out of Tokyo with ease. (2) The Airport Limousine has a designated stop at the hotel - a smooth seamless ride from Narita or Haneda airports to Shibuya Excel Hotel or vice versa. (3) Fantastic views - This hotel offers you the best view of Shibuya Crossing from their glass panelled lifts and lift lobbies. You can even view the skyline of Tokyo from your hotel room. (4) Service is impeccable - I would say that their concierge counter is one of the most efficient I've come across. (5) Perfect location - Tons of restaurants and shopping places to visit and explore.The room is small - it's the standard in Tokyo. Housekeeping maintains the room well, neat and clean with ample toiletries. The restaurants (either Japanese or French-Western) serving breakfast at the top floor of the hotel offer good views of Tokyo. Given a choice, do not opt for the breakfast option. The spread is limited and is not worth the price. You can just go for a Starbucks breakfast located within the same building or a nice pastry cafe (I forgot the name) next to the entrance/exit of the Tokyo Metro. Check-in and check-out times are fixed. No early check-ins, no late check-outs - no matter how big a suite you booked. You will be treated like all guests, no exceptions. Earliest check-in time is fixed at 2pm or later. So be prepared to queue like all guests. All guests must check-out by 11am, unless you are a "Comfort Member", you get to check-out latest at noon.Will there be a third stay at the hotel? But of course !

Great location, right on top of Shibuya station. Western breakfast is questionable but food options in the district are great. I use for business but ideal for a short break also. Fly in to Haneda - taxi ride is affordable vs the longer trip from Narita.

Take a room on a high floor for the best views. I think rooms on the corner face the Shibuya crossing. Brilliant hotel. Fantastic location for restaurants, bars and subway. There is a bar in the hotel which is quite expensive but there are lots of alternative places to eat and drink close by. It's a good choice if you are traveling alone and on business. I got the best nights sleep in this hotel.

Quite a nice hotel, not the most modern or exclusive but you really get what you pay for here. It's clean and service is very good. Breakfast is loaded and very good with a view that is breathtakeing. Water filled up our bathroom floor the first day, but after reporting it, it was fixed when we got back to the room. No complaints otherwise. Great but very busy location, if you can't handle that maybe look for something else.

The Excel hotel has the best view of Shibuya crossing. The view from reception and the elevators can't be beaten. Rooms are nice, clean, and with everything you need. I would definitely stay there again.

Stayed 2 nights Standard Quad sharing room with 4 single beds for my family of 2 adults with 2 teenagers. Room is very spacious with separate bathroom and toilet. Many power point as well. The down sides are that the room is quite dated, lights not bright enough and the cable channels are limited. Very few English and international language channels.Connected to Mark City Mall with many choices for dining. Easily accessible by subway as well as airport bus.Within walking distance to many shopping malls and shops in Shibuya. We even tried to walk back from Shinjuku -> Harajuku -> Shibuya. Long distance of walking but we get to see the quiet neighbourhood without feeling the rush. Shibuya area is usually pack with people.As there are so many choices for dining in the surrounding areas, we did not try to dine at the hotel premise.As we stayed through the weekend before Christmas, the rate we paid was rather steep. But we will still consider to stay at this hotel again for the location.

Right in the middle of Shibuya crossing. Recommended if you plan to explore Tokyo the whole day. Lots of restaurants in the side. Izikayas and yakinikus in the side street. Another area is Shinjuku since all the major intersections are there

We got the limousine bus from Narita, it dropped us right at the lobby on the 5th floor. A great start. The lobby is on the 5th floor in the Mark city shopping centre. reviews have said it is not easy to find, it is very easy, Just get out at Shibuya crossing from any exit from the subway and look for Mark city, it is one of the biggest buildings right at the crossing. Just take the lift in the entrance to the 5th floor lobby. Very easy. Rooms were big enough, clean, good free internet and a great view over the crossing. We flew out from Haneda, the bus left right from the lobby to that airport as well. Would very happily stay there again next time i am in Japan.

Location location location. This hotel is located within walking distance of fantastic shopping, restaurants and Shibuya Station.The rooms were nice. The beds were comfortable. Breakfast was delicious and the views from the restaurant cannot be beat.

The excel hotels offer great value. The rooms are good. Small, yeah but its Tokyo. But in terms of comfort I cannot fault them. Beds were great, and in my opinion, thats the most important thing in a hotel room. The bathroom was very clean, and of course the japanese heated toilets are the best. If you are looking for a hotel in a great spot which is very comfortable, modern interiors and clean then this place should be on your list.

Directly connected to Shibuya JR and Metro station. Not only this, direct bus from Narita and also Haneda. What can you ask for more? It is great for both business and leisure. Right on top of the most famous Shibuya Crossing. Shopping and Dinning places all around you. Well, OKOK, I know I may be biased, travelers to Tokyo are like this. When you get used to Shinjuku, you will not go to Ikebukuro. When you get used to Ikebukuro, you will not go to Shibuya. When you get used to Shibuya, you will not go to Shinjuku. So, it is really a matter of choice, which area you like best?

This hotel is located at the shibuya shopping districts. There are lots of eateries nearby thus finding food is not a problem. There is also a subway station under the hotel so travelling long distances is pretty convenient. The hotel room was pretty okay (although mine was pretty small).

We usually stay in Shinjuku but decided to try Shibuya this time. The hotel was conveniently located above the Shibuya station and its many lines, and a stones throw away from the famous Shibuya crossing and all it had to offer. Lots of shopping and eating within a 10-min radius including Ichiran Ramen, McDonald's, Midori Sushi etc. My teenager loved being here, as it meant she could easily hop out to shop while the rest of us rested in the hotel. We stayed in a quad room, which was really well sized for us, with 4 beds.A rather unpublicized fact is that the hotel has a self-service laundry on certain floors, which was really convenient for me. Highly recommended!

Besides being a very well run and maintained hotel, this hotel is right in the heart of Shibuya. You can literally be in your room within 5 minutes from the time you get off the Yamanote line (take the Tamagawa exit). Rooms are hot or miss. Most of the time we get a decent sized room, but last time we got a tiny room where our luggage barely fit. But it has definitely become our base hotel for any business in Tokyo.

Would definitely stay here again for my next Tokyo visit. Food was great (you can choose between japanese and western breakfasts), rooms were great and there was good sound-insulation in our room. Directly adjoining Shibuya crossing and next to convenient railway/metro lines.

This is a hotel situated in a business area of Tokyo. You'll see lots of nicely dressed people in the hotel as well as the Shibuya train station located below the hotel. It's really convenient to go down by a couple of levels from the lobby (5th floor) to buy things in the massive shopping center, or to catch a train from the station below that.
