One thing that was sort of hard for us to figure out was the lighting system in the room! You must place the room card key in the slot by the door to turn on the lights and AC in the room. Then you go to the "control" which is sitting on the table between the beds. This will allow you to switch the lights on and off (see picture).

I was recommended this hotel by my Japanese client and was very satisfied with it. The best possible location in Tokyo, with a view to the Shibuya crossing. Although it is located in a very busy area of Tokyo, you hear nothing from the bedrooms. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and the price is good for such a great location, especially for Tokyo.Breakfast was not included and was quite pricy, but there is a Starbucks right next door so that's where I would get my breakfast. Wifi works really well too.

I was very impressed with our stay at this hotel. It is literally connected to the Shibuya train station which makes it ultra convenient. It's in the equivalent of New York Time's Square and it's bar overlooks the famous Shibuya Crossing. Vibrant, busy area with tons to do. Rooms were very nice, more spacious than others on our trip. Bathroom was also a decent size, very clean and was well stocked. I am VERY happy we stayed here! Staff also spoke English which was helpful.

Before going to the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyo, I read many reviews on this site. Lots of the reviewers had mentioned how difficult it was to find the hotel.I was meeting someone there, so I planned to get to Shibuya station, where the hotel is located, a half hour early, to be sure that I had enough time to find the hotel.Wrong! The hotel is very, very easy to find. Maybe after those reviews were put onto the TripAdvisor site, the hotel changed the signs in the train station.The hotel is located in Shibuya Mark City, which is a new part of Shibuya train station. There are lots and lots of signs in Japanese and in English directing you to Mark City, and when you get somewhat close to it, lots and lots of signs in Japanese and in English indicating where to go to get to the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyo.No problem. Don’t be put off by those reviewers’ comments.

Shibuya Excel Hotel is located right smack in the middle of the trendy Shibuya district. It is conveniently connected by the Tokyo trains as Shibuya station is just outside the hotel. Highly recommended for business traveller who needs to travel around Tokyo by rail. Room is small but comfortable and dining and after work entertainment is aplenty around the hotel. The Narita airport shuttle makes hourly trip to the hotel although flying in via Haneda airport is a better choice as it is much nearer.Another interesting thing to do, please do not forget to have your photo taken with HACHIKO who is just outside the Shibuya station.

As other reviews have said, the location is perfect. It sits ontop of the shibuya station that enables you to go anywhere in Japan really via transfers. Its also a stones throw away from hachiko crossing which is cool to watch the crossing from some of the rooms and the elevators. And virtually ontop of a supermarket so you can stock up.Shibuya station isnt the labrynth that shinjuku station is. Its much easier not just to get around but also to find the right exit. I always exited at hachiko exit which isnt the closest exit to the hotel, its about a 2 minute walk to the hotel but it was always fun just to be in that crossing area with all that energy)The only downside to being in the middle of the action is that youre in the middle of the action. My first night i thought that the next door room was playing their tv loud but it was in fact outside. I was on one of the top floors but even then the noise was still intrusive until 12am when they must shut all the music etc off. Also japanese emergency vehicles must play their sirens at all hours because I was awoken the first night in the early hours of the morning by the sirens.But then thats the price you pay for being in the middle of the action and being central. I dont know why they havent invested more in soundproofing the rooms, but for me it was too darn loud.Not loud enough to not want to go there again. But i think I would see if there was a wing of the hotel that was quieter.Oh and there was an average western buffet that was ok. Not something I would want to eat 7 days on the go but certainly good enough to fill your stomach for a days sightseeing.

Room is quite small, business hotel feeling, no drinking water, no body lotion, nothing else etc. The bottom line, if the best location is what you want and do not expect anything else!! This place is it. You can go direct from hotel in several floors to the Metro, JR and shopping malls. Shibuya is the station that you can enjoy shopping and eating until very late at night. Good station to stay.

Stayed for 8 nights in total in 2 different room types. Overall, we enjoyed the stay.Location - excellent, its easy access to the metro and JR and no worries about rain.Service - Not too consistent, as the staff who did our first check-in was not too keen to help, but still acceptable service. Our main concern was Concierge, as they did not seem to record down or manage the luggage well. We had 4 pieces but they were not able to locate the other 2 and brought out to ask if the pieces belong to us (which did not belong to us). Room Amenities - Safe deposit box not available in all rooms. But I think it's pretty essential. Hopefully this can be made available to all rooms.Room - Clean and comfy

Stayed three nights during my family trip in Tokyo. The hotel can be reached directly from Haneda airport by airport limousine bus. The family room we'd booked is very ideal for my family and quite spacious with four single beds and a dining table. The bathroom is spacious with separate WC equipped with good toiletries ammenities. What we liked very much of this hotel is the location. Shibuya station and the famous Hachiko statue are 'under' the hotel. The famous Shibuya scramble crossing can be seen throughout the windows of hotel corridor. Many restaurants and shops around. I highly recommend this hotel and would like to stay again when I visit Tokyo

My 2nd stay at this hotel during business trip to Tokyo and again very satisfied with all aspects. Very good location directly opposite Shibuya station, smallish room (expected in Tokyo) but spotlessly clean and very comfortable bed, didn't use the restaurant, but centrally located in Shibuya close to many restaurants, cafes, shops etc! Limousine bus service from Narita airport stops at this hotel which is a real convenience after a long flight.Will definitely stay again next November!

The hotel is in such a great location- right next to the train station so easy to find.The views from the restaurant for breakfast are amazing.We stayed in a twin room and it was a good size for Tokyo - the bathroom was very small but overall OK.From the hotel Windows by the lifts you can watch the shibuya crossing and all its craziness! I was surprised that we could not hear noise in the room from outside given that we were in the middle of bright lights and traffic.The hotel was clean and has a nice feel- nicer than I expected for the price and it is on the doorstep of the bustling city which I found to be so convenient.Staff were pleasant and helpful. WIFI was free and good connection. For me the location was perfect next to trains in Yamnote line- just 1 stop to Harajuku.I would def stay here again- I had tried to book in for when we returned to Tokyo but it was booked out!

The ride from the Haneda Airport to this hotel by bus only took about 1 hour. The location of this hotel is awesome. As reported by many trippers, everything is true. The Shibuya crossing can be seen from the lift lobby, the hotel is surrounded by eateries, restaurants & malls. There's so much to see & do just around the hotel. The Shibuya Station is within walking distance, and there's so many restaurants in the floors below the hotel. The lobby of the hotel is on level 5. You get to choose between the Japanese or International breakfasts, which were both good. I prefer the Japanese though. Our room was not tiny like most hotel rooms in Tokyo, we ordered a twin sharing & we even had a sofa which was great. The toilet was separated from the shower which was good. We had dinner in the Japanese Restaurant & the food was excellent. I'll definitely stay in this hotel again.

Great location in the center of the city in Shibuya. Close to shops and restaurants and easy to commute from to business meetings or shoppings.Rooms are big and convenient.The breakfast is great and you can enjoy Japanese buffet or western buffet. The hotel provides free internet in the room and lobby.

Used to stay here since 2005 while in Tokyo. JR and multiple metro lines converge here. The hotel is located in Mark Sq connected to the train stations. Loads of eateries, shops etc within or outside the complex and some of them operate almost round the clock.

I'm an American and this was my first time visiting Tokyo. This hotel was the best location. With the Shibuya train station connected to the hotel, it made it the perfect way to get around especially when it was raining and we wanted to get right on the train. The hotel was clean and nice and while the bed was a bit firm, it was still very comfortable. Great bathroom with lots of amenities (shampoo, body wash, conditioner, tooth brushes, etc...). Great view with buffet breakfast for additional charge. The room was quiet and air purifier helped block out any outside noise. Elevator and most rooms have great views of Shibuya crossing. The only areas for improvement: 1. A concierge that speaks English. It was pretty difficult to communicate with the staff; especially when at one point I needed a doctor. It would have been nice if there was someone more fluent in English to assist with certain day to day needs. 2. A pool or gym. 3. The restaurant and breakfast are overpriced. You are better off leaving in most instances for any food you might need. 4. No english speaking TV channels - not that this is a make or break as you rarely watch TV on vacation but it would have been nice to have one channel to watch. If this is your first visit to Tokyo, there is no better location. I highly recommend this hotel.

Your standard 4 star hotel...pluses?lovely amenities, smack bang central location…comfortable beds and a view of the Shibuya Crossing if you are lucky. If not, walk across to the Starbucks and have a stunning view from there.Front desk aren't very warm or welcoming, then again this is central Tokyo and they hardly had a second to breathe!

We stayed for one night in this hotel on our last night in Japan. The location is perfect and our corner room had a stunning view over the famous crossing. Ask for a crossing view room preferably a corner room. The room was spacious with a small bathroom. The view across the skyline of Tokyo from the room was amazing too and the view from the top floor breakfast room is even better. The breakfast was fine - the western and japanese breakfast rooms are separate - and the western one opens half an hour earlier at 6:30am ( we had a morning flight back). The Shibuyu area is great for a stroll around and as it was the night before Halloween the streets were thronged with people dressed up in amazing costumes.

Stayed at Excel for a week. Perfect location at Shibuya crossing and all the restaurants, shops and connections in walking distance. Rooms OK however somewhat old style and interior. Good service and cleanliness, bathrooms updated. Restaurants and breakfast deserves 5 stars. Good start of the day with breakfast on 25th floor with a good view on Tokyo. I had a room in the end of the corridor and by that some problems with the internet connection, irritating.

Disappointing check-in procedure. We are in a group of 10 and have booked and paid our rooms online. However, I have no idea why it took us like half an hour to check-in! Even if some of our guys have already checked in previously. The hotel cards are not working well. For once we are being locked up in our room and we are waiting for such a long time to wait for the staff to come up even though we are in a hurry. Having said this, one of the staff called THAKURI is very nice as he/she helped us to keep our parcels there.

Stayed here for 7D6N. The hotel is strategically located in Shibuya. In fact, the famous Shibuya Crossing can be seen from the lift lobby. Hotel is also connected to Shibuya Mark City; with lots of eateries and a train station. Surrounding the hotel there are also lots of attractions within walking distance e.g. Shibuya 109, Disney Store, Loft, Muji, Zara, Uniqlo, H&M, Forever21 etc. Lots of vending machines and authentic Japanese restaurants too. Definitely a hotel located in a prime position. Room is also very very clean. Although the bed was a bit sunken.

I felt like I was in a "1970s idea of the future hotel". Can't complain, simple, basic, very clear. No windows open but air con' quiet and worked well. Great WiFi. Amazing views, I was near the top. In 2008 when I stayed ( I don't know why Tripadvisor date drop down menu does not go back considering people must sign up daily??) the Miyagi earthquake hit as I was actually looking out of my room window. The entire building, and all the high rise buildings around, swayed like tall blades of grass. Nice to know the design team were on point the day the did the plans.! Great area, masses of stuff to do right outside hotel. I'd advise going to the fisherman's market, you need to get up early and don't try to close a taxi drivers door.! You'll see why. Loads of couples at this hotel and as expected the staff are unbelievably professional and polite, as are all of the Japanese people I met and worked with. I would recommend this hotel, it's not top 4 star but fine for a short city break

Location couldn't be more convienent. Right at the Shibuya station- you technically don't even need to leave the subway station to get there. It's above the Mark City building. A bit confusing to find the entrance at first but you can get to it from the 1st, 2nd or 5th floor of that building. Rooms were decent size and could be considered spacious for Tokyo. Staff all spoke English and were really nice. Best part was the awesome choice of breakfast- Western or Japanese in different restaurants. The restaurants are on the 25th floor with a beautiful expansive view of Tokyo. Western breakfast is an extensive breakfast buffet. Japanese breakfast was plentiful, beautifully presented of course, and also delicious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a mid level hotel.

Hotel is located in the middle of Shibuya, everything is close so you do not have to walk too far. Easy access to the trains and rails as well! Rooms are big, spacious and clean. Hotel is a little inflexible with early checkin/late checkout but that's absolutely fine with me. Their front desk really impressed me during my last trip in September. My parcel was rejected by the hotel as the name was incorrectly written however, they managed to get the parcel back for me even though it was already late in the evening and the postman probably left the area. I do not know how they do it but that certainly helped me as I was checking out the next day. This is definitely my top choice whenever i head over to Tokyo!

In my opinion, this is the best location to stay at in Tokyo for the following reasons:1) If you're coming from Haneda airport, there is a shuttle bus that drops off right at the hotel.2) The hotel is on top of Mark City shopping center, with many good restaurants including Umegoaka No Midori sushi place (pls see my other review on it).3) The hotel is right in the middle of Shibuya, one of the prime entertainment & shopping districts of Tokyo. We could see the famous pedestrian crossing from our room. The Hachiko dog memorial is in front of the hotel.4) Easy access to the subway network with Shibuya station downstairs. The Odakyu station to Mt. Fuji and Hakone area is nearby too. In terms of price, its relatively midrange compared to other Tokyo hotels so the its quite good value. Rooms are

Everything about this hotel is PERFECT! I only have good words. The location is perfect, just a few floors down is the most famous crossing in the world- Shibuya crossing! The Metro is also in the building. All the shops and restaurants you need are in Shibuya! Our room was very spacious unlike other hotels in Japan. The Nespresso machine is a big plus! I loved my bed! It was very comfortable and big!The airport express shuttle stops here so no need to ride the train anymore to and from the airport.I will definitely come back to Tokyo and will stay here again.

Hotel was centered in Shibuya. Easy access to trains and rails. Front desk has people that speak fluent english and were handy with maps, descriptions and food options that were in the surrounding areas. A western style bathroom and shower (US). I would definitely stay here again. No complaints whatsoever.

This place is fabulous!Just right. Clean, very spacious. Coffee machine in the room and fully equipped. Excellent service. In the middle of everything! Right in the middle of shibuya!If you get a room in the higher floors you'll have an amaaaazing view. I loved this place. So did my kids. And my friend who used to work and live in japan for years.. It's close to everything. Easy access. Perfect location, sits on top of shibuya subway station. Rooms are great. Only thing negative maybe that the breakfast is a bit expensive.. But there are a million places to go to right outside the door so no problem.I will come back. Already booked for next summer :-)

This hotel has one of the most convenient locations possible in Shibuya. It's right at the Shibuya station. Great restaurants, shopping, and transportation are all within 2-10 minutes of the hotel. The rooms are small as expected in downtown Tokyo but clean and had everything needed. The western style buffet breakfast was just OK. The menu doesn't change so after a day or two the breakfast is boring and not that great. Breakfast was a disappointment. This is the second time I have stayed here and I remember thinking the same thing last time. Boring breakfast if your here for more than one or two nights. I tried the Japanese breakfast option and it was very good but very traditional. I would prefer if they combined the two options and had one breakfast with both Western and Japanese options. If you want to be in the middle of the excitement of Shibuya and right on top of Shibuya crossing, you can't beat this hotel!

The hotel is close to train station, next to department stores, shopping outlets and fast food outlets, convenience stores so it is very convenience.The bell boy was never to be seen in the hotel entrance (where the airport bus and taxi stops) so expect to carry your own luggages. There aren't any complimentary bottle water in the room so we went to ask at the reception and the reply was to drink tap water. I know that the tap water is drinkable in Japan but I travel to Japan 1-2 times a year for the past ten years and have never seen a hotel charging over USD150 per night without bottle water. The carpet was very dirty; something fall next to the bed, I picked it up and there were dust all over my hand. We dropped a plastic bag from the convenience store on the floor under the table and it was there for 3 days. There were also dust all over the lights including the standing light. The majority of the hotel staff process poor English and the level of service was very poor. The night shift staff can be describe as rude. One even starting chatting to another guest (the guest was already served by 2nd staff) and abundant us at the reception area while serving us. We were making reservation for the airport bus and our booking was missing on the day of departure. Luckily, there were other passengers selecting that time slot so it stopped in our hotel. Considering the price they charge per night, there are many options available in Tokyo since the JR is very convenience. Seriously, even the hostels in Japan can do better than that.

We have been there for business and found the location is super convenient, just opposite of the train station. It's in the middle of Shibuya district and so we found plenty of choices for dinners and a bit of nightlife. Professional staffs, not super friendly but very attentive. Rooms are clean, but obviously not too spacious. For smokers a minus would be that no smoking rooms are available, but you'll find a small 1 man smoking cabin on 6 floor. Distance by taxi to Haneda about 45 min, to Narita by bus about 90 min.

Initially I had concerns about finding this hotel (as I had read reviews that said it was tricky to find). Not true and no problem, go door to door from Airport to Hotel if you do the following.At Narita, I booked the Airport Limousine bus (directly opposite exit from Arrivals) and this will take you (after one other hotel stop) directly to the hotel's (street) entrance. This is at the 'Shibuya Mark City' stop and the bus stops at the Airport bus stop outside the hotel, where you wheel your luggage along a short distance to the entrance to the hotel where down the hallway is the hotel reception.I arrived early, so my luggage was stored for me while I went exploring.I scored room 2208 (on Floor 22) and it had the most expansive city view of Tokyo, it was fabulous. It was a single room but the bed was more of a small double and it was very comfortable. The room was spacious enough for one person, it had a desk, chair, relaxing chair with foot stool (to enjoy the view), a spare cushion stool, dressing table with wing mirrors, a variety of (phone) chargers, notepad & pen, fridge, ice bucket, (ice was available from a particular floor which I forget), water cooker (which keeps the water hot), wine and tumbler glasses, mug and cup, pyjamas/kimono, bathrobe, disposable and real slippers, excellent range of toiletries, fluffy towels, bath, hairdryer and a coffee maker.The staff were extremely helpful and made an appointment for me to visit an English speaking doctor and get medical treatment (on a Sunday). They ensured I had a printout of the address, arranged a taxi for me and spoke to the taxi driver. I am extremely grateful for this service.I did not eat at the restaurants but this hotel is in a shopping mall with lots of eating options. The "Food Show" food court on (basement) floor B1 in the Tokyu Shopping mall next door has the most extensive array of take away foods available, catering for every single taste; fresh and beautifully presented. It also has an International wine, beer and spirits shop there. The fresh dumplings there were cheap and delish. Just wished I'd discovered it earlier than my last day. There are nearby 'Family Marts' for mineral water or other essentials.Only glitch at this hotel was the lack of WIFI connectivity for this room, my mobile connected no problem but my laptop wouldn't at all and after going down to reception (where the laptop immediately connected, proving it was not an issue with the laptop). I was supplied with a modem to plug into the room locally and then it was all fine. A staff member did come up to the room the previous night with the modem but he did not plug it in and he just advised me to disconnect my mobile and then he said my laptop would connect up (which it didn't). I think he didn't know about plugging the modem into the room.A one day pass for unlimited subway travel is available for 650 Yen, this can be purchased from the Shibuya Station Ticket office. The trains show and announce station stops in English also. Subway maps are available from both hotel and ticket office. The lobby has English info on Shibuya and Tokyo. Often there will be English signage for Tourist information and subway exits.Japanese people are extremely helpful and will always make an effort to help even when they do not speak English. It was my first visit to Japan and I loved it, so recommend this hotel for its central location, helpful staff and accessibility.

This location cannot be beat. Can see Shibuya Crossing from hotel floor window. Across the street from the Crossing and the subway station. Rooms and bathroom seemed large for a Japanese hotel. There are separate rooms for the toilet and the bath/shower. Front desk was helpful and stored our luggage happily. (The gentleman at the front desk however never heard of Shibuya honey toast so we had to get recommendations from the department store next door.)

I stayed here for a night - it's a fantastic location - right in the heart of Shibuya and Shibuya crossing .. The only challenge is finding the place .. It took us a while before we could find it ... The rooms are tiny but clean and good for a short term stay in Tokyo.The place is buzzing with all sushi bars and shops .. Great shopping here ..The hotel offers free wifi and it's quite reasonable in price too It's definitely advisable to book earlier to get good rates and rooms ..the View from the 21st floor was "Tokyo sky scrapers".. Shibuya definitely represents Tokyo The place

This was our first trip to Tokyo and we chose the Excel Hotel Tokyu in Shibuya because of the access to the subway and JR lines. The location was perfect! We had no troubles finding the hotel from the Narita Xpress train. We had convenient access to the subway to tour around the city. The hotel sits atop the Mark City shopping center, which has good shops and restaurants. Also connected to the Tokyu Department store and the excellent Food Show food court in the basement. The connection was especially helpful as we had significant rainfall for 4 days during our visit. All around the hotel is great shopping and restaurants. We stayed on the 17th floor and our room was very clean. Definitely small, but what we expected for Tokyo. We didn't have any issues with noise. We could see the Shibuya Scramble from the elevators, but had to crane our necks to see it from our hotel room. Still had great views of the area. The bathroom was well stocked with toiletries, including large bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body wash directly in the shower. Bidet toilet. Wifi worked great. Air conditioning worked great also. Overall, we were very happy with our stay.

The hotel is not easy to find as the main entrance is inside the shopping centre next to the Shibuya station. It took me some time to find it. Other than that, the room is good and clean, the staff are friendly. There is airport express right at the lobby floor of the hotel which I found out after check-in, took it when we left the hotel to airport.

Hotel is within the Shibuya station area. You can easily travel because the location is very good. Stayed at 22nd floor, it was clean and comfortable. Western people might find the room a bit small, but it's okay. You can see the Shibuya scramble when you use the elevators.And the TOILETRIES! This is the first hotel I've been to that has large bottles of body wash, shampoo and conditioner. They also provide a foaming face and hand soap. Very nice! Females would love these.During my last day, I was awoken by the shaking of the room. Earthquake lol but it wasn't alarming as earthquakes are common in Japan.

We stayed here for 3 nights. We took the airport limo bus from Haneda airport to hotel since we had luggage. They drop you in the back of the hotel but you walk only a few steps. Hotel itself is very nice and staff speaks good English. Hotel had it's own restaurants but we did not eat there. There is a food mall in the same building with wide variety of choice - if you are not vegeterian. Vegeterians will be stuck with limited choice - unless you are ok eating pasta and burger in Japan! Outside there are many small eateries - including one KFC. Best thing about this hotel is its location - both JR train and Tokyo subway is right in the building. With JR pass in your hand, it is extremely convenient. It is also not a very big station. Just make sure you always look for "yellow notice boards" on platform to get your location and direction. Those are VERY helpful. The hotel also gives great views of Shibuya crossing and we saw that famous scene many many times! Rooms are a bit small - as are in Japan everywhere - if you are tall but if you have asian type height, you will manage.

Rooms were okay but hallway carpet very dirtyVery busy hotel over railway station, found it difficult to get from station to hotel probally took three days to find our bearings then it was time to leave. Not a hotel or area for children.

I normally stay at Shinjuku, but this time I'm glad I chose Shibuya Excel Hotel. Our room on 21st floor was spacious, clean with view and price is better than Shinjuku. Breakfast buffet is good, but there are plenty of restaurants nearby. There is a 24hr Japanese restaurant on the right corner. 0101 mall, Shinbuya 101, Zara, etc across the street. Next to train station and bus stop 100yen takes you to Shinjuku. Checkin is on the 5th floor, no gym or fitness room but we jog around the hotel no problem.

If you ever go to Tokyo and stay in Shibuya as a hub, this is the best location hotel since its situated on top of a few JR lines and metro train junciton (Shibuya is a big hub); you are in the heart of shopping heaven. Also for night spots and also late dining nite life is all nearby. If you dont mind to walk South along the track side path (where a lot of new trendy restaurants are set up), 15 minute walk already in the nice affluent neighbourhood of Daikkan-yama (boutigues, cafes) and also the biggest book shop in 3 archittectural tasteful bldg in park setting). Shibuya itself also just 3 stops take you to Harajuku (Yoyogi-park) for street fashion stores ; before you know it you are in Omotesando . All nice neighbourhoods.To add to this Hotel's superior location, There are airport direct limousine bus lines to/from Narita and Haneda Airport directly to the 5th floor lobby (which is a bus stop right outside of hotel lobby)

This hotel was just fine - the room was clean and comfortable (albeit relatively small by some standards, but I understand that that is normal for Tokyo). It is really well-located for exploring Tokyo and the staff were very helpful.

stay there from time to time. one of the best location connecting to Shibuya station facing the famous shibuya scramble crossing. Never had troubles finding food around it. it is not really cheap rate considering the room is very simple and no fitness center facility. but if you plan to go out whole day enjoying tokyo, this would be the perfect location. they have a packege for media to use their banquet room for the interview with supporting service.

check in swiftly to get going in the big city with good room size and comfortable mattress. Large selection of breakfast buffet on the 25th floor tasty coffee. Bathroom has more than enough utensils that you might have forgotten at home.

This hotel is right above the train station - good location close to shops and a millions places to eat. There's about 3 cat cafes within 5 minutes walk and The Hachiko statue is pretty close by too. There's good amenities - restaurants in the hotel are a little pricey - and I can't find the gym the mention on the website. WiFi is free and fast, and they have coin operated laundry facilities near the lift on each floor in case you don't want to use the laundry service. And the vending machines sell booze!

As many other reviewers said, this hotel is inside the same Mark City complex where the Shibuya station is. There is a direct access elevator from the hotel lobby that takes you to the third floor where you can access the station or the first floor which takes you to just within a few steps to the Shibuya crossing. Just for this reason, I would use the hotel again on my next visit. Location accessibility aside, the staff were very accommodating. I had no trouble communications with them in English. I arrived pretty early before the check in time of two pm but was able to leave my bags at the bell desk. Asking for a higher floor gave me an upgrade and the room was quite exceptional for a three star hotel. The bathroom had more toiletries than most hotels I've been in. The room had really good AC and an air purifier as well. Super clean and modern!

Got the triple room and was so happy to see how huge our room was! Each bed has its own charging outlets. Nook where we can have breakfast by the picture window. Location was perfect. Airport limo bus from narita stops right in the hotel. Scenic elevator to view famous shibuya busy intersection. A bit pricey but it pays to be at the center of everything!Space for each of our luggages. Big flat screen tv. Very helpful staff. Needed a sewing kid and it arrived promptly.

Stayed here for 2 nights last weekend and it was a really enjoyable stay. Location is unbeatable, it's right above the Ueno station in the heart of Shibuya. The metro stations are just a stone's throw away, across the road. The room had a 2 super single beds and it was clean and cosy. The view was superb as you can see the infamous shibuya crossing. And at the top floor you can find in view of shibuya's skyline.

This is an incredibly well located hotel. The airport shuttle bus stops (and departs-the hotel sells the tickets) outside the hotel lobby, the hotel has a lift down to a) the Subway (three different lines) and the JR station and b) to the Hachiko statue at ground level and is across the road from the Tokyu Department Store. Within the station area, there are a number of eateries and shops also. In the streets near the vehicle access to the hotel, there are an incredible number of small shops and inexpensive eateries. It's also within easy walking distance to some very upmarket shopping, coffee/tea shops and good eateries. It's also very close to Tokyu Hands. This is a place with quite a buzz even late at night. By Tokyo standards, the rooms are reasonably priced.Please read carefully the descriptions of the room you are intending to book as it is a very accurate description of the room that you are getting, especially the size. The rooms are well maintained, well furnished and have all the things that you are likely to need. When choosing, i was particular to get a room facing "that" crossing- it's not necessary. In this hotel, the lift lobby on all floors look down on the crossing and if you're high enough, the appearance of a disturbed antnest is remarkable. The staff are nice- pleasant and helpful, the rooms are well maintained and contain what you need and the location is very hard to beat (the Tokyu Department Store Food Show is well worth a visit, especially the fruit and delicatessen areas and the pre-cooked food becomes much cheaper in the early evening). Unless you are proposing to stay in the room all the time, this is a good place to stay- it is a comfortable hotel with good service and a very hard to beat location

I wanted to stay in Shibuya and this hotel is in the heart of it all, our room had a view of the famous crossing. We got there by bus direct to our hotel - although bus easy to find and very convenient, watch out for traffic - the trip dragged on for 2 hoursThe hotel was clean, the view from our room was awesome... it's all we really needed... close to everything in shibuya and right on top of the station to take u to the best places in tokyo

I stayed with my family for 5 nights. We took two rooms between the four of us. The rooms were quite small but you can find everything you need, especially liked the amount of shampoo and body wash that they give. Rooms were very clean and even have air purifiers.Location is excellent! Shibuya station is next door and all kinds of shopping is close by.Will definitely come back, two thumbs up.

My Husband & I stayed for 1 week at The Excel Hotel, in wonderful Shibuya. We particularly wanted a room with a view of the famous ' SCRAMBLE CROSSING', hence booked a corner room being 1801, which had magnificent views of the City to the Mountains !!! The room was large with floor to floor windows & had arm chairs & a table to relax or read, a safe for your personal belongings, a fridge & had every amenity you could ask for - great housekeeping & daily Newspapers in both English & Japanese.This Hotel is so central to everything Shibuya offers - shopping is a delight with fashion stores everywhere, Starbucks Coffee is just across the road, The Train Station is actually underneath the Hotel, making for easy access upon arrival & departure, via elevator. I would highly recommend a stay at The Excel Hotel - everything is within an easy stroll & is also great for exploring Tokyo on the Train. You must visit 'The Loft' a wonderful Department Store, which stocks an array of quality items from stationary to clothing & giftware.Plus upon checkout we were able to store our 3 large suitcases at Reception, until we were ready to move on to our next destination in Tokyo.Melissa from Melbourne in Australia

The Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is a genuine 3 star hotel right in the thick of the action at the heart of Shibuya.Our room was quite small but that's not unexpected for Japan and room size wasn't the reason we decided to stayed here. The view out our window was fantastic and straight out over the often photographed Shibuya intersection.The room itself was decorated and equipped to a typical 3 star level with a small sitting area, firm queen/double size bed and a the basic necessities (TV, bar fridge, kettle etc.).The bathroom was also compact with only enough room for one person at a time (again not unexpected) but had everything you need from a shower/tub combo and nice range of amenities to the obligatory electric toilet.The hotel itself sits on top of the Shibuya train station and the hotel lobby lift will take you into the upper levels of the station. This makes it very easy to get around as you can access the Tokyo Metro and the Yamanote Line without even leaving the building.Service was pretty good with staff happy to help arrange a taxi or a late check out.The only complaint we had was that there was a fairly obvious stain on the blanket when we arrived and it took a couple of days before the blanket was changed.Overall the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu represented pretty good value given the location so if you want to be in the heart of Shibuya and don't want to pay too much this hotel is a good option.

We were located next to the Shibuya Crossing. This hotel was in the heart of everything worth seeing and eating. The Shibuya station is located on property and the in room massage was heavenly. Don't forget to visit all the shops at market city located below the hotel. Lots of yummy things to eat and buy to take home for omiyage.

-- Easy to get to as it is serviced directly by the airport shuttle-- Easy to get around as you are just above the Shibuya station-- The best possible view of Shibuya Crossing. Tip: you don't need to pay extra to get a room with a view as the best views are from the lift lobbies. Whether you want to stay high or low is a matter of taste (you cannot access lift lobbies apart from the one of your floor)-- Pricey and rooms are not big but this is Tokyo after all. Clean-- Noise levels are acceptable but this depends on your tolerance

Pure convenience. Above Shibuya station with direct access. Vibrant neighbourhood. Many shops and good restaurants nearby.Good views, far and near, including Shibuya Crossing.Concierge service good, but sometimes have to wait.Buffet breakfast so-so.
user_name:
Advisor10012
New York City, New York

review_body: Hotel is very conveniently located above Shibuya train station which is well connected to the rest of Tokyo. I was pleasantly surprised at how spacious and clean the room was given the reputation of small sized hotels in Japan. Breakfast was a choice between western or Japanese. I didn't try the Japanese breakfast but western food was very tasty. Lacked variety but made up for it in quality. There was no egg station but I requested for an omelettte for my toddler and they kindly obliged. So great service! When coming from the train station, look for the exit heading towards shibuya mark city. Take the escalator to the third floor and you will see the entrance to the hotel. Lobby is on the fifth floor. Great view of shibuya crossing from the lift as well! Oh and the bus stop for the shuttle bus to airport is just outside the hotel so that was very convenient!

Whenever I'm in Tokyo I insist on staying at this hotel. When I need to make reservations, the staff always graciously assists me through email. The desk staff, although overly strict about check-in time, have found me some great restaurants and transportation. WiFi service is easy and reliable. The buses from Narita and Haneda drop you off mere feet from the check-in desk. You can get a Starbucks or a wonderful, affordable sushi meal on the mall levels, or the best cream puffs anywhere at Beard Papa across the street behind the station. But best of all for this hotel is the location - easy indoor access to Shibuya Station and subway lines, wonderful food available at the Tokyo Food Show, and of course those great views of the scramble crosswalk. Get an Excel Corner twin room if you can - they're the best views and very comfortable, spacious rooms. On a clear day, you can see Mt. Fuji from the higher floors. The proximity to the Yamanote line means you can get virtually anywhere from here. This might be my favorite hotel in the world so far. :)

This is beyond doubt on the absolute center of Tokyo. Some might be taken aback with the lack of lavish walk in entrances - but its dead center and millimeters cost money...The restaurants offer a capable variety of cousins - European and Asian alike.

Every time a great place to stay with a lot of bars and restaurants around. The nightlife in Shibuya never stops and if it does the station is right infront to reach other places in Tokyo. Also enjoy the sight from the 25th floor!

Having lived in Tokyo for several years, I personally find Shibuya to be the best place to stay- not as overwhelming as Shinjuku, boring as Ginza, or far out like Asakusa. This hotel is more of a "business hotel" pretty stock standard, and no frills, but even for our last night of honeymoon, I preferred to stay here right smack dab in the middle of the action than at the Park Hyatt with a nicer room. The service, like almost everywhere in Japan, was great- and I love the fact that the hotel is part of the train station, as well as the Airport bus goes directly to and from here! amazing! I will definitely be staying here next time I'm in Tokyo.

This hotel is very convenient for a stay in Tokyo. It is right at Shibuya Station with access to shopping, restaurants and most importantly transportation to all parts of the city. The rooms on the higher floors have better views. We took the breakfast option. It was very convenient, but don't expect too much. The food was average at best. We had both the western and Japanese breakfasts. The Japanese was the better of the two. Otherwise, head out for great local dining options. If you are looking for fun shopping nearby, go to Tokyu Hands and The Loft - both are just a few minutes from the hotel by foot.

Very nice, modern, clean hotel. I really like how central this location is and how easy it is to come and go from this hotel - even with luggage during rush hour. Plus the views are incredible (they have these great little maps in the rooms that tell you which building is which). The restaurant is very nice (and the choice of Japanese or Western breakfast is perfect), as is the lounge. The restaurants in Mark City are also very handy. We were traveling as a family of 5 and had two rooms. The one room we had with a double bed was small (not unlike other rooms in Tokyo), but we found the triple room to be very spacious (not just Tokyo spacious, but generally spacious). Another surprise was how quiet our room was, and how effective the block out curtains were - these are big pluses when staying in Shibuya. :)The hotel was a little tricky to find at first (it was rush hour and we were 5 people with luggage). What we learned was to look for the station exit for 'Shibuya Mark City' (a shopping center). The hotel is part of this complex. The station merges with Mark City and the elevator for the hotel is essentially between the station and the Mark City shopping center, but it is easy to miss. If you have followed the signs to Mark City the elevator for the hotel can be accessed from the same floor as the Metro Station Office. The corridor to the elevator is marked from the sides and there is a floor mat with the name of hotel (I cannot remember if it is marked from above). Anyway, this elevator will take you to the hotel lobby, which is on the 5th floor. If you end up outside the station, it is best to find the Hachiko exit. Marc City is across the street (behind Hachiko's back) - as you cross the street (don't cross the scramble intersection) you will see an outdoor escalator that leads to Mark City. Don't go up this escalator but look for the elevator through the double doors to your left. This elevator is the same one that you can take from the station and (again) on the 5th floor you will find the hotel lobby. As I said, I really liked staying at this hotel. And so did the rest of my family. Everyone was friendly and helpful. It was a great modern hotel in a bustling center, with easy train and subway access to the rest of the city. We will certainly stay there again and will recommend it to friends. (P.S. My kids thought the WiFi was extremely fast)

Room: Bigger than standard Tokyo ones, with a great view of the Shibuya crossing. Nice modern design too.Location: Next to the Shibuya station, with lots of restaurants, shopping malls and shops, convenience stores all around.Very decent pricing. Will definitely stay here again!

This hotel is located directly next to Shibuya station. At first I had a hard time to find the entrance, as there are no big signs on the façade or at the entrance. Luckily, being in the middle of Tokyo I easily found some people that spoke English and could help me. Once I knew where the various entrances, some of them going directly into the big Shibuya station complex are, this turned out to be a very convenient location. No need to go outdoors to catch a train. There are also several restaurants within the train station building.The rooms are not very big but nice and clean. My colleague had a room with a direct view to Shibuya crossing. Also some of the elevators have windows from where you can see the people playing football on the roof of the neighbouring building.The breakfast is quite expensive, but in addition to the good food there is a stunning view over the city from the restaurants, which are located in one of the topmost floors. There are two restaurants, a French one serving European style breakfast and the other one serves Japanese breakfast. I only tried the French one and there the breakfast was very good.The people at the reception do speak English but some of them not very well. For special requests this might be a bit tricky.

The location is really good. You're right on top of the central station and if you come from Narita Airport, the shuttle bus stops right in front of your hotel. We had one of those bigger rooms and even they were on the smaller side, but it's Tokyo. All rooms are tiny in comparison. We had breakfast included and were very impressed. They've got two restaurants. One Western/French one and a Japanese restaurant. Loved the view from the restaurant. Hope to be back one day!

My son and I stayed in this hotel for 13 nights as this was our first time to Japan and wanted to be located in the one place and travel by train from there. We got the Narita Express which took us direct to Shibuya station. Take the central exit - you don't need to go outside for this one or the Hachico exit where you will be outside but Mark City is easy to see. Upon arrival we were checked in quickly and we had upgraded to a corner room with a view of the crossing via the concierge prior to arrival. Even though we were facing the crossing it was inevitable that there was some noise it didn't bother us - we were too exhausted! The hotel was quiet though. The hotel is clean and had a calm relaxed atmosphere. Our room was on the 18th floor and was the first room from the lift, there was no noise from the lift. The room was clean and large with a small seating area, the view of the crossing was fantastic as was the view of Tokyo (you can see Shinjuku from the window and Yyoggi Park). There's a fridge and safe in the room. The staff were excellent whenever we contacted them and their English was great compared to our Japanese. Breakfast was included and was always fresh with exceptional service. Some reviewers complained about the variety of food - I'm not sure what people eat at home but we were more than happy with the breakfast. There is a washing machine and dryer on the 8th and 10th floors which are in with the vending machine - they aren't big but at least they are there. Overall we had a fantastic stay in this hotel made better by its location, sleep quality, cleanliness and helpful staff. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to families, couples or single travellers.

I traveled to Tokyo with a group of 5 friends total and we wanted to share a room to save money so we could spend it on other activities. We were a bit weary about squeezing 5 people in a room, since last time I went to Japan, the room I stayed in was quite tiny (granted there were only two of us then, so we didn't need much space), but we found on Orbitz that this hotel offers a room that would accommodate 5 guests (2 double beds, and a pull out sofa bed). When we checked in, the lady at the front desk said this room does not exist. We knew it was too good to be true. However, they put us in a room 4 four beds, and a living/dining area. The beds were slightly bigger than a twin size, but not quite a full size. There was a shower, tub and sink that was separated from another bathroom with just a toilet and sink, so both could be used at the same time. So convenient for our large group! The concierge/front desk was very helpful with making reservations for us. You can go downstairs and grab fresh snacks/food from the market, or walk down busy streets to find something. Conveniently located near the Shibuya crossing and Shibuya station. Free wifi and great location!

Agree the location is amazing. But no pool no gym no fitness centre.Seems floors are going non smoking but the furnishings have not been changed so for non smokers it smelt.Rooms were very different in size. Bathrooms very small. Towels small.Staff were present but did not seem inclined to go out of their way to do more than they have to.Booked for the 'included breakfast' when booking only to discover the cost per head had we rocked up every morning to eat would have been 3000Y cheaper per person - not happy. Food was good coffee always cold.No advice in any documents on how to find the reception. Had it not been for one of us having some Japanese vocabulary we would have been in trouble.This really is a 'Businessmans' hotel. Not a tourist/family hotel.

excellent modern hotel in the heart of the entertainment district... EXCELLENT views of the city and even MOUNT FUJI!Recommend for everyone who wants to be central to the fun part of the city.Staff were great, quick service and even responded to me via email immediately.

My Wife and I stayed here for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The location is great and the view from our room looked down on to Shibuya crossing. The room was small with 2 single beds. The bathroom was also small but they were ok. The Wi-Fi in the room was excellent! The carpet looked a little bit old and the TV only had CNN in English but apart from that I can’t really complain. We ate breakfast only once in the restaurant as it was quite expensive but I would recommend going up to the restaurant at least once just for the view. We ate breakfast sitting next to the window looking over the park towards the Shinjuku City Skyline which was a fantastic view. I’d definitely recommend this place.

This hotel can't get enough stars for location. EVERYTHING is literally right under your feet. JR. Station, Metro lines, shops, supermarkets, food halls, cafes, restaurants etc. EVERYTHING. The hotel also has buses that run to Narita and Haneda Airport. The bus stop is right outside the hotel lobby on the 5th floor. No need to book in advance, just get on the bus and pay the bus driver directly. Sign up as a Excel Member and get discounted room rates. Their English website doesn't provide much information so I emailed them directly to make a reservation. The hotel was very accommodating as I kept going back and forth with travel plans. I originally booked a Standard Twin room with 2 x double beds for my family (myself, husband and 2 girls aged 3 & 5). In Japan, it is quite common for kids under 6 to sleep in the same bed as their parents. Saying that, their double beds were much smaller than the double beds that I had earlier in the week at Sheraton Grande Tokyo Bay, so they offered us an upgrade to a triple room at a discounted rate when we were checking in. The triple room was perfect for the four of us. My husband and I each had one bed and our girls shared another. The room had separate toilets and bath areas. The husband was pleased about not having to share the toilet with 3 other females.Our room was on the 14th floor and it had an ice-vending machine and 2 drinks vending machine (dispensing beer and other soft drinks).The hotel was quite strict on the check-in time and won't check you in before 2pm. We arrived at the hotel at 1pm and they told us to come back later.The staff were all fluent in English, so no issues there. However, service isn't great. The service is good to the point where they provide you with just enough but they definitely don't go out of their way. The very few times I had gone to concierge to ask for directions or to pick up something, there was never a smile that went along with it. It kinda made you feel like you were imposing on them. Despite that, I would still come back again. It is such a great hotel to base yourself if you want to explore the city.

I've stayed in a few hotels in Tokyo but this has to be the best location in terms of convenience and price combined.If you arrive by train, follow the signs to Mark City (shopping centre) and when you get close there'll also be signs for the hotel itself. Shibuya is on the Yamanote line, which is good if you have a JR rail pass, but there are also a few subway lines running through it (which you'll have to pay for) which makes it an easy location to get almost anywhere in Tokyo from without many line changes. The rooms are a reasonable size (we didn't ask for a larger room so I assume we got the standard size) and the higher up floors have an awesome view of Shibuya. I didn't specifically ask for a higher floor, so was very pleased to get one. The room had a coffee pod machine in it, which pleased my husband who was suffering from a lack of decent coffee after three weeks in Japan. The bathrooms are well stocked with toiletries, I think you could travel to Japan with nothing but your clothes and you'd be sorted! Shampoo, conditioner, body wash, travel toothbrush and toothpaste, razor, soap, shower hat, brush and cotton pads are all there. Also hairdryers so don't bother brining your own. The bed was slightly less firm than the usual western bed in a Japanese hotel, which was nice for a change! The rooms all have a safe. The staff were helpful and several of them speak English well, if you need to ask for advice or directions. We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on the food, but they have a restaurant on the 25th floor which I'd assume has great views and might be worth a try. I believe breakfast up there was around ¥2500 per person.

From the hotel, you get a view of the Shibuya Square, where you get to experience the real meaning of organized chaos, and you get to see the statue of Hachiko as it stands right outside the hotel. Groceries and shopping places are just a few steps from the hotel. You do not have to worry about carrying heavy shopping bags as you can easily drop it off inside your room and just go back to shopping after. The hotel is that near to different establishments.The hotel is also surrounded by different Japanese restaurants. If you want to save money, do not eat inside the hotel. Wake up early and go out and explore the place.

Location is fantastic and hotel is nice! Staff was a little hit or miss with how kind and helpful they were, but overall pleasant and helpful staff. Room size is what you would expect from a Tokyo hotel, but efficient, clean and comfortable. Buffet was smaller than I was expecting but good enough. Like everyone else has said though, can't beat the location, both in terms of being close to Shibuya Station and all the action in Shibuya.

Perfect location! Mall and train station easy access! Our room was small but all hotels in Tokyo are small. Just right though if you are only planning to sleep. Love the breakfast area. Lots of selections and view is great! Heart of Shibuya and perfect view of Shibuya crossing and the football field from Tokyo Drift movie! Made me so happy! Im a viewaholic!

Hotel tokyu excel is a perfect location to explore shibuya and tokyo in general. The hotel is within the shibuya train station and thus gives you access to all transportatiin forms except the shinkansen. The hotel lobby is on the fifth floor. There are separate elevators to hotel rooms, and a separate elevator that leads to the Mark city mall, trains and the street level. The mall is on the third floor after turning left from the elevator. An escalator to the fourth level of the mall brings you to their restaurants which are affordabke and excellent. An escalator down to the second floor leads you to a walkway with its attendant crowds heading either to Tokyu department store on the right, or to the tanagawa entrance and exit of the Yamanote train line, your friend to exploring Tokyo.If you want to go to street level, just use the hotel elevator to the first floor. When you come out it's the shibuya scramble! From here you can explore shibuya shopping. Hotel rooms are fair by japanese standards, fast free wifi, ice machine and vending machines on each floor. The staff speaks excellent english and is quite helpful for directions and suggestions. A bentiot restaurant on the 25th floor gives a fair western breakfast which is filling but serves the same stuff day in and out. I suggest you skip the japanese breakfast at shunshai resto next to it. It serves a set japanese meal of dry salmon, pickled vegetables, rice and miso soup. Definitely not worth it. But both restaurants give you a great view of the famous shibuya scramble, so bring ykur video cans or phones with you. Some bad points- tv is just japanese channels except for bbc and cnn and a korean and two chinese channels. You would think they would cater to their foreign tourists.They do not provide free bottled water, but water from the tap is drinkable and tgere is an electric hotpot boiler provided. And with family mart closeby and 24hour, you can buy drinks and put them in the empty refrigerator provided. But all in all a great convenient hotel to use as a base in exploring beautiful Tokyo.

Efficient but rather impersonal. Breakfast buffet ordinary. Nice view of Mount Fuji out of one window of the restaurant. Rooms small but there were two double beds. Only Japanese TV channels. On top of metro and train service into central Tokyo and other destinations. Probably would stay in Ginza rather than Shibuya if visiting Tokyo again.

The location alone makes the hotel a top choice. Fantastic spot right above Shibuya square, great subway access to everything a definite pick if you are a shopper. The rooms are a great size with wonderful views. The view from the lift area over Shibuya Square is awesome. The Tokyu Food Show in the basement is amazing, with an incredible array of shops and stalls selling a huge selection of salads, sushi and assorted prepared meals - great for assembling a lunch for your Shinkasen journey. Reception is very well staffed and staff are all too happy to help with restaurant bookings. Great shower, comfy beds and good hair dryer too!

I've stayed in this hotel for about 5 times already and each time has been pretty much above expectations.Location is excellent, right in the heart of all the action.From both Haneda and Narita the limousine bus will drop you right the the doorstep. If you are coming from Narita and have many bags, the bus might be a longer and slightly more expensive experience though it saves you the hassle of lugging the bags around.You can easily make your way to Shinjuku, Harajuku, Omotosando Hills, etc, all well connected within a few train stations away.There are several good CVS nearby, and a 24 hour Ichiran ramen is just 10 min walk away.Shibuya 109, Don Quixote, MSK drugstores, H&M and Uniqlo all around to satisfy your shopping.Shibuya Mark City and Tokyu both have basements to satisfy your dessert cravings and provides a decent place to buy them back as a gift though prices can be a bit high. The hotel provides 2 breakfast locations, one Japanese and the other International. I went for the International each time and though the variety and quality was good enough to fill me up every morning.The size of the room, while small, was cosy and comfortable. Don't expect big rooms in Tokyo and at the price and location, you can't complain much.Service depends largely on the staff you encounter. Some were extremely friendly and helpful (Miss Kimura for instance) while others looked like they were having a rough day most of the time. Was slightly disappointed at being turned down by my request of late check out (only an hour more was given) but I guess that happens from time to time.I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Price is expensive but for the location, comfort and the fact that you probably won't get a better deal elsewhere means this would be my hotel of choice each time I visit Tokyo.

The hotel location is unbeatable. It is connected to the various subway lines, which makes it very convenient to travel to almost all parts of Tokyo you might wish to visit, even to certain places outside of Tokyo like Yokohama. It is an excellent hotel for independent travelers who are sightseeing on their own. The reception speaks fairly decent English, you will be able to ask for directions and make general enquiries. We had a Quad room, and the size is reasonable, even luxurious by Japanese standard. The hotel is also connected to Mark City, which offers various food options and bakeries. It is also connected to Tokyu Foodshow, which is a huge supermarket very well-stocked with everything u can think of. For cheaper food options, you can roam the nearby streets riddled with ramen shops, curry rice, udon, sushi and everything else. The hotel is also close to popular ramen joints Ichiran, Ippudo and Hanamaru Udon. I have stayed elsewhere during my other trips but this location is by far my favorite. Other than the location, the room is decent with full-sized toiletries. A very good average hotel.

Great hotel, great location. We had a triple room--three comfortable full size beds with crisp linens, clean, spacious, quiet, 2-room bathroom, great view of Shibuya Crossing, which is fun. Wonderful location in Shibuya Station (subway and trains) restaurants and shopping in the station and all around this area, abuzz all the time. Easy access from Narita direct to the hotel door on the limousine bus, which is nice after a long flight. The concierge was very helpful with good restaurant recommendations.

This is a very comfortable hotel right in Shibuya Square. We were on the 23rd floor in a spacious room with unbelievable views!The hotel had a great staff that spoke multiple languages and were very helpful. It is a very short walk to the metro. We toured all over using metro.There were several restaurants very close with prices for every budget.I would stay here again.

Very good location. Easy to explore Shibuya area and go to other area of Tokyo.Good managed modern style hotel. I've stayed in the triple room due to my kid, and room was quite spacious. Bed and other amenities were also nice, no complaint.When I entered the room at first, found two big pieces of nori(sea weed) on the floor near the entrance. Very minor thing, but considering Japanese hotel's quality and price, little bit disappointed.Lobby area near front desk is not so large and always crowded. I recommend this hotel to business traveler, and young couples.

I've stayed here many times with private and business uses. Location is an excellent to go to everywhere. You can ride an airport bus which is directly access to the hotel from Narita and Haneda airports. In the same building of this hotel called " mark city " which has shopping and eating areas. My favorite sushi restaurant "Midori sushi" is also in Mark City. If you are in a "lucky" room, you will see amazing tokyo view from in your room:-)

Location was really great!!! I stayed in room 2122 that can saw Tokyo Tower by the window and some of the room faced Shibuya junction. Hotel is above Shibuya station. 7-eleven is very near just 2 mins walk from hotel.

Choosing to stay at Shibuya Excel Tokyu was a good decision, The airport limousine bus drops you off at the hotel lobby itself (Y3100 from Narita, Y1030 from Haneda). Hotel staff speaks good English (even the housekeeping boy speaks good English! :)) so it was easy to communicate. The hotel sits above Mark City, and links you to Tokyu Departmental Store as well as all the train stations. It is within walking distance to the Loft, Shibuya 109, Seibu, Tokyu Hands, Animate, and a small halal Kebab place near Don Quijote.Stayed in Rom 1301 - the room was spacious by Tokyo's standards, and offers a whole wall (and a bit more) of windows that open to the beautiful Tokyo skyline. Looking down below, you'll see the Shibuya scramble. On days when it's about to rain, you can sit by the window and watch the clouds slowly cover the landscape before your eyes. Quite mesmerising!Rooms are very clean and well maintained.The only thing is that the room I was in was a little noisy. So I could continuously hear sounds from the streets below, and what I made out to be part of the tune from "Superman" being played over and over again. I can imagine it would be annoying for some people, but I actually took comfort in having some noise in the room. What was annoying or rather distressing though was the blare from the police sirens because we were rather near Shibuya Police Station. But by Day 3, I got pretty immuned to the sirens and it didn't bother me any more.Overall a good hotel to stay in. At about SGD290 per sleep (without breakfast), it's not too bad a rate for the convenience it comes with.PS: Wifi in hotel was fast. Never had a problem. We also placed an order for Pocket wifi from Global Advance Communication and the hotel received it for us (without any problem), and also offered to post out its return on our last day.

Have stayed several times before at the Shibuya Excel, and it is a well run and professionally managed establishment. It offers a great base for business in the Shibuya area and throughout Tokyo from being central to the subway. There are great restaurants in the hotel, in the center where the hotel is located as well as all around the Shibuya area.However, the in-lobby coffee-shop serves some of the most expensive and un-impressive cups of coffee I have come across. And when you're sitting there for business discussions, having to pay over 1000 yen (that's close to 8 EUR) for a regular small cup of par-at-best coffee, really is annoying. Also, the in-room amenities like the espresso capsules are provided in anemic quantities, and having to call for an iron and ironing board to be delivered, and to wait for that to appear due to stock shortage, that is really unnecessary in a place like Tokyo.

Located inside the Shibuya station, this is a good hotel to stay when you arrive in Tokyo or just want a central location from where you can easily explore the city. The staff is welcoming and friendly, and there are plenty of restaurants nearby. The top floors also offer a great view to the Shibuya square and its crossing.

Everyone seems to be complaining about size of hotel rooms in Tokyo but the room at Shibuya Excel is really not that bad. My room is smaller than those of American hotels but large enough for my taste. We didn't get Shibuya crossing room but still were able to see one of the main road leading into the crossing. Since JR line goes right across the building at lower level, there is some noise from the train but it won't interfere with your sleep since there is no train running during the middle of the night. When it is running, it does give you a sense of the city. I kind of like it. We didn't eat in the restaurant so can't comment on that.

The hotel is located in the same facilities as the train and subway station, which is a great advantage considering the public transportation as your primary option in Tokyo. Services are very good, room is small but perfectly clean.Before arriving in Japan I was told about the size of the beds, my reservation was for a semi-double bed (SD) which is slightly less than a double bed. At first I was worried but in the end it wasn't bad at all. My room (1806) had a nice view of Shibuya crossing and Tokyo skyline.The staff at the hotel is always willing to help you. I needed the hotel to keep my luggage overnight and they did it as a compliment for my surprise. Most of the hotels in NYC will charge you even if you get your bags on the same day.Also, this hotel has an express bus shuttle service to the airport which is perfectly convenient when you have lots of bags.This is my primary option when returning to Tokyo.

My husband and I spent two nights at this hotel. We travelled on the Narita express from the airport to the hotel as the hotel was situated above the Shibuya Station. We had no trouble following the signs to locate the hotel, however we knew it was situated above the Mark City Shopping Centre. The check-in staff were efficient but wanted us to upgrade as they said our bed would be small. We upgraded but discovered the floor plan next to the lifts that our room was the only large room on the floor with all the others half the size. Perhaps we should have checked the room before upgrading!The room was very large, with well equipped bathroom and separate toilet - which could do everything! The bed was comfortable with quality bed linen. There was a coffee machine in the room which we used.We were on the 22nd floor and had a parcial view of the 'scramble'. We could get a better view from a couple of the lifts.The location was excellent, easy to get to the train station and to walk to neighbouring areas to explore shops and restaurants. Would stay again.

Shibuya Excel is located hotel in shibuya,near shopping centers,train station where we can see the unsleeping city of Shibuya intersection from top view.There are a lot of nice resturants and shopping locations close by.

The hotel is straight across the street to the Shibuya station. There are a lot of nice restaurants and shopping locations close by. The hotel itself is really modern and provides a great view day and night.

Hotels in Japan are known for their small size, so we were pleasantly surprised with the space we had with our quadruple share regular room. From experience, unless you're in a villa or suite, the usual lay-out for a triple or quad share room would have all the beds lined up against one wall (where the 3rd or 4th beds are usually folding beds) and there would hardly be space to walk around or leave your luggage. This was not the case with our room in this hotel (although the pic of the room when we booked online looked this way). Here (Room 1114), 2 single beds were on one side of the room, and 2 twin or small double (slightly bigger than the singles) were on the other. This was the prefect set up for us--3 adults and 2 toddlers. The single beds could actually be moved together to make a bigger bed (for Daddy and our 3yo), while I occupied 1 of the "bigger" beds with our 1yo. Nanny took the other big bed. Not only that, in the middle of the room, was a dining table for 4, with ample space to move all around it. We actually had enough space for the 2 boys to run around, while our 2 strollers were parked (not folded). We were also able to pack away our luggage in the closet.Another plus: the bathroom was split into 2 rooms: one had the toilet + wash basin, and the other had the shower/bathtub + wash basin. Which really does make sense when there are many people sharing the room.Standard room amenities were provided. Especially helpful to us was the hot pot, where we cold heat water for the kids' oatmeal. Our floor (and I'm assuming this is true for all floors) had a vendo machine for drinks and an ice machine.Side note on some room for improvement (pun intended): more closet space. Quad share means more people, and the space provided was just not enough. Also, although it was clean and pleasant, the room could use a little more sprucing up or modernizing.I need to mention also that the hotel location was just perfect for us.1) The airport shuttle (we arrived via Haneda), stops right by the hotel lobby (about a few meters walk from where the bus stops to the lobby doors). Even more convenient, the shuttle we took just made 3 other quick stops before reaching the international terminal.2) The hotel sits on top of a major metro station- the Shibuya station. Needless to say, this gives you easy access to most of Tokyo.3) The JR line station is just across the street (which made going to Disneyland very convenient for us).4) The hotel sits on top of a mall (Mark City) with so many food options. It was most convenient for us to take many of our meals in our room because of the kids (good thing we had a dining table!), and we had so different options to choose from everyday.5) It's right across the famous Shibuya crossing, so many stores within a 5 min walking radius.

Shibuya Excel is a centrally located hotel in Shibuya (on top of the train station), makes it really convenient to visit other parts of Tokyo, 1 train stop away from Harajuku and 2 train stop away from Shinjuku.The hotel room is clean and spacious for Japanese standard and offers view to either the Shibuya Crossing or the harbour. You can get a really good view at the crossing in the elevator. One must try the sushi bar on Level 5 (same building) called Midori sushi, excellent quality and reasonably price. The Airport Limousine bus to Haneda Airport docked at the hotel, easy to travel from/to airport, especially if you have lots of heavy luggage.

This hotel is located in the centre of shibuya which is just upstairs of the train station and just across the JR and airport express. There are frequent airport shuttles service operate fromNarita and haneda international airports. Room is clean and hotel staffs are pretty helpful and friendly.

My family of 3 arrived after a 4 hour train trip from Takayama and all we wanted was a place to rest our tired feet. Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu located right above the station was the perfect location. It was raining but we never had to leave the station to get to the hotel. Our son was 22 months old and we made the booking for 2 adults and 1 child. When we got to our room on Level 7, we found 2 super single beds joined together to form a giant bed for the three of us. Perfect. It was obvious some "rearrangement" of furniture had taken place to accommodate us. Spacious rooms by Japanese standards meant that we had lots of room to move around without bumping into each other at every turn. The only thing I could have wished for was a higher floor so we could better appreciate the view from the hotel in what was a prime location in Shibuya. To top it off, the icing on the cake was the Airport Limousine Bus service which left the hotel from the same level as the lobby reception. No more pushing of luggage in the street at 5.30am in the morning to get to the bus stop.

Stayed here for business. It was a little pricey but great location right on top of Shibuya station with views of the famous pedestrian crossing from above. Nice views from the upper stories and the restaurant at the top. The room was relatively spacious for Japan and had all the amenities one would need. Wifi worked fine. I didn't use it but I noticed there were laundry machines on the floor I was on. Not sure if there are machines on every floor. Most of the guests when I was there were non-Japanese. Quite a few Chinese tourists. Probably because, as I said, the hotel was a bit on the pricey side. And the desk staff speak English. I ate breakfast in the top restaurant just once, mainly to check out the view. I'd have gone up there more but $25 for a basic buffet is a lot of money. I made sure to go on a morning when the skies were clear. One morning I had ramen at a 24-hour place down at the street. Another morning I ate at the Kobeya cafe/bakery within the station. And other times I ate at coffee shops that were on my way to work.The airport bus makes the location very convenient to/from both Narita & Haneda.If I were on a private trip, I'd search for a better deal and a place with a proper ofuro.

Perfect location, helpful staff, easy to get to the hotel from Narita airport. We trained there and bused back for an early flight and watching the city wake on our journey was a highlight. Only on overnight stop this time but will stay here again on our next hopefully longer visit.

I recommend Excel Tokyu Hotel as a base hotel for travelling in Tokyo, especially if you want to stay in Shibuya area. The Hotel is on top of Shibuya JRstation. So convenient, just take the elevator down and you're at the station. Also The Airport Limousine Bus stop is at the hotel, so its easy to travel from/to airport, especially if you have lots of /heavy luggages. From Hotel to Airport (Narita or Haneda), you just buy the bus ticket as the front desk and they will carry your luggages to the bus.The room is large for Tokyo standard, and is very nice and clean. The room have 2 side, one facing the Shibuya crossing. (the best view is the nearest to the elevator) and the other is not facing the Shibuya crossing but its larger in size(longer).We tried the japanese breakfast in the restaurant on the top floor. Its ok, but it's plenty better restaurant for breakfast outside the hotel for much cheaper price. Nice view though, of Shibuya, Yoyogi park and Shinjuku.Rates is in the middle upper but for the large room and Convenient of the location, is well worth it. Besides Shibuya, it is also 1 train stop away from Harajuku & Omotesando, and 2 train stop away from Shinjuku

Great hotel, staff very helpful! Fantastic location, minutes walk from the station. The hotel is located within the shopping centre, this was a little confusing to us at first. We used our JR pass to travel to different areas of Tokyo, Shibuya is a great location for exploring.
