We stayed for 4 nights. Location is in the centre of action. Lots of lights and many restaurants nearby. A bonus is being right by a major train station. Price is very fair. The room was very clean, quiet and reasonably sized. The bathroom was not huge but was fine. I would stay again.

It had been my dream to visit Tokyo for many years. I'd always wanted to feel the rush of the city and the calm of their ancient traditions. I felt for my trip I had chosen the perfect base in the heart of Shibuya.The check in was very fast and smooth and everybody had impeccable English which is very comforting after a long flight and brand new surroundings. I actually even called the hotel before my trip and was impressed by their language skills and professionalism over the phone.The hotel is situated right next to the Shibuya station, a stop on the Narrita Express from the airport. You can reach the hotel without going outside but it is a fair walk if you have many bags. If you are traveling light you will be fine. During my stay I also found out you can book a limo bus to the airport from the front desk. This is helpful if you shop a lot and find you have more bags than you came with.I requested a room overlooking the Shibuya crossing. It was AMAZING. The view is awesome. I could sit up there next to the window for hours. The best room in my opinion is the corner room overlooking the crossing which is 01. For example, the 17th floor would be 1701. The corner room has more space and the best view.I travelled alone and always felt safe here. I heard some street noise but nothing bothersome and I'm a very light sleeper. The hotel was spotless. If you are a girl who travels with her hair products (shampoo, conditioner) you don't need to at this hotel. They have very large full size bottles of good quality.Overall, I would stay again at this hotel in a heartbeat and I would recommend it to my friends.

I am travelling as 7.5 months pregnant and find this hotel very convenient for me since everything is just close to this hotel. Right below are restaurants and shopping areas. The room size is adequate and comfortable, complete toiletries. It is very close to the train station. Mostly shops around open late and close early so it is nice to maximize the time

We've now stayed at both the Cerulean Tower and Shibuya Excel hotels.We stayed at the Shibuya Excel a few weeks ago and were very pleased with our decision. Even if the Cerulean Tower was at the same price, we would choose this hotel again every time. We had a triple room and it was great. Enormous bathroom and separate toilet. Very comfortable beds and plenty of room for luggage. No complaints at all. OK so the bathroom doesn't have marble tops like Cerulean, but that's pretty much all you're sacrificing. The location can't be beaten right on the station and Shibuya crossing. It was so convenient not to have to make the extra 10 minute walk to the Cerulean. It was raining when we were there so it made a big difference. We are planning to go again in October and will be gladly booking this hotel again. We didn't try breakfast or anything like that as we just headed to Starbucks on the crossing and had a lovely breakfast watching the crossing. Everything at the hotel was very clean and the hotel is totally non smoking now. One of the lifts is made of glass and you have an awesome view of the crossing as you use it. Don't hesitate to book this hotel it's great value for money in Shibuya. Free wi fi in the rooms too! There was a little bit of train noise early in the mornings from our room but nothing too bad. No street noise at all.

1st time stay at this hotel. Find out it was the best location. Room was nice especially qulaity bed and pillow. Staffs are all friendly and helpful. Breakfast had 2 options either Japanese set or ABF. We must say having breakfast here made us had a good start of the day.

The best thing about shibuya excel hotel is its prime location. Most of shops close quite late so you can actually walk around at night to discover the night life in here. The room is big compare to a few other hotels that I stayed before. Great service and helpful staff. I would stay here again if I come back to Japan

Excellent situation in heart of ShibuyaGood airport connections on Limojsine bus to And from NaritaRooms quite small normal for Tkkyo hotels and all those leaflets left in the rooms : are they really necessary ?Breakfast view over Tokyo from top storey is fantastic Good coffee shop and excellent service When getting into lift you need to be quick as doors close quickly

Had four nights in Shibuya after a snowboarding trip. The hotel was clean, room was reasonable in size for Tokyo standards and with the interaction we had with the staff they were pleasant. The hotel is ideally located at the Shibuya train station and makes arriving and departing easy. Would certainly stay there again.

Your view of this hotel really depends on whether you spend more time in the hotel or out of the hotel.If the former, the hotel is nothing to shout about. The room is small and rather cramp even though I had a semi-double. The pillows are not good at all; they are far to soft to provide any support. For some, it will be cause for neck aches in the morning. There is also no bar to speak of. There is a fridge which isn't very cold but it doesn't come with anything. However, the essentials are provided - toothbrush, shaver, comb, hairdryer, etc. There is, however, a good view of the Shibuya skyline. If you are lucky, you may even see the famous Shibuya crossing. There is also free wifi. Plenty of trains run nearby and the noise will affect some rooms but not all. Rooms on the south side and higher up will be quieter. If you don't spend much time in the hotel, however, the hotel cannot be more ideal. From the airport, there is a straight airport bus that takes you to the doorstep of the hotel. Buy your ticket at the exit of the airport. You can't miss it. Once there, it is located in a huge shopping complex that a famous sushi place as well as an assortment of other eateries that will serve your needs. Around the area, you will find plenty of shopping for both males and females and other wonderful dining opportunities.If you wish to travel further, Shibuya Excel is also an excellent base. You will get to almost anywhere in Tokyo with at most one transfer by train. There are many lines nearby as well as the JR line to travel out of Tokyo. Overall, I will recommend it to people travelling with friends who will be spending more time out of the hotel than in. If you are however travelling with the elderly or young children and envisage spending quite a bit of time in the room, you should find a more comfortable hotel.

If you want to stay in a central spot in Shibuya, location-wise, it's hard to beat the Shibuya Excel!It's connected to the station via walkways and it's easy to get to the main busy Shibuya intersection in a minute or less!It's technically in the Mark City shopping plaza (shops, restaurants) that will supply you with a small convenience store, cafes, food, etc., but don't cheat yourself as there's plenty of good options on the nearby streets!The hotel lobby and rooms were clean, with free wi-fi and if you get a room facing the street, it can be a nice view!The room isn't especially spacious, but it's not as small as some true Japanese business hotels. It was enough for sleeping since you should be out and about!All the amenities in the bathroom should take care of any forgotten (or lost!) items you need for personal care though the free toothbrushes were pretty tough.The prime location is the real draw and it doesn't disappoint. It was easy to get around via the JR or subway and when you're out eating/drinking late in Shibuya, you don't have to worry about "last train" like your friends might!Would stay again based on the prime location.Kudos - I must call this out separately - the concierge/bell staff were immensely helpful after United lost one of my bags for 3 days! They helped us locate shops where we could procure all the necessities that were lost and were also helpful in setting up restaurant reservations and mailing packages and luggage. There were quite a few good English speakers on staff and they were always eager to assist.

This was the first time we were travelling to Tokyo (with a 18 month old) and we booked this hotel for 2 main reasons-1) the airport bus stops right at the airport. Once we came out of the arrival hall, we saw the place to buy tickets (told the lady there our hotel name and we got our tickets. Stress-free). By the way, for some strange reason the name of the hotel wont appear on the screen in the bus but as mark city (the mall beneath the hotel) instead so don't panic as we did, wondering whether we took the right bus!2)Shibuya is a major interchange station with many train lines (local and JR). We didn't have to change trains to go to the usual tourist spots such as harajuku, ueno, asakusa etc. The room was small( as expected). We booked through agoda because the hotel website is somewhat confusing and chose a "semi-double room" (no idea what that is- Certainly felt like half a room hah.) But this was one step up from the normal room so I guess some rooms were even smaller! There was a thermal flask provided in the room (great for us who needed hot water for milk) and the usual bathroom amenities (love it that their shower gel/shampoo is not the horrible 2-in-1 kind and they are very nice smelling).Was a bit apprehensive that we are in the wrong demographic for hip Shibuya (us too old, baby too young) but we were so wrong! So much good food around us! There are great French bakeries in the mall right beneath the hotel and this sushi place (umegaoka sushi) on the 4th floor with very long lines (cheap and good! We ate there twice!). We took a ticket from the machine and went back to our room to rest (the wait on average is 2.5hours!) Very glad we stayed so near! Shopping is also fantastic. 5 min walk away from shibuya 109!

Stay there if you want to be in the lively Shibuya location in Tokyo. Very nice hotel with decent size room. No noise at all which is relaxing after a walk in the busy Shibuya area. Restaurants and shops are all over you once you get out of the hotel. Fantastic local. Convenient as next to all ground transportation (bus, train, subway)Highly recommended.

This hotel was expensive! However, we didn't have the time to plan ahead on this trip and only booked this one because it was close to the Shibuya train station and the iconic street crossing. We did pay the extra fee to get an "upgraded" room on the top floor (the elevator required a special key to gain access), but the room was average at best. It was small, with a normal bed, and normal amenities. The view was excellent, though. Overall, this is Tokyo, and the small accommodations are to be expected. That being said, I would recommend this hotel because of it's location and access to what the city has to offer. Also, we were able to have wonderful drinks and appetizers at the restaurant located below the hotel. Our table had a perfect view, and the drinks were strong. A definite plus. Worth it in the end.

The hotel is conveniently located next to Shibuya station surrounded by many shops and dept stores. Airport transfer from Haneda airport is available which stops right in front of the hotel. Book a triple room which is considerably huge and comfortable compare to the usual Tokyo hotel size. The only setback is there are only 2 plugs insufficient for 3 persons. Highly recommended and will definitely come back again.

Book a room, then ask frontdesk to upgrade your room to higher level floor when you check in. Ofcourse you have to pay a little extra, but…it's worthy. This hotel 's location is …on the Shibuya station. So technically it has no enemies to compare with traffics. If you love the croud of the crossroads, this is your best choice to have it all! And the bus to airports is also very convenient if you're about to checkout and heading to a flight. Staffs were friendly if you're willing to ask tasks. But It's a little noisy from crossroad, if you're searching a quiet place to stay, the noise even at high level floor is the same. But to compare to every situation, I would love to stay again just because of it's extraordinary location and views.

Stayed 4 nights with my wife and booked a room with a view to Shibuya crossing, and we got that on the 19 th floor, but the best part was actually the view over the Shinjuku skyline and rest of the town, wow! I spend a long time looking out that windows every morning and evening, this alone make it worth spending a bit extra. The rooms are not that big, but the big window make you forget about that. The breakfast buffet is not that interesting, but the view is fantastic from up there on top of the Building! The hotel is in a great location and it is easy to reach from Narita with the train.

The hotel is fabulously located - on top of department store & train station. We took a train to the hotel & easily navigated to the hotel even with our big luggages. Lots of restaurants & shopping & nightlife surrounding the hotel.The hotel is very nice & elegant. Staff is helpful & friendly. We had a family room & the room is very big even for South East Asian standard. The toilet is separate from the bathroom which was great for us. We used the laundry / washing machine a lot which is a bonus for us.

We stayed here with 2 children (8&10) for a week in March. We could not fault this hotel. The room wasn't spacious, but with a location like this you are hardly ever in it. So close to trains and the famous Shibuya Scramble crossing. Excellent shopping and food so close. We will definitely stay there again! Thanks for a great holiday.

I stayed here on a business trip earlier this month and found it to be be a busy but efficient hotel. The room I had overlooked Shibuya and part of the world famous crossroads. It was clean and well presented with an introduction note from the maid assigned to the room, which was a nice personal touch. In typical Japanes fashion staffing levels were high and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was OK, I only tried the western option, and it was no worse or no better than other hotels. I did have dinner one night in the restraunt on the top floor hoping to take advantage of one of the set meal options that offered relatively good value for money, given the prices on the menu. However, I was informed it was not possible and had to select from the A La Carte menu. When I asked why all I got was "Not Possible" which I am inclined to think was due to language difficulties rather than any other reason. View while dining very impressive, as was the presentation of the food. However, be prepared to have to eat something else later if you haver a normal appetite as the portions could not be described as generous. I di try to get a dessert menu, but again the language barrier prevented this. This might indicate that there was a shortage of English speakers, but those staff who could speak English did so very well, certainly better than my awful attempts at Japanese. I think I was just unlucky. There is very little wrong with this hotel, there are probably cheaper alternatives, certainly better places to eat but few have a better location. The only downside is there is no flexibility when it comes to getting an early check in with out paying extra, even if the room is available. After a 12 hour overnight flight the last thing you want to do is jhang around the lobby until the clock gets to 1400.If landing at either if Tokyos international airports there is a reasonable shuttle bus service that drops and picks up right outside the hotel. Time to Haneda was around 50 minutes on a Saturday morning and cost 1030 yen (around £5). Be aware, wspecially if you are used to average European timekeeping, the departure time is met every time.

Stayed here only for two nights just for it's convenience and "the view". Got a room with a street view and got a really good look of the busy street of Shibuya, the busiest street and zebra cross I've come across. Traveling was very easy since the metro was connect to the hotel underground.Wish breakfast could be a little longer that day as the view was amazing. The room have been a little small, but again it was all about the location and view!

1. Excellent location. Just get on the direct Airport Limousine Bus from the International Airport to this hotel... luggage, kids, stroller and all! The bus stop is at the Hotel Lobby, which is on Level 5. All of the major train lines are at Level 1. You can't get a better location than this.2. Room size. There are not that many reasonably-sized hotel rooms in Tokyo. There are 2 kids (1 teenager) and 2 adults in our family and we always book a Triple room, and there is enough space for all!3. Amenities and hotel staff are professional and polished. This is a business hotel, and therefore everything works as expected. Free wifi, and hotel breakfast is optional. If you need your regular starbucks fix - just head on down to level 3.4. And finally for photo enthusiasts who want a good bird's eye view of the famous Shibuya crossing... look no further, this is the hotel for you. There are 4 elevators to the guest rooms. 2 of these will have glass windows that will give you breathtaking views as you go up the floors!

Decided to stay here again after our last trip to Tokyo chasing the sakura in 2013. Yes, Excel still lives up to its name, excellent service with courtesy and respect to guests, as only the Japanese knows how.The location is superb within a shopping complex and next to the Shibuya train station. So convenient to hop on a train to anywhere in Tokyo. So many dining outlets and kiosks selling their local delicacies for us to have a taste of Japan other than sushi, tempura and all.Our room on the 23rd floor has a beautiful view of the city made even more scenic through large glass windows.The infamous Shibuya scramble crossing can be seen from the hotel itself just outside the Shibuya Station.Shibuya Excel Hotel is excellence itself and when I come to chase the sakura blooms I hope to stay here again, God Willing.

I highly recommended this Shibuya Excel Hotel..As in lahat nandito na Food, Shops, electronics as in.. :D you never go wrong if you booked this hotel. Ayos dito. all you need to shop is so near like the famous Don Quiote.

Serves both Japanese and western breakfast. Unfortunately in different restaurants so the entire group has to decide on the type of breakfast for the morning. Though you can get coffee in the Japanese one and if asked you can get green tea in the western restaurant. View from rooms are great with explanatory sheet of information of what you are seeing. Very helpful staff.

Stayed here for 3 nights in March after spending time in the snow and had a lovely stay.Rooms are modern and fresh but definitely on the small side with my partner and I squeezing in a double sized bed and the bathroom is definitely lacking space with the bath/shower, toilet and basin all squished in a little room. There is also barely any room for luggage so if you're staying any more than 3 nights I highly recommend you find another hotel.Location is perfect. Right in the heart of Shibuya, close access to the train station of the city hub of Shibuya so plenty of eating and shopping to be done!However, there is just so much to see and do in Shibuya that you won't spend much time in your room anyway! We ate all our meals out in town as well, much cheaper and you have an overwhelming amount of options.

We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights, 1 triple room and 1 twin room; locations of this hotel is great, within shopping mall Mark City, above Shibuya station, with access to JR and Tokyo Metro lines. Staff at front desk are friendly and able to speak good English. The rooms are clean and well-maintained, Internet access was good, able to support multiple devices. We've also used the coin laundry service at 8th floor, 300 yen for 30-min wash, 100 yen for 30-min dry, very convenience. We had a food package delivered from Hokkaido and needed to store in freezer overnight before we check out, and hotel is able to accommodate this request as well! We will definitively stay again at this hotel if return to Tokyo.

Since we had a baby with us, we wanted to choose a hotel that is connected to the JR and Metro. Indeed, this is the perfect choice as the hotel is connected to both the JR and Metro at Shibuya Station. As the hotel is located in Mark City, there is an abundant of dining places to choose from. The hotel's lobby and entrance is on the 5th floor, while the restaurants are on the 4th Floor. The JR and Matro are on the 3rd floor.The hotel is connected to the Tokyu department store and right in the centre of Shibuya area.Would highly recommend this hotel as it is very convenient for almost everything. The only comment on the Shibuya location is that there is no Shinkansen stop at Shibuya.

My first trip to Shibuya, I arrived via train from Yokohama at the Shibuya Railway station, dont believe for one second that when you get off the train and go up that you will end up in the hotel foyer as explained by the staff. I got lost in the station and ended up 3 blocks away, yes 3 blocks. Shibuya Station is one of the biggest and most complex in Japan. Being all underground it is very easy to lose your bearings. Ended up walking and finding the hotel. I checked in with ease and was given my room key card. I got to the room that was spotless and I had an awesome view of the area. However, I had booked a smoking room which at the time of my reservation was available only to find that the hotel had gone smoke free 4 days prior to my arrival and now I had to jump in the lift every time I wanted a smoke. More of a lazy complaint from me but if I had of known this was the case I would simply have booked elsewhere. Bed was comfortable, shower was great, access to everything was brilliant an navigating around town was simple. Great spot to centrally position yourself if touring Tokyo with Shinjuku, Ebisu, Akihabara, Roppongi and all major tourist activities within 10 minutes.

It is located in a shopping center in which there are a lot of metro connexions. From it you can see one the most famous road cross section of Tokyo. There is everything you need, restaurant, food shops, clothes shops, ...With the metro you can reach every part of Tokyo from that place.It is really clean, like everything in Japan, the service is nice but quite expensive. Free wifi. The bar is nice but again, expensive. My room was small but comfortable.

Okay Excel Hotel Tokyo is in an absolutely brilliant location. Our room literally looked over the often filmed "Shibuya square" where all those video panels up buildings and a million people crossing the road at once all occurs. The metro station is directly out the front of the hotel granting easy access to all of Tokyo. The room was very clean and decently appointed. Quite, slept well. The included breakfast was great. No complaints at all, I'll try to stay here next time when I come back.

The location is fantastic. Your are right in the heart of Shibuya & next to the train station. It does not get any better. The hotel itself is a bit dated. The bathrooms are tiny, but this is not unusual for Tokyo. I stayed at the Excel with my daughter. We booked a few months in advanced and requested two beds. According to the desk, they were not able to meet our 'request' and gave us a room with a double bed. When we pointed out the error, we were told we had to pay for an upgrade if we wanted 2 beds and they did not have to give us a room with 2 beds as it was merely a request. The fact we pre-paid months in advance for a room with 2 beds was irrelevant. After much discussion and a demand to speak to the manager, the desk staff relented and gave us a room with 2 beds at no extra charge. They made sure it was the worst room available - lowest floor, next to the elevators and across the hall from the vending machines & ice machine. the staff were extremely rude buy Japanese standards. They clearly felt insulted that we refused to pay extra.

Perfect for travellers arriving via Narita Express, and for short stay in the coolest place in Tokyo. Room is small and simple, but the loaction is so fantastic it makes up for anything else... Rooms can be cold inn winter, bring PJs.

We chose this hotel for the location and my wife found a great deal for a family room with breakfast. The hotel is attached to the Shibuya station and Mark City (shopping Centre), you have the famous Shibuya crossing, Hatchiko statue and a huge choice of dining and shopping surrounding the hotel. The quad room was a bit tight but had separate shower/bath from the toilet which helps in the morning, beds were comfy and the room is laid out well. Breakfast was better than expected although the service is a bit slow, the scrambled eggs are the best I have had in a buffet arrangement, I would love to know how they do it. We would definitely stay here again.

We stayed Hefe for business with a a large groups. The location is the main selling point. It is in the center of Shibuya! Like literally in the center. It was the best located hotel I've ever stayed in within a city center. If you are going to stay in Tokyo, why not stay in the middle of Shibuya? Walking distance to the amazing sights. Just looking out your windy is impressive! A short walk , and you are in the Harajuku district. So cool. Definitely recommend. Did I ment the location?????!!!

Spent 3 weeks at the Excel Shibuya. Whilst the rooms are quiet small. They are perfectly adequate & have everything you need.There are washing mashines on 3 of the hotel floors which was really useful.The location is just fantastic. You are overlooking the famous Shibuya crossing and right by the train station and all the shops. Really couldn't be in a better location.I would definitely stay here if I came to Tokyo again. Can highly reccomend.

I was recommended by friends to stay here after their recent experiences. I travelled with two teenage daughters and my 10yr old son. A quad room was perfect. Big enough for 4 beds, separate wet room/shower, as well as separate toilet and a third room which is the bathroom. Gave everyone room to get ready for the day so that we were not on top of one another. Well priced for what you get. Clean. Loved the view from bedroom. Great location as it is serviced by 5 subway lines. Rooftop bar /restaurant gave surreal views of cityscape and neon excitement. I am sure there are better and bigger hotels, but for access to the rest of Tokyo, nightlife and restaurants, and shopping at your door, I am convinced this is the place we will return to and recommend to our friends.

Superb location next to shibuya train station easy access to anywhere by train.walk to shopping belt with well known brands like Zara, h&m, forever 21 etc Super convenientClean hotel which cater 4beds in a room Fantastic!Will be back next trip to Tokyo..

I stayed five nights at the Shibuya Excel Hotel, with my mother and sister in December 2014. It was in a fine location - once you could actually find it. The sign out the front is incredibly small, and can pretty much only be seen when you are right at the entrance. It is located at the between the Shibuya Mark City Shopping Centre and the Hachikō entrance to the underground station. Literally across the road from the latter. We had two Japanese men assisting us with their 3G, and it still took 20 mins in the rain... Once they found it, they took us and our luggage all the way to the hotel - Japanese people were very friendly and lovely; and willing to go out of their way to assist us tourists. The staff at the hotel were relatively helpful, but friendly, or competent in English is a bit of a stretch (considering our other experiences with Japanese people in service positions and the general public, there definitely seemed like an element of poor customer service, especially in light of the wonderful experience we had at the ANA Crowne Plaza, Kobe immediately before, and the helpful young men who escorted us to the hotel). We had a fair amount of trouble getting recommendations for late night eateries on the first night. And subsequent requests for tea and room service were ignored - possibly a language issue, but, seriously, who can't understand 'can our tea please be replaced?'The room itself would have been a fine size for two adults, but it was quite tight for three adults each with their own bed (twin beds, and a roll out). The luggage situation was that we could only open two out of three at any one time, and one had to be opened on the table provided. The bathroom was fine, and was surprisingly large compared to the living space. We visited the cafe in the lobby a couple of times for snacks, and aperitifs. The service was very friendly and accommodating and the food and cocktails were delightful. All in all, the Shibuya Excel Hotel was a fine place to stay. The location was excellent for exploring the vicinity, there was a lot of shopping and places to see and eat in the area. And in terms of reaching other parts of town, by foot and public transport, it was brilliant. The service left something to be desired, but considering we were pretty much there to sleep and shower, it was quite comfortable.

The hotel is in a great location but everything else was average at best. The concierge service was unhelpful, there is no coffee in the rooms, the rooms were not always properly serviced and we got one with no view, the room service menu is extremely limited and overpriced. I would not recommend staying here unless you got a really great deal on the rooms. Last time we stayed at Keio Plaza and it was much much better. We will not stay here again.

This hotel is the best. I've stayed at the much more expensive Cerulean Tower Hotel in Shibuya and wished I stayed here again, because it's so much better. The staff here are friendly and happy to help.The rooms are small, but that's to be expected in Japan. Our room had a view of the Shibuya scramble crossing, which was cool to watch at night. Rooms are very clean, comfortable and well maintained. Housekeepers were friendly too.We went up to the top floor and had the breakfast they offer. It was a traditional Japanese breakfast (salmon, omelette, miso soup, rice, sushi etc.) and it was good, so if you're into that sort of thing you should definitely try it. The location of this hotel really couldn't be better. It's on top of Mark City, which is a small mall connected to Shibuya Station. You can get pretty much anywhere in Japan from here because it's a large station. Mark City isn't much for shopping but it's great for getting food ! I recommend you go underground, there's heaps of nice small shops selling cakes and things that people don't often see. :) I tell everyone who goes to Tokyo to stay here. It's the best.

Got a sweet deal through Trip Advisor. Over looks the famous square. Fantastic location. A huge food hall underneath and surrounded by good restaurants. It's your little escape from chaos from a seemingly endless parade of people coming in and out of Shibuya station. Only thing is ventilation in building. No fresh air apart from air con. But meh that's nothing. Awesome stuff.

Location: Stay for 6 nights with an interim break to Hakone from 6 Dec to 13 Dec. Located inside Mark City building, reception is on the 5th sty. Airport Limousine bus took 1.5hrs to reached from Narita T2 to hotel and stop at the entrance. On the 4th floor (in the shopping mall) you should try the ice cream and waffle if you have time. JR line is located at 3rd sty, walking distance to Tokyo Ginza Line, sheltered all the way, cannot ask for more.Check-in: Fast, present my passport and the reservation is done very fast. My rental wifi device was given to me without me asking for it as I have made prior arrangement with the telco to sent it to the hotel..Check-out: if you are going to airport by Limousine bus do book early as its very busy, check with reception on timing.Room: We emailed the reservation dept to reserve the room as we dont understand how to book the 4 bedder room. Room size was ok, amenities: Includes everything, such as blow dryer, toothbrush, toothpaste, razor. Bring your travel adaptor for your devices if you require one. Cleanliness no complain but the interior design is dated. The 4 bedder room was located furthest from the lift lobby and the facing is the side view of 109 building. i was allocated a room on the 12 floor. Reception offered to upgrade to higher floor for additional JPY8000 per day. i did not take up the offer as its still the same view.The beds are set opposite each other with a round table in the middle. The bath room & toilet is separated which is good so that we dont have to rush to use. Limited English TV channel unless you want to pay, the instruction manual warn you about pressing the "PAY" button. If you have kids please be careful else you will need to pay. Fridge is empty, you can buy your own stuff to store Free wifi : Room wifi was fast for 4x Handphone, however was extremely slow when i try to connect to Blackberry dont know whyBreakfast: Cost about JPY2500+ per pax in the hotel which we did not try, plenty of shops around for breakfast.Facilities: There is a vending machine on my floor for beer, water & soft drink (Cost about the same as convenient store). Ice dispensing machine (This is free). If you ever required any extra storage and not thinking to buy extra luggage. You can buy carton boxes (Postal type) which i bought 2nos to keep all my winter clothing before flying back to SG. Price range from (JPY 200 to 400) depend on size

The overall for the hotel is very good, room is clean, breakfast has 2 restaurants ; western and japanese. The location is very comfortable can walk from JR and past Tokyu. There are many food shops near the hotel and shopping center.

picked this hotel for its location, which i have nothing to complain about. but if you are a foodie and want to make reservation at any decent restaurants, don't expect anything assistance from their concierge. Almost all decent restaurants (michelin stars) would not take reservation directly from foreigners visiting the city, they ask that the booking be made through the hotel concierge. This hotel's concierge would not help you with any advance restaurant bookings until you are checked in, which by then will be too late to get a table at any decent restaurants you want to visit. I made the horrible mistake of not finding out about this (as i've assumed that concierge is all about providing assistance to hotel guests) and now am stuck with no restaurant bookings for my upcoming trip.

stayed for 2N. conveniently located in the heart of shibuya. a lot to see around. room was fairly standard, spacious enough. breakfast had a nice selection. a bit on the expensive side, but if you want a nice hotel in the middle of shibuya i guess you have to pony up. staff was very robotic and their recommendations were cookie-cutter standard and as such next to useless. they should put in more effort to serve their customers.

My Husband & I stayed for 1 week at The Excel Hotel, in wonderful Shibuya. We particularly wanted a room with a view of the famous ' Scramble Crossing', hence booked a corner room being 1801, which had magnificent views of the City to the Mountains !!! The room was large with floor to floor windows & had arm chairs & a table to relax or read, a safe for your personal belongings, a fridge & had every amenity you could ask for - great housekeeping & daily Newspapers in both English & Japanese.This Hotel is so central to everything Shibuya offers - shopping is a delight with fashion stores everywhere, Starbucks Coffee is just across the road, The Train Station is actually underneath the Hotel, making for easy access upon arrival & departure, via elevator. I would highly recommend a stay at The Excel Hotel - everything is within an easy stroll & is also great for exploring Tokyo on the Train. You must visit 'The Loft' a wonderful Department Store, which stocks an array of quality items from stationary to clothing & giftware.Plus upon checkout we were able to store our 3 large suitcases at Reception, until we were ready to move on to our next destination in Tokyo.Melissa from Melbourne in Australia

Not the first time staying in this hotel, and their service are still very good on top of its prime location. I find a good offer from Travelzoo and the stay was my second part of my Tokyo trip. I used Japan EMS service to transfer my luggage to the hotel and they do handle them with very good care. I love the location and the services and would definitely come back if I choose to stay in Shibuya next time!

Location: The best in Shibuya, it's connected to Mark City building, and it overlooks the infamous Shibuya crossing. Basically you can access anywhere in Japan from this hotel.Room: For a hotel in Tokyo, it's pretty big. (which is to say, average size in the States). Amenities: Includes everything, such as blow dryer, toothbrush, toothpaste, razor, etc.Cleanliness: Any hotel in Japan is guaranteed to be cleaner than hotels in US. I have yet to experience cleanliness issues in Japan.Service: Excellent. Took less than 5 minutes to check in and check out. Front desk literally jumps to help you when you come up to the counter. We had to leave our bags for couple of nights while traveling elsewhere, and it was no problem.From the airport: Limousine bus will take you right up to the entrance of the hotel, it's about 30 dollars/pp. If you take JR, you have to cross the street, so it can be tricky with lots of bags, but doable as well.The only downside of this hotel is the noise level due to the location. Since it is right in the center of Shibuya hub, you will hear some outside noise even late at night. If you haven't been to Shibuya, it's like NY Times Square on steroids, so it can't be helped. It wasn't too bad though, and I would take convenience over a little noise anyday. (just join the party!)Overall, considering all the factors, I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Tokyo. Recommend.tip: Free wifi was extremely fast.tip: If you use limousine bus to get to the airport from the hotel but you still have some time after you check out, they will hold on to your luggage and take it to the bus for you. Great service!

Stayed in this hotel several times. Each time has been great. The views from the hotel can be amazing if you get the right room. The hotel staff if very efficient and rooms are clean. The best thing is pricing is very affordable for Japan and room size is not small. Plan to stay here everytime I go to Tokyo.

This hotel has the best location: just on top of the Shibuya Station which is the heart of Tokyo. You can just walk down to have as much shopping as you want or you can take the JR to most places easily. Rooms have an excellent view of Shibuya. Cleanliness, space and service is excellent too. And moreover, there is airport limousine direct from the hotel.

I think it is hard to find a better hotel and location at this price in Tokyo.Rooms are small, but this is TokyoAnd the Airport limousine stop at the entrance.They provided a very good service and the staff was very friendly and helpful. And the location, smack in Shibuya and the night life and shopping is just outside the doorI will stay here next time I go back to Tokyo

If you're used to the higher end hotels like ANA Intercontinental and others, this one could be very painful. First, it's one of those tiny room Japanese-style hotels with rooms so tight you run into the walls, nothing in the mini bars (use the vending machines!) - and everything just seems 20 to 30 years old. Make the mistake of taking a nap and putting a do not disturb sign, and you get no service the entire day. Wifi terribly slow. Second, taxi's. They have two entrances. The logical place where you would expect to get a taxi is a ramp that is primarily used by buses so you have to be lucky to find a taxi there, and because it's Shibuya, taxi's don't come up the ramp because there is so much traffic down below. So, request a taxi - and expect a 10 to 20 minute wait. but you can go down in the heart of Shibuya and fight it out. But, in fairness, this place was packed with what seemed to be happy people - and I never tried any of the restaurants which there seemed to be a few. Of course, if you want to be in Shibuya (Times Square on steroids), this is smack in the middle of it - so that's why people emphasise location/location/location. But, as a business hotel, this one falls very short. And, I can't imagine bringing a family here with children, it would just not work. So - if you're solo or in a couple, want to be in the hear of the shopping district and don't need ultra luxury - hey, this is for you. but if you are a standard higher end business traveller or coming to Tokyo with family, try your best to go somewhere else.

Stayed here on business and it was fantastic as a business traveller. Easy transport connections. Not sure would stay here as a tourist/on holiday. Very clean and functional. Very business orientated.

~ Konnichiwa ~- The location is bloody marvelous; right in Shibuya crossing close to restaurants and shopping- Narita Express from airport comes right into station connected to the hotel- View was 10/10, overlooked Shibuya crossing - however this makes it noisy- Late check-out is not free; quoted 80USD for 2 hours. I said no!

Right at the famous Shibuya crossing. Stayed here for the last 4 trips to Tokyo. Best location for shopping, eating and sightseeing. Shibuya Station is right underneath it. Airport limousines stops right in front of it. What more can you ask for?

The location of this hotel is superb, the views are simply breathtaking, and upon arrival, the hotel exudes class, so I was surprised to find the bed not all that comfortable. The en suite bathroom facilities (in one of the cheapest rooms, which i imagine was by no means "cheap") was pretty dated (although the toilet seat contraption was the best I discovered on this trip to japan). For the price of a room, one would expect more, considering there are more affordable places, with better bedding an facilities (many of the ryokan hotels).By all means, a good hotel though!Really appreciated the helpfulness of staff concerning the left luggage facilities!

This was my second time stayed in the hotel. Very convenient for the airport transfer as the airport limousine bus just in front of the lobby, the fare is jpy1100 (Haneda) and jpy3100(Narita).The Tokyo subway and JR station just around the corner. The hotel located in Shibuya Mark City Building where famous and popular eatery can be found everywhere. Midori Sushi and Wako Tonkatsu is the must try food for myself.The hotel room clean and neat but the bathroom looks a bit old compare to the first time of my stay. the shower curtain and the wall have stain.

Shibuya Excel is right smack at the heart of the famous district. The airport limousine conveniently drops you off and picks you up at the driveway. Staff are very courteous, friendly and helpful. If you get a chance to ride one of the left-side elevators, it'll give you a scenic view of the Shibuya scramble.Rooms are big, especially for Japanese standards. I stayed at an Excel twin room with my daughters on the 21st floor, and we were treated to a wonderful view of the Tokyo Tower and all the hustle and bustle down below.We tried the western breakfast buffet once. Quite pricey in my opinion, for the selections offered.Getting around Tokyo is easy since the hotel is right above the Shibuya Station. Shibuya Mark City is also connected to the hotel, offering a wide array of restaurants to choose from, should you wish to dine outside the premises.It is quite pricey but you pay for the convenience and view. I will definitely recommend this to my friends and stay again should I find myself in the Shibuya area in the future.

I'm sure the most commented feature of this hotel is its location. And I agree.Just steps from major Tokyo Metro and JR rail lines, attached to Shibuya Mark City that has dining options (including a popular sushi chain, Starbucks, and Jean Francois french bakery), it is perfectly located in the heart of Shibuya's maze of stores, restaurants and happenings (we were here on Halloween night, and the street party took place literally under our noses).The only downside of the hotel is the room size. Around 23 sqm. It is cozy, but tight. Spotlessly clean. The hotel in my opinion is a full 5 stars, with good service, and amenities. On a rainy day, just walk up to the concierge to borrow an umbrella. They dont even ask you for your room number.The Airport Limousine Bus also drops off right on the hotel doorstep, around 90 minutes from Narita Airport. Very convenient. Didnt sample the on site restaurants as there are many choices in the area.Wifi was free, although I pre-ordered a mobile hotspot device for the trip.

this hotel is perfectly located just on top of shibuya station, with a wonderful view of the shibuya crossing itself. Perfect for touristing Tokyo and very nice for evening strolls.The rooms are fine, somewhat larger than japanese standard but still not big. Mobilephone and laptop docking stations in room was a plus.the beds are nice and quite comfy but not fancy. Spotless clean as usual in japan.The bathroom was a little disappointment, clean of course but lower standard than expected given this hotel ambitions. Nice but ordinary toiletries. The hotel has no sento, but two restaurants. We ate breakfast at both and i reccomend to just avoid both. The japanese one was the worst I ever tasted in Japan, clearly low quality. the western one had very limited options and is nowhere worth the money. I would reccomend the hotel to close one of the restaurants and remodel as roof-sento, and rethink about what to do with the other one.the staff is nice, but not so fast when handling more complicated questions than check in. for instance I rented the mobile wifi, it took ages to get it. It did not work and it took ages to leave it back.Still a nice experience and I may come back for the unbeatable location.

Although i had travelled for work, I could imagine this to be the perfect hotel for a vacation. Bang on top of the shibuya junction and easy connectivity to everywhere. The rooms are on the smaller side but works out fine for a business traveller. The breakfast was ok but they need to have more than the 5 options they have for room service.

This hotel helped my visit in Japan better! The access of the MRT was very convenient. The location was awesome and very convenient too. The rooms are all clean and just made for the right people. I will book this hotel again when i come back to Tokyo.

Similar to other reviews you can't beat the location. When we booked the hotel we requested a higher floor with a view of the crossing. We lucked out and received room 2102. I would recommend requesting this early rather than waiting closer to your arrival date as I am sure they assign rooms as they get booked so don't wait until the day before and then be disappointed your request wasn't fulfilled. We took the NEX train to the hotel which is 50% off if you have an international passport. The train went from JFK to Shibuya station and then you need to follow the signs to Mark City Centre and then signs to the hotel. We took the airport bus back to the airport and it was a little easier to manage as it picks you up right at the hotel and saves having to tow luggage and a 4 yr old through the train station. The staff speak a little English but don't expect fluency - you are in Japan! Lots of shopping and restaurants in the area. We ate at the Japanese restaurant on the 4th floor in the Mark City Centre. There is always a wait. Get a ticket at the machine in front of the restaurant and wait on the bench or in line nearby and wait for your number to be called. We thought the people were waiting for a tour or a bus or something initially when we walked by but nope it was for the restaurant. There is always a wait regardless of when you go. Good food, reasonable prices and enough pictures on the wall and in the menu to order without knowing Japanese.We would definitely return to this hotel should we come back to Tokyo again.

If you do it, do it right. If you want to visit Tokyo's most vibrant, trendy and buzzing neighbourhood then stay right in the middle of it. The Tokyu Excel hotel is located on top of Shibuya station so it is easy to find and located right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. All rooms are located on rather high floors, so good views are guaranteed. The famous Shibuya crossing can be seen from most hallways, so even if your room doesn't provide a view of the crossing you can still take pretty pictures by walking to the end of each hallway.My room was on the 22nd floor and while the hallway smelled like mixture of old cigarettes and feet, the odour in the (no smoking) room was just fine. The rooms have a reasonable size and are packed with a desk, a chair facing the window, a flat screen TV, a (little) plant, a safe deposit box, an empty fridge (buy your own snacks at one of the many convenient stores), a coffee maker and a phone charger. Wifi is free and fast, cable Internet is available as well.The noise from the streets is clearly audible in the rooms, but in a way this adds to the charm of the hotel. On the other hand: the giant billboards play the same lyrics all day long. Hearing the same lyrics and sound effects every minute or so can drive one crazy! You booked a hotel in the very heart of Shibuya, so you'll know it! And... as of midnight even the streets of Shibuya go quiet and one can enjoy a good nights sleep.The only disappointment was breakfast. It costs 2,571 yen which gives the guests a choice between Japanese and Western breakfast. The Japanese breakfast is a set meal including a (dead) fish, which for me is a no no. The Western breakfast does offer plenty of vegetarian options, but not very healthy ones. The bread is either white (no nutricial value at all) or croissants (a bundle of the most harmful fat). The muesli wasn't the healthy kind either. There is no whole wheat brown bread, no nuts, no rice crackers, no truly healthy options. So in the end I paid 2,571 yen per day for a glass of orange juice! What a disappointment! Luckily Shibuya is "pretty girl city" and so there are numerous healthy restaurants in the vicinity.Would I stay here again? Yes, but next time I would book a room excluding breakfast.

I felt so comfy in the room and the location was so close to everything, from nearest 7-11 to shopping centers. Wish I could stay longer than just one night. Only one drawback I would say was that the tour bus could hardly drop you off near the entrance and so you might end up walking and dragging your luggages along to check-in and they seem not having bus parking lot, therefore, if you come in as large group that need a bus, then this hotel is not convenient, but if you are smaller groups, would be better as they have taxi stand right in front of the hotel entrance.

There's no better combo of location, services, and excitement in Tokyo. The Excel is right in the middle of it all, and the hotel is in the middle of all the shopping, restaurants and entertainment you could ask for. But somehow it manages to be an oasis of calm and quiet in the relative chaos of Shibuya.With a direct bus from the airport and easy JR/subway connections, it's an easy place to get to and from. The Ginza and Hanzomon line also mean you can go crosstown quickly - most parts of Tokyo are less than 30 mins away.Rooms are smallish, but that's Tokyo (so get over it). Otherwise, the hotel is spotless and rooms have all necessary accoutrements. The only complaint is that the staff is a bit cold and distant, but always professional and responsive to requests. I'm just not sure they'd go out of their way for their guests.
user_name:
estranger
New York City, New York

review_body: The hotel is right next to the Shibuya train station, just outside the famous Shibuya intersection. Even late in to the evening on a Saturday night this place is hopping. Lots of shopping, easy access to the trains, and a great view makes this a good hotel to stay at if you are looking to spend some time in the Shibuya area. It was maybe 30 minutes on the train to Tokyo Station, and a direct bus ride on the airport limousine to or from either Haneda or Narita airports.Also one of the few hotels that can accommodate more than three people in a room. We had a four-bed room for the four of us, meaning we did not need to book two separate rooms. The room was tight with the four beds, but we didn't stay here to hang out in the hotel room.

This hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya. The hotel is amazing itself and the limousine airport shuttle drives you to the front entrance. If you are going, it's great to buy your to and from airport ride pass and plus you get 2 or 3 day metro passes at the airport. The metro is steps outside the hotel and the most convineant way to get around Tokyo! There are abundant restaurants, bars, and shops all around the hotel too. Your are directly linked to a mall so there are so many restaurants to eat from. My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and got 2 twin beds which were perfect because the room was spacious with a great view. You can share the bed or sleep separate and have an amazing sleep!!! We cannot wait to come back here!

We visited Japan with our son, who works in South Korea and met us in Japan. We planned to stay in Kyoto for 3 nights and Tokyo for 3 nights. We needed somewhere in Tokyo with a good location and with a triple room and used TA to help us locate this hotel. The hotel is excellent quality - good standard of rooms / beds / public areas / reception and the staff were very helpful.If you want to get somewhere that is at the heart of Tokyo then this is it ! But the rooms are very spacious and comfortable so you can hide yourself away from the hustle and bustle outside if you need to !There is lots to do in the area around the hotel and the subway / JR local train is about a 2 minute walk. The Tokyo subway system is vast and there are 2 separate subway lines in Tokyo that sometimes share stations, so plan your journey in advance ! We got the bullet train from Kyoto and arrived at Tokyo station - the information desk were very helpful and spoke good English and advised us to get the over-ground JR 'circular line' train to Shibuya and not travel across the city on the subway - great advice ! The hotel did a coach transfer to the airport which we used for our return journey - this was the same price as the JR line train, took 30 minutes longer, but saved us having to carry our suitcases to the station and onto the train. We would highly recommend this hotel.

I stayed here for one night due to the typhoon cutting the first part of my trip short. It was a good stay, located right at the shibuya station. It was pouring rain when we arrived but thankfully we didn't have to leave to station as the hotel was connected to it underneath. The hotel is located in the Shibuya Mark City Tower (talk highrise that is overlooking the famous shibuya crosswalk)Overall it was a nice convienient stay. I'd recommended asking specifically for the shibuya crossing view when you book your room.

This hotel is in a great location with amazing views of the crossing. Proximity to both JR and metro train lines makes exploring tokyo easy. Only downside is that this hotel seems to be more business oriented than tourist. All in all provided a good base for our stay. Make sure to explore the area behind the hotel as it has great bars and eateries.

We chose this hotel for its location and view of Shibuya Crossing. It seems rooms 1 & 2 on each floor (i.e. we stayed in 1802) are next to lifts and thus have the best views of the crossing (don't worry, you can't hear the lifts!!). Excellent amenities - wifi, clean rooms with great toiletries. No iron or mini bar though. Good access to all JR lines, subway and a 15 minute walk to Harajuku and all shops/restaurants in Shibuya. You feel right in the heart of the chaos ... and it's awesome! Only downside is breakfast buffet is random and quite expensive but plenty of other options nearby.

This hotel is accessible via the local train, directly from the airport (est. 40mins). It is right at Shibuya Mark City shopping centre. Stayed for a total of 4 nights. Checking in was fast. What I like:- Wifi was good- Clean room despite looking slightly aged- Checking in/out was fast- English speaking staff- Ample shopping centres/shops around the hotelWhat I dislike- Tv channels were all in Japanese without any subtitles- Checkout is at 11amFor a Muslim traveller like myself, you can find 2 halal joints in Shibuya district, 10 minutes walk from the hotel. One is called Gyumon (3 Chome-14-5 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo-to, along Shibuya Police Station) & the other is Hanasakaji-San (3 Chome-14-5 Shibuya, Shibuya-ku, Tokyo-to B1F). I spend around 4500 yen on average for dinner. Ask the hotel front desk for a map & guide.

Located right in the middle of ShibuyaThe car access is trough a ramp which leads to a quiet entrance and avoid any initial stress when checking in with a lot of luggageWe where at the 19th floor with a beautiful view on the townThe check in was promptThe luggage delivered rapidely to the roomThe japanese breakfast was good an served on the 25 th floor with a breathtaking viewThe rooms are a simple affair but perfectly cleaned and maintainedThere is a nice multicharger for your tablet addiction on the bedside standOverall clean, well run and very well located

I stayed at this hotel because of its easy transport links. The railway station is immediately below the hotel and the airport shuttle bus leaves from the reception level.The room was comfortable and spacious with good night time vistas of the Tokyo skyline.The western breakfast was terrible- don't waste your money, buy croissants and fruit from the food hall downstairs and take advantage of the in room Nespresso machine.I had a nighttime flight out so booked the room for the extra night so that we could stay until the 4.00 pm airport bus, when reception realised I was checking out early they refunded part of that days room cost- a pleasant surprise!

This is a very good hotel in an ideal location on Shibuya. I had an Excel room which is on a higher floor and is slightly larger.There were two single beds, a table and two small armchairs in the room which filled the room but I had no problem with it and found it more than adequate for one person. I did not have breakfast because it was expensive, about £15, and decided against it. The in-room wi-fi I had was very good.Apart from the hotel itself being good the location is obviously perfect, easy access to/from airport, right in the centre of shops/restaurants and right on top of the station. The hotel does have a map of Shibuya but if you are staying in Tokyo, or anywhere else in Japan, if you can, do go to Japan Tourist Board in London, they have excellent information and maps. If you are coming from the airport the Narita Express is the cheapest and very convenient but back to the airport take the limousine bus which picks up outside the hotel and drops off outside the departures hall. Whilst it does take longer than the train, they are both the same price, it does mean you do not have to carry luggage up/down stairs and escalators to the train and then from the train to the departures hall.

Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is right where the action is. Just a few steps away from the mad scramble, shopping, restaurants and bars for all types of budget. It's right on top of the Shibuya station of the JR lines. You can access any place from it's excellent location. I went with 3 other friends and we got a quad sharing room. Lay out is very good - 4 beds along the 4 corner with a round table in the center. Toilet and bath are separate. Plenty of room to navigate suitcases and shopping bags. Beds and pillows are comfy. Wi-fi slow but we had our own mobile wi-fi which we used instead. We had the city view which was very nice during sunset. I am very happy with the hotel and will recommend.

We chose this hotel due to the proximity to shibuya crossing. What a choice, it was even closer than the description.... Just a zebra crossing away from the entrance via the famous hachiko statue. We landed very early in the morning and while check in wasnt until 2pm we were able to check in to the room straight away which was a relief having travelled for so long. Rooms were on the small side given the rate being pricey but the expense is more for the location which we didn't mind. Rooms were comfortable, modern and very clean. Everything we needed was there in the room. Breakfast was at an additional cost, quite pricey but again for convenience we didn't mind. Both western and Japanese style with amazing views, what else do you want first thing than a coffee and amazing view. The restaurants offered dinner which we weren't able to get to but I'm sure with a view over the city lights would have been magical.Staff were very helpful with queries and arranging some services especially transport back to the airport at a reasonable price for door to door convenience. Would recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a central location. The JR and subway station across the road was central to all major regions of the city.Only additional point would be the addition of an in house spa, there was the option for in room massages from an external company but in house is nicer in my opinion. Definitely not a deal breaker though.

A great location in Shibuya, a 5-minute walk from Shibuya station.If you are looking for an active location and full of life.. this is the right choice!It was a little bit confusing how to get to the hotel reception in the first time only, since you have to take a certain elevator at one side of the (Shibuya Mark City) which is a shopping mall at the same building. (Hotel reception is at the 5th floor)The hotel reception upgraded my room to a bigger size free of charge, due to room availability.The room was very good, with AC control, safe box, all stuff you need in the toilet.The TV has many channels but all of them are Japanese, no English channels.The internet is free and with very good speed and connection.There is no gym nor pool in the hotel.

Quite a pricy hotel but was perfect for our group of 9 as it had the ability to cater for up to four people per room which was quite hard to come by in japan. Rooms were large, breakfast was great! Hotel staff spoke english very well. Right in the centre of Shibuya with some of the best and famous views of the crossing. Would definitely recommend!

This hotel was perfect for our trip to Tokyo. The rooms were comfortable with decent air conditioning and nice views across Shibuya. The two options for breakfast are great plus the nice bar in reception. The hotel is right on top of some great restaurants and a mini supermarket aswell as many different transport lines. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a comfortable stay.

Very convenient location, easy to get there from airport, Trains & Departmental stores right below. Whole lots of shopping malls, restaurants, bars, all within walking distance. Hotel Service is good, you can also book airport limo bus tickets just at the reception.And the most popular meet-up spot in Shibuya, The Hachi-ko statue, is just across the road, made it easy to arrange meet-up with my Japanese friend.

Great location in Shibuya right at the famous Shibuya Crossing. Below is a shopping mall and access to trains directly from Shibuya Station below. Walk oit and you get tons of food and shopping. Great location is uou want tge hustle and bustle of the city.
user_name:
Stevo M
Petaling Jaya, Wilayah Persekutuan, Malaysia

review_body: Tokyu excel has the best location in Shibuya. Close to the subway, lots of food choices in the basement, and shopping! Price was reasonable and rooms were clean. Transfer from Narita also was so easy because the airport Limo bus drops you off right at the hotel. Already planning my return trip and will definitely stay at Tokyu Excel again.

After some research prior to my trip, I chose this hotel mainly due to location and reviews.I am very happy with the hotel and even if I would want to be critical, I would not be able to complain about anything. The room was spacious and clean, the bed very comfortable, the air-conditioning kept consistently the right temperature without making any noise and playing the usual ‘too-hot-too-cold’ game, and the room service was flawless. My room was on the 23rd floor and there was barely any noise from the busy intersection outside. The hotel is right in Shibuya center and the subway station is a short walk as well all restaurants and stores.

Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. Arrived at 9am at the hotel but counter staff said no room available but if we are willingly to pay 100% for extra day then there's room available. No logic to me since we only earlier a few hours prior to check-in but they wanted to charge us so much more. It's crazy! Then came another suggestion that we needed to top-up to get a bigger room but we declined. Initially experience is that they kept pushing you for extra $$$$.... Asked for late check-out and they said have to pay extra too...And check-out timing is 11.30am!!Nevertheless, this hotel location is good because this is the limousine bus station (Narita/Haneda), very convenient for you to take transport to airport.It's right in the middle of Shibuya, shopping and eatery everywhere near you.Room is clean and wifi is strong plus toilet amenities are sufficient for use.Another ridiculous thing is that you need to pay for those international TV channels i.e BBC etc.So basically all Japanese channels.Generally location surpass allIf going to Disneyland - the easy way is to take the JR line (within the complex) Saikyo Line to Shikiba abd change to JR Keio line to Mahaima Station. Ask the hotel concierge and they will give you the direction too.

So glad I chose this hotel. From Narita airport, we took the Limousine Airport Bus and the drop off is directly at the hotel. No hassle, no confusion on how to take the metro, don't need that stress upon arrival. The bus operates every hour. We booked a room with 3 beds, its spacious enough, and has a separate bathroom and toilet which is fantastic for 3 persons staying in one room. Check in was quick, the room is clean, quiet and has free wifi which works well. The hotel is located within Mark City which is a shopping mall with lots of restaurants. It is very central, you can find the metro, lots of restaurants & shopping nearby. Its about 15-20 mins walk to Meiji Shrine & Yoyogi Park. We can see the Shibuya crossing from our room, and if you go up to 25th floor, you can get a nice view around. The restaurant on the 25th floor serves both western and Japanese breakfast. We only went once for western breakfast when we got tired of Japanese food. The food was ok, don't expect a huge buffet. The hotel also offers free shuttle bus service to Akasaka and Roponggi. To leave Tokyo for Narita airport, just book the bus tickets from the reception. The only negative thing is check out is officially at 11 am and our flight out was at 10.30pm. They could only extend check out to 12 noon. The rates are a bit on the higher end but this is Japan, expensive.

This hotel could not be better placed; it is on the direct airport bus route from both Narita and Haneda Airports and is built above the busiest interchange station on the Tokyo Metro system. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable with all the usual facilities, including a very good free wifi and a coffee machine, but the public areas, including the restaurant, are al little bland and functional. However, what the restaurant lacks in ambience is made up by its location on the 25th floor with spectacular views over the city. Check in and out process is amazingly quick and efficient and the prices, although a little high, are reasonable when considering the location and ease of location. If one is looking for a friendly atmospheric hotel this is not for you but if you want a functional, efficient and impersonal hotel this is absolutely perfect!

Stayed for four nights with my wife and daughters. The location is superb, right in the middle of famous Shibuya Crossing, you can watch from the hotel elevator or feel it the crowd after exiting the hotel entrance. You can spend a whole day exploring restaurant, shops etc in the surrounding hotel which is Shibuya station area. If you want to experience the the Tokyo megapolitan then this is the right place. The room is not that big, but spacious enough for family with children. The staff is polite and attentive, they helped me to call my airline to get my seat problem fix. The hotel also has a bus stop for airport bus which is very convenience so you don't have to the taxi or monorail. Definitely worth the money.

As my title says, the location of this hotel cannot be beat.After taking the airport limo bus, which not only drops you off right at the hotel, but is the easiest way to travel from the aiport into town...as we did not want to take the NEX with the luggage we had with us.Once at the hotel, a set of elevators down to the 3rd floor ( check in and lobby is on the 5th floor )will put you within walking distances of the Subway and train lines.Also on this 3rd floor you will find a great sushi restaurant, Umegaoka Sushi No Midori, the wait will be long but the sushi and the price is well worth it.Getting off on the 1st floor in the same set of elevators will take you at street level...and right into the action....a great little supermarket on one corner, and shopping malls. Highly suggest you go to the lower basement floors of these mega shopping malls and you will see what a Tokyo food court looks like...wow !!! Back to the hotel;- nice clean rooms, comfy beds, but not very huge rooms.- washrooms are small.- nice front desk and staff....booked Mt.Fuji trip, taxis, overall very helpful.

I would echo many of the other comments made – very clean, decent bed, location can’t be beat. But don’t rely on the advice others have given to “call the night before to get a room facing the Crossing”. We did, and they had none available. Facing the crossing was important to us, it’s why we booked the Excel – my wife is a photographer. When we asked again at check-in, they claimed they had no doubles facing the Crossing, but I am a bit dubious about that. Regardless, it is a good hotel and I would recommend it. (We rode the northeast corner guest-only elevator, which is made of glass and has a stunning view of the crossing, up and down a few times, to get our crossing “fix”.)

I'm so excited to add my thoughts on this hotel, because I am so pleasantly surprised by it.* ok, the rooms are small, but I'm not in Tokyo to spend my time inside the hotel. It's like New York, space is at a premium. Small room, no problem.* between the closet and drawers, I had plenty of room to put my clothes and shoes away and stow my suitcase. * in the room, they have outlets next to the bed, in the bathroom and next to a vanity mirror. Awesome!* on the nightstand, they have provided multiple charging adapters (see picture). This is brilliant. I was able to charge my iPhone and Samsung at the same time. They have 5 connector choices, including iPhone 5 as well as old 30-pin connector.* Great view of Shibuya, including the famous intersection.*location, location! A short walk to my favorite noodle place and so much shopping. The metro is right there. You are really in the heart of it at this hotel.Need to improve:* western style breakfast buffet is small and the scrambled eggs are runny. The bacon is meh. Go for the Japanese breakfast instead. * air-con turns off by itself in the middle of the night which makes for a very sweaty wake-up in the middle of August when it is hot and humid outside.*no coffee in the room, only tea. Also no bottled water. All in all, I really appreciate this hotel. I will stay here again.

Stayed here several nights when visiting Tokyo.Superb location ,near to everything,restaurants , shopping mall, ,the Yamanote MRT line was just opposite the hotel.The room was quite small but very clean.Wi-fi was strong inside the room and within the hotel.Check in and out was superbly quick.

If you're looking to hit the square for some Shibuya night life the Shibuya Hotel is the place to be. It's super convenient for traveling the rail, as you never really leave them, you just go upstairs. Rooms are small but comfortable and clean. Ask for a window view, as we where facing the main square several stories up and got some amazing pictures.
user_name:
Lisa G
Land O Lakes, Florida

review_body: Small functional hotel room but located in the heart of Shibuya and close to metro/train lines. The room was so small the bed was against one wall. However the view was fantastic, the restaurant was expensive!

Stayed here during my first visit to Japan. Although the room is a bit small compared to your usual NY hotel room, it was very clean and comfortable. Wifi access throughout the whole hotel. Perfect location for first time visitors. Close to many restaurants, shops and across the street from train station. We loved it here and would definitely return! Oh and staff is extremely helpful and friendly.

The room & toilet is big and clean. But need to improve at customer service. We've booked 2 rooms with triple bed & we requested for connection room or both rooms at the same floor, but they have only 1 room for triple bed on each floor, so we tried to ask for downgrading one of our room to double bed room as it's more than enough for us. However, the service desk was rejected our request impolitely and told us to pay extra (about 10k yen) for this option. The location of the hotel is great, it's at the Shibuya street & link to both subway and JR station. it's less than 5 mins walk to reach the station from hotel :)

If you are looking to taste the famed "warm Eastern Hospitality" ie the "Bows", the "aligato gozaimas (meaning thank you)", the "sweet smiles", etc, you are in for great disappointment with the staff of this hotel!!!From day 1 contact point, they have been slow in email response and not wanting to please during our stay.Only plus point is the location, 5mins walk to main shopping strip. Rooms were small and clean as is expected of hotels in Tokyo.Wont be back to this Hotel for sure!

I stayed at the famous Shibuya Crossing location based upon a colleague's recommendation. The hotel was everything I expected for a business trip: clean rooms, good service, good food in the hotel. The bathroom was a bit cramped but I think it was the room layout (#1601) as my colleagues mentioned theirs were not as cramped. Breakfast was great and guests have a choice between Western or Japanese, both with an incredible view of the city. Service was good but I wouldn't recommend the in room massage because they don't bring a portable massage table and the bed doesn't really work well to relax.My room had a great view of the crossing, which looked like watching ants from the 16th floor of the hotel. The location is great with easy access to the train at the lower level of the hotel. Plus there are a number shops and restaurants within walking distance.

The location is quite nice. It is very convenient for shopping. There are directly NEX train from Narita airport and the hotel is just above of the Shibuya station!! I stayed in upper floor. The view is very beautiful.The service is quite normal. In this high qality service provided country,the service in this hotel is really "normal" and didnt meet my expect. Especially the front desk staff, they might forget their smile sometimes. I also purchased japanese style breakfast for one day but I think the quality and quantity didnt meet its price.The bottled water is not provided in this hotel. You can buy the water and the food in convenience store. There are more than 3 convenience store near by the hotel.Totally this is a hotel having good location and nice view in upper floor. If the service can be improved, it will be more attractive.

It was my first time to visit Tokyo and the people recommendation was to stay at Shibuya Excel Hotel because it is close to the famous Shibuya crossing and all shopping stores. The hotel was so nice and the staff were so friendly. The good thing about the hotel is the metro and the JR are under so it easy for tourists to hop in and chose their destinations. One thing tourist must pay attention to is rooms are too small if you have a kid and more than 2 luggage they won't have a space to move comfortably.

The title sort of says it all; a mediocre, tired hotel literally attached to Shibuya station so what's most important to you? Location cannot be beat, my room overlooked Shibuya crossing and getting in and out was a treat. My room was tired,small and basic, totally comparable to an average NYC hotel room. I will admit it was clean and the Japanese toilet was indescribable. The staff upon check-in was good but the "concierge" was an absolute joke. I understand there is a language barrier but don't waste my time completely. We asked for several things, including calls to make reservations in Japanese and information on various places. They had a hard time accomplishing anything at all actually. One place where they had been busy printing out maps to for us (hello, its 2014, i don't need a hardcopy map) wasn't even open the day they sent us in. That was a total fail in my mind. When checking out, we went to the restaurant for a cup of coffee and wait for a friend. The coffee was $10 seriously. We know Tokyo can be expensive but a $10 cup of coffee without refill is out of context with the rest of the city. Overall, nothing (other than concierge) was so terrible that I can't say stay away but it just depends on what's important. I definitely understand why it was cheaper than the other things we looked at which I'm sure couldn't compete location-wise.

As everyone else has said, the Excel's location is unmatched, connected directly to the main station, and in the centre of all the bars, restaurants and shops, you are in the thick of it.We requested a room with a view of the scramble, the hotel kindly replied they would do their best. Good service! On check in we were offered a top floor room upgrade for $30 more a night, bargain for us! And what a view, directly over the scramble and over to Yoyogi park with the towers of Shinjuku in the distance.The room itself was small but perfect, all the right amenities. A very nice touch was a power outlet in the safe to charge phones etc securely. And night lights under the bedside table.But the views were incredible.The staff were very nice, but always seemed busy. At times reception were not too responsive , trying to look busy and ignoring people waiting.
