Not the same friendly encounters as other hotels.Because the location is the best, we never tried the in house dinner options , maybe next time.It would get one more star if there was a pool, but in this situation it is the best possible place to stay in Shibuya and perhaps Tokyo!

I love this hotel: great location, stunning views and lovely staff in the middle of Shibuya.There are several restaurants in the building with amazing views of the city centre! I will certainly come back.

It's at the heart of everything! Shopping, eating and partying. Right next to the famous Shibuya intersection and seconds away from JR station. The hotel is clean, modern and right on top of a shopping mall. The triple room we had was normal (means smaller) for a Japanese business hotel but we expected that with the prime location that we were in.

The hotel is very well situated in the heart of Shibuya busy shopping area. Great hotel, clean common areas, wi-fi free of charge everywhere. Breakfast buffet enough and nice view from the top floor restaurant. Rooms are clean, not very big, but large enough, comfortable bed. Shopping at your feet, really!

I think the most attractive point for the hotel is its location. Thus, let's start with the location.It is exactly above Shibuya station. There is also an airport bus station outside the hotel. You can get to the hotel from Narita by airport coach directly. On my arrival, the weather was bad with heavy rain, the airport coach helped a lot in this case.In Shibuya station, there are plenty of restaurants and stores. You can do a little bit shopping there even the weather is bad. Further, as it is exactly above the Shibuya station, it is very convenient for tourists to travel through the city.There were staff who can speak fluent English and they were nice. Next to the lobby, there was a cafe which you may have your light breakfast or supper there. For the rooms, I booked 2 smoking queen bed rooms. The size was a little bit small, but still acceptable. 1 of my room had a table (not a teapoy) which was useful when I wanted to enjoy my melons. Yet, there was something undesirable: the air-con was too weak. It would be better if you're staying in a non-smoking room. However, in a smoking room, it can be a problem. Though it had an air refresher, it'd be rather unbearable if your friend don't smoke.Above all, in light with its supreme location, I think it would be a good choice for family trip with elderly or children.

We stayed here 3 nights in June 14. Upgraded on check in to a view room (19th floor) overlooking the famous scramble crossing. Our room was clean and much bigger than we were expecting, even a little table as chairs by the window to sit and watch the crossing below. Finding the hotel the first time can be a little tricky (just keep following signs to Mark City however and you'll get there!) but once you locate it- you can easily get your bearings. We didn't eat at the hotel- prices were quite expensive there (25 breakfast) but there are heaps of fantastic little local restaurants all around you where can get an authentic Japanese meal for 1/4 of the cost of hotel dining. We would stay here again when in Tokyo. Highly recommended.

The Excel is right in top of the famous Shibuya scramble crossing and you can see it from some rooms and the lift lobbies. That was pretty cool for a girl on her first trip to a Tokyo! It's absolutely ideally situated if you want to shop in Shibuya. Plus, it's right on the (huge) train station so getting to and from the airport - or anywhere else - is a cinch. Rooms were bigger than I'd expected in Tokyo and typical nice hotel style: heavy furniture, crisp white linen etc. The breakfast upstairs is somewhat expensive but worth it as they have a good selection at the buffet. Staff seemed a little abrupt but they do speak excellent English!

Ok, the rooms aren´t amazing. But the mediocre furniture is easily forgotten thanks to the astonishing view on the city and the super good location right on Shibuya crossing. Just a trip on the glass elevator that brings you up is worth the booking. The hotel can be entered right from the train station, which at first might seem tricky, but it´s pretty cool as soon as you get how it works. Fun fact: if you´re a woman travellng alone, you´ll probably get a room in the "women only" floor. The restaurant on top didn´t look particularly nice and the menu was pretty mediocre.

As the other reviewer said: can't go wrong with the location. Location is superb, just in front of many restaurants and shopping mall. Very convenient to walk and closed to the JR or Metro station. Room is rather small but clean. And with the small room, the room rate is quite expensive compare to other hotel.

Room was rather small but clean and comfortable. I asked for another duvet but they could only give me a fleece blanket.The hotel is situated right on top of the subway station.It was extremely convenient especially when travelling with children. You can practically walk anywhere from this hotel and there are also plenty of nice restaurants around that area.We didn't have breakfast included, but it was easy to grab a bite from one of the cafes nearby. Would choose this hotel again but definitely book a bigger room!

Staying in Shibuya is a must. This was my second time staying at Excel and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else when in Shibuya. Perfect location, with a million dollar view. The rooms are big and clean. The buffet breakfast is amazing and the service was excellent. Having the train station right under your door step is a Big Plus.I just loved it there and I look forward to going back someday.

Arrived early about 8.30am early :-) needless to say i expected to wait til the official 2pm check in time (as with all things Japanese - everything starts on time). But to my surprise and after leaving our luggage with the concierge, i was called back by the front desk staff and told that our rooms would be ready by 12 noon. Brownie points great!Our rooms were decent from a Tokyo size perspective; didn't mind that there was no room service as we had already planned our itinerary back to back and expected to eat out most of the time (highly recommend Jean Francois bakery just below the hotel if you want freshly baked breads or just a few doors down there's a sushi place with a queue that starts at 10.30am for lunch). So as you can see food wasn't a problem.As most reviewers have already pointed out; the hotel itself is well placed - shops, restaurants and Jr/Metro stations all nearby. My only gripe and to some it may be small, was with the toilet paper.....or er tracing paper that they tried to pass off as toilet paper :-)All in all a decent enough stay at this hotel but might be inclined to try another hotel on my next visit.

You can't go wrong with the location. Ask for a room facing the scramble. It make for some entertaining watching. The view from the top floor breakfast room more than makes up for a breakfast that hardly changed for the 7 days I was here. There is a water drainage system in the bathroom that makes for odd smells occasionally. I got a note in my room from the front desk asking that I don't smoke in the room....I never did! Otherwise the service is solid and nice. The glass elevator at night makes a great video.

Spent a week at this wonderful hotel in the heart of Tokyo. The service is excellent and the staff is very kind. There is an excellent breakfast on the top floor, 25th level with a magnificent view of Mt. Fuji on a clear day. There was a strong quake while I was there and the hotel held up perfectly. Not even a crack! The only issue is that the hotel is not easily accessible from the street. You have to go up a long driveway to the entrance. There is a nice cafe in the lobby area.

I think this hotel is very nice to stay because of the location. It's great to have a JR line near the hotel so that I can travel easily.The rooms are big enough for me. Good views to see from the inside of the room. Also,comfortable bed.However,as a muslim,the western breakfast doesn't serve beef most of the time. It's quite dissappointing because breakfast is important before having sightseeing activities.All in all,book this hotel if you need JR line the most on your holiday or simply have a great view of Tokyo!

I truly do not like being negative but must say my stay at the Excel Hotel in Shibuya last week was most disappointing. This was my third trip to the region in the past year, and the first time I paid so much for a room (due to my trip being so last minute my usual place was booked out!) I was initially completely surprised by the fact I did not at all feel welcome when I checked in at the reception desk - which is so NOT the Japanese way. Their customer service is usually beyond reproach. And, at over $300 a night for my room, this was the first hotel I have ever stayed anywhere in the world where one's luggage is not taken to the room for the guests. More an observation than a complaint however. I had flown into Tokyo at 8.30am so by the time I arrived at Shibuya it was more 11am and too early to check into my room so I went out walking for hours. Returned to take occupancy of my room, desperate for a cold water, and not a single thing in the bar fridge: nothing. I checked the documentation and no 'room service' either until later in the day.Towels - I would advise packing your own. Towels in the room extremely thin - matching the oh-so-thin toilet tissue.I found it difficult finding my way around and, as an elderly person, thought it would have been wonderful if I was told that the airport limousine had dropped me at the fifth floor, and I then had been given a map to work out exactly how to get around the hotel.On a positive note, the room was larger than the 'normal' standard accommodation space in Japan. Beautifully presented bed linen. Great view of course. Fabulous location if you are a train user, but I do think there is much room for improvement - particularly for the cost.

Stayed for 6 days during Golden Week, 2014. The entrance to the hotel is pretty hard to find but if you're at a place called "shibuya mark city" then you're within the vicinity of the hotel. Shibuya Excel Hotel staff did not speak english well. The clerk, however, spoke english well but his attitude wasn't that welcoming. What I mean is that it seemed he was tired and wanted to go home. I'm not asking for much but at least put on a smile, you know? Anyway, the other staff were friendly and polite.Room: Very tiny (I'm used to US-room standards), yet clean. The AC would not turn on unless the lights were on, which was odd. Bathroom was small and came with basic amenities. View: Stayed in the 20th (out of 25) floor and we had an amazing view of the city. Although we requested a view of shibuya crossing, it was only a partial view of it. Value: It was definitely a fair price (around 150USD/night)Food: We didn't order any but we had wine at their local restaurant.Proximity to Shibuya station: 3 minute walkNote: Shibuya is a pretty sketchy place to walk around at night. I was offered adult services numerous times by rude vietnamese touts who get angry if you ignore them. In addition, if you go north to kabukicho, you'll probably be constantly bothered by nigerian touts inviting you to check out their bar. Bottom line: No pool or fitness center. I'd recommend this place if you know Japanese well or if you're a local. In the future, I think I'd stay in Roppongi or Shinjuku.
user_name:
Jay S
New Brunswick, New Jersey

review_body: My favorite hotel in the city! From the valet to the bartender every single staff member is polite and friendly. The suites are immaculate. Not a single detail is over looked at this beautiful historic land mark. I recommend it to anyone visiting Dallas or anyone just wanting to get away from the kids for the weekend. Beautiful!!

I stayed at this hotel twice. Room was large for Tokyo standard, great view. Best location in Tokyo Hotel is on top of station Shibuya JR and metro. You can go to hotel from airport by airport shuttle.

Very nice and convinient hotel in the center of shibuya. We stayed at the 23. floor with an amazing view over Yoyogi Park way to Shinjuku. The room was great, very clean (but i must say the standard for japanese hotels is very high though), it was the perfect size and the rates are very affordable. If you are in Tokyo to explore the city, thats the perfect place to stay. Tons of small restaurants around (lots of places in shibuya are open alsomst 24h, so if you have to fight a jet lag, the best thing we did is to have some gyoza and soba at 3 in the morning). The hotel is connected (!!!) with the Shibuya railway/subway station, what more can i say? Of course it is a big hotel with lots of room, if you are looking for a small boutique hotel with personal service thats not the right one, but still we felt very good stying in Excel Tokyo Shibuya.

We enjoyed the stay at the Excel and the room was comfortable and large by Tokyo standards with a small couch, and great view (we were on floor 22). Room was quiet enough although can still hear trains a little, since it is literally on top of Shibuya JR and Metro stations. The room quality is good but not great. Reminded us of hotels in China with nice looks but some cheap things too. Bathroom door is like cardboard. Cell phone charger didn't function. They supplied two bottles of water upon arrival and that was it! No refills the next day. They really missed an opportunity with this too. Instead of explaining that they had excellent tap water (they did) and they were trying to save the earth from water bottles, they simply said we should buy water at the vending machine on our floor! Pretty cheap for a room that costs several hundred per night! Coffee machine was nice (Nespresso) and they have a good quantity of plugs to use for electrical devices. TV ok - but no English stations at all, except pay. Refrigerator good. Bed was comfortable, but pillows not that nice (one foam, one regular) and too small for bed. Room maid service adequate. Shower good. Toilet spray seat of poor quality and did not work consistently (noisy too). All in all, we enjoyed staying here - right on top of the Shibuya "Times Sq" area and some of the restaurants in Mark City are also good. So convenient for trains too. The hotel quality is good but not great. But quite a bit less than the average hotel of this quality in Tokyo.

The location, obviously. That trip down in the glass elevator overlooking Shibuya crossing is good fun. Great view, so try to get as high up as possible (we were on 19th). Also, perfect for coming out of the station after a day of sight-seeing and straight into the hotel. Lots of great places to eat within 10 mins walk. More than that though, this is just a very nice place to stay - we paid a bit extra for a three-person room but it was worth it. It was the biggest room we had anywhere in Japan, three good-size beds plus lounge area. Interestingly, the toilet and bathroom were separate, which is useful but unusual, particularly in space-conscious Japan. The breakfast is a bit overpriced for what it is but again - the view. Staff were very helpful, especially in storing luggage and booking the bus to the airport - no hassle at all, just walk straight on from the lobby. All in all, a bit pricey compared to other places we stayed but worth it for our final splurge in Tokyo.

Like everyone else says you can't beat the location right over the famousCrossing .And the good thing is when they say a room sleeps 3There are 3 full beds in a room and not a rollaway .But the beds are very hard, and lumpy , not sure WhAts in the mattresses.

This Hotel overlooks the famous Shibuya intersection and gives a feel of being at the center of High Activity Zone (aka Time Square of Tokyo). This place is easily accessible to everything like Public Transportation, Shopping Malls, Restaurants, Theaters, Pachinko's, Super stores etc.The rooms are small but decent enough for a business trip. They donot have complimentary breakfast but thats less of a problem as you Starbucks and Excelsior in the same building . It would be better if they provided bottled water in the rooms atleast on the first day until we figure out the vending machine. From 26th floor, I got a fantastic view of the Shibuya Junction and you can pretty much see Shinjuku, Yoyogi park and a beautiful Sunset towards western hills.The Coldstone creamery that is on the 4th floor of the same building is a must visit.The Staff is not as hospitable as I have seen in other Hotels in Tokyo.There are hundreds of eateries around this place and you can find pretty much every kind of cuisine.

The Hotel is located right above the Shibuya station which was fantastic due to the convenience! Easy access to transportation, food, shopping, clubs, etc.The room was a reasonable size. There was three of us in the one room and so they had put an additional rollaway double bed into the room. As a result there was not a lot of space to put luggage but we managed. The bathroom was a good size.There are numerous entrances to the hotel (eg. through the shopping centre). At first, it can be a bit difficult to navigate, but you will get the hang of it. If you're staying out at night, be sure to know which entrances you can access the hotel through.The hotel offers great photo opportunities of the Shibuya crossing!

It's all about the Location...easy to look for food and shopping near the hotel. Located connected to the subway. Personally found the rooms a bit small considering the price, but great view. Had a clear view of the Shibuya intersection...one of the busiest street in Japan. Absolutely safe and convenient location. Amazing view at the breakfast buffet...it was definitely a great experience, worth a stay!!

One of the drawbacks of being on a package tour is that they put you up either in an airport hotel, miles away from city lights, or in some hostelry meant for foreign visitors, whose guests come from all over the world, except the country where the hotel is located.The Shibuya Excel Hote avoids both these drawbacks. It is located in downtown Tokyo. Actually Tokyo has many down towns. This one is the downtown for Tokyo's citizens. The hotel is surrounded by all things Japanese- Japanese shops, Japanese food places, including multi-cuisine restaurant choices,and Japanese people. In fact the hotel forms the top floors of the local railway station. so if you wish to travel cheap all around Tokyo, using the subway system, you cant hope to stay in a better place.The rooms are large, all the windows have cityscape, so it doesn't matter which floor you are on. When evening falls, the city lies spread out below, twinkling like a thousand diamonds. The view justifies the location.The beds are large. there is a flat screen TV, a mini fridge with tea & coffee service, and free wifi connection.The toilets are high-tech, with artificial intelligence, that makes you momentarily uncomfortable, but you quickly get used to, and even enjoy the warmed seats, the bidet & water spray functions with their controlled speed and pressure. They grow on you.The restaurant serving breakfast is on the top floor. The breakfast, included in room charges, is a buffet with separate rooms for "European" and Japanese breakfasts. Although the spread is incredibly large, and the seating adequate, I would advise that one goes early, as the waiting lines become long, if you reach late. The coffee is excellent.I enjoyed the hotel and the bust bustling area in which it is located.

Great location - you can see it just outside the subway. Also few minutes walk from one of the best ramen in restaurant in Tokyo, Yichiran ramenAwesome view - you can see floods of people crossing the streets from your room, one of the most amazing and interesting views you can get in ShibuyaNeedless to say, the staff is nice and helpful, like many others in Japanese hotels.

Right in Shibuya Train Station and close to the hussle and bussle, Amazing Breakfast Buffet and great view from the top roof restaurant, rooms are small, but its Japan. The only thing its I got in around 8pm on a Friday and they gave me a smoking room.... so make shure you tell them when you make reservations bout it....

Great location above Shibuya Station, overlooking the most famous crossing of Tokyo! Rooms are big, even for the solo traveler. I've been in this hotel four times, two of them with family, and I'll be going again next month. Highly recommended.

Location, location ,location...you can not beat where this hotel is ...Mark City Building where the hotel is is in Shibuyu station ..you cannot get a better location ...right in the center of Shibuyu next to great restaurants and the vibrant city ....right in the train station ..incredible!!The hotel is first class with everything you need right there in the hotel....you will love this hotel...my wife and I did ....We would absolutely stay at this hotel again....

Pros - Superb location. The hotel is right in front of the famous Shibuya Scramble Crossing. Plentyof eateries nearby including food halls insides departmental stores like Tokyu and Seibu that conveniently located near the hotel. The hotel was inside a shopping mall called Shibuya Mark City. The airport shuttle bus (Airport Limousine) stops directly in front of the hotel lobby.Cons - Hotel check-in staff unfriendly and cold. Did not feel any warmth in the handling of my check-in process. No smiles was seen on any of the staff's faces. They were also very inflexible when I asked for my check out to be extended. All they allowed was an hour and anymore than that was chargeable. I also felt that they were not approachable, maybe because I'm not Japanese.....The room was also not cleaned up well as dirty glasses and used yukata was still left lying around even after the room was supposedly cleaned. The pillows were also not arranged properly and neatly, just thrown on the bed.To be honest, the popularity of this hotel is solely due to its location. If not for the location, this hotel will not be worth anything or even worth any mention!!!

The hotel is right across the Shibuya station and in from the famed shibuya crossing. The rooms are a little small and the check in strictly at 3pm. There is a big mall next door and plenty of eateries. Across the road and within walking distance, there are many shops- local and international brands. The Hachiko statute is nearby as well.

Absolutely loved this hotel. It is not a luxurious hotel and the rooms are small, but who stays in the room for long anyway? It has everything we needed, and more: toiletries, kimonos, slippers, ironing board, hair dryer, and dehumidifier. The free wifi in the rooms worked perfectly, which was a great plus, and the beds were super comfortable. We can choose between the Japanese breakfast or the western buffet breakfast, both which were fine. But what tops it all was the location!! The location is just second to none: right in the middle of everything. Shibuya in itself is already a great area, and the Shibuya Excel Tokyu Hotel is in the middle of where all the action is. Everything is right there at your doorstep: endless shops, department stores, supermarkets and convenient stores, and a wide array of restaurants. You don't have to worry about running out of cash because you can find an ATM on the 9th floor of the Tokyu Department Store just across the hotel, and also on the 7th floor of the Shibuya 109 for Women. It is directly linked to the Shibuya train station, right at the famous Shibuya crossing (which we can see from the room). The Narita limousine bus stops in front of the hotel which made it very convenient for travelers with large suitcases. What more can you ask for? Should I return to Tokyo, I would not bother to look for another hotel. The Shibuya Excel Tokyu Hotel is THE hotel of choice.

This location is perfect in meeting our needs. First off, the airport limousine bus which we took from Narita (right off the arrival area) stops right in the hotel entrance. A must for us and huge convenience with all the luggage we had. We felt very comfortable and safe in the bus.We purchased the 2 day round trip Bus and Subway combo for $60.00 each-what a bargain since we used the 2 day pass while exploring the City.Check-in was a breeze, with staff very welcoming and helpful. Our room was more than I expected- huge, full of amenities (robes, slippers, etc.) with comfortable beds.Our room was facing a brightly lit huge billboard but the heavy curtains with shades helped a lot. We also had a nice view of the Shibuya crossing which was an entertainment by itself. The hotel is in a busy area but the noise level is controlled and we had a great night's sleep. There's a lot of choices for places to eat, a department store and convenience store in the hotel center. 2 floors down is the food hall with so many choices. In the hotel's vicinity is a plethora of shopping and dining destinations. It's a one stop shop for us and very ideal for short visits. The subway line is across the hotel, and can be accessed through the walkway bridge in the hotel- again, so ideal since it was raining on the days we were in Japan. Had breakfast on the 25th floor and it was so nice-the view, food selection and service was fantastic. Breakfast was $25.00 and well worth it. Took a cab to the Meiji Shrine ($8.00) and walked to Harajuku. On the way back, Harajuku was a short subway ride. Upon check-out, the staff helped us with our luggage to the bus, and took care of all boarding requirements. Much more efficient than airline travel. I really love this hotel and location and will definitely stay here again.

There were really many positives about this hotel: really efficient staff, very clean rooms, really comfortable beds, wonderful view of the Shinjuku skyline, great location in Shibuya with easy access to JR and subway as well as so many good restaurants and bars in the area (I really think Shibuya is the best area to stay in Tokyo). And most importantly, we had all of this at a really reasonable price (about 175$ a night) which is why I give this a 5-star rating.The only downside is that the room size is quite small compared to international standards, but this is Tokyo where it seems to be the norm. Also I guess if you don't get a room on one of the upper floors your view won't be as nice. Finally, breakfast is overpriced at 2,500 yen, but it was nice to get some fruits and vegetables in the morning.

Being my first time in Japan I was kind of lost and of course had no phone or wifi access but as soon as my girlfriend and I left the Shibuya station we found the hotel without any issues. It was great. The location made it so incredibly easy to get to the metro station and back to the hotel. The wifi worked wonderfully, the rooms were nice and warm. The view from the room however is what really made me fall in love with the hotel. It was an amazing view. Great places to eat near by as well.It is constantly crowded due to the location but it is very quiet inside the hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I get the chance.

As you can tell from my other reviews, when in Tokyo, I usually stay at the Granbell Shibuya. However, this time it was completely full so my second choice was the Tokyu Excel Hotel Shibuya.As most reviewers noted, this is a very very convenient hotel pretty much attached to Shibuya Station.Why from two stars to four stars you ask? Upon check-in, I had requested a high floor non-smoking room. The staff at the check-in punched a few keys on his computer a few time and said nothing about my request and handed me the room keys to a 7th floor smoking room. He then brought out a laminated flyer asking if I would like to pay extra for a nice room. This hotel was already more expensive than the Granbell so I declined. As a single male traveler who can rough it at times, I thought I could handle the room.... wrong! The room reeked of cigarettes. The lighting in the room was dim. The bed was against a wall that had scratched wallpaper. View, what view? Open the drapes and you can see a retaining wall. I gave in and called the concierge to ask how much it would cost to upgrade to those fancy rooms. $40 USD a night.What a difference! I got the top floor, 24th (25th is actually their highest but that's where the restaurants are). The room was non-smoking with two double bets. Huge bathroom. Fantastic view of Shibuya. The room was large not only compared to Japan hotels, but compared to any hotel world wide. It was spotlessly clean with an air cleaner/humidifier. The air conditioning worked perfectly. Large TV and all the bathroom toiletries you need. Should I book this hotel next time, I would definitely ask for the rooms on the 24th floor. For an extra $40, definitely worth the upgrade.

I go to Tokyo at least 2 to 3 times a year and I usually stay at Century Southern Tower in Shinjuku. My girlfriend found a deal at Shibuya Excel so we decided to give it a try.The moment I walked into the hotel it was crowded and noisy. It did not help when I just arrived from a 12 hour flight. The lobby is very small and the front desk staff is very cold. I cannot say she is not nice but just not the warm, big smiles I used to get from most Japanese front staff. Believe it or not during my 4 day of stay, every time I need to ask someone at the front desk, it had always been this girl.We stayed at the ladies' floor. The carpet was quite old and dirty. They do provide cleanser, toner, moisturizer in sample size each night from Shiseido for ladies' only rooms and it is a nice touch. Other than that, the room looks quite outdated and nothing special.We also tried both the Western and the Japanese breakfast. The Japanese breakfast is ok but definitely have better ones at the hot spring hotels. The western breakfast lacks variety and quality is only so-so. It is right connected to the Shibuya station and a department store which could be both plus and minus. Of course it is convenient but at the same time it is also super crowded and busy all the time. I would not recommend doing the Narita Express as it is a long and confusing walk to the hotel. Take the Limousine bus instead.I guess I am just too used to the standard of Century Southern Tower in Shinjuku - they have way better service, large and calmer lobby, newer rooms and better breakfast. Price wise these two hotels are very similar. I cannot think of any reasons why I would stay here again if Century is available.

Pros: Location: Shibuya is really, really convenient, close to Meiji shrine as harajuku Staff spoke decent EnglishGood viewCons:Location: living in shibuya is like living in Times Square in NYC. Tons of foot traffics and can be a little overwhelmingNot a lot of dining options: tons of fast food but all he good restaurants are in the ginza areaRoom: small which is expected for tokyo, but I found the beds to be really uncomfortable and he pillows to be really hardGiven the chance, I would probably try to find a hotel in the shinjuku/ginza areas the next time I visit

We stayed here on our first night in Tokyo. The hotel was very easy to find on the Yamanote Line from Tokyo Haneda. The hotel was literally linked to the Shibuya station which made it incredibly easy. The sushi restaurant in the complex was amazing, and outside the hotel elevator. Would stay here again.

Location was good at Shibuya Crossing with lots of activity at night. One stop to Harajuku and two stops to Shinjinku via JR Rail. Rooms were ok, nothing spectacular about them. One thing I did not like about it was the really hard pillows.One thing to note is that if you are coming from Narita and using the NEX there are no signs or directions as to what exit to use inside the station. Use Tamagawa Exit (think spelled wrong) and look for the sign to hotel, but FYI he are easy to miss. However you can take the airport limousine bus and it will drop you off right in front.

My stay at Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu was GREAT!!!! The staff was really helpful when it came to providing directions and maps for my trip in Tokyo. From our room, the view was fantastic as we were able to see the Tokyo tower and city lights at night. My friend and I were very excited about the location as it was PERFECT!!! The Shibuya Crossing can be seen from the hotel windows and is located right outside the hotel entrance. Great restaurants and shopping is located near the hotel so be prepared to do some walking because the neighborhood is filled with stores for both men and women. Harajuku was only one train stop away about 5- 7mins, while the Tokyo Tower was 15-20 minutes away and Tokyo Disneyland is only 25-30 mins from Shibuya Station, which made the location even better as the Shibuya Station entrance and exit is located right next door or across the street (depending on where you exit) to the hotel. The rooms were comfy, the staff was really pleasant and though we didn't want daily cleaning, they did provide us with towels and other items needed daily. The Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is a nice gem at a great price, will definitely stay here again!!!!

We stayed in a four bed room with our two children. The room was a reasonable size although not huge with a large bathroom. The room was clean and the beds were very comfy and we all slept very well. We had breakfast included which was on the 25th floor with an awesome view and a good selection of Western foods. The location is excellent being attached to Shibuya Station. The area is very interesting with Scramble crossing and lots of shopping. The station makes it a good base for sightseeing. We stayed for just the last night on our way out of Japan. Our children found the area very busy and crowded and I am glad we did not stay here on our first nights in Japan at the start of our trip as it may have been overwhelming for our young kids.

This hotel is conveniently connected to Shibuya station while this place could be your central of activity for shopping, dining or even sightseeng. I personally stayed in Tokyo for almost 8 years, thus very familiar and have valid reason why I choose Shibuya as place to stay.The hotel is very clean and well equipped with the best material you can find, such as tempur etc.The room itself is very spacious compared with its peers and offered spectacular view if you stay at higher floor.I plan to visit Tokyo sometime this year and will pick this hotel as our place to enjoy busy life in Tokyo.

This was my second time to stay at this hotel and I will definitely return for further stays. Shibuya is a hub of restaurants, shops, entertainment and transportation and a perfect location for a Tokyo stay (unless you're looking for some place quiet and serene). Over the years I've stayed in many of the hotels in the area and I find the Excel Hotel Tokyu to be my favorite. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean and the views are great.
user_name:
JuhaUitto
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's location is very convenient and is next to Shibuya JR station. The room is clean and there are many shopping malls and convenience stores nearby. There is a lift which is convenient for residents to transfer from the shopping mall up to the hotel lobby. There are cafés and restaurants in the Mark City Centre.

We stayed here for 4 days while visiting Tokyo for the first time. We easily arrived here from the airport and did not have a problem transporting our baggage from Shibuya station on our own. They were able to accommodate a request for view of the Shibuya crossing and we enjoyed the changing view morning to night. Although the rooms are small, they have everything you need and are surprisingly quiet. From this destination, we were able to explore Harajuku, Shibuya, Akihabara, Ginza, Odaiba and Shinjuku, while stopping back at our hotel before dinner for a bit of a rest before wandering around Shibuya. Front staff were helpful and polite. Would stay here again when visiting Tokyo.

I only had a couple of days in Tokyo and was looking to be somewhere convenient for transport to/from the airport as well as in a good launching spot for other typical tourist attractions in the city. I was really happy with place. It is at the famous mega-crosswalk that is so often featured in films on Tokyo with the zebra crossings zigzagging across the street. The ride to the Tokyo Airport can take a while and the Shibuya station is one that has a direct connection, which was a plus for me. The main train station is right across the street from the hotel which I really appreciated. The vibrant and interesting neighborhoods of Harajuku and Shinjuku are nearby and it didn't take look at all to get to the fish market, Ginza or the Imperial Palace from where I was. There were tons of great stores and restaurants just a stone's throw from this hotel and since it was pouring when I was there, that was definitely a plus. The hotel itself was ok. I had a nice view of the famous crosswalk and was high enough to see the city skyline. The rooms were nothing special though - fairly small, but from what I've read they seem to have been on par with other hotel rooms of this size and class. Breakfast was not included and I never found the gym, but there were enough places nearby for breakfast and I did enough walking that it really didn't matter too much. So, in short, I would say that if you're looking for a convenient launching spot for a short trip to Tokyo and don't plan on spending much time in your room, this is a great place. It was clean and efficient, but the location was everything.
user_location: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
user_name:
garspolyglotte
Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA

review_body: This hotel is located just above the Shibuya station on 2 lines, the Yamanote and the Ginza. It is in actually part of Shibuya Mark City so location-wise, there's really not much to say as everyone else has commented.The rooms size were reasonable and were clean.A common problem in Japanese hotels: insufficient power plugs for chargers.The breakfast provided (both continental and japanese) were not very good.

The hotel is very clean, the breakfast is quite good I must say. The food is always freshly prepared, and the service was excellent. The view also frm the restaurant is quite spectacular as you cvan see mount Fuji on a sunny day. What I also like about the hotel is that it is very closde to the subway station which has a lot of shops, as yu know most stations in the East are also shopping malls. It is just so convenient and you can also get fresh rice parcels and sushi-freshly prepare.

This was our second stay at this hotel within a year, so basically our first stay was good thats why we decided to stay there again. Very convinient since it is located in the central part of Tokyo. Its 5 mins away from everything. The only thing is, we forgot to mention to book us on a non smoking floor, since we were tired from the trip, we decided to stay. Once you get out of the lift, you can really say its a smoking floor as you can smell the difference. Breakfast had a few selection but it was good and fresh. Rooms and bathroom were clean. We put a Do not Disturb sign but when we got back, the room was cleaned. Didnt mind to inform the front desk because only a few knew how to speak little english. Overall stay was good.

The Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is a well run facility, with very helpful and knowledgable staff. The hotel is located right at the Shibuya "hub" of transportation (subway is basically AT the hotel) and busses, shopping and restaurants. With the great selection of restaurants within 5 minutes walk, one does barely need to venture out to get fantastic Japanese specialities (however, see "Caution" below). The hotel has good meeting room facilities, albeit rather expensive (approx $50 for two hours and there's a minimum of 1 drink order per meeting participant). The meeting facilities tend to get booked, so make sure this is secured before setting meeting agenda etc.Hotel rooms are small, but clean and beds very comfortable. Beware though that "non smoking" needs to be emphasized upon both booking and check-in (apparently, since I was first given a smoking room). The breakfast is a little minimalistic in selection, and the breakfast room is rather starkly lit (resembles a cantina at a struggling company at best…) and the breakfast is not cheap (approx $22 for the "buffet").So…the "Caution"…: If you ask the concierge at the hotel for restaurant suggestions, make sure you indicate the price level you're looking for, since restaurants can vary widely on pricing, even for "entry level" Japanese foods like Tempura. We were recommended an (allegedly) fabulous tempura restaurant around the corner, to realize that the menu (which was sparse) had main courses typically in the range $80-110 (for food that you would expect to pay $15 for at most elsewhere. But, the concierge staff was excellent, great command of English, great smiles and always there to assist to find a "regularly priced" restaurant too. I will stay again, and now knowing what to ask for and how to book the meeting facilities and get the right restaurants.And… there are plenty cafés and coffee shops (including Starbucks) right at the floor levels below the hotel… the hotel's reception is at the 5th floor of the building...

When booking a hotel, location and cleanliness are always at the top of my list. When it came down to staying in tokyo, I knew i wanted to be at either Shibuya or Shinjuku station and ended up at the Shibuya Excel.Service: Very helpful and accomodating! Japanese hospitality is second to none. I had contacted the hotel 3 months prior to see if they would hold our luggage for a week while we traveled throughout Japan by train (we were coming back after to stay). They promptly and politely replied that it was no problem. Upon check in, the front desk clerk had told me that they had saw my booking request to be on a higher floor. I was informed we were going to be staying on the top (24th) floor of the hotel. Despite the clerk's broken English, he did his best to tell us about local restaurants and shops in the area. Location: It is actually part of the Shibuya station - you don't even need to go outside to enter the hotel. Look for signs and head towards the Shibuya Mark City complex. The lobby is located on the 5th floor of the building - you can enter from the 3rd floor of the Mark city or 1st floor from ground level. Note that if you're coming via Narita Express, you have to make you way to an upper platform and walk along that for 300m. We spent half an hour in the train station looking for the right way out. The hotel itself looks down on the famous shibuya crossing with many dining and shopping options nearby.Room: Small room by north american standards (~200sq ft) but typical for Asia. We had a double room with just enough room for 2 large suitcases. Bathroom was compact but clean. We had a fantastic view from our room on the 24th floor. Didn't hear any noise from the rooms beside us but strangely, could hear the occasional ambulance down near the shibuya crossing. AC/Heater worked fine and was quiet.Overall: We got a great deal on this hotel as we booked early. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

If you aren't a smoker, make sure you explicitly confirm a non-smoking room before arrival. I booked through Kayak and wasn't asked online.When I got stuck with a smoking room I found the staff to be less accommodating then hotels that cost 1/4 of the price.

We spent two nights at the Excel and found it to be just great. Our room was very nice, some would think it's small but it had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. Our room was on the 22nd floor, we had a view of the Olympic stadium and the Shinjuku. Shibuya station and Mark City are part of the hotel complex, making it very convenient to catch a subway or grab dinner. We could see Shibuya crossing from our room and watching the crossing from above was really cool! The staff was very friendly (they even drew out the subway route we had to take to the fish market) . We found this hotel to be an exceptional value for the area. The Friendly Airport limousine stops at the Excel for both Narita and Haneda airports.

Stayed for 6 nights from 10th November for business. Great location in middle of hustle and bustle of Shibuya, right on Shibuya crossing! Great + that airport limousine bus from Narita stops right outside! Rooms a little small, VERY comfortable bed and really quite acceptable as I was only in the room to sleep - only thing missing was a 'comfy' chair only chair was a desk type chair! Bathroom small but perfectly usable. All kept spotlessly clean and tidy - free wifi in room great bonus! Didn't eat breakfast here as cost prohibitive on my budget, but plenty of cafes/restaurants within a couple of minutes walk. Would definitely stay again next time in Tokyo!

I stayed at this hotel for several days. It was the horrible experience. Because my travel agency didn't remark the no-smoking room for me, I just knew the hotel prepared the smoking room while I were checking in and I requested them to change the room immediately. But I arrived the hotel late, so I understood it should be not available for the empty no-smoking room at that day. I said if they can change the room for one or two days during my stay, it will be very appreciated. But they just said "No" and do nothing, then only give me a bottle of deodorant after I called the room service many times. Because there was really terrible smell around the room. These days, I felt I am going to be sick. If you never smoke, how can you stand up to any smoking smell for many days? 我住在這間飯店幾天，那是我最糟糕的經驗。因為我委託的旅行社未特別註明需要禁菸房，所以飯店為我安排了吸菸房時。我在辦理入住手續時，拜託他們立即幫忙換房。但因為入住當天我抵達飯店的時間也有點晚，所以我可以理解也許當天已無空的禁菸房，我說如果可以在我入住的幾天中換個一、兩天，我就會很感激了。但他們就是說“不”，並未曾為我做任何的事。只給我一瓶除臭劑在我打了很多通電話給客房服務後，因為那整個房間充滿著可怕的味道。那些天，我覺得我就快要生病了。如果你完全不抽菸，你怎麼能忍受得了任何菸味那麼多天呢？このホテルに何日間滞在した。。最悪な経験だった。委託した旅行会社は特別に禁煙室を注文しなかったので、チェックインする際に、ホテルは喫煙室を用意したことを知って、直ちに禁煙室へ交換することをお願いした。私の到着時間が遅いので、当日は無理かもしれないことを理解していて、滞在中に一日や二日でもいいので交換できればとても感謝するとお願いしたが、受付の方は”できない”だけ言って、何もしてくれなかった。部屋中にひどい匂うがして、何度も客室サービスに電話して、ようやく一本の除臭剤だけくれた。あの数日間、私が病気になりそうだった。全然タバコを吸わない人はどうやって数日間タバコの匂いに耐えられますか？
user_name:
zz1012
New York City, New York

review_body: Since we were only staying in Tokyo for three nights this location was perfect for us. We had a nice non-smoking room overlooking Shibuya Crossing and getting there was easy with Airport Limousine since they dropped us off right outside the lobby. Being right over the mall and subway station was really convenient since it rained hard for the first day we were there. We never bothered with the breakfast as there were other choices in the mall for much less money. There was also an ATM, convenience store and drug store in the mall.The staff was friendly and although the room was spacious and well appointed, I thought when I booked it that there would be two twin beds, not one double. We couldn't change so a friend and I had to share but it was big enough for the two of us to sleep comfortably. The shower was excellent and the beds comfortable. We requested extra pillows and a blanket and they were provided. The free wifi was also a nice feature. I would highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Shibuya.

If you just need a place to rest your head, this is the perfect place for you. It is in a very central location, with extremely easy access to the subway and walking distance to many restaurants. However, rooms are tiny and pretty bare minimum. Service at the front desk is confusing and not very friendly. We asked for a map/directions to a restaurant and a woman at the front desk said she sent it to our room. However, upon arriving in our room, there was clearly no fax or anything that would allow for the map/directions to be sent to our room. So, we had to go back down and request the map/directions again. Upon check-out, they gave us directions and reservation confirmation to another restaurant that we had gone to the evening before. They are very confused and disorganized at the front desk/concierge. You won't get much of a level of service here - just a small clean room in a great location. I would definitely stay in this location again, or Shinjuku, but would choose a better hotel with better staff.

Actually, the hotel is in the Mark City East complex opposite the Shibuya Station. An entrance is on the right as you enter the mall - the lift will take you to level 5, which is the lobby. Try to get rooms overlooking the "scramble crossing".Rooms are large, well appointed. There's a restaurant row in the Mark City complex, as well as connection to Shibuya and other rail lines, so there is no need to go outside to connect. We will definitely return to this hotel the next time we are in Japan.

Recently I had to stay in Tokyo on business and stumbled on a very nice hotel right in the middle of the busiest part of Shibuya . The hotel is clean and the service is typically Japanese . Great service , very polite and nothing is too much trouble . This hotel also puts on a western breakfast or you can choose to have a typical Japanese breakfast . Either way the value for money in Tokyo is very good . This is not the kind of hotel I would take my wife to on a romantic weekend , but it is perfect for a businessman on the move . Give it a try .

The hotel is across the road from Shibuya station and towers above a shopping mall. It overlooks the famous Shibuya crossing and if you ask for a high level room overlooking the crossing, the view is incredible. The room we had was nice and had everything we needed for our stay (our luggage didn't arrive in Tokyo with us so the toiletries and clothes freshener were much appreciated). The hotel seemed to cater for business travellers but we were on holiday and it really suited us. Shibuya is one of the nicer areas of Tokyo so I think we chose well. We didn't eat in the hotel but we did have a drink in the bar. We got a window seat and enjoyed watching the world go by way below us. The staff in the bar and at reception were very efficient and helpful.

Perfect location for travellers. Located above the main train station, you can take the Narita Express to/from the airport. Hotel rooms also seem bigger than the other hotels I've stayed in Shibuya within the same price range. Reception is very friendly. It was a rainy week when I was there, and all the guests were offered umbrellas to take them out with. Very good experience

The location is fantastic to be your base for travel around Tokyo. Firstly, the airport limousine bus stops here directly. Next, the famous shibuya crossing is literally just downstairs. This means you are a stone's throw from the yamanote JR line as well as 2 other Tokyo metro lines. So getting to other parts of Tokyo is a breeze.4 of us shared a room comfortably. The room was clean and had a fantastic view of the city.Only bummer is that there was only 1 toilet, so we had to take turns using it. Only consolation is that toilet and bath areas were located separately, so it wasn't too bad.Overall, for the location, it's definitely value. Shibuya is a fantastic place to make your base in Tokyo. And this has been my 8th trip to Tokyo already and have stayed all over. My next trip will be at Shibuya Excel.

This is a great hotel in a perfect location. It is a drop off point for the airport express bus and it is on a metro station and across the street from the train station. It is connected to a huge mall and surrounded by restaurants, shops and other malls. Transportation to other parts and sights in Tokyo is steps away and very efficient. The buffet for breafast is limited,but adequate. The staff is helpful and most speak English. The rooms are very clean and roomy. We went on a couple of tours and the free pickup hotel was five minutes walking from our hotel. Wifi was great and free.

I've been to Tokyo a few times and it's hard to find a bad hotel. Most are very clean / have great service etc etc.The big difference between Hotels for tourists is location. If you have kids / teenagers - stay in Shibuya. Theres no better located hotel than the excel if you have teenagers / older juniors. It's located right on top of the station right in the heart of the action. Kids love this spot. Millions of them. If your older, or are not travelling with kids - Stay in Shinjuku. Couple of traps. The Southern Century and Sunroute (both popular choices on trip advisor) are NOT in Shibuya. They are in Shinjuku. If you are travelling to Tokyo - these two major locations should be where you stay. Shinjuku or Shibuya.

The hotel is so convenient. From Narita airport you can take the narita express so cheap if you take return trip or one way trip with suica card included (only for foreigners) or limousine bus. Limousine bus might be more practical if you have a lot of luggages. If you take narita express you might need to at least get down some stairs with your luggages in order to go to the hotel from Shibuya station. but afterwards the building is connected to the hotel building. For the room : I got the 7th floor room (actually the first floor for the rooms) even facing Shibuya crossing you got no views except for a big publicity panel. This room was very depressing and the bed very uncomfortable. Asked for another room at higher floor and were told no more big bed room but only twin bed room left at higher floor and would have to pay 2000Yen per night. I took the upgrade for the nights left (except the first night) and were very happy then. The view was wonderful and the bed was much better. The rooms are quit small but for Tokyo and the price it was good.For the service : very good as everywhere in Tokyo, people are willing to help but not everybody could speak good English.I will go back to Tokyo for sure as I really enjoyed the city but might try Shinjuku instead of Shibuya as there is not much to do by night (shopping). Nevertheless if I go back to Shibuya I will stay again in this wonderful located hotel in higher floor room.

Location is Right in the centre of Shibuya district. The Twin room we got was big (Japanese standards). We will definitely stay here again.Restaurants and Shopping Malls around the hotel. Walking distance (5 minutes walk) to Shibuya and JR train stations.A/C worked well.There is strong WIFI signal in our room.We stayed in a non- smoking room.Staff very friendly and can speak english.You have to reserve a twin room to get the big rooms.Will definitely stay here again.

I'll be returning to this hotel next month when I go back to Tokyo on business here is why: Staff is friendly and helpful, even with my very basic Japanese I had no problem communicating with staff and getting help with complex directions, and computer issues. My room last time was clean, and as it was on an upper floor had a STAGGERINGLY GORGEOUS view of Shibuya, the crossing and many of Shinjuku's landmark buildings in the distance. The location is super convenient with all the major depato's and restaurants of Shibuya at your feet. The hotel offers a shuttle to the airport, which I've never used as I prefer to take N'ex in from Narita, but other guests have told me it's affordable and efficient. The only drawback in my mind (and this may not matter to most) is that as a large Western Style hotel, it lacks the charm of places like the nearby Dormy Inn, but that is not a huge concern if you are out and about enjoying Tokyo all day.

The hotel is in the heart of Shibuya; from Narita Airport you have a direct bus or train connection hence very easy accessible. The hotel offered free Wifi, our room rate included a sumptuous breakfast being served on the 25th floor which offers an awesome view across greater Tokyo. Rooms are very functional and clean like everything in Tokyo. Simply a place to stay without regret.
user_name:
Christian G
Victoria, British Columbia, Canada

review_body: The Shibuya Excel Hotel is an excellent location that places you amongst it all. Shopping, Restaurants, Bars and Transport. The Hotel is connected to an excellent shopping mall and a walkway straight through to Shibuya Station. The views from the hotel are amazing, you can even see Mt Fuji from the top floor dining room. The rooms are quite small, but have everything you need. I will stay here again the next time I come to Tokyo. Copy this: Tokyo Ten Glenn Wingrove ,into "You Tube" and see the views from The Excel Shibuya Hotel and why we love Japan

Situated right on top of Shibuya crossing makes this a great place to stay. The rooms are spacious and the breakfast buffé on the top floor has a magnificent view over Tokyo. The kids loved he glassed elevator going up there. Free wifi.

In the heart of Shibuya, next to the train station you need to stay here. Always something to do and so easy to get around.Hotel was one of the best I have stayed in. Japanese know how to do hotels well. Room clean and comfortable. Staff amazingly helpful.Worth the little bit extra to stay here.

Located in the middle of Shibuya. The hotel is connected to a mall and the train station. The location is just perfect! It also has tons of shops and restaurants surrounding the hotel. Very lively even late in the evening especially during the weekend. The rooms, bathroom and beds are big and comfortable with free wifi. I highly recommend this hotel!

We booked this hotel based on personal recommendation and also reviewing various hotels on tripadvisor and other travel websites. I had my own room and my parents had their own double room.Pros:-Location:Superb location to get to from Haneda airport and about 60-85mins by limousine bus from Narita Airport (note: this timing was early in the morning with moderate traffic). You can order a limousine bus from any airport and also from the hotel reception. It stops right outside the hotel and is a great, easy, good priced way of transport. Alternatively, the hotel is superbly stuck onto Shibuya station/Shibuya crossing and you can get the Tokyo express line to and from the airport this way. We only used the taxi from Haneda as it was close. But wouldnt recommend to Narita (too far and too expensive! - even the front desk will tell you that!).Customer Service:Impeccable customer service as you would expect. Humility, decency and extremely good natured staff everywhere in the hotel - from the lobby and front desk to the restaurant staff for breakfast in the morning to the cleaners. Just amazingly perfect. Notably the honesty and assistance they show you in helping you plan your stay is just excellent. The front desk guided me on some of the things to see and which order as well as providing me with maps, bookings for dinner and otherwise - with no complaint and no quirks. I cannot recommend this enough. Rooms:Really good size double room. Larger than normal expectation in Tokyo. Parents room was an upgraded double which was even bigger. Please ask at desk for upgrade options. Impeccably clean and cleaned regularly. Breakfast:We didnt use the restaurant for anything other than breakfast (which was included in our price). There are too many restaurants and cafes (starbucks etc) in the station (about 5mins within the same complex) OR outside that warrants you taking a stroll. No need to eat here. The breakfast however was perfect. A good selection of western (fruit, cereals, eggs, toast, bacon/sausages etc) as well as local cuisine - which was also nice aswell. If you can, id definitely try and get this within the price. Itll set you up for the day.I cant thank the staff enough for our stay. Both my parents and I loved the rooms and the service we were given. Id recommend this hotel to both families for the above as well as convenience of location as well as others who want to start their journey/tour who want to be in the heart of Tokyo at a good price.

Our fourth time at this hotel. It's a great location and good value for money - especially if you're part of their comfort members club. Only gripe - it'd be great to have a few English speaking channels on the tv....

We booked this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and were very pleased. There were 3 of us but we could not get a triple room so we booked a quad. It was a very large room with 4 beds and a table and chairs. The bathroom was split into 2 rooms with a sink and the shower/bathtub in one room and the toilet and a sink in another. This was very helpful with 3 people sharing the room. The rooms are very clean and comfortable but a little dated. There was a washer/dryer in the vending room which cost 100 yen per load. The location was wonderful. We had a room overlooking Shibuya crossing. It is easy to get anywhere in Tokyo from the train station downstairs. I agree with another reviewer how said the entrance was a little difficult to find. We tried breakfast at the hotel the first morning on the 25th floor. It was expensive and just OK. We had a very hard time finding a place for breakfast in the area that was the one negative on the location. There is bus service to the airport right at the hotel for 3000 Yen per person.I would definitely recommend this hotel.

We checked in and were given a room on the 12th floor with a great view of Shibuya Crossing. A lot of the staff at the hotel speak English so we had no problem with anything! I loved the location of the hotel......it is right in the middle of all the action but once you enter the hotel area there is a sense of calm. I recommend that (if this is your first time to the area) you take the airport limousine bus to the hotel. The limo bus will put you off right where you need to be in order to check in quickly. There are several entry points into the hotel and this could confuse you if you are not aware of the different entry points. There are places to eat at the hotel and one of them serves good drinks in the evening. In-room massages are available also. We ordered room service the first night because we were too tired to go out and eat. Anyway, we have no complaints about the hotel........you are provided with everything you need...a trouser press, bathroom amenities (toothbrush, hair brush, slippers, robes, nighties, etc.). I would definitely stay here again and I recommend this place to anyone visiting Tokyo. Check out my video of the view from our room: http://youtu.be/F0MnM6TMT2k

Location-wise you cannot go any better: smack in the middle of the famous Shibuya crossing and literally on top of the train station. If you manage to get a room with a view it's going to ne one of the hoghlights of a trip to Japan.The room itself was fine (we slept as a couple and small child in a double) and we had everything we needed. It was quite clean but I did find a very evident ball of hair on the carpet when entering (I removed it myself and did not mention it to the staff because there was no other issue.At one point my key card was not working and a staff member helped promptly (I was using it wrong).In room wifi worked fine.Would return for sure.

This is the 3rd stay in as many years.For the first time, I got myself a queen size bed. 7th floor room with absolutely no view at all.Internet was reliable but because of the 5 different wireless channels, it is advised that you log into only one else your phone or tablet starts getting confused and starts wireless surfing unnecessarily.Wired connection for the laptop is good so no issues there.Nothing different from my last visit here. Everything I needed is working and available. From bathroom necessities to room.The only thing I really dont like about is the TV. Your local channels are in Japanese, which is fine, but there is no English channels without the pay option. Yes, CNN and BBC is newsworthy but its not entertainment. For your non-Japanese speaking clients, there is hardly any TV for those lonely nights in the room.Western breakfast was the usual but the Japanese breakfast is a nice option to have.Having said all that, its still a great hotel in a fantastic location. Not cheap but its still all about location location location.

I've stayed at this hotel twice now - it's clean and modern, good value and you simply can't beat the location! All that Shibuya has to offer at your doorstop, plus right on top of a big transport hub if you want to go exploring. (If you're heading here from Haneda Airport it's very easy to get to via the Keikyu and JR Yamanote lines). The first time I stayed in a standard single room and whilst it was clean and had good amenities it was pretty small (even for Japan!). This visit I paid a little extra and got a double room, which had a proper seating area with couch - well worth the extra money for the extra space (especially if there's two of you)! Service is efficient and friendly. The rooms are clean and surprisingly quiet. Oh and there's free (and fast) wifi.Word of warning - the hotel entrance can be a little tricky to find the first time! All the entrances are in the Shibuya Mark City shopping centre - keep an eye out for the directional signs. And if you're on the main street, under the big pedestrian walkway, look for a elevator lobby near the entrance to Shibuya Mark City shopping centre. These lifts will take you to the hotel lobby on the fifth floor.

While I did not stay at this hotel, my in-laws did and I spent a lot of time here during my trip to Japan. I stayed at the Cerulean Tower however; I do know that rooms here are much cheaper. Rooms are much smaller and part of the reason we did not stay here as we were a family of 5 and the Cerulean Tower was better able to accommodate. Accommodations are not as nice as the Cerulean. Rooms are much smaller and not as luxurious however, the rooms and hotel are impeccably maintained. There were several beautiful Ikebana arrangements on display. Location is actually better than the Cerulean Tower. The Shibuya Excel Hotel is located within the East/West Mall, which is a great place to shop and eat, across from the famous Shibuya Crossing, Hachiko and the Shibuya Train station. Location wise there is no better place in the Shibuya area. I have to comment on the kindness of hotel staff too. My mother and father in law were on one floor and my brother in law was on another floor at this hotel. For some reason there was some confusion on what floor my brother in law was on (I think there was some thought he was a on a security floor which made us unable to reach him and he did not pick up his phone). After some explaining they were able to call his room and pass him along to a family member to get the right information. It was a huge relief as we had an excursion planned. I can't thank the staff enough for there kindness during our family disorganization. When I get a chance to come back to Tokyo and my kids are older I would love to stay at this hotel. The location just can't get any better!

We stayed here for 4 nights. The limousine bus from the airport took us directly to the hotel in around 80 minutes. The bus actually stops on the 5/F so there is no need to take any lifts to get to the lobby The hotel is actually next to all the major underground and train routes so is extremely convenient. For breakfast, don't go to the Japanese buffet which was bland, the western buffet is better but selection is very limited. WIfi was super fast

This hotel is in a prime location, right on top of Shibuya Station. I also had a room which looked out on to the famous Shibuya crossing. The hotel is clean though a little on the small side for what you pay, but that's common on Tokyo i guess.I was a littel confused when i first arrived as you have to take the lift to the 5th floor where the reception is. You then have to change lifts to the residents lift and go to your room, but this didn't become an issue for me. The room had a desk and chair, double bed, Flat screen Cable TV and a small dresser. The bathroom had a bathtub with shower and some basic toiletries. There are no international plug sockets so take an adapter. I didn't try the food as i was out most of the time.The airport bus is easy too. The bus for Narita and Haneda both leave from behind the hotel. Once you come back down to the 5th floor, you walk out the back door and you're at the bust stand. no steps or inconvenience.The area is great and always lively. Neon light galore and the Tokyo they usually show on TV. I would definitely stay here again.

We spend our first two nights here. I have to say that you couldn't find better location. The hotel is nothing special but if you never been in Tokyo before I Recommend to stay here because all what u need is at your door step to enjoy the Tokyo craziness ;)

I used this hotel with business trips. Easy access to train station and surrounded by all kind of shops. Can see the most famous traffic junction of Tokyo by foreigners (because of super crowd) down the hotel. Good restaurants and drinking places are reachable easily. Good service and reasonable price. There is a corner in the room for make up. Good thing for women.

I visited the hotel 1 of July 2013 and stayed for 6 nights, my choice upfront was primarily based on the location, being on the famous Shibuya crossing, and close to the station(s).Location is indeed excellent and very important, Shibuya is one or two stops away of places like Shinjuku, Omotesando, Harajuku and less than 15 min to Ginza, Roppongi and Tokyo station.The hotel lived up to the expectation, it is clean, modern and overall a nice looking place, on top of the JR and local metro stations.Nothing fancy though, but considering it's moderate price per night compared to the real high end hotels, I can fully recommend this place.Allthough Shibuya is a noisy area, our room on the 15th floor was soundproof.Room is relatively large with all necessary amenities, enough storage space and a great city view, opt if possible for Shibuya croosing view!Finally, Budgetwise, with a room of <€200 per night, it can aboslutely compete with similar hotels in Hong Kong, Singapore or Bangkok to name a few cities!

Not as posh as the Cerulean but who cares it was more fun! Right next to the Shibuya station and several department stores. I ran down to the basement of one of the department stores to buy an apple and was back in about 10 minutes. Modern but room was more of a 3 star. Good air conditioner and view. We had both free breakfasts on two separate mornings. The Japanese breakfast was fun but VERY exotic. Most of it I didn't know what I was eating. Pink cold vinegar to drink anyone? The rice porridge was good. The Western breakfast buffet was great also, and more of what you may be used to but also kind of boring compared to the adventure next door. This room was around $250 for two twin beds but had the free breakfast and free internet. Actually MORE than the Cerulean, but worth it because it was more fun. Front desk is helpful although you need to speak carefully and slowly and repeat the answer back to them to make sure you know what they said.
user_name:
Jennifer H
Corona del Mar, CA

review_body: This hotel is right in the middle of the action. The hotel literally sits on top of shibuya station. This makes getting around tokyo very convenient. To add to this, the view from our 16th floor room was a perfect view of shibuya crossing.The room was also comfortable. We have a family of 4 and we all got our own beds. This is rare when we are traveling. It also had free wi-fi although the connection was weaker between 6-10pm. I'm guessing its overloaded.The hotel was very helpful in arranging taxis and shuttles. The only negative is when we asked for a restaurant recommendation, they recommended their hotel restaurant....It maybe a fine restaurant but when your traveling you want recommendations that take you out in the city not inside your hotel.High highly recommend staying here if you are going to tokyo.Shibuyahh!!!

A reasonable sized room, very nice inside, but great location. This is actually located within the Shibuya train station, but of course the room is completely upstairs in the actual hotel. The great thing is, you can arrive into the station and just walk straight to your hotel without worrying about walking the streets with your bags trying to find your accommodation. Was fantastic. The staff were so friendly (just like all the Japanese seem to be). Very helpful. We had the breakfast every morning which was on the 25th floor overlooking the city. Amazing views, and the food was great. Just couldn't have asked for anything more!

Just in the middel of everyting. Fantastic view from our room in 22th floor. Spaceious room and clean room, friendly staff. Directly connected to the subway and JR-rail. Lots of restaurants and estery in the shopping center under the hotel. Very good choice.

This place is a great way to immerse yourself in bustling Tokyo! We came here as we were moved from another hotel because of overbooking! This turned out to be a blessing in disguise. The room we stayed in was a very decent size( we did have one of the executive rooms) which had an amazing view of the city! The beds were extremely comfortable and the room was surprisingly quiet given its central location and being right above Shibuya station.Hotels can be very expensive in Tokyo so we were very surprised that the Excel was very reasonably priced!The only downside for me was the breakfast. A little on the average side for my taste. Nothing interesting there. I would suggest the shopping centre below for meals.The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would certainly recommend this place!

Stayed on executive floor with large room and great views across Tokyo from 24th floor. This place is location, location, location at the heart of Shibuya. However, the rooms are well appointed and quiet. Service was attentive. One star off for the dull breakfast. Plenty of much better options downstairs in shopping centre or beyond. Would stay again.

Family of 5 stayed at Tokyu Excel hotel Shibuya last week. Took a family room, located at 12 floor - city view.Though room was not too big, it was definitely comfortable, furnished with 4 beds and a small dining area are the centre. 2 of the beds are super singles and 2 singles. Very comfortable and happy stay for a family of 5!Locaiion was great - hotel is sited just above the Shibuya station - though must say the Shibuya station is so huge and complex!Lots of shopping ( for teens) and food options available.One suggestion for improvement - hotel may want to consider to tighten security for guests access to rooms, as currently there isn't any in place - meaning all can go up to the rooms.

The location of the hotel is perfect, convenient for food, shopping and commute to important sights. You can get the shuttle bus from the airport and get off at the last stop which ends up at the feet of the hotel. It is right on the shibuya crossing, perfect for late night dinners, shopping and generally a nice and young spirited area to stay at. Rooms are nice, however may be a bit small, The room we had booked was rather too small and the view was the back of the building but we asked for a different room and with a small fee were taken to a new bigger room with view of the town. It is located next to a few major shopping malls. Not to forget that you can easily walk to Mark city for the famous sushi Midori at restaurants avenue, A must go for sushi lovers.

The rooms are just standard hotel rooms - clean, free of personality - and quite small (expected in Tokyo), but you are really there for the convenience of the location and awesomeness of the location - right over the Shibuya train station and the Shibuya scramble crossing.

We went to Tokyo for a 3 nights short trip and needed a hotel that can give us easy assess to trains, shops and restaurants. Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu is just perfect for these purposes. Its right on top of Shibuya station which has most major train lines there. We arrived in Tokyo around 7am and we took Narita Express which brought us to Shibuya station directly. On the day we left, we took the bus from the hotel directly and it was very convenient. It's also in walking distance to most shopping areas. It is also very convenient for us to meet up with our friends in Tokyo. The hotel rooms are very clean and the bed is comfortable. We highly recommend this hotel. Do not pay extra for breakfast, you can simply walk out and find lots of yummy selections. The only complaints we have is that even though we stayed on the 18th floor, we can still clearly hear the trains.

This hotel is located in the midst of the busy Shibuya area, which is frequented by the young crowd. The hotel is situated in the Mall building and also has a train station in the same building. You can see the popular traffic signal from this Hotel and the view is amazing. The hotel serves Japanese and continental breakfast and Japanese breakfast is a must-try. The restaurant is situated in the 24th floor and you can get a stunning view of the Tokyo city from there. The hotel location is very convenient as it is surrounded by shopping area and eateries. There are some night clubs around too.

It was quite confusing checking in, as the hotel reception is located on the 5th floor of a high rise building..this information is not indicated on the hotel website. So to get there, one would need to take the lift from the ground floor to the fifth level, check in and then take a different lift to your room. On the fourth level, there are lots of eateries with a varied international cuisine. The hotel is very centrally located..directly opposite is the Tokyu Department Store, with a huge food hall in the basement. Lots of shopping all around the hotel, though it's all catered to a younger crowd. Just across the road from the famous dog, Hachiko monument. Shibuya would be recommended for the more mature shopper with the excellent Isetan department store..The room is quite small and very clean, good strong free wifi, all the basic amenities. Two sachets of tea, no coffee or bottled water. Lots of TV channels, but nothing in English, all Japanese only.

I stayed at Shibuya Excel Hotel for 2 nights in February 2013 while I was in Tokyo for a business trip. My company travel agent selected this location based on rate and location. The hotel is located just at the station. The lobby is not situated in the ground floor and there is a convoluted way to reach it albeit there are good indication signs. You can avoid this by taking a lift from the ground floor of the station directly to the lobby. The room is reasonably sized and it had great views of Shibuya and Shinjuku. There are lots of restaurants and stores nearby and good public transportation. Definitely recommend it.

hotel situeted in the youth heart of tokyo. it was our third time in this fantastic city, but living on ginza we cant feel this pulse of life. manager on reception was realy top-class man and helped us to change room for an amazing view of the shibuya crossroad (#1201!!!)room size is realy giant for tokyo hotels.direct limousine bus to and from narita airport - is very convenient thing and not expensive for tokyo.

We stayed at the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu for 3 nights in April 2013 and really enjoyed it. We were in a room on the 19th floor with an amazing view of the city and Shibuya crossing. The room itself was reasonably sized with a clean bathroom with a great Japanese toilet. The room wifi worked nicely.The hotel staff was friendly and spoke excellent English.
