They helped us make a reservation at an upscale sushi restaurant since we didn't speak Japanese. There are vending machines in the lobby with snacks and ice cream. The hotel is in an unbeatable location literally in the Shibuya train station! Shibuya is a great neighborhood to explore and is a great base since the train station is home to many different metro lines. We would stay here again if we come back to Tokyo!
user_name:
wonderberg
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in April 2013 and seriously do not have any complaints! The location is awesome, located right near the Shibuya crossing and it's also connected to the Shibuya station, which is really handy (especially when you have just come off the train from osaka with 2 suitcases each haha). The room size is quite big, we had 3 of us staying in a triple room and we each had a lot of luggage and there was plenty of room for it all. The beds were comfortable and the room had a separate bathroom and toilet and the toilet had a mirror and basin in there too. We didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on that but there are plenty of restaurants around to choose from! U can get free wifi in the lobby which is very fast and they also have computers that you pay to use the internet on, its 100 yen per 10 minutes. There's also a printer available for use which is free. The hotel has vending machines with snacks and drinks available too. We organised through the hotel to get a shuttle bus from the hotel to Narita airport, which was only $30AUD per person and took about an hour and a half, this is definitely easier and cheaper than catching a train or cab. All in all loved staying at this hotel and if we go back to Tokyo will definitely stay here again

We loved the location of this hotel, right next to the Shibuya station. The check in procedure was easy & smooth. Staff spoke good English & were very helpful. There was some vending machines located near the front door so that was handy, & there were also vending machines on every floor where the ice machine was. You could buy beer, ice cream and all sorts of things from the machines.The room was clean & the bed/pillows were comfy. There was no safe in the room or iron, but there was tea/coffee facilities.Although the hotel is in an unbeatable location, the hotel had no lobby lounge or bar for relaxation as it would be nice to have a quiet drink instead of having to go out to a bar. Having said that, I would stay here again & would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the heart of Shibuya.

It is located a few steps away from the most famous crossroads in Shibuya. We had a room on a high floor with a very nice view. Japanese restaurant on 25th floor offers delicious food and breakfast in European restaurant is also very nice. I would recommend this hotel if you want to feel the life of Shibuya

Stayed with my husband and 4 yr old. Fantastic location for shopping and subway and a great first impression of Tokyo. Right in the heart of the action, literally on top of the famous crossing and lots of places to eat including the department food floors. Airport bus drops you at hotel which is very convenient. Our last 2 nights in tokyo was in Shinjuku and I much preferred this Shibuya location, Shinjuku is soulless with a skyscraper business district feel so we loved being in Shibuya as if felt alive and exciting.The hotel japanese breakfast was great and we got a good rate by negotiating with the hotel directly. Concierge wasn't very good, not good english and the service is fairly curt and no frills but that was fine as we didn't need much help.Would definately stay here again.

The hotel is very convenient to the Metro station, a shopping mall, and numerous restaurants including a fantastic bakery downstairs. Otherwise it is 1 block away from Shibuya crossing. Our non-smoking room was on the 16th floor with a great view (and a flyer on the windowsill describing the view). The room was small but always very clean. There is no iron, but you can borrow one from the front desk for 1 hour. There is a pant presser in the room. Slippers are also provided in the room. There is no true concierge nor is there pick up at this hotel for tours, but this is a stop on the Airport Limo. The wifi is free, but you must ask at the front desk for the access code if you are using an ipad. In addition, if you book a return Airport Limo and "charge it to the room" it does not get charged to your credit card, you should allot 3000 yen pp cash.

Stayed with a friend, and we made sure to get a two bed room (look for "twin" not "double"), and the room was great--easily spacious enough for two people and we lucked out, having our room on the 23rd floor (of 24); the view was tremendous! Shibuya is well located, with plenty of bars, restaurants, and shopping nearby; plus it is a major public transportation hub with several subway and bus lines passing through. The hotel was clean and professional, and the bathroom was quite nice with heated/fogless mirrors and Japanese toilets/bidets. It was a great choice and I'll have to stay here again!

Location is the best! Airport limousine drops you right at the hotel entrance. Could not have been more convenient! Many restaurants below hotel at Mark City. Rooms are very small but also very efficient. We enjoyed an awesome view from our window. Be sure to ask for non smoking room. Staff was very helpful and pleasant.We will be back!

I stayed here 18 months ago and resolved to come back. it is a great location for being in the beating heart and to get your bearings. I think though, that once you have done that you might want to stay in other places. For variety.But for what it is, it is a great location and very conveneient for the new visitor to Tokyo. Enjoy!

We stayed for 8 nights on the 22nd floor. The view was incredible and the location was perfect! The rooms were clean and made up each day, staff were friendly and there was so much to do and see in such a close proximity of the hotel. We will definitely be back!

We stayed in Shibuya Excel Hotel Last Ma25-April 1 and our stay was just delightful! The hotel itself is located in the middle of everything! name it! from train stations, to shopping malls to restaurants and night life! it was a very busy street and very fast faced but very enjoyable! We had daily buffet breakfast included and in some days we tried their Japanese Breakfast which was both excellent. Although there were lines for the western breakfast, it was ok since they had a nice view from the 25th floor! Room was ok, eveything you needed was there, free wifi in the rooms, vendo machine at the 5th floor, staff were courteous and friendly. We would be back soon!

We are happy with our choice to stay here. The location is fabulous right in the heart of Shibuya, our favourite suburb, and adjoining to the JR station which is very convenient. The room was great, we requested a non smoking floor and were put on the 18th floor with views over Tokyo, stunning at night!!! The room was clean and had great amenities, e.g pants press, hairbrushes, cotton buds, hair dryer etc. bed was comfy and the curtains blocked out all the neon lights outside so we had a great sleep. The glass lifts are fun, like riding the tower of terror each time haha. (you can pick non glass lifts if heights isn't your thing). We enjoyed a bath in our room daily after long days exploring Tokyo. I would stay here again if we came back

It's quite hard to review the Shibuya Excel. Nothing went wrong, but I wouldn't say we had a pleasant stay as well. Everything was kind of just alright but there were hardly any nice touches, and the staff were helpful and well-informed to the extent we had any queries. That said, it is really easy to underrate this hotel and I think it represents great value for money given its great (Shibuya isn't really "central") location and links to the Subway, private subway lines and the main JR station.Rooms: Hairdryer in the room. Trouser press. Air conditioning controls thankfully in English (we read Japanese, but really really slowly...). Bit cramped overall and bed sizes on the small side. Clean and comfortable. Best bit of the room was THE VIEW. As some other reviewers have indicated - getting a view over Shibuya's famous crossing was quite a show in itself and the kids spent quite a bit of time looking at "the bees" and "the mushrooms (when it was raining)" colliding into each other every 2 minutes or so. Tiny tiny thing - could do with a room safe.Food: didn't try the inhouse restaurants but Mark City (right below the hotel) provides as much Japanese food as you need. Tokyu's foodhall (also underneath the hotel) gives you the authentic Japanese supermarket foodhall experience with all the usual shouting thrown in. Candy store within the foodhall was quite fascinating.Staff: friendly, helpful and well informed - up to a point. Not really great with off piste requests, but that's Japan for you and not really a reflection of poor customer service at this place. When things went slightly awry (room card key didn't work on day 4), problem got fixed rally quickly. English levels were adequate and we had to resort to a bit of broken Japanese from time to time. *** MAKE USE OF THE LUGGAGE SERVICE!If you're travelling into other parts of Japan, make use of Japan's luggage service which delivers your medium/large suitcase to any part of Japan within a 2 hour slot on the next day for about 1500 yen (approx £11). We pre-packed 2 suitcases, sent them on their way and they were waiting for us at check-in when we arrived in Kyoto. Forms are all in Japanese (helps if you print out your next destination's address in Japanese text) but hotel front desk will help you fill this out.

This is my third or fourth time visiting the Shibuya Excel. I must reiterate what I have said before, this is the best location you could possibly find. Located just right above the train station and RIGHT at the world famous intersection, one could not possibly ask for more. However, you shouldn't be expecting such a massive high-end room. The rooms are of modest size for Japanese hotel standards and are very clean so I wouldn't complain. The staffs have a fine level of communicational English and although I do not know how good the hotel restaurant is, if you go to the 4th floor you'll see a long queue for a very very famous sushi place which is supposed to be really really good. Word of advice, take this hotel and none else! You'll get to walk a lot in Tokyo, and being in this hotel would probably save A LOT of that walking to the train station!

I stayed here for 4 days for a business trip, and thoroughly enjoyed the hotel. The wifi was free, and the rooms were decent size. The staff was always very helpful, even though I didn't speak Japanese, they would get someone right away who could speak English. There were so many good restaurants and places to go within walking distance and all my meetings were a short cab ride away. The beds were comfortable as well. I would definitely stay again on my next trip!

I stayed here for 4 nights during my trip to Tokyo. The hotel is centrally located in the heart of Shibuya and also have a direct exit from Shibuya station (through Mark City dept store). Only a 3 minute walk to the famous 109 building and also overlooks the scramble intersection. It's just nice to stay in such a centrally located hotel and not to worry about being too tired after shopping the entire day in shibuya. I stayed on the 7th floor and in a twin bedroom. The room size is very good to japanese standards, clean and comfortable. however try to avoid staying on the 7th floor because the billboards are RIGHT outside your window which lights up throughout the entire night and even the curtains won't help (if you're a person who needs to sleep in absolute darkness like myself).

I stayed here during my Tokyo trip. Located in the Shibuya Mark City building. Department stores/restaurants/metro are located on lower floors.Clean room, great views (view of the Crossing!). Shibuya station is right there. Room comes with hair dryer, toothbrush, razor, shaving cream, amongst other things.Front desk speaks English and were very helpful in booking restaurant reservations for me as I cannot speak much Japanese.To get here from Narita Airport - after baggage claim walk directly out and there should be signs for "Airport Limo/Bus" - get a ticket for Shibuya Excel (3000 yen) and then proceed directly outside (gate should be right in front of you). My flight landed during rush hour so the bus ride was approximately an hour and a half.
user_name:
niccimichelle
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is located right in the heart of Shibuya and very near the Shibuya station that will take you to all places in Tokyo very easy. The hotel itself is a high-rise so if possible get yourself a room high up from where you will have amazing views. The lobby is on third floor and you can access the hotel from the street and the train station. The room we stayed in was large (we paid extra for an upgrade) and stayed on 23rd floor. Two large twin beds, sofa, separate toilet and bathroom and huge panoramic windows. The breakfast restaurants is on 25 floor also with amazing views. Be early as the restaurant is small. Breakfast was not that great, not enough choices of food. So if you are paying extra for breakfast think twice.

We recently stayed at the Shibuya Excel for 5 nights. It was our first time in Tokyo and I must say, this hotel is great! The location is awesome and is right across the street from the shibuya station, which has basically every train line you could need. The hotel overlooks the main square, so we had a great view, but it was still really quiet at night. The rooms are small, but not unbearable. They are very clean and the bathroom was nice. There was free wifi in the room and it worked great. The hotel staff was friendly, but didnt speak english that well, so we didn't use them a ton for recommendations. I would definitely stay at this hotel again and would highly recommend it to my friends. The overall experience and price were very good!
user_name:
tiffanynyc31
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is geared more for the young and hip party goer or Business Traveler as the area is filled in drinking (Izakaya's) places and its proximity to Harajuku. Nevertheless the location of the hotel is great:The Pros:1.) Direct drop-off to the hotel by the Airport Limousine Bus from Narita. (prepare for a really windy and cold arrival upon exit from the bus as the parking lot is open).2.) Access to the 4th Floor Food hall of the Mark City Mall next door is a plus (access to Mark City is better on the 3rd floor than the Lobby because of the tight lift provided by the mall from lobby to 4th floor).3.) Proximity to the Tokyu Supermarket and Shibuya train station across the street. The Tokyu supermarket is the best place to grab some Sushi or Sashimi for Dinner. They offer 20% discount after 6PM and rivals the quality in some of the best restaurants. Remember, the supermarket not the food hall right outside it. Just buy some soy sauce in the supermarket as they don't offer it for free.4.) There are also a lot of reasonable eating outlets to the left of the Hotel (upon exit from the G/F lobby). Soba, Ramen, Yakiniku, Donburi, everything you want in such a small area! 5.) There are a lot of vending machines in the hotel lobby even a washing machine in the vending area per floor of the hotel.6.) Access to Starbucks (3rd Floor) and Excelsior Cafe (4th floor) in Mark City. Great sandwiched in Excelsior as well.The Cons:1.) The Shibuya area is filled with young people, this is the only reason I can attribute to the area being generally dirtier than the rest of Tokyo. Small trash can be seen everywhere. Compare this to the Ginza area and other nearby areas and you will know what I mean.2.) We left used cups and teaspoon from the tea service in the room and came back to find then un-washed when we returned. I really don't know if its customary in Japan not to have this cleaned by the maid service. 3.)The cleaning service was generally not that good. We only found the room really clean (1) night out of the (4) nights we stayed. We constantly found our used Starbucks coffee cups still lying on the floor next to the trash bin due to it being filled already.4.) You will constantly hear the train all night (stayed in the 8th floor). So this will be a problem if you are a light sleeper. Just drink a 500ml can of beer from the vending machine and you will be all set for the night. :-) Some tips for Families with Strollers or Baby Prams:1.) When taking the train.Take the South Entrance of the Shibuya Station (to the right when you cross the street). This is where the lift is located, took me 10 min. just to find it.2.) Most of the restaurants in the 4th floor Food Hall of Mark City next door is very child friendly.3.) Remember to take the 3rd floor access to Mark City from the hotel and just go (1) flight up the escalator.4.) Most if not all convenience stores do not sell fruit so if you want or need some for your baby or what not get it from the Supermarket (the Tokyu supermarket is small so go off-peak hours) or the fruit stand right outside to the right of the Hotel G/F exit.5.) ask the hotel for extra towels for your babies as they wont give you extras unless requested.6.) The Hotel doesnt offer baggage assistance so expect to log your own luggage to and from the lobby and/or bus.You will see that the Pro's out-way the Con's but given my experience here and in Shinjuku, I think we will try Ginza next. I think it is much more laid-back and definitely cleaner.

This is the second time I am posting this review. TA told me initially that it did not contain enough "information" to make it relevant. As a senior reviewer I find this very surprising and disappointing. I feel the information I have supplied genuine and helpful for people in a similar situation. I have travelled the world and am trying my best to not lose my faith in the site I have had so much faith in. So, TA, will you publish my honest account of my family's stay? Here it is. As stated by previous reviewers this hotel is fantastically situated. Couldn't fault location. Upon attempted check in after an overnight flight with 2 very tired children they flatly refused any sort of leeway with check in. I would have happily paid extra for this but it was not offered. As such my kids pretty much cried in the foyer for 4 hours while we valiantly tried to settle them. Very disappointing. Hotel facilities were fine. No other complaints.

location is the best! It is in the middle of everything. Restaurants,shops and underground train is just in front of hotel. There is airport shuttle bus which is convenience and help me save a lot of money(taxi is very expensive).Room is small but clean in contemporary design.I also got massage chair in room!lovely business hotel

This hotel is located in an excellent location of Shibuya with lotsa shopping, restaurants and fast food chains around. The train service is just right below the hotel! How great is that! The room was clean and a little small but it's fine given the excellent view of the Shibuya from the top. During my 6 days stay in Tokyo, the staffs from the Housekeeping Dept never fails to tidy up my room and topping up the water in the boiler everyday! Thanks for going through the extra mile! Not to forget to mention, the wi-fi service in the room was excellent! No disruption and connection are really consistent and strong. The breakfast buffet at A Bientot on the 25th floor was tasty and great because you get to see Mount Fuji while dining. Excellent! I really enjoyed my stay with Shibuya Excel and I will definitely choose to stay in the same hotel again on my next trip.

This hotel is superbly appointed- the best located in Tokyo. We had an issue with the room upon arrival- heavy smell of perfume (not something I brought up but noticed by the lady who checked us into a room). Without me mentioning it she had our rooms changed and we were given some complimentary breakfast coupons. I really appreciated that and I thought the Front Desk staff were really friendly and professional. The rooms are sound proofed, we could only get a room on the 7th floor because of the room change and I was apprehensive about being so close to the street and the train station- but it was really quiet and peaceful which was impressive. Overall I thought this a great hotel for the location and price- and I recommended it to three groups of friends who have made subsequent bookings in Feb and March. However one thing that was really, really appalling and actually quite rude- the Hotel Restaurant Manager. We spent 10 nights at this hotel- we spent a lot of money and I would consider myself a fairly good guest. We had breakfast on the 25th floor (which has amazing views btw)..we returned to our room but Room service were about to clean it. Instead of interupting them we decided to go to the lobby and let them complete. While down there I decided to get something to drink- it was Sunday morning and very quiet- my partner and I went into the lobby lounge restaurant, which is an open planned area. After being seated I ordered a 990yen smoothie- my girlfriend with me decided not to order anything as we had just eaten. Please bear in mind there were only 3 other people in there in approximately a 150 cover space. The server went away and a few minutes later a jumped up man (the Restaurant Manager) came over pointing at the menu and in poor English declared "one person, one order". I politely explained and showed him my key card that I was a guest at the hotel and was waiting for 5 minutes while our room was cleaned and that I would like to order a smoothie just for myself while we waited. He shook his head "one person, one order". UNBELIEVABLE. There were no signs pertaining to this..and one would think as the restaurant was virtually empty and that we were guests we have have been treated better. Basically we had to order something else or leave. As my partner and I were embarrassed (the other 3 Non-Guests in there were looking by now) I ordered a slice of cake as I did not want to get up and leave and upset my partner further. This incident was unacceptable- I couldn't really make any points to him as a) he was not listening and b) his English was poor. It ruined the stay in many ways- and I would not ever recommend anyone going in there. Shameful for what is a nice hotel. We would have eaten there a number of times but after this incident refused too- so in the long run they lost income from this dreadful, dreadful service.

This hotel is located in the heart of Shibuya - right next to a ton of shopping and eating locations - and it's connected right to the train station! The location is awesome - especially in the winter when it's cold outside - since you can just walk right to the train station and take it to another suburb.It's decently clean, both in the rooms and outside, and the wi-fi connection is awesome everywhere! The rooms are simple and have all the basic hygienic needs - and you can ask for a women's floor if your group is all women! They'll give you a little facial care packet on top of the basic things. Our room came with breakfast vouchers. Breakfast is between a Japanese porridge set and a Western continental breakfast buffet - and both are decent - but not mind blowing. My only complaint is that the reservation counter was a bit slow at getting us our rooms - but otherwise - a great place to stay!

We stayed 5 days while house hunting and were booked at the Excel since the Cerulean was unavailable. The location is really convenient with tons of food and shopping options. The room was comfortable and relatively spacious As in many japanese hotels internet was by Lan cable only and we had to hook up our router for wifi. We took the train from narita to arrive but there were few escalators so I had to haul our suitcases up and down the steps. For the return we booked th airport linousine bus. Same price and much more convenient. There aren't many options for tourists in this part of town, so the Excel is a solid choice.

I've stayed at the Shibyua Excel numerous times, and it is a solid, standard "low-frills" Japanese business hotel. Clean and well run, it's best feature is probably its location directly above Shibuya station. Anyone doing business in or around central Tokyo, and planning to travel by train or subway, could do a lot worse than this place. The hotel is also a stop on the limousine (express bus) services to Narita airport.

Connects right to the Shibuya station, most rooms have a view of the crossing, and the service is excellent. Nice large rooms for Japan, very comfortable beds, and clean! The hotel is part of the Mark City shopping center with a Starbucks just outside the 3rd floor exit! The 25th floor restaurants were too impression - good, but not for 2300 yen. In the breakfast buffet, there are actually a few 2 person seats that have a view of Mt. Fuji! The Japanese style breakfast left much to be desired. I would try that one elsewhere.

Chose this hotel due to it being a dropoff point for the Narita airport limo buses. It's smacked right at the busy crossroads of Shibuya and Hachiko, where malls and restaurants spill over. Clean and good enough, nothing fancy. Took the triple room, size was decent and like all japanese hotels, toiletries and soap are provided with heated toilet seats and hygiene wash. Can't ask more from a hotel, best location imo for food / shopping and easy access by subway to anywhere in Tokyo.

Fifth time in Shibuya and fifth time staying at this hotel. Still feel the same about this hotel...the service, the staff, the cleanliness and the location are all perfect. Lively and fun area in the heart of the city with restaurants and shopping all over.

Recently we spent 8 nights at the Shibuya Excel Hotel. We chose the hotel as it is a stop on the Airport Limousine service which makes access to and from Narita Airport very convenient (3000 yen each way). It's location above a major railway station and in heart of Shibuya, a major shopping and restaurant hub is a bonus. The room was spotless and the bathroom facilities including accesseries were five star. After a day sightseeing, if we chose to relax in our room, there is a food hall which offers a large variety of takeaway options about 3 minutes walk from the hotel. (tip: the closer to closing time the cheaper the food gets). The hotel has direct access to a "Restaurant Street" which has a variety Japanese and International eating establishments all reasonably priced. The staff were fantastic with excellent customer focus. If there was a downside we thought the beds were a bit firm for our liking.

I was here a week ago for business trip. The single room is typical japanese hotel, small, but I got everything I need. Comfortable & clean bed, desk for work, wifi with fast internet connection, enough space for my lugage, clean and nice shower, and good breakfast. The location also very good. The hotel's elevator directly bring you to the shoping mall in B1 and B2 floor. Only takes 5 minutes walk to JR station near Hachiko Dog statue. Shibuya itself, is a great place to shop. You can fine easily convenient store, small restaurant to fine dinning, electronic store, shoes to clothes store is within 5 to 10 minutes walk from this hotel.A little dissapointed is only: not all staf in front desk can speak english fluently. But they are really helpfull.

Can't get much more convenient. Smack bang in Shibuya & working at Tokyu Orb is great. Decent sized rooms for Tokyo, good beds & amazing pillows - and lovely deep baths that fill in seconds. Breakfast on top floor worth it for service let alone the view. Highly recommended.

The Excel is right above the JR and metro stations at Shibuya. Rooms and bathroom are clean and spacious, but not extremely recent. It does not have standing showers and wooden floors as is now customary but it is extremely decent. The Mark City mall below the hotel offers plenty of food choices if you need to eat in your room.Great views of Shibuya towards the South- East come with some train noise below, so maybe the other side is a better choice (looking North toward Yoyogi?)Very good Japanese restaurant on the top floor.Compared to the Cerulean on the other side of the plaza, this is a much more affordable choice and closer to the station and the city life of Shibuya.There is no fitness center.
user_name:
YDz
New York City, New York

review_body: One of the best views in Tokyo. You look down right at the busy Shibuya Square. I can here alone and thought it was relatively easy to get to from the airport. One train and then follow the signs to the hotel. Great location, near shopping and tasty restaurants. Front desk staff spoke english. The looks pretty typical at first but then you get into the details which really impressed me. The toilets have a remote control on it. When you get out of the shower the mirror steams up except for the area in front of the sink. Also you can control every light in the room from your bedside. i would def stay here again.

This is the second time I've stayed here and thoroughly enjoyed it again. I really like the Shibuya area and prefer it over Shinjuku as it's not as big and crazy. This hotel's location allows you to walk out on the main crossing into the main part of Shibuya or head over to the train station. There are plenty of shops and restaurants within walking distance to keep you busy. Walking to Harajuku only takes about 15 minutes too.We requested a room overlooking the crossing on this stay and were not disappointed. We had a room on the top floor and it was an amazing view of the crossing and also out over the city and park to Shinjuku. We spent quite a bit of time looking and working out where we needed to go based on landmarks we could see! The room was quite large for Japanese standards, but it was an Excel Twin and the closest to the crossing. There was plenty of room for all of our bags, plus a desk and tables/chairs. The bathroom was a little small but was still okay. The concierge was very friendly and helpful for information and spoke English very well. The airport limousine bus also stops at this hotel, which is super convenient if you don't want to worry about the train.

The Shibuya neighborhood right outside this hotel is like Times Square on steroids. The Shibuya subway station serves as a terminus for 3 different metro lines, putting the whole Tokyo within reach, and has 15 (!) exits; plus there are at least two more JR (Japan Rail) lines going through the same plaza. So every day, there are tens of thousands of people going to the shops and restaurants in the area. On week-ends, thousands of teenagers and young adults descend on the plaza looking for company and entertainment. And Shibuya Excel Hotel serves all this up to you on the platter. The hotel is situated right in Mark City shopping center, with multiple entrances at different levels. One takes you to the shops and restaurants; another to the rail stations; and the one on the first floor puts you right in the middle of the action on the plaza. TripAdvisor lists almost 3,000 restaurants in Shibuya, and many of them are within walking distance to the hotel. Plus there are stores and clubs aplenty, of all types, sizes and price ranges.The hotel itself is not fancy but perfectly serviceable. I was lucky to get a room on the 16th floor, which had a fabulous view of the area. The glass elevators display the area quite nicely as well. My room had a comfortable king-sized bed, with one firm and one soft pillow, a reasonably sized desk with a wired Internet connection (included in the room rate!), a little dressing table, and a dresser with a couple of drawers and a built-in mini-fridge. The closet was OK but had only 3 suit hangers, which wasn't enough for all the business and casual clothes I brought for an 8-day stay. The bathroom was small but serviceable, with a decent, clean shower/tub, a full-sized counter, and high-tech toilet seat, with both a heated bidet and a "shower". There was no cake soap, instead there were huge pumps with body wash, face soap, shampoo and conditioner. The bath towel was ample and absorbent, but I was given only one; there were two tiny hand towels, not nearly as absorbent. A very nice touch was a tray full of spare toiletries - very welcome, because somehow I forgot my tooth-brush and had to "borrow" one from the tray (it was replaced every day). The room had a nice TV set, but even though it showed two English language channels (BBC Word News and CNN) both were dubbed in Japanese so I could not hear any English at all; unfortunately I do not speak Japanese so I had to go cold turkey on TV watching for a week.There are at least 3 restaurants associated with the hotel, but the prices there were outrageous (something like $30 for breakfast!) so I just took advantage of the fantastic variety offered by the location. There is a fabulous Sushi restaurant (Midori Sushi) on the 4th floor of Mark City that I highly recommend (my Japanese hosts from other areas of Tokyo all knew about it), and I also found a great place two blocks away, called Chapon, where I could have a full dinner with a drink and a dessert for almost the same price. In the 8 days I stayed at Shibuya Excel, I had to ask the front desk for help multiple times; I never had to wait more than a minute, and the staff spoke good English and were uniformly pleasant and helpful. So to summarize - a perfectly clean and decent, if somewhat cramped, room, with a great view, and good service. At a very reasonable price, too (I booked pre-paid special rate). Ask for one of the top floors for a view - and enjoy a great location!

I have been to Japan several times, and I think Shibuya is the BEST area to stay in, and this hotel was perfect. The sky bus dropped us straight outside making airport transfers easy, our room was small (just standard for Japan) but well equipped, clean and had a great view of the crazy crossing in Shibuya. Located on top of the train station, so travel anywhere was easy! Also walking distance to Harajuku for markets and shopping. It was a little more pricey than some surrounding hotels, but I felt it was worth it:)

Tiny, tiny, tiny, tiny rooms, beds, and pillows. I know rooms in Tokyo are small, but this was laughable. The pillows were about as thin as my cellphone and almost as small in diameter as well. For two relatively small 20 year olds, this bed was maybe a 'full size' mattress, and did not cut it. Did I mention everything is small? On a positive note, the location is outstanding. The hotel is very nice, along with its staff. All it needed was just to be a little larger than a closet and I would have been very pleased.

This hotel is situated in front of Shibuya main train station from where you can travel any where in Japan. The hotel is 25 storey hotel with two restaurant on 25th floor namely A`Bientot. One is japanese and the other international and american cuisine. Their Bfast is perhaps the best american western Bfast one can eat in Tokyo. The rooms are small but very clean and with enough space. The complimenatry Internet and bell captain service is amazing. This area is full of shops, restaurants and the hotel is adjoining to the Marlk City shopping mall. One walks to the main railway station and there are many japanese and american food restaurants on the second floor of this complex. There is a convenience store next door and too many Starbucks and one right in the building on the second floor. The most valuable news about this hotel is that there is a dirct bus service from both airports which bring you right at the back of the hotel and you just walk in to the reception area. They also have a direct bus from the back parking area of the hotel direct to the airport and you buy the ticket from the reception. The front desk people are polite and helpful and speak good english.

With views of the famous Shibuya crossing Good value, location, staff, views and ask for rooms with massage chairs (not many but they are top notch)- only downsides no gym but seems that's normal for Tokyo
user_name:
Jeremy B
San Clemente, California, USA

review_body: Went here for business and stayed for about a week. The hotel's location could hardly be better. The glass elevators overlook the famous Shibuya Crossing and the hotel is just minutes away from Shibuya Station, one of the main rail stations in the city. The rooms are ok, not spectacular, but well equipped with a flat screen, a little fridge (no mini bar, but vending machines throughout the building) as well as fast free wifi. Some noise from the train station can be heard, but in general the environment is remarkably quiet. Unfortunately there is no gym, no pool or any other facility for physical exercise.The breakfast buffet in the Western-style restaurant was sufficient, but I didn't find the food of outstanding quality. Better take the elevator down to 3F into the mall where there is a Starbucks right around the corner.

Shibuya Excel Hotel could not be better situated. The rooms are clean and comfortable; the wifi is excellent and the breakfast in the beautiful restaurant, with panoramic views of Tokyo, is good (there is an American style buffet and an Asian breakfast buffet). Access to Shibuya as well as JR and Subway lines can not be overstated - this is a key location to benefit from all that Tokyo has to offer.

The hotel is clean and nice. The room size for me is just perfect since I travel by myself. The locations is very convinient. Now they have free wifi in the room. I would love to come back here again :)

Stay for one night for business.Shibuya excel tokyu has superb location, just right next to extremely busy shibuya station. Therefore, it is very convenient for eat, drink, shop, travel.The room is small as tokyo standard, and nothing special, but it is terrible expensive above tokyo standard. Free Internet is +++, and you can easily get in Airport Limousine bus.

We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in September. It is in a great location right across the road from the station and Shibuya is on the Yamanote line which makes it very convenient to get around Tokyo. The hotel room was fairly large for Tokyo standards, Tokyo is such a dynamic place you rarely spend too much time in your room. There is no free wifi in your room only in reception so makes it had trying to Skype in public. Each floor has a vending machine and an Ice machine so you can get a quick beer before going out to dinner. There are heaps of restaurants around the area - too many to choose from and eating in the hotel is very expensive - you get better food in the streets. We found the shopping centre the hotel was in had a good selection. wandering around at night is safe also. I found the reception staff were not friendly or accomodating - after a 30 hour flight from Australia we arrived at the hotel at 11am and they were adamant we could not enter our room until 2pm even though they were not fully booked. In the end we paid a sum of money to get in early so we could shower and rest. They were very inflexible which is weird because we found stangers extremely accommodating. This hotel is OK but I would try other hotels in this area if I returned to Tokyo.

This hotel is located right next to the metro and JR station. Location is supreme! So many things to do around the area. Great restaurants, bars, shopping center. Easy to get cab as well.The room we stayed were very big for four people and very clean. The staff are extremely helpful. Free Wifi in our room and by the lobby. 5 stars service at a 3 stars price :)Would definitely stay again and would recommend. You will not be disappointed! Trust me!

Catch the airport limousine - it's easy and takes you the lobby! Just get off at Shibuya Mark City - which is a shopping center and part of the hotel.The room is a bit small - the bathroom was a bit shocking at first but you get used to it! The main light switch is located on the bedside table - it took us ages to figure that out!the view is amazing - we just looked out over Shibuya crossing. and the lifts are mainly glass lifts so you can enjoy the views!shopping is insane in shibuya and it's an easy walk to Harajuku.Staff aren't that great at English but that is to be expected. Didn't try the restaurants - there is so many better and cheaper options so close!

This was my first time staying in Tokyo, and I have to stay, Shibuya seems to be one of the most amazing parts of Tokyo - there is always lots of stuff happening. This hotel is located at the Shibuya train station, which means that it is very easy to get around Tokyo. There are lots of great restaurants and shops nearby, and if you like 'people watching', this is definitely the place to stay. This hotel is right above the famous Shibuya crossing - and you get an absolutely fantastic view! The room is quite spacious by Tokyo standards, the room was clean and comfortable, and the staff were friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel, and will definitely stay here the next time I'm in Tokyo!

The location is fab. Right in the middle If shibuya, which is the heart of Tokyo , if u r not old. (If u r old, u won't stand the busy, hecteck, noisy shibuya. But if u r not old, this is the happening place. )Easy access to train, buss, taxi, stores, restaurant. The airport buss stops here , too, which is the big plus. Some speaks English Everywhere is so clean, the rooms r big for Tokyo standard. The down fall is the prices. Restaurant is expensive, like I need $100 per person for dinner. I mean they charge u $15 for a cup of tea. No refill at that. If u can find a deal to stay here under $150 a night, it's worth it. Otherwise, there is a cheaper version of Tokyu chain hotel called tokyu Inn near by and it's good enough.

Excellent location if one is planning to explore the sights, sounds, smells and Colours of Shibuya city! Total convenience, right smack in the centre of Shibuya 109, great malls, eateries, shopping and Shibuya station! A Bird's eye view from the hotel of the little ant people down below crossing the main junction. The room was clean and cosy. What I loved most was the toiletries in the bathroom offering generous and luxurious hand & face soap, body shampoo, hair shampoo and conditioner! Love the smell! Service is not always friendly though but heck, thoroughly enjoyed a good night's rest to get me going the next day! The double rooms are pretty small though, so ask for a bigger room if there are two people staying.

I've stayed for 6 days at this hotel which is extremely well located at the heart of Shibuya. Access to the Shibuya station, Mark City mall and Shibuya crossing. Room very nice and big for Japan standards. I've stayed in smaller rooms in UK and cruise ships so this room was very good. Clean and neat. Front desk very friendly and helpfull. When I come back to Tokyo I will definitely stay at this hotel. Recommend to all.

We checked-in very late at night and it was a breeze. It has a 7-Eleven right outside the hotel and those stores around Tokyo are just about the only ones that have ATM that accept foreign debit/credit cards to withdraw money. If you leave the hotel and go down towards shibuya station you will find a very affordable fast food noodle joint that has some tasty food and we ate around 2am. Also there is another convenience store that if you have seen the latest No Reservations season when Anthony Bourdain goes to buy tasty food at a convenience store with a japanese chef, that's the convenience store they visited, right next to the hotel.The location minutes away from Shibuya station shouldn't be ignored, it's so easy to go to different places around town. Shibuya shopping district is just minutes away walking and so is the nightlife. It was a breeze walking from the clubs to the hotel late at night, and as far as crime, we never felt unsafe.The staff is very helpful, the front desk helped us book tickets from the sumo tournament that was going on at the time of our visit and they booked us a place at the Mizutani Sushi joint in Ginza, overall very helpful! The breakfast I never tried as I felt it was a bit too expensive and also because there are cheaper places to eat nearby.The rooms are clean and spacious, I had never been to Tokyo and was very affraid I'd end up staying in small and cramped room, but this wasn't the case, the rooms were great and spacious, the bathrooms clean and the view...TO DIE FOR. I think this was the highest I've ever slept at, 34th Floor. My travel group was planning on staying at a hostel in Asakusa but last minute we changed to this hotel and it was the best decision we made! It's not cheap, but then again, the finer things in life aren't.

Very conveniently located, great spacey room and reasonable prices! I should say better than my expectation. The famous Shibuya scramble crossing is just a walk away, also Hachiko statue only across the hotel. Definitely recommended! I will not forget my stay in Shibuya Excel Tokyu hotel :)

This hotel sits above the Shibuya subway Station, making transport to other parts of the city very convenient. If you take the Limousine bus from airport, it stops right at the front door. Room is spacious in Tokyo standard, i've been to hotels in Tokyo where you literally cannot have suitcase fully opened. Nice working desk / extra table (depends if you stay in Single or twin room), plus a make up table. Over looking the infamous busy cross road of Shibuya, and the nice night view of Tokyo. You gotta choose between the western buffet style or a traditional Japanese set style breakfast. Both are really good.About the comments on A/C, i think it make sense that it shuts down whenever you're out, to save energy and all. The A/C got the room cool fast enough in my opinion, i had no problem with the A/C.

The hotel is conveniently connected with Shibuya Station, though navigating through the extremely busy station with very poor signs (forget about English, I am talking about Japanese signs) isn't easy for first timer. Their service is average or less. I couldn't get any help with my luggages maybe because I arrived at the hotel late. The room was clean and practical. I liked that they had coin operated laundry machines.

this hotel has the best location if you're in town for few days as basically most surrounding areas are easily walkable.apart from this, rooms are really tiny, some of the rooms have horrible plastic bathrooms, so make sure you check what you are getting.breakfast was okay, views are lovely, still, it is quite pricey for what you get.

I suspect that because of the location, this hotel has enough traffic. It has some kind of tie-up with organisations in the area to pass good rates through. So--and this is my guess--this would explain the rather curt response at reception.I arrived on a red-eye flight but "Hai, so sorry you cannot check in until after 2 pm. Hai." The result was a small queue at the lobby many mornings. I have never been in a hotel where no one has been able to check in and then at the miracle hour, everyone can check in. Obviously, rooms that were ready were not made available to guests.But once you are past this, the hotel is fine. The rooms are spacious by Tokyo standards. You can actually walk--as opposed to tiptoe--to the window. You do not have to worry about your elbows in the bathroom.I did not take the hotel breakfast--my special rate did not allow for it--but instead went down to Starbucks on Level 3. I had lunch once at a sushi restaurant on that stretch of mall.The location of course is tops. I had to take the taxi a couple of times and it was not problem. Once at the curb, I never waited for more than a minute.All in all, if you set your expectations low, this hotel can surprise.

If you're trying to decide whether to stay in a 'happening' area of Tokyo - DO IT. I can't emphasise enough how convienient staying in Shibuya was for us. Attractions, transport, cheap food and nightlife is right on your doorstep. Not to mention Shibuya Crossing is literally at the entrance of the hotel. I later stayed in Ueno on our way back to Tokyo and it felt like I was in the sticks, a 20-30 minute train ride to any of the major spots of the city. Save yourself the hassle.Although I warn, Shibuya is a very young (teens and twentysomethings) and hip area. The trend here is to eat at instant-type Japanese restuarants, shop, and hang out with your friends in trendy establishments. Being a bunch of twentysomethings we fit right in and LOVED the atmosphere but if you're a bit older and want a more sophisticated Tokyo experience, you might feel out of place - check out hotels in Ginza or Shinjuku instead. The hotel itself is nice but nothing overly special. Roomy, the beds were a bit stiff but we got used to it after a few nights. We stayed in a triple room on the 18th floor with a nice view of the city. The curtains block out the light and noise very well - could hardly tell what time it was when our room was so dark! If you're worried that being in the thick of it means you can't escape in your hotel - not the case here.Cannot recommend this hotel enough for younger tourists.

We stayed at this hotel between 15th and 20th May 2012. The room was very clean, transportation was amazing because the entrance of the underground is just next to the hotel, you can find many places around to eat,to drink etc. Nearly 24 hrs for every budget! I didn't have breakfast at the hotel but my husband did and he enjoyed it.The only thing is every single day my room entrance card was somehow deactivated and I needed to walk quite a long corridor to reach the lift, down to the reception from 13th floor and changed the key and come back! after such a tiring,long day it can be very annoying believe me! Anyway apart from that it was a nice,clean,very central hotel!

This was a convenient location to commute to many customer locations and to my Japan office. However, it is more of a "Japan businessman's" hotel - simple, small and smoky in the lobby area.Also, I'm personally not a fan of noisy Shibuya - I like the Japanese peacefulness of other areas near parks like the New Otani- even if it means extra commutes.One comment to hotel - in the summer, give customers sheets on the beds. The air turns off when you leave the room and the air conditioner cannot get the room cool enough at night to sleep with a down comforter. I had to ask for a sheet and then hide it each day - or the cleaning staff took it.Tip - Food Market in the basement of the Mark City building - I didn't find this until my last day of a week trip. Excellent selection of foods and great place to grab carry out to eat in the hotel if you aren't that hungry and just want a light meal while catching up on emails.
Located on Shibuya Crossing and above the metro, there can't be a better location. Our room was a good size for Tokyo standards with lovely amenities and good quality fittings.

Stayed here July 6th-9th...Location is pretty much everything for the hotel. All the subway and JR line are connected to the hotel. Check in time is 2:00 PM sharp, check out time 11:00 AM, late check out request can at most extend to 12:00 PM. It is Japan after all, so everything is down to the min. I didn't use much service other than the room. No water is provided, but there are vending machine on every floor (Thought the ones on the 5th floor is a bit cheaper). Toiletries are complete with what is normally provided in all hotels. We stayed at room 2403 which was on the 24th floor. From room 2404 onwards, the room is even smaller...say 2 square meter short. Bathroom is 2x2 meters. A bit small comparing to Keio hotel in Shinjuku area. There's really no fuss here as long as you respect their time. All in all, it's a very decent hotel as there are plenty of shopping area to go to, and plenty of good restaurant within the area. Would most likely stay here again as I think it's more convenient and more things to do in Shibuya than in Shinjuku area (personal preference off course)

Located on Shibuya Crossing and above the metro, there can't be a better location. Our room was a good size for Tokyo standards with lovely amenities and good quality fittings. We basically walked everywhere (up to Harajuku and Omotesando) and there were great places to eat in the surrounding streets. We caught the train from level 3 to Shinuku and Shimokitazawa with little difficult and used the limo bus service to and from Narita airport.I'd definitely stay here again.
I should probably try somewhere else - but why! It's a great position in the middle of Shibuya at a reasonable price. It's a simple hotel with no frills but it's clean and quiet.

When in Tokyo you want three things for sure: 1) to be *really close* to the metro; 2) be in one of the bustling areas; 3) have great views. The Shibuya Excel has all three. It is literally part of the Shibuya Station metro station, meaning that if you are in Tokyo in full summer you can entirely avoid the dreadful weather and take your air-conditioned path directly to your next train. Shibuya station is also on the Yamanote line (which goes around Tokyo like a big ring); the Yamanote is the one train line that is the best friend of all those who go to Tokyo for the first time. And for those afraid that being attached to a metro station is a negative, please keep in mind that metro stations in Japan are like awesome shopping centers, with great fresh food courts, and highly rated restaurants. So, no need to fear.Also, the Shibuya Excel is right in the midde of Sibuya square... if you are going to Japan, this is where you want to be. The place is so characteristically Japanese you will have a blast. You are also a short walk (or 1 station) away from Yoyogi Park (where you can visit the Meiji Jungo Mae shrine), and shopping districts like Omotesando and Harajuku. Shinjuku and Meguro are also close by on the Yamanote, and Kamakura (with its wonderful temples) is no more than a 1 hour train ride away (making it a perfect day trip).Finally, you want views. Have breakfast or dinner at the restaurants on the top of the Excel for breathtaking views of the city. I have never been in a room in the Excel and not had a great view. Solid all around.One negative comes with the rooms themselves. If you can, pay some extra cash for the extra square meters, cause the smaller rooms are really SMALL! No joke. True story.Other than that, great staff and great stay. And one final suggestion. If you are leaving with a plane, always reserve a bus ride to the airport. The concierge can help you out :)

Having stayed in Japan many times over the last few years I came to this hotel with certain expectations thanks to the reasonable room rate vs the prime location of the hotel.Even upon entering the hotel itself I found myself pleasantly surprised, with its airy loby and host of various, guest only, amenities- vending machines full of snacks/drinks, a photo-copier (not free) and an English PC (not free).From there my experience only grew better! Having come in on an early flight I arrived well before the 2pm check in however staff kindly offered to home my bags and supplied me with a ticket that meant I could, should I have wished, left them there for up to a month.Once checked in I found my room very spacious for a Japanese single room especially given that the hotel is not only priced at business rates, but that I only paid for their basic room.Equipped with the usual: tea; kettle; toiletries, etc, and also boasting not only the usual little Japanese hotel room extras: hair brush; razor; ear and face cleaning items (buds and cotton swabs); slippers, but also an unexpected bonus of a sleep shirt and what looked to be a trouser press. The bathroom was a little cosy but certainly not in any way claustrophobic, though I was a little saddened to find that my toilet seat was not heated as i'd come to expect- this due to the hotels wish to be as green as possible in the use of electricity etc. I was exceptionally lucky to get a room overlooking the scramble crossing and the rooms very cleaver glazing meant that I heard only a little of the noise from crowds/advertising boards in the late evening. The entrance to the hotel is a little tucked away, with the main lobby being reached either by a lift from the 3rd (possibly second) floor of the Mark City complex or via escalators on the 5th, however if you exit at the gate just before Hachiko it's fairly well a straight line and, should you exit at Hachiko, Mark city is the very obvious sky scraper to your direct left- also taking in the limousine bus will bring you directly to the entrance if you've the spare pennies for the journey (the desk will also take reservations for a return trip at any point during your stay)It's basically adjacent to Shibuya's R station so you've easy access to all the tourist spots via the Yanamote line as well as various other lines that run from the station. Breakfast was not included in my stay and I found the hotel's buffet a little over priced for the small selection I found at 7:30, however there is a combini just a short walk down the hallways of Mark City and the hotel supply an empty fridge that could easily be filled with more perishable items/large drinks containers! All in all a much more impressive hotel than I was expecting for the price and certainly worth the rating it's getting here! Staff as friendly as expected for the Japanese and everyone I dealt with spoke very good English considering it's not actually a requirement.
user_name:
Tash B
Ilminster, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I've stayed at several Excel hotels in Tokyo. They tend to be simpler hotels with clean rooms and basic services. The Shibuya Excel Hotel is right across the busy Shibuya Station and quite convenient from Narita Airport. It is either the second stop by airport limo bus or the second stop on the JR train from Narita Airport. The rooms are basic, but has all the necessary comforts for a business stay. Comfortable bed, desk, hi-speed internet both connected and wifi, flat panel TV, hot water pot, shower/bath with excellent water flow and the Japanese toilets with cleaning jets. Finally, they have an excellent breakfast restaurant at the top floor of the hotel. Great western and Japanese choice available. I've stay at this Excel the most because it is most convenient with shops, restaurants and transportation.

Smack in the middle of the uber-busy Shibuya this is suited for travellers who value travelling and location convenience (it's situated in the middle of Shibuya station) over everything else. The staff were of the usual high Japanese quality and quick to cater for your needs but as the front desk is always busy don't expect any people to be helping you with your luggage. The rooms were average. Decent bed but the bathroom leaves something to be desired. Overall, location is superb if you like the hustle and bustle of Tokyo but some standard business hotels offer better room quality.

It's a good hotel. Well located in one of the most exciting area in Tokyo. Great advantage also to be closed to the Shibuya station where the Narita express stops. The quality of the service is fine. The rooms are small and bathrooms very small. The bar closed very early (11:30PM).

I stayed at the Shibuya Excel Hotel Tokyu for four nights, I booked it through hotels.com and got a great rate. The hotel is literally adjacent to Shibuya Station, you can access the train and subway stations without stepping outdoors. My room was on the 24th floor facing Yoyogi Park and the view was incredible. Shibuya Crossing was right below us, one of the busiest pedestrian crossings in the world. The beds are very nice, the comforters are fluffy. I would stay here again.

I have stayed 2 times in this hotel and I am very satisfied with both visits. The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of Shibuya, near all the good shopping in the big malls 109 etc. It is also walking distance to Harajuku which is the nicest shopping area, according to me. I got a room on one of the top floors which had a very nice view, especially in the evening. The rooms are nice and clean and has everything one needs. The breakfast was not included in my room but I had breakfast everyday anyway. I think it was worth the money.There was a good variety of food and everything was very fresh. The view from the breakfast area is also very stunning, at the top floor.

hotel`s in a very convenient location and for a family of 7,we all had 1 bed to out own so it was really comfortable.only problem was the bed was a bit too hard and the pillows were too small for my liking..staff were very approachable and ever smiling like most of the people in the service industry in japan.language was not a problem here as all the staff could speak english.we had a really nice time staying in this hotel and will definately stay there again if ever we return to Japan.

Have stayed in several hotels in Tokyo over the past 20 years ( Imperial, Westin, Hilton etc ) and was concerned about changing from the regular western style hotel but due to business location Shibuya was on the cards this time. From arrival at check-in the hotel and staff have not failed to impress. Room is typical in size for Tokyo and cleanliness is as expected. Superb view from floor 15 and up and very quiet. 3 mins from Shibuya station and Tokyo on your doorstep from there. Highly recommend.

I was hoping for a modern, efficient & comfortable place but was disappointed. It was basically OK & in a very convenient location. But it needs updating in terms of decor and the F&B offering was poor. My TV didn't offer English speaking channels despite a lot of effort from the staff. The concierge was truly rubbish. The front desk couldn't even answer very basic requests for a recommendation for a local restaurant.

The location was spot on, right by the famous Shibuya crossing and the train station with Airport Express. Breakfast or lunch can be had at the 5th floor restaurants, it was Sushi Midori and Starbucks for us. There were vending machines on both our floor and lobby for drinks. A food court, Tokyo Food Show, was also at the basement. As for the room, my only complaint would be the teeny tiny pillows. Even the additional ones were small, guess it was their standard size. Bed was soft (my priority). Room was clean. Nothing to complain about really. The view was amazing-can see the Shibuya crossing below and Tokyo skyline. Friendly staff.Got a great advance rate at Expedia.

We stayed five nights in the hotel and the location was perfect to explore Tokyo for the first time! Shibuya is not a complex station and it was easy to reach other points of the city from there.For the category of the hotel, the room is fine and you can enjoy a nice view from your window.

This hotel wasn't cheap - around £100 a night, so more expensive if you are staying on your own... but... it has a fantastic location, immediately next to Shibuya Station. By taking the lifts you can see the famous scramble crossing and all of Tokyo before your eyes. The facilities in the hotel are limited, but the rooms are certainly solid 4 star standard with great views. The staff were very helpful, they allowed me to stow some fragile goods with them for 2 weeks whilst I went elsewhere in Japan. However, I can't give this place 5 stars because of terrible directions given the the limousine bus to Narita Airport, nearly missed the bus as a result. The bus goes from the 5th floor not the ground floor! Aside from this mishap that I'd recommend this hotel without reservation as it is so conveniently located. If you have only a couple of days in Tokyo and want to make the most of it this is better located than many other more expensive (and more famous) establishments.

We've stayed here twice, but this hotel is just okay. I think it's good as a business hotel and to use as your base to explore Shibuya. It is also very convenient to the subway, which is a necessity in Tokyo. The rooms are fine, but small. Same goes for the bathroom. It is also connected to a mall with a lot of eateries and buses from both airports go directly there. 4 stars for convenience.

This hotel was good for my trip. The employees were very nice and helpful. The room had the basics and a great view of the Shibuya crossing. It was very centrally located... actually located on top of the Shibuya train station, which allowed me easy access to the trains, subway, and taxis. I found I could find places to eat at almost any time of night and was nearby shopping areas too. Harajuku district was only about a 25 minute walk away. The only downside to the hotel is that the wifi is only accessible in the hotel lobby. So to use internet you have to be plugged in and at the desk, you cannot sit in bed and use wifi.

We stayed for 3 nights at the Shibuya excel Tokyu & love it! It's extremely convenient as its right above the Shibuya station, which is a life saver after having to walk the whole day in Tokyo. We even managed to catch last minute shopping time at all the great shopping centres around the hotel! Bed was great, rooms were clean & comfy. Highly recommended! Will definitely stay here again.

This was a quick business trip, but because the hotel was in such a great location it was easy to fit in a bit of sightseeing. Views down on the famous Shibuya crossing were a bonus, as was the glimpse of a distant Mt Fuji as I was enjoying breakfast. Some excellent restaurants are within walking distance and, as Shibuya station is just opposite the hotel, it was a good base for getting around the city. Yoyogi Park is a short walk away and a great place to escape the hustle and bustle for a while. The regular limousine door-to-door bus service to and from the airport is fairly inexpensive (by Tokyo standards) and makes it so easy to get to and from either Haneda or Narita. Rooms are relatively small but very clean and the staff were all tremendously helpful.

Probably a great spot but finding our way through the station, four bags, two kids and a million commuters was stressful to say the least. We finally found the hotel, no help offered with bags just here is your room off you go. The size of the room was fantastic. We had four king single beds and room in the middle for a small dining table.The breakfast whilst expensive is worth it just for the amazing views and really the friendliest staff in the Shibuya area.I would not recommend this area for families. There are few choices and it's not very interesting, sorry but we really felt alien which is unusual in The Asian countries we have visited.

This hotel is in absolutely the best location, facing the amazingly busy shibuya crossing. It's in the heart of shibuya where there is lots of shopping and restaurants. It's right above shibuya train station which makes it incredibly easy to get around Tokyo, unbelievably convenient.I booked a small double room and I thought the size was actually quite big, keeping in mind that I was expecting a tiny room typical of Tokyo.The room was clean and basic.No English channels on tv and no wi-fi, but it wasn't a big deal.The staff don't speak very good English so it was hard to get any decent concierge advice.I would definitely stay here again, in fact I wouldn't even consider anywhere else.

We stayed here for 6 nights occupying a triple room, on our first night we were given a smaller room on a non-smoking floor but I had to complain because someone beside us or in front of us was smoking,the next day they transferred us to a much higher and bigger non-smoking room with a much better view!! that made me appreciate the professionalism of the hotel staff! great spacious room with separate bath and toilet! housekeeping kept our room clean and smelling good! very convenient hotel just above the Shibuya station and right across the busy Hachiko crossing and restaurants all around!All I can say it was a great hotel and would definitely stay again!

Stayed at this hotel during my solo trip to Tokyo in early April for the Sakura season. It is smack in the middle of bustling Shibuya and therefore a perfect location to be in the heart of the action.Room:Stayed in the cheapest Single room available. Was placed on the 7th floor.- Surprisingly spacious; had space for desk, table and chair, closet, also able to spread open my large suitcase and yet be able to walk around.- Usual room amenities including iron + board, hairdryer, kettle, yukata and bathrobe. However, this class of room did not have an in-room safe.- FREE WIFI available in the room. LAN cable also available.- Reasonable sized bathroom with bathtub and usual Japanese toilet.- Bed is fairly hard and so are the pillows which seem to be of the memory foam kind. I like it hard but I know many others would not agree with me.- Only English channels available on the flatscreen TV are BBC and CNN.Staff:- Friendly and helpful as is the norm in Japan.- English fluency varied among the staff but very helpful nonetheless.Hotel:- Extremely convenient location being attached to the huge Shibuya station which connects with both JR lines and the metro lines. Fantastic to use as a base for travelling to other parts of Tokyo and its outskirts.- Usefully connected to the Mark City shopping complex. The food hall (Tokyu FoodShow) in the basement is a must.- Just in front of the famous scramble crossing and Hachiko statue leading to all the major shopping malls and eateries in Shibuya.- The Airport Limousine bus stops exactly at the hotel. One of the major factor as to why I chose this hotel. Extremely convenient way of getting from/to Narita or Haneda. I know many other seasoned travellers would pick using the train from the airport to Shibuya station (and v.v.) as you never know what traffic conditions may be like at the time you land or depart. However I really don’t see why anyone would prefer schlepping luggage bags and navigating the train station to find the right exit and the hotel connection, when the bus can transport you and your luggage directly to the hotel entrance. If you’re coming off a longhaul flight, you’ll find this the most stressless mode of transport.Conclusion:I would strongly recommend this hotel as the Pros outweigh the minor Cons.

A good plain non intrusive hotel. Clean, nice linen and bedding.Everything seemed right. Nice big window with view over Shibuya. And the location is perfect.Food mall of restaurants above the station and just one floor down from the hotel made eating easy. Easy train ride from the airport.Internet in lobby near the vending machines was enough for me.
Great location, beds uncofortable. For Tokyo, price is ok....Walk right off the expresstrain from Narita and your here.

Fourth time in Shibuya and fourth time staying at this hotel. Love this hotel, the service, the staff, the cleanliness and especially the location. Right in the heart of the city with access to tons of restaurants, shops, train, malls, etc. Lively area and fun! Yes, the rooms are a bit small but that is to be expected in most of Japan.

I spent 7 nights on the 22nd floor. Higher floor = better view and a more spacious feel. Ask for a view over Yoyogi Park. The room was comfortable. Small but not bad by Tokyo standards. The bed and pillows were really good and bathroom was fine.No wifi (free or otherwise) really p'd me off. That said, the lack of casual wifi access in Japan is a national disgrace. Make sure you rent a pocket wifi when you arrive at the airport (softbank seems to work best).They had free cable based internet but no good if you have an iPad.Never ate at the hotel restaurants - they were expensive compared to the hundreds of small bar/restaurants in the immediate area. The food was divine and the atmosphere was great.No movie channels or pay per view movie channels so non-Japanese speakers are stuck with CNN or BBC only. Take a good book or plan to be out unless you are sleeping.The service was good and everything went very smoothly.

I love this hotel cause of several reasons: location (its sitting on top of Shibuya MRT station). Apparently cause of this, this is supposed to be the safest building in Tokyo. It has a ladies floor - so if you're a lone lady travelling for biz this is perfect! They offer completer toilettries. Its clean and they have comfortable beds. The room is just right. It isnt that spacious but its good enough. Check in and check out service is super efficient too. Its right in the heart of the shopping area -everything is a stone's throw away-Shibuya 109, international brands, small boutique shops. Also, really nice restaurants are walkable. I can really recommend this hotel!

This is my third stay at this this hotel, and it seems the rooms just keep getting smaller. I know its Tokyo, but these are small rooms. I keep coming back because of the location, the best in the city I think. It is less than a 5 minute walk, all indoors to the Shibuya train station, and from there you can be anyplace in Tokyo in 30 minutes. And the area around the hotel is packed with things to do 24\7. Great restaurants and shopping, and the best people watching anywhere!The hotel is clean and the staff are friendly and very helpful. The restaurant on the top floor serves a good breakfast, both western and Asian for a “reasonable” price. The amazing view is a great way to start any day.

I was taking shelter at this hotel exactly a year before, when that great earthquake struck. I wasn't a guest, but being a foreigner in a foreign land, I was simply hoping to gather more info bat the situation. I was with my elderly mom, and we were made to feel as comfortable as possible, given bed sheets, warm food and drinks . Some kind fellow- country men offered us a room by 3 am as they had decided to make their way to the airport to catch the earliest flight home. We got to see and use their rooms first hand - very spacious compared to the usual shoe boxes associated with rooms in Tokyo. Beds are comfy and good shower too! Would choose to stay here again..

From our room we could look straight down and view the 'busiest crossing in the world', in a room which is bigger than the regular Tokyo shoebox-sized rooms. In the heart of the shopping district, you can find all the food and creature comforts of an modern urban metropolis. There is a mall just below the hotel, whose reception lobby is at the 5th floor. Hachiko the storied dog's statue, a popular meeting place, is just a stone's throw away as are shopping centres for youth fashion such as Shibuya 109. All the major mega multi-story department stores are also a tiny walk away.Bonus is that the airport limousine bus stops here making it VERY convenient if you do not have alternative transportation to Narita or Haneda airports.

This was my second trip to Tokyo and I cannot comment on value for money as it was paid for by an arts association but I preferred the Hotel Century Southern Tower where I stayed last time. Thanks to Tripadvisor reviews, I knew to ask in advance for a quiet, non-smoking room with a safety deposit box and I was given a room on the 24th floor which had all these things although the hotel could not foresee workmen doing repairs under floodlight on a rooftop terrace opposite at 1am!!! My room was spacious but felt less so because of the busy patterns (all different) on the carpet, walls and furnishings. It could have accommodated an easy chair which would have been useful as I stayed for ten days and got fed up having to sit on the bed to watch the TV. The bathroom was quite small and smelled musty despite the front desk assuring me the extractor fan was working.I was also surprised that the bathroom did not have a high tec toilet. The furniture in the bedroom was surprisingly scruffy. I had to ask for extra towels and hangers (which were instantly supplied as the staff here are very helpful ). Breakfast was served on the 25th floor with great views of the city. There was a good selection of cold foods. The hot food selection was a little limited but the chef did make excellent bacon and eggs on request. The staff in the restaurant were exceptionally courteous and helpful and I was especially impressed by one waitress who, by the second day knew that I liked tea with milk and kept refilling my teacup. I didn't try room service as it looked quite pricey, especially when there are so many restaurants nearby, but I did have the in-room massage which was excellent and very reasonably priced. For those who don't carry a laptop, this is rentable for 1000 yen per day or there is rather cramped computer room where the charge is 100 yen per 10 minutes. All in all, if this was my first experience of Tokyo hotels I would recommend this one but for elegance and tranquillity I prefer Hotel Century Southern Tower.

The entrance lobby of this hotel is actually located on the 5th Floor, by the escalator leading to the shopping arcade. The hotel is well connected to Shibuya station, particularly good on rainy days. Our room, on the 18/F, is of decent size (by Tokyo standard) and very clean. Will definitely stay again. One small note, the hotel only offers free high speed internet connection with LAN cable, but not wi-fi.

Overlooking the famed Shibuya pedestrian crossing and adjacent to the railway line, the Shibuya Excel in Mark City is positioned in a great location for a short stay in Tokyo. It's close to everything with a shopping arcade and restaurants within the hotel and department stores, Harajuku and Shinjinku districts closeby. The hotel restaurants on the 25th floor were a little pricey but there are plenty of dinner options locally that also afford great views. The staff were superb and the standard rooms were a little larger than you'd usually expect in Japan.

We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I found the only pro was its location, no doubt , easy to get access to JR, but not thing more than that.There was not one to welcome us when we arrived, neither bag boys to help with baggage. Quite weird~ Breakfast is on 22 floor in buffet style, again great view, but lacking variety. Last but not least,no free in room WI-FI

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for business. I found the rooms to be of a very high standard, huge comfortable bed, with a choice of pillows, a small fridge, and great views. The hotel was easy to find from Shibuya station, with lots of signs directing us onto the right escalators. My main comment was that based on everywhere else we had stayed in Japan, and all of the people we had come in contact with, the staff that we came into contact with at this hotel were neither friendly nor particularly helpful.

I needed to go around Shibuya district by trains, buses and this hotel has offered me all the comodity that I expected. Firstly, I could take the Narita limousine bus straight to the hotel which I did on the way back to the airport as well. With the luggage, it's really convenient. Due to my business, I didn't get to stay mcuh time in the room but it was clean and spacious enough for me. The view of Tokyo, looking over not only the famous crossing of Shibuya, but also night view of Shinjuku was pretty, too. Oh, if you get lucky, you can see Mr.Fuji, too!!

Since my first trip to Shibuya, I've been itching to stay at the Shibuya Excel Hotel for it's incredible location.
