The airport limonsine took us right to the entrance and the location was above my expectation as it was situated on top of the Mark City dept store and in the heart of the Shibuya shopping district. The check-in was effecient and the staff spoke very good English and checked us in a non-smoking room on the 13/F. I've asked for the city view so when we opened the door, we were amazed with the view showing the Tokyo skyline and we got even more excited that the popular intersection with overflowing human traffic is right beneath our feet. We just couldn't wait to go down and experience it ourselves. The hotel room is little small but the bed is comfortable, bathroom is clean with sufficient bath gel & shampoo as they come in big sizes. A brand new body cloth is provided for cleansing each day. Free wireless internet. JR & Tokyo subway are right below or across from the hotel. Walking distance to all Subuya shopping landmarks such as Seibu, Tokyu & 109. Starbucks located across from the hotel opens till early AM. Vending machines with a good variety of drinks & snacks available at the reception so you don't need to pay more using the mini bar. Local calls are same as public phones outside. The only thing missing is a safe to keep valuables but I checked with the hotel and they have available safe boxes. Staff are professional and helpful. We definitely will come back for the convenience and comfort.

Excel Shibuya is situated in the shibuya station which is also connected to Tokyu department store and Mark City, a complex of restaurants and shops. I cannot find anywhere more convenient than staying literally on top of the train tracks. Of course there was the noise factor but it was tolerable. My husband and I stayed here for 2 days and we were both very impressed with the service of the hotel staff. I had to leave for a meeting once I got out the airport limosine bus. I asked the hotel staff to deliver my luggage to my room and check me in at the same time when I hurried off to see my company. No problem at all. Then I had asked the hotel concierge for recommendations for a hair salon. She booked the appointment for me and took me personally to the hairdresser; explained what I needed before she left. She did the same thing to my husband. I could not have asked for more. We stayed at a double room with standard shower and tub. It had a sitting area big enough for 4 people. The facility was a little bit old but the level of service and its location made it a great place to stay. As long as there is a Starbucks and my favorite sushi restaurant, Midori, close by, I am satisfied.

Our family visit Japan almost every year. This was my 9th visit, and our third stay at the Hotel. We were very impressed at their Triple-Room during our 2nd visit. We made early reservation & were able to enjoy their early-bird discount this time (about 25% off rack price).Remember to join their Tokyu Hotels Comfort Membership. You can join on their web-site, or at the Hotel. Members receive room discounts and gift vouchers. We used our vouchers for breakfast (1,950 yen per person) at the Hotel, which was great. Also, check with the hotel by e-mail in advance to reserve the room of your choice, eg. ladies floor, non-smoking, free internet access, etc. They have very prompt response.Location of the Hotel is excellent, with convenient access to Metro station & Rail Station. Shibuya itself is a great shopping & dining place, and other trendy shopping areas, such as Harajuku & Omotesando are just one station away. There're also direct subway/ rail routes to go to other famous shopping areas like Shinjuku, Ginza, and Akihabara.If you like Sushi, a must-try Sushi place is at Mark City, the Shopping Complex connected with the Hotel. There is always a long line-up outside the restaurant, which you are not likely to miss when you pass by.

If you are looking for a central hotel, with rooms that are clean comfortable and a good size for such a central city location then this is the place for you.The hotel is on top of a shopping Mall (but please do not think by this that the rooms are noisy as they are not) and next to Shibuya underground, so you can just wonder down stairs for a selection of restaurants or if you fancy going further afield just hop on the under ground.One point to note about Tokyo if you are travelling from the UK, our phones do not work out there, so can be a pain if you are travelling with others to keep in contact. (what did we do before the mobile??)Highlight of my trip was seeing the band the Killers who were also staying at this hotel!

I am writing this in my room at the Shibuya Excel Tokyu using the free internet access at the end of my 2 week stay.Overall I was very impressed with the hotel, it is very clean, the room was much larger than I expected, and the view was great!! And the price was pretty reasonable for the centre of Tokyo.The location is ultra convenient, right above Shibuya station, which has lots of over- and under-ground connections to get you just about anywhere extremely fast.Bear in mind that Shibuya is just about THE busiest place I came across in Tokyo, so it might not be to all tastes. I was a bit worried there might be a lot of noise in the room at night, but actually that didn't prove to be a problem at all.Based on the quality of the hotel and the great location I would definitely come back here again with no hesitation.One tip -- it took me some time to notice the "Food Show" section under the Tokyu dept store next to the hotel, this was a great place to pick up some of the familiar western foods I had been craving but couldn't seem to find anywhere...

This was our second stay here. We booked through Asiarooms and got a great deal which included breakfast. This is a great deal (breakfast at the Western-stye restaurant is about 19,50 yen a person) and the western -food buffet was delicious. Because Asiarooms is a bulk room buyer, you get what they have available. We did not have the greatest view, but did get the nonmoking requested. Be warned however that people at this hotel sometimes ignore the fact that they are on a nonsmoking floor. It's annoying, but we picked up some Japanese Febreeze and that really helped. There is convenient internet access via 2 computers in the lobby and you get 10 minutes for 100 yen.The location is convenient--located right by the JR station in Shibuya. The areas is always crazy crowded with plenty of all night "conbini" markets and lots of clubs within walking distance. This part of town can sometimes feel a bit dirty, but it is extremely energizing, regardless. You do have the Tokyu Department stores and Mark City Shopping Complex and plenty of clothing stores aimed at the ultra-hip Tokyo youth. "Love Hotel Hill" is also nearby if you want to take a "break." The room was quiet despite Shibuya Crossing being just 8 floors below. Beds are comfortable.

Having stayed at the Shibuya Excell on a number of occasions I have expressed each time my disapointment that basic needs particularly for the visiting business man are simply not available.When the front desk is approached to provide assistance they tend to adopt a no can do attitued.I have visited this Hotel a number of times since drawing these anomolies to thier attention but see no effort to make improvements, They are most certainly not international in thier service although the staff are polite and well groomed the end result always remains the same....No can do!!!This last visit will be my last as I have given up on any expectation of improvement, my business associates in Tokyo are naturally disappointed to learn of my frustration and have confirmed similer complaints by other guests they have recommended to the Hotel.They will no longer recommend visitors on business to check into this Hotel and I have visited it for the last time.
I stayed there a week ago, the hotel facilities were awesome, though the staffs couldn't quite speak English so my Suggestion is, this is definitely a fine place !

I stayed here for 3 nights on the way back from Australia/NZ and was really pleased that I chose to stay here. It was OK value about £90 a night, pretty good/average for a tourist/buisiness hotel in Tokyo.The location was perfect and my room on the 20th floor overlooked the famous crossing that most people remember from Lost in Translation and had a fabulous view of the city but the room or hotel wasnt at all noisy.As I was travelling on my own I choose to stay on the women only floor (allthough the city is v safe so it wasnt really necsecery) which costs no more but has key card entry to the floor and apprently more "feminine rooms". My room was very clean (and I am very fussy!!)and the size fine with an good size/clean bathroom and a duvet on the bed so none of the horrible sheet and blanket thing that a lot of hotels have!Mini bar at usual okish prices and TV with CNN and BBC news etc and good air con, not too noisy.So after a long flight it was a great room to collapse into and relax.Breakfast which I ate in hotel once was OK ish but not cheap and to be honest with several (dare I say it and its v bad I know but cant beat a tall skinny latte!) Starbucks nearby it was easy and cheaper to grab a latte and Muffin!So hotel good, views great BUT location amazing! bang in the heart of Shibuya with great shops and places to eat, right on top of the station and you really feel that you are in the heart of things and its really easy to get around and see some of the amazing places.The Limosine bus(normal coach)goes from the airport straight to hotel and only costs £15, its easy if a bit boring 90min journey. I would definetly reccomend staying here.Have Fun......

I stayed a week at the hotel on a business trip. Location is great as the hotel is on top of Shibuya station with direct access to the station itself.Shibuya is on the other hand a cool location full of bars, restaurants and pubs, it's basically a young people's neighbourhood and is always crowded, so if you're looking for a quiet place, this is isn't it!My room was OK, not large but not small, comfortable. I didn't spend much time in it as I was the whole day visiting clients, but it was OK. The bathroom was OK in size and the room was very clean too.I had western style breakfast the whole week and it was plentiful and good.I will definitely return to this hotel in my next business trip :)Ahh...and the elevator view is simply spectacular!!
Excelent location. Rooms are ok. The best: their outside elevator and the views from the restaurant.

We have two young children. As I was planning this trip, I was looking for a hotel with rooms that can fit four people comfortably. I found this hotel from a friend who traveled to Japan often. We stayed in a four bed room. The breakfast buffet was excellent. I would recommend this place.
